entries.red:
A strange seed was
planted on its
back at birth. The plant sprouts
and grows with
this POKéMON.
entries.blue:

entries.yellow:

without eating a
single morsel. In the bulb on
its back, it
stores energy.

back is filled
with nutrients. The seed grows
steadily larger as
its body grows.
entries.silver:

on its back right
from birth. As it grows older, the
seed also grows
larger.
entries.crystal:
While it is young,
it uses the
nutrients that are stored in the
seeds on its back
in order to grow.
entries.ruby:
BULBASAUR can be seen napping in
bright sunlight.
There is a seed on its back. By soaking up the sun’s rays, the seed
grows progressively larger.

entries.leafgreen:
Its short feet are tipped with suction
pads that enable it to tirelessly climb
slopes and walls.

tirelessly climb
slopes and walls.

are tipped with

entries.yellow:
If you touch the
feeler on top of
its head, it will release a horrible
stink to protect
itself.
entries.gold:
For protection, it
releases a horri­
ble stench from the antenna on its
head to drive away
enemies.
entries.silver:
Its feet have
suction cups
designed to stick to any surface. It
tenaciously climbs
trees to forage.
entries.crystal:
It crawls into
foliage where it
camouflages itself among leaves that
are the same color
as its body.
entries.ruby:
CATERPIE has a voracious appetite.
It can devour leaves bigger than its
body right before your eyes. From its antenna, this POKéMON releases
a terrifically strong odor.
entries.sapphire:

entries.emerald:
Its voracious appetite compels it to
devour leaves bigger than itself without
hesitation. It releases a terribly strong
odor from its antennae.
entries.firered:
It is covered with a green skin. When it
grows, it sheds the skin, covers itself
with silk, and becomes a cocoon.
entries.diamond:

antenna to repel enemies. It
grows by molting repeatedly.

entries.sun:
When attacked by bird Pokémon, it resists by
releasing a terrifically strong odor from its
antennae, but it often becomes their prey.
entries.moon:
It’s easy to catch, and it grows quickly, making
it one of the top recommendations for novice
Pokémon Trainers.
entries.ultra-sun:
Perhaps because it would like to grow up
quickly, it has a voracious appetite, eating
a hundred leaves a day.
entries.ultra-moon:
Its body is soft and weak. In nature, its
perpetual fate is to be seen by others as food.

entries.red:
Usually found in
power plants.
Easily mistaken for a POKé BALL,
they have zapped
many people.
entries.blue:
Usually found in
power plants.
Easily mistaken for a POKé BALL,
they have zapped
many people.
entries.yellow:
It is said to
camouflage itself
as a POKé BALL. It will self-destruct
with very little
stimulus.
entries.gold:
It rolls to move.
If the ground is
uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting
a bump can cause
it to explode.
entries.silver:
It was discovered
when POKé BALLS
were introduced. It is said that
there is some
connection.
entries.crystal:
During the study
of this POKéMON,
it was discovered that its compo­
nents are not
found in nature.
entries.ruby:
VOLTORB was first sighted at a company
that manufactures POKé BALLS.
The link between that sighting and the fact that this POKéMON looks very
similar to a POKé BALL remains a
mystery.
entries.sapphire:
VOLTORB is extremely sensitive - it
explodes at the slightest of shocks.
It is rumored that it was first created when a POKé BALL was exposed to a
powerful pulse of energy.
entries.emerald:
It bears an uncanny and unexplained
resemblance to a POKé BALL. Because it
explodes at the slightest shock, even
veteran TRAINERS treat it with caution.
entries.firered:
A life-form whose identity is unknown.
It is said to SCREECH or suddenly
SELFDESTRUCT.
entries.leafgreen:
Usually found in power plants. Easily

zapped many people.
entries.diamond:

It is dangerous because it may
electrocute or explode on touch.

entries.legends-arceus:
An enigmatic Pokémon that happens to bear a resemblance to a
Poké Ball. When excited, it discharges the electric current it has
stored in its belly, then lets out a great, uproarious laugh.

entries.red:
It stores electric
energy under very
high pressure. It often explodes
with little or no
provocation.
entries.blue:
It stores electric
energy under very
high pressure. It often explodes
with little or no
provocation.
entries.yellow:
Stores electrical
energy inside its
body. Even the slightest shock
could trigger a
huge explosion.
entries.gold:
It is dangerous.
If it has too much
electricity and has nothing to do,
it amuses itself
by exploding.
entries.silver:
It stores an over­
flowing amount of
electric energy inside its body.
Even a small shock
makes it explode.
entries.crystal:
The more energy it
charges up, the
faster it gets. But this also
makes it more
likely to explode.
entries.ruby:
ELECTRODE eats electricity in the
atmosphere. On days when lightning
strikes, you can see this POKéMON exploding all over the place from
eating too much electricity.
entries.sapphire:
One of ELECTRODE’s characteristics is
its attraction to electricity.
It is a problematical POKéMON that congregates mostly at electrical
power plants to feed on electricity
that has just been generated.
entries.emerald:
They appear in great numbers at electric
power plants. Because they feed on
electricity, they cause massive and
chaotic blackouts in nearby cities.
entries.firered:
It explodes in response to even minor
stimuli. It is feared, with the nickname
of “The Bomb Ball.”

The tissue on the surface of its body is curiously similar in
composition to an Apricorn. When irritated, this Pokémon lets

entries.red:
Often mistaken
for eggs.
When disturbed, they quickly
gather and attack
in swarms.
entries.blue:
Often mistaken
for eggs.
When disturbed, they quickly
gather and attack
in swarms.
entries.yellow:
The heads attract
each other and
spin around. There must be 6
heads for it to
maintain balance.
entries.gold:
The shell is very
durable. Even if
it cracks, it can survive without
spilling the
contents.
entries.silver:
Using telepathy
only they can
receive, they always form a
cluster of six
EXEGGCUTE.
entries.crystal:
If even one is
separated from the
group, the energy bond between the
six will make them
rejoin instantly.
entries.ruby:
This POKéMON consists of six eggs that
form a closely knit cluster. The six eggs
attract each other and spin around. When cracks increasingly appear on the
eggs, EXEGGCUTE is close to evolution.
entries.sapphire:
This POKéMON consists of six eggs that
form a closely knit cluster. The six eggs
attract each other and spin around. When cracks increasingly appear on the
eggs, EXEGGCUTE is close to evolution.
entries.emerald:
It consists of six eggs that care for each
other. The eggs attract each other and
spin around. When cracks increasingly
appear, it is close to evolution.
entries.firered:
Even though it appears to be eggs of
some sort, it was discovered to be a life-
form more like plant seeds.
entries.leafgreen:
It is often mistaken for eggs. When

entries.diamond:

telepathy. They can quickly gather
if they become separated.

entries.omega-ruby:
This Pokémon consists of six eggs that form a closely knit
cluster. The six eggs attract each other and spin around.
When cracks increasingly appear on the eggs, Exeggcute is
close to evolution.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
This Pokémon consists of six eggs that form a closely knit
cluster. The six eggs attract each other and spin around.
When cracks increasingly appear on the eggs, Exeggcute is
close to evolution.
entries.sun:
Its six eggs use telepathy to communicate
among themselves. It is believed to carry
plant genes and the genes of other species.
entries.moon:
Six of them together form a full-fledged
Pokémon. It’s often hunted by Crabrawler,
but uses psychokinesis to drive it off.
entries.ultra-sun:
Six of them form a single Pokémon. Should one
of the six be lost, the next morning there will
once more be six.
entries.ultra-moon:
Although they are the same size as other
Exeggcute, the ones produced in Alola are quite
heavy. Their shells are packed full.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
The heads attract each other and spin
around. There must be six heads for it to
maintain balance.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
The heads attract each other and spin
around. There must be six heads for it to
maintain balance.
entries.sword:
Though it may look like it’s just a bunch of eggs,
it’s a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates
with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.
entries.shield:
These Pokémon get nervous when they’re not in a
group of six. The minute even one member of the
group goes missing, Exeggcute become cowardly.

entries.red:
Legend has it that
on rare occasions,
one of its heads will drop off and
continue on as an
EXEGGCUTE.
entries.blue:
Legend has it that
on rare occasions,
one of its heads will drop off and
continue on as an
EXEGGCUTE.
entries.yellow:
Its cries are very
noisy. This is
because each of the 3 heads thinks
about whatever it
likes.
entries.gold:
Its three heads
think independent­
ly. However, they are friendly and
never appear to
squabble.
entries.silver:
If a head drops
off, it emits a
telepathic call in search of others
to form an
EXEGGCUTE cluster.
entries.crystal:
Living in a good
environment makes
it grow lots of heads. A head that
drops off becomes
an EXEGGCUTE.
entries.ruby:
EXEGGUTOR originally came from the
tropics. Its heads steadily grow larger
from exposure to strong sunlight. It is said that when the heads fall off,
they group together to form EXEGGCUTE.
entries.sapphire:

they group together to form EXEGGCUTE.

heads grow larger from exposure to strong

entries.firered:
It is called “The Walking Tropical
Rainforest.” Each of the nuts has
a face and a will of its own.
entries.leafgreen:
It is said that on rare occasions, one
of its heads will drop off and continue on
as an EXEGGCUTE.
entries.diamond:

If a head grows too big, it falls
off and becomes an EXEGGCUTE.

entries.omega-ruby:
Exeggutor originally came from the tropics. Its heads
steadily grow larger from exposure to strong sunlight.
It is said that when the heads fall off, they group together
to form Exeggcute.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Exeggutor originally came from the tropics. Its heads
steadily grow larger from exposure to strong sunlight. It is
said that when the heads fall off, they group together to
form Exeggcute.
entries.sun:
Each of its heads has its own will. They use
telepathy to discuss their plans before coming
to a joint decision.
entries.moon:
When the time comes, one of its three heads
falls off. Before long, the fallen head grows into
an Exeggcute.
entries.ultra-sun:
It engages its enemies using psychic powers.
Each of its three heads fires off psychokinetic
energy, tripling its power.
entries.ultra-moon:
Each of its three heads has its own thoughts.
When they want to go in different directions,
Exeggutor becomes unable to move.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Its cries are very noisy. This is because each of
the three heads thinks about whatever it likes.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Its cries are very noisy. This is because each of
the three heads thinks about whatever it likes.
entries.sword:
Each of Exeggutor’s three heads is thinking
different thoughts. The three don’t seem to be
very interested in one another.
entries.shield:
When they work together, Exeggutor’s three
heads can put out powerful psychic energy.
Cloudy days make this Pokémon sluggish.

entries.red:
Because it never
removes its skull
helmet, no one has ever seen
this POKéMON's
real face.
entries.blue:
Because it never
removes its skull
helmet, no one has ever seen

real face.
entries.yellow:
Wears the skull
of its deceased
mother. Its cries echo inside the
skull and come out
as a sad melody.
entries.gold:
If it is sad or
lonely, the skull
it wears shakes, and emits a plain­
tive and mournful
sound.
entries.silver:
It always wears
the skull of its
dead mother, so no one has any idea
what its hidden
face looks like.
entries.crystal:
It lost its mother
after its birth.
It wears its mother's skull,
never revealing
its true face.
entries.ruby:
CUBONE pines for the mother it will
never see again. Seeing a likeness of
its mother in the full moon, it cries. The stains on the skull the POKéMON
wears are made by the tears it sheds.

entries.alpha-sapphire:
Cubone pines for the mother it will never see again. Seeing a
likeness of its mother in the full moon, it cries. The stains on
the skull the Pokémon wears are made by the tears it sheds.
entries.sun:
When it thinks of its deceased mother, it weeps
loudly. Mandibuzz that hear its cries will attack
it from the air.
entries.moon:
The skull it wears on its head is that of its dead
mother. According to some, it will evolve when
it comes to terms with the pain of her death.
entries.ultra-sun:
At night, it weeps loudly for its dead mother,
but those cries only attract its natural
enemy—Mandibuzz.
entries.ultra-moon:
It wears its mother’s skull on its head, so no
one knows what its bare face looks like.
However, it’s clear that it’s always crying.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Wears the skull of its deceased mother.
Its cries echo inside the skull and
come out as a sad melody.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Wears the skull of its deceased mother.
Its cries echo inside the skull and
come out as a sad melody.
entries.sword:
When the memory of its departed mother brings
it to tears, its cries echo mournfully within the
skull it wears on its head.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon wears the skull of its deceased
mother. Sometimes Cubone’s dreams make it cry,
but each tear Cubone sheds makes it stronger.

entries.red:
The bone it holds
is its key weapon.
It throws the bone skillfully
like a boomerang
to KO targets.
entries.blue:
The bone it holds
is its key weapon.
It throws the bone skillfully
like a boomerang
to KO targets.
entries.yellow:
Small and weak,
this POKéMON is
adept with its bone club. It has
grown more vicious
over the ages.
entries.gold:
It has been seen
pounding boulders
with the bone it carries in order
to tap out mes­
sages to others.
entries.silver:
It collects bones
from an unknown
place. A MAROWAK graveyard exists
somewhere in the
world, rumors say.
entries.crystal:
Somewhere in the
world is a ceme­
tery just for MAROWAK. It gets
its bones from
those graves.
entries.ruby:
MAROWAK is the evolved form of a CUBONE
that has overcome its sadness at the
loss of its mother and grown tough. This POKéMON’s tempered and hardened
spirit is not easily broken.
entries.sapphire:
MAROWAK is the evolved form of a CUBONE
that has overcome its sadness at the
loss of its mother and grown tough. This POKéMON’s tempered and hardened
spirit is not easily broken.
entries.emerald:
A MAROWAK is the evolved form of a CUBONE
that has grown tough by overcoming the
grief of losing its mother. Its tempered
and hardened spirit is not easily broken.
entries.firered:
It is small and was originally very weak.
Its temperament turned ferocious when it
began using bones.
entries.leafgreen:
The bone it holds is its key weapon.
It throws the bone skillfully like a
boomerang to KO targets.
entries.diamond:
From its birth, this savage Pokémon
constantly holds bones. It is
skilled in using them as weapons.
entries.pearl:
From its birth, this savage Pokémon
constantly holds bones. It is
skilled in using them as weapons.

to tap out messages to others.

Some whisper that a MAROWAK graveyard
exists somewhere in the world.

entries.y:

entries.omega-ruby:
Marowak is the evolved form of a Cubone that has overcome
its sadness at the loss of its mother and grown tough.
This Pokémon’s tempered and hardened spirit is not
easily broken.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Marowak is the evolved form of a Cubone that has overcome
its sadness at the loss of its mother and grown tough. This
Pokémon’s tempered and hardened spirit is not easily broken.
entries.sun:
Originally, it was weak and timid. After evolution,
its temperament becomes violent, and it begins
to wield bones as weapons.
entries.moon:
This Pokémon is out for vengeance on its natural
enemy, Mandibuzz. It throws bones like
boomerangs to try to take it down.
entries.ultra-sun:
It throws bones at Mandibuzz to knock it down.
It’s thought that Marowak is trying to avenge
its parent.
entries.ultra-moon:
They thump their bones rhythmically to
communicate among themselves. There are
nearly 50 different rhythmic patterns.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Small and weak, this Pokémon is adept
with its bone club. It has grown more vicious
over the ages.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Small and weak, this Pokémon is adept
with its bone club. It has grown more vicious
over the ages.
entries.sword:
This Pokémon overcame its sorrow to evolve a
sturdy new body. Marowak faces its opponents
bravely, using a bone as a weapon.
entries.shield:
When this Pokémon evolved, the skull of its
mother fused to it. Marowak’s temperament also
turned vicious at the same time.

entries.red:
When in a hurry,
its legs lengthen
progressively. It runs smoothly
with extra long,
loping strides.
entries.blue:
When in a hurry,
its legs lengthen
progressively. It runs smoothly
with extra long,
loping strides.
entries.yellow:
When kicking, the
sole of its foot
turns as hard as a diamond on im­
pact and destroys
its enemy.
entries.gold:
This amazing POKé­
MON has an awesome
sense of balance. It can kick in
succession from
any position.
entries.silver:
If it starts kick­
ing repeatedly,
both legs will stretch even long­
er to strike a
fleeing foe.
entries.crystal:
It is also called
the Kick Master.
It uses its elastic legs to
execute every
known kick.
entries.ruby:
HITMONLEE’s legs freely contract and
stretch. Using these springlike legs, it
bowls over foes with devastating kicks. After battle, it rubs down its legs and
loosens the muscles to overcome
fatigue.
entries.sapphire:
HITMONLEE’s legs freely contract and
stretch. Using these springlike legs, it
bowls over foes with devastating kicks. After battle, it rubs down its legs and
loosens the muscles to overcome
fatigue.
entries.emerald:
Its legs freely stretch and contract.
Using these springlike limbs, it bowls over

entries.firered:
The legs freely contract and stretch.
The stretchy legs allow it to hit a
distant foe with a rising kick.
entries.leafgreen:

entries.diamond:

entries.red:
While apparently
doing nothing, it
fires punches in lightning fast
volleys that are
impossible to see.
entries.blue:
While apparently
doing nothing, it
fires punches in lightning fast
volleys that are
impossible to see.
entries.yellow:
Punches in cork­
screw fashion. It
can punch its way through a concrete
wall in the same
way as a drill.
entries.gold:
Its punches slice
the air. However,
it seems to need a short break after
fighting for three
minutes.
entries.silver:
Its punches slice
the air. They are
launched at such high speed, even a
slight graze could
cause a burn.
entries.crystal:
To increase the
strength of all
its punch moves, it spins its arms
just before making
contact.
entries.ruby:
HITMONCHAN is said to possess the
spirit of a boxer who had been working
towards a world championship. This POKéMON has an indomitable spirit
and will never give up in the face of
adversity.
entries.sapphire:
HITMONCHAN is said to possess the
spirit of a boxer who had been working
towards a world championship. This POKéMON has an indomitable spirit
and will never give up in the face of
adversity.
entries.emerald:
A HITMONCHAN is said to possess the
spirit of a boxer who aimed to become the
world champion. Having an indomitable
spirit means that it will never give up.
entries.firered:
The spirit of a pro boxer has infused this
POKéMON. It throws punches that are
faster than a bullet train.
entries.leafgreen:
While apparently doing nothing, it fires
punches in lightning-fast volleys that are
impossible to see.
entries.diamond:
The arm-twisting punches it throws
pulverize even concrete. It rests
after three minutes of fighting.

entries.red:
Its tongue can be
extended like a
chameleon's. It leaves a tingling
sensation when it
licks enemies.
entries.blue:
Its tongue can be
extended like a
chameleon's. It leaves a tingling
sensation when it
licks enemies.
entries.yellow:
Its tongue spans
almost 7 feet and
moves more freely than its forelegs.
Its licks can
cause paralysis.
entries.gold:
Its tongue has
well-developed
nerves that run to the very tip,
so it can be deft­
ly manipulated.
entries.silver:
Its long tongue,
slathered with a
gooey saliva, sticks to any­
thing, so it is
very useful.
entries.crystal:
It has a tongue
that is over 6’6’’
long. It uses this long tongue to
lick its body
clean.
entries.ruby:
Whenever LICKITUNG comes across
something new, it will unfailingly give it
a lick. It does so because it memorizes things by texture and by taste.
It is somewhat put off by sour things.
entries.sapphire:
Whenever LICKITUNG comes across
something new, it will unfailingly give it
a lick. It does so because it memorizes things by texture and by taste.
It is somewhat put off by sour things.
entries.emerald:
Whenever it sees something unfamiliar,
it always licks the object because it
memorizes things by texture and taste.
It is somewhat put off by sour things.
entries.firered:
Its tongue is twice the length of its
body. It can be moved like an arm for
grabbing food and attacking.
entries.leafgreen:
Its tongue can be extended like a
chameleon’s. It leaves a tingling
sensation when it licks enemies.
entries.diamond:
Instead of hands, it uses its
tongue, which is twice its height.
Its sticky saliva grips anything.
entries.pearl:
Instead of hands, it uses its
tongue, which is twice its height.
Its sticky saliva grips anything.
entries.platinum:
When it extends its over-six-foot-
long tongue, its tail quivers. There
is a possibility they are connected.
entries.heartgold:
Its tongue has well-developed
nerves that run to the very tip,
so it can be deftly manipulated.
entries.soulsilver:
Its long tongue, slathered with a
gooey saliva, sticks to anything,
so it is very useful.
entries.black:
When it extends its over-six-foot-
long tongue, its tail quivers. There
is a possibility they are connected.
entries.white:
When it extends its over-six-foot-
long tongue, its tail quivers. There
is a possibility they are connected.
entries.black-2:
Being licked by its long, saliva-covered
tongue leaves a tingling sensation.
Extending its tongue retracts its tail.
entries.white-2:
Being licked by its long, saliva-covered
tongue leaves a tingling sensation.
Extending its tongue retracts its tail.
entries.x:
Its long tongue, slathered with a gooey saliva,
sticks to anything, so it is very useful.
entries.y:
Its tongue is twice the length of its body. It can be
moved like an arm for grabbing food and attacking.
entries.omega-ruby:
Whenever Lickitung comes across something new, it will
unfailingly give it a lick. It does so because it memorizes things
by texture and by taste. It is somewhat put off by sour things.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Whenever Lickitung comes across something new, it will
unfailingly give it a lick. It does so because it memorizes things
by texture and by taste. It is somewhat put off by sour things.
entries.ultra-sun:
It checks out whatever’s around it by licking
everything. If you don’t clean off a spot where
it’s licked you, you’ll break out in a rash!
entries.ultra-moon:
It licks filth clean with its tongue. Whatever it
licks always stinks afterward, so whether it’s
really clean is...questionable.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Its tongue spans almost seven feet and moves
more freely than its forelegs. Its licks can
cause paralysis.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Its tongue spans almost seven feet and moves
more freely than its forelegs. Its licks can
cause paralysis.
entries.sword:
If this Pokémon’s sticky saliva gets on you and
you don’t clean it off, an intense itch will set in.
The itch won’t go away, either.
entries.shield:
Bug Pokémon are Lickitung’s main food source.
This Pokémon paralyzes its prey with a lick from
its long tongue, then swallows the prey whole.
entries.legends-arceus:
Wields its long tongue deftly, as though it were an arm.
The Pokémon's viscous saliva, once it has been collected and
boiled down, yields a strong and highly useful adhesive.

entries.red:
Because it stores
several kinds of
toxic gases in its body, it is
prone to exploding
without warning.
entries.blue:
Because it stores
several kinds of
toxic gases in its body, it is
prone to exploding
without warning.
entries.yellow:
In hot places, its
internal gases
could expand and explode without
any warning. Be
very careful!
entries.gold:
Its thin, filmy
body is filled
with gases that cause constant
sniffles, coughs
and teary eyes.
entries.silver:
The poisonous
gases it contains
are a little bit lighter than air,
keeping it slight­
ly airborne.
entries.crystal:
If one gets close
enough to it when
it expels poison­ ous gas, the gas
swirling inside it
can be seen.
entries.ruby:
If KOFFING becomes agitated, it raises
the toxicity of its internal gases and
jets them out from all over its body. This POKéMON may also overinflate its
round body, then explode.
entries.sapphire:
KOFFING embodies toxic substances.
It mixes the toxins with raw garbage to
set off a chemical reaction that results in a terribly powerful poison
gas. The higher the temperature, the
more gas is concocted by this POKéMON.
entries.emerald:
Getting up close to a KOFFING will give
you a chance to observe, through its thin
skin, the toxic gases swirling inside. It
blows up at the slightest stimulation.
entries.firered:
Its thin, balloon-like body is inflated by
horribly toxic gases. It reeks when it is
nearby.
entries.leafgreen:
Because it stores several kinds of toxic
gases in its body, it is prone to
exploding without warning.
entries.diamond:
Lighter-than-air gases in its body
keep it aloft. The gases not only
smell, they are also explosive.
entries.pearl:
Lighter-than-air gases in its body
keep it aloft. The gases not only
smell, they are also explosive.

Toxic gas is held within its thin,

cause massive explosions.

entries.lets-go-eevee:

entries.sword:
Its body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into
garbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw,
rotting trash.
entries.shield:
It adores polluted air. Some claim that Koffing
used to be more plentiful in the Galar region
than they are now.

entries.red:
This POKéMON is
vulnerable to
attack while its shell is soft,
exposing its weak
and tender body.
entries.blue:
This POKéMON is
vulnerable to
attack while its shell is soft,
exposing its weak
and tender body.
entries.yellow:
Hardens its shell
to protect itself.
However, a large impact may cause
it to pop out of
its shell.
entries.gold:
Inside the shell,
it is soft and
weak as it pre­ pares to evolve.
It stays motion­
less in the shell.
entries.silver:
It prepares for
evolution by har­
dening its shell as much as possi­
ble to protect its
soft body.
entries.crystal:
This is its pre-
evolved form. At
this stage, it can only harden, so it
remains motionless
to avoid attack.
entries.ruby:
The shell covering this POKéMON’s body
is as hard as an iron slab.
METAPOD does not move very much. It stays still because it is preparing
its soft innards for evolution inside
the hard shell.
entries.sapphire:
The shell covering this POKéMON’s body
is as hard as an iron slab.
METAPOD does not move very much. It stays still because it is preparing
its soft innards for evolution inside
the hard shell.
entries.emerald:
Its shell is as hard as an iron slab.
A METAPOD does not move very much
because it is preparing its soft innards
for evolution inside the shell.
entries.firered:
Even though it is encased in a sturdy
shell, the body inside is tender.
It can’t withstand a harsh attack.
entries.leafgreen:
This POKéMON is vulnerable to attack
while its shell is soft, exposing its weak
and tender body.
entries.diamond:
A steel-hard shell protects its
tender body. It quietly endures
hardships while awaiting evolution.
entries.pearl:
A steel-hard shell protects its
tender body. It quietly endures
hardships while awaiting evolution.

The shell covering this Pokémon’s body is as hard as an
iron slab. Metapod does not move very much.

evolution inside the hard shell.
entries.sun:
Its shell is filled with its soft innards. It doesn’t
move much because of the risk it might
carelessly spill its innards out.
entries.moon:
Its shell is hard, but it’s still just a bug shell.
It’s been known to break, so intense battles
with it should be avoided.
entries.ultra-sun:
Its shell is filled with a thick liquid. All of the
cells throughout its body are being rebuilt in
preparation for evolution.
entries.ultra-moon:
Its hard shell doesn’t crack a bit even if Pikipek
pecks at it, but it will tip over, spilling out
its insides.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Hardens its shell to protect itself. However, a
large impact may cause it to pop out of its shell.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Hardens its shell to protect itself. However, a
large impact may cause it to pop out of its shell.
entries.sword:
It is waiting for the moment to evolve. At this
stage, it can only harden, so it remains
motionless to avoid attack.
entries.shield:
Even though it is encased in a sturdy shell,
the body inside is tender. It can’t withstand a
harsh attack.

entries.red:
Where two kinds
of poison gases
meet, 2 KOFFINGs can fuse into a
WEEZING over many
years.
entries.blue:
Where two kinds
of poison gases
meet, 2 KOFFINGs can fuse into a
WEEZING over many
years.
entries.yellow:
It lives and grows
by absorbing dust,
germs and poison gases that are
contained in toxic
waste and garbage.
entries.gold:
If one of the twin
KOFFING inflates,
the other one deflates. It con­
stantly mixes its
poisonous gases.
entries.silver:
Top-grade perfume
is made using its
internal poison gases by diluting
them to the high­
est level.
entries.crystal:
When it inhales
poisonous gases
from garbage, its body expands, and
its insides smell
much worse.
entries.ruby:
WEEZING loves the gases given off by
rotted kitchen garbage. This POKéMON
will find a dirty, unkempt house and make it its home. At night, when the
people in the house are asleep, it will
go through the trash.
entries.sapphire:
WEEZING alternately shrinks and
inflates its twin bodies to mix together
toxic gases inside. The more the gases are mixed, the more
powerful the toxins become. The
POKéMON also becomes more putrid.
entries.emerald:
By diluting its toxic gases with a special
process, the highest grade of perfume can
be extracted. To WEEZING, gases emanating
from garbage are the ultimate feast.
entries.firered:
Very rarely, a sudden mutation can result
in two small KOFFING twins becoming
conjoined as a WEEZING.
entries.leafgreen:
Where two kinds of poison gases meet, two
KOFFING can fuse into a WEEZING over
many years.
entries.diamond:
It grows by feeding on gases
released by garbage. Though very
rare, triplets have been found.
entries.pearl:
It grows by feeding on gases
released by garbage. Though very
rare, triplets have been found.
entries.platinum:
It grows by feeding on gases
released by garbage. Though very
rare, triplets have been found.
entries.heartgold:
If one of the twin KOFFING inflates,
the other one deflates. It constantly
mixes its poisonous gases.
entries.soulsilver:
Top-grade perfume is made using its
internal poison gases by diluting
them to the highest level.
entries.black:
It grows by feeding on gases
released by garbage. Though very
rare, triplets have been found.
entries.white:
It grows by feeding on gases
released by garbage. Though very
rare, triplets have been found.
entries.black-2:

and mixing them inside its body
lets it spread an even fouler stench.
entries.white-2:
Inhaling toxic fumes from trash
and mixing them inside its body
lets it spread an even fouler stench.

entries.y:
Very rarely, a sudden mutation can result in two

a Weezing.
entries.omega-ruby:
Weezing loves the gases given off by rotted kitchen garbage.
This Pokémon will find a dirty, unkempt house and make it its
home. At night, when the people in the house are asleep, it will
go through the trash.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Weezing alternately shrinks and inflates its twin bodies to mix
together toxic gases inside. The more the gases are mixed,
the more powerful the toxins become. The Pokémon also
becomes more putrid.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
This Pokémon lives and grows by absorbing
poison gas, dust, and germs that exist
inside garbage.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
This Pokémon lives and grows by absorbing
poison gas, dust, and germs that exist
inside garbage.
entries.sword:
It mixes gases between its two bodies.
It’s said that these Pokémon were seen
all over the Galar region back in the day.
entries.shield:
It can’t suck in air quite as well as a Galarian
Weezing, but the toxins it creates are more
potent than those of its counterpart.

entries.yellow:
A POKéMON with a
one-track mind.
Once it charges,  it won't stop
running until it
falls asleep.
entries.red:
Its massive bones
are 1000 times
harder than human bones. It can
easily knock a
trailer flying.
entries.blue:
Its massive bones
are 1000 times
harder than human bones. It can
easily knock a
trailer flying.
entries.gold:
It is inept at
turning because of
its four short legs. It can only
charge and run in
one direction.

It doesn't care if
there is anything
in its way. It just charges and
destroys all ob­
stacles.
entries.crystal:
It can remember
only one thing at
a time. Once it starts rushing, it
forgets why it
started.
entries.ruby:
RHYHORN runs in a straight line,
smashing everything in its path.
It is not bothered even if it rushes headlong into a block of steel.
This POKéMON may feel some pain from
the collision the next day, however.
entries.sapphire:
RHYHORN’s brain is very small. It is so
dense, while on a run it forgets why it
started running in the first place. It apparently remembers sometimes if it
demolishes something.
entries.emerald:
Once it starts running, it doesn’t stop.
Its tiny brain makes it so stupid that it
can’t remember why it started running in
the first place.
entries.firered:
Strong, but not too bright, this POKéMON
can shatter even a skyscraper with its
charging TACKLES.
entries.leafgreen:

entries.diamond:

armor-like hide,
it is capable of living in molten
lava of 3,600
degrees.

it.

The eggs laid by Chansey are rich in nutrients
and a favorite food of many Pokémon.
entries.moon:
Not only are these Pokémon fast runners,
they’re also few in number, so anyone who finds
one must be lucky indeed.
entries.ultra-sun:
It seems that other Pokémon’s efforts to take
its delicious, nutritious egg away from it caused
Chansey to get faster at fleeing.
entries.ultra-moon:
Because the eggs on their bellies have been
overharvested by people in the past, the
Chansey population remains very small.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
A gentle and kindhearted Pokémon that shares
its nutritious eggs if it sees an injured Pokémon.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
A gentle and kindhearted Pokémon that shares
its nutritious eggs if it sees an injured Pokémon.
entries.sword:
The egg Chansey carries is not only delicious
but also packed with nutrition. It’s used as a
high-class cooking ingredient.
entries.shield:
This species was once very slow. To protect their
eggs from other creatures, these Pokémon
became able to flee quickly.
entries.legends-arceus: This purehearted Pokémon shares its eggs with the injured.

entries.red:
The whole body is
swathed with wide
vines that are similar to sea­
weed. Its vines
shake as it walks.
entries.blue:
The whole body is
swathed with wide
vines that are similar to sea­
weed. Its vines
shake as it walks.
entries.yellow:
Its identity is
obscured by masses
of thick, blue vines. The vines
are said to never
stop growing.
entries.gold:
The vines that
cloak its entire
body are always jiggling. They
effectively un­
nerve its foes.
entries.silver:
It tangles any
moving thing with
its vines. Their subtle shaking
is ticklish if you
get ensnared.
entries.crystal:
During battle, it
constantly moves
the vines that cover its body in
order to annoy its
opponent.
entries.ruby:
TANGELA’s vines snap off easily if they
are grabbed. This happens without pain,
allowing it to make a quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced by newly
grown vines the very next day.
entries.sapphire:
TANGELA’s vines snap off easily if they
are grabbed. This happens without pain,
allowing it to make a quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced by newly
grown vines the very next day.
entries.emerald:
Its vines snap off easily and painlessly
if they are grabbed, allowing it to make a
quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced
by new growth the very next day.
entries.firered:
Blue plant vines cloak the POKéMON’s
identity in a tangled mass. It entangles
anything that gets close.
entries.leafgreen:
The whole body is swathed with wide vines
that are similar to seaweed. The vines
sway as it walks.
entries.diamond:

behind this growth of vines.
entries.pearl:

entries.sword:
Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows
nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this
Pokémon’s true appearance remains a mystery.
entries.shield:
The vines of a Tangela have a distinct scent.
In some parts of Galar, Tangela vines are used
as herbs.
entries.legends-arceus:
It is cloaked entirely in blue vines, preventing any glimpse of
its true identity. The vines impart a refreshing sensation when
chewed—they're useful as a spice.

entries.red:
The infant rarely
ventures out of
its mother's protective pouch
until it is 3
years old.
entries.blue:
The infant rarely

in its belly
pouch. Won't run from any fight
to keep its young
protected.
entries.gold:
If it is safe, the
young gets out of
the belly pouch to play. The adult
keeps a close eye
on the youngster.
entries.silver:
To protect its
young, it will
never give up during battle, no
matter how badly
wounded it is.
entries.crystal:
To avoid
crushing the
baby it carries in its pouch, it
always sleeps
standing up.
entries.ruby:
If you come across a young KANGASKHAN
playing by itself, you must never
disturb it or attempt to catch it. The baby POKéMON’s parent is sure to
be in the area, and it will become
violently enraged at you.

be in the area, and it will become

playing by itself, never try to catch it.

on its belly. It is skilled at attacking

entries.sun:
Kangaskhan’s maternal love is so deep that it
will brave death to protect its offspring.
entries.moon:
The child in its pouch leaves home after roughly
three years. That is the only time the mother is
heard to cry wildly.
entries.ultra-sun:
Kangaskhan protects its child by keeping it in
its pouch. It has zero forgiveness for those
who harm its child and will beat them down.
entries.ultra-moon:
You shouldn’t get close to the child when it’s
playing outside its mother’s pouch. Its mother is
always nearby watching over it.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Raises its young in its belly pouch. Won’t run
from any fight to keep its young protected.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Raises its young in its belly pouch. Won’t run
from any fight to keep its young protected.
entries.sword:
Although it’s carrying its baby in a pouch on
its belly, Kangaskhan is swift on its feet. It
intimidates its opponents with quick jabs.
entries.shield:
There are records of a lost human child being
raised by a childless Kangaskhan.

entries.red:
Known to shoot
down flying bugs
with precision blasts of ink
from the surface
of the water.
entries.blue:
Known to shoot
down flying bugs

of the water.

danger, it will

If attacked by a
larger enemy, it
quickly swims to safety by adeptly
controlling its
dorsal fin.

while still facing
forward.

When they're in a
safe location,

fast, this POKéMON anchors itself by wrapping its tail around rocks or coral
to prevent being washed away.

reflexively spray a dense black ink
from its mouth and try to escape. This POKéMON swims by cleverly flapping
the fins on its back.

while facing forward. It spits ink to

water or a special type of ink from its mouth.
entries.sword:
Horsea makes its home in oceans with gentle
currents. If this Pokémon is under attack, it spits
out pitch-black ink and escapes.
entries.shield:
They swim with dance-like motions and cause
whirlpools to form. Horsea compete to see which
of them can generate the biggest whirlpool.

entries.ruby:
SEADRA sleeps after wriggling itself
between the branches of coral.
Those trying to harvest coral are occasionally stung by this POKéMON’s
poison barbs if they fail to notice it.
entries.sapphire:
SEADRA generates whirlpools by spinning
its body. The whirlpools are strong
enough to swallow even fishing boats. This POKéMON weakens prey with these
currents, then swallows it whole.
entries.emerald:
The poisonous barbs all over its body are
highly valued as ingredients for making
traditional herbal medicine. It shows no
mercy to anything approaching its nest.
entries.firered:

entries.ruby:
GOLDEEN is a very beautiful POKéMON
with fins that billow elegantly in water.
However, don’t let your guard down around this POKéMON - it could ram you
powerfully with its horn.
entries.sapphire:
GOLDEEN loves swimming wild and free
in rivers and ponds.
If one of these POKéMON is placed in an aquarium, it will shatter even the
thickest glass with one ram of its horn
and make its escape.
entries.emerald:
In the springtime, schools of GOLDEEN
can be seen swimming up falls and rivers.
It metes out staggering damage with its
single horn.
entries.firered:
Its dorsal and pectoral fins are strongly
developed like muscles. It can swim at a

entries.leafgreen:

entries.pearl:

entries.platinum:
Though it appears very elegant

Although known for their splendid tail fins,
Goldeen apparently compete among themselves

entries.ultra-moon:
The way it swims along fluttering its dress-like

The male and female will take turns
patrolling around their nest and eggs. The guarding of eggs by these POKéMON
goes on for over a month.

POKéMON that can

loses in battle.

entries.ruby:
STARYU’s center section has an organ
called the core that shines bright red.
If you go to a beach toward the end of summer, the glowing cores of
these POKéMON look like the stars
in the sky.
entries.sapphire:
STARYU apparently communicates with
the stars in the night sky by flashing
the red core at the center of its body. If parts of its body are torn, this
POKéMON simply regenerates the
missing pieces and limbs.
entries.emerald:
It gathers with others in the night and
makes its red core glow on and off with
the twinkling stars. It can regenerate
limbs if they are severed from its body.
entries.firered:
It appears in large numbers by seashores.
At night, its central core flashes with a
red light.
entries.leafgreen:

pieces and limbs.
entries.sun:
Large numbers of these Pokémon make their
home at the seaside. At night, a strange red
glow radiates from the center of their bodies.
entries.moon:
This Pokémon gets nibbled on by Lumineon and
others. Thanks to its red core, it regenerates
fast, so it’s unconcerned by their snack attacks.
entries.ultra-sun:
In many places, there are folktales of stardust
falling into the ocean and becoming Staryu.
entries.ultra-moon:
No number of injuries can bother Staryu. Its
amazing regenerative powers return it to its
previous state in half a day!
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
As long as the center section is unharmed,
this Pokémon can grow back fully even if it is
chopped to bits.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
As long as the center section is unharmed,
this Pokémon can grow back fully even if it is
chopped to bits.
entries.sword:
If you visit a beach at the end of summer, you’ll
be able to see groups of Staryu lighting up in a
steady rhythm.
entries.shield:
Fish Pokémon nibble at it, but Staryu isn’t
bothered. Its body regenerates quickly, even
if part of it is completely torn off.

entries.emerald:
People in ancient times imagined that
STARMIE were transformed from the

gentle waves at night.

Its shining core is thought to receive and
transmit enigmatic signals. It has been known

entries.moon:
Its unusual body shape, reminiscent of abstract
art, led local people to spread rumors that this
Pokémon may be an invader from outer space.
entries.ultra-sun:
Its sparkling core is called “the gem of the sea.”
This core can be made into high-priced
accessories that are traded in secret.
entries.ultra-moon:

through the water. It always seems to be
sending out mysterious radio waves.

it glows in seven colors.

The organ glows in seven colors when Starmie is
unleashing its potent psychic powers.
entries.shield:

As this Pokémon cruises through the ocean, it
absorbs tiny plankton.

mysterious

entries.ruby:
MR. MIME is a master of pantomime.
Its gestures and motions convince
watchers that something unseeable actually exists. Once it is believed,
it will exist as if it were a real thing.

convince others that something unseeable
actually exists. Once believed, the
imaginary object does become real.

to be able to create walls out of thin
air by miming.
entries.leafgreen:
If interrupted while it is miming, it will
suddenly DOUBLESLAP the offender with its
broad hands.
entries.diamond:
It is a pantomime expert that can
create invisible but solid walls
using miming gestures.
entries.pearl:
Emanations from its fingertips
solidify the air into invisible walls
that repel even harsh attacks.
entries.platinum:
It shapes an invisible wall in midair
by minutely vibrating its fingertips
to stop molecules in the air.
entries.heartgold:
A skilled mime from birth,
it gains the ability to create
invisible objects as it matures.
entries.soulsilver:
Its fingertips emit a peculiar
force field that hardens air to
create an actual wall.
entries.black:
It shapes an invisible wall in midair
by minutely vibrating its fingertips
to stop molecules in the air.
entries.white:
It shapes an invisible wall in midair
by minutely vibrating its fingertips
to stop molecules in the air.

by minutely vibrating its fingertips
to stop molecules in the air.
entries.white-2:

by minutely vibrating its fingertips
to stop molecules in the air.
entries.x:
Emanations from its fingertips solidify the air into
invisible walls that repel even harsh attacks.
entries.y:
It is adept at conning people. It is said to be able
to create walls out of thin air by miming.
entries.omega-ruby:
Mr. Mime is a master of pantomime. Its gestures and motions
convince watchers that something unseeable actually exists.
Once the watchers are convinced, the unseeable thing exists
as if it were real.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Mr. Mime is a master of pantomime. Its gestures and motions
convince watchers that something unseeable actually exists.
Once the watchers are convinced, the unseeable thing exists
as if it were real.
entries.ultra-sun:
Its pantomime skills are wonderful. You may
become enraptured while watching it, but next
thing you know, Mr. Mime has made a real wall.
entries.ultra-moon:
It creates invisible walls with its pantomiming.
If you don’t act impressed, it will attack you
with a double slap!
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Always practicing its pantomime act.
It makes enemies believe something exists
that really doesn’t.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Always practicing its pantomime act.
It makes enemies believe something exists
that really doesn’t.
entries.sword:
The broadness of its hands may be no
coincidence—many scientists believe its palms
became enlarged specifically for pantomiming.
entries.shield:
It’s known for its top-notch pantomime skills.
It protects itself from all sorts of attacks by
emitting auras from its fingers to create walls.
entries.legends-arceus:
The behavior of this clown-like Pokémon reminds one of
pantomime. It creates invisible walls using a force emitted
from its fingertips.

agility and speed,
it can create the illusion that
there is more
than one.

agility and speed,

there is more

grass and slices

grass with its

to track.

leaves only a
blur. If it hides in grass, its pro­
tective colors
make it invisible.

its speed. It

not even know what
knocked it down.

speed enhances the effectiveness of
the twin scythes on its forearms. This POKéMON’s scythes are so
effective, they can slice through thick
logs in one wicked stroke.

Scyther is blindingly fast. Its blazing speed enhances the

thick logs in one wicked stroke.
entries.sun:
It confuses its prey with its quick, ninja-like
movements. Then, in an instant, it cleaves
them with its scythes.
entries.moon:
While young, they live together deep in the
mountains, training themselves in how to fight
with their scythes and move at high speeds.
entries.ultra-sun:
Its two sharp scythes are more than just
weapons. It uses them with dexterity to dress
its prey before eating.
entries.ultra-moon:
Some call it a ninja. Its movements—
imperceptibly quick—are sufficient to cleave
the air in two. It’s very popular in Alola.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Leaps out of tall grass and slices prey with its
scythes. The movement looks like that of a ninja.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Leaps out of tall grass and slices prey with its
scythes. The movement looks like that of a ninja.
entries.sword:
As Scyther fights more and more battles, its
scythes become sharper and sharper. With a
single slice, Scyther can fell a massive tree.
entries.shield:
If you come across an area in a forest where a lot
of the trees have been cut down, what you’ve
found is a Scyther’s territory.
entries.legends-arceus:
The large, wickedly sharp scythes on its forearms are truly
fearsome weapons. Prey's attempts to flee are unfailingly
thwarted by this Pokémon's nimble motions.

wiggles its hips
as it walks. It can cause people
to dance in
unison with it.

wiggles its hips

JYNX walks rhythmically, swaying and
shaking its hips as if it were dancing.
Its motions are so bouncingly alluring, people seeing it are compelled to shake
their hips without giving any thought
to what they are doing.

entries.alpha-sapphire:

entries.ultra-sun:
It sways its hips to a rhythm all its own. The
precise movements of Jynx living in Alola are
truly wonderful.
entries.ultra-moon:
Its strange cries sound like human language.
There are some musicians who compose songs
for Jynx to sing.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Appears to move to a rhythm of its own, as if it
were dancing. It wiggles its hips as it walks.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Appears to move to a rhythm of its own, as if it
were dancing. It wiggles its hips as it walks.
entries.sword:
In certain parts of Galar, Jynx was once feared
and worshiped as the Queen of Ice.
entries.shield:
The Jynx of Galar often have beautiful and
delicate voices. Some of these Pokémon have
even gathered a fan base.

entries.red:
Normally found
near power plants,
they can wander away and cause
major blackouts
in cities.
entries.blue:
Normally found
near power plants,
they can wander away and cause
major blackouts
in cities.

If a major power
outage occurs, it
is certain that this POKéMON has
eaten electricity
at a power plant.
entries.gold:
Electricity runs
across the surface
of its body. In darkness, its en­
tire body glows a
whitish-blue.

Its body constant­
ly discharges
electricity. Get­ ting close to it
will make your
hair stand on end.
entries.crystal:
When two
ELECTABUZZ touch,
they control the electric currents
to communicate
their feelings.
entries.ruby:
When a storm arrives, gangs of this
POKéMON compete with each other to
scale heights that are likely to be stricken by lightning bolts.
Some towns use ELECTABUZZ in place of
lightning rods.

entries.sun:
Half of all sudden blackouts are caused
by Electabuzz gathering at electric power
plants and gobbling up electricity.
entries.moon:
Electricity leaks from it in amounts far greater
than the amount of electricity it eats.
entries.ultra-sun:
Electricity permeates its body. It swings
its arms round and round to charge up
electricity before unleashing a punch.
entries.ultra-moon:
While it’s often blamed for power outages, the
truth is the cause of outages is more often
an error on the part of the electric company.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
If a major power outage occurs, it is certain
that this Pokémon has eaten electricity
at a power plant.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
If a major power outage occurs, it is certain
that this Pokémon has eaten electricity
at a power plant.
entries.sword:
Many power plants keep Ground-type Pokémon
around as a defense against Electabuzz that
come seeking electricity.
entries.shield:
With the coming of a storm, many of these
Pokémon will gather under tall trees and sit there
waiting for lightning to strike.
entries.legends-arceus:
Feeds on electrical energy. During sudden showers beneath
looming thunderclouds, one can observe Electabuzz scaling tall
trees, where the Pokémon will then wait for lightning to strike.

burns with an
orange glow that enables it to
hide perfectly
among flames.

Its body always
burns with an

hide perfectly
among flames.

volcano. Its body
is always cloaked in flames, so it

ball of fire.

places, so it
blows scorching flames to make the

able for itself.

of its body gives

the sun.

In battle, MAGMAR blows out intensely
hot flames from all over its body to
intimidate its opponent. This POKéMON’s fiery bursts create
heat waves that ignite grass and trees
in its surroundings.
entries.sapphire:
In battle, MAGMAR blows out intensely
hot flames from all over its body to
intimidate its opponent. This POKéMON’s fiery bursts create
heat waves that ignite grass and trees
in its surroundings.
entries.emerald:

all over its body to intimidate its foe.
These fiery bursts create heat waves that
ignite grass and trees in the area.
entries.firered:
Found near the mouth of a volcano.
This fire-breather’s body temperature is
nearly 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit.
entries.leafgreen:
Its body always burns with an orange glow
that enables it to hide perfectly amidst
flames.
entries.diamond:
Born in the spout of a volcano,
its body is covered by flames
that shimmer like the sun.
entries.pearl:
Born in the spout of a volcano,
its body is covered by flames
that shimmer like the sun.
entries.platinum:
When it breathes deeply, heat
waves form around its body, making

entries.sun:
When it’s tired, it leaps into the mouth of a
volcano and soaks its body in magma to ease its
weariness. Its body burns at 2,192 degrees F.
entries.moon:
When angered, it spouts brilliant fire from all
over its body. It doesn’t calm down until its
opponent has burned to ash.
entries.ultra-sun:
Its entire body is burning. When it breathes,
the temperature rises. When it sneezes, flames
shoot out!
entries.ultra-moon:
The hotter the place, the better they feel.
Magmar in Alola are said to be hardier than
those in other areas.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Born in an active volcano. Its body is
always cloaked in flames, so it looks like
a big ball of fire.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Born in an active volcano. Its body is
always cloaked in flames, so it looks like
a big ball of fire.
entries.sword:
Magmar dispatches its prey with fire. But it
regrets this habit once it realizes that it has
burned its intended prey to a charred crisp.
entries.shield:
These Pokémon’s bodies are constantly burning.
Magmar are feared as one of the causes
behind fires.
entries.legends-arceus:
Legend has it that this Pokémon was born from the crater of a
volcano. When wounded, it bathes in lava to heal its body, much
as one would soak in a hot spring.

entries.red:

crush the victim
in its pincers, it will swing it
around and toss
it hard.
entries.blue:
If it fails to
crush the victim
in its pincers, it will swing it
around and toss
it hard.

Grips its prey in
its pincers and
squeezes hard! It can't move if it's
cold, so it lives
in warm places.
entries.gold:
With its horns, it
digs burrows to
sleep in at night. In the morning,
damp soil clings
to its body.
entries.silver:
Swings its long
antlers wildly to
attack. During cold periods, it
hides deep in
forests.
entries.crystal:
When the tempera­
ture drops at
night, it sleeps on treetops or
among roots where
it is well hidden.
entries.ruby:
PINSIR is astoundingly strong. It can
grip a foe weighing twice its weight
in its horns and easily lift it. This POKéMON’s movements turn sluggish
in cold places.
entries.sapphire:
PINSIR has a pair of massive horns 
Protruding from the surface of these
horns are thorns. These thorns are driven deeply into the
foe’s body when the pincer closes,
making it tough for the foe to escape.
entries.emerald:
Their pincers are strong enough to
shatter thick logs. Because they dislike
cold, PINSIR burrow and sleep under
the ground on chilly nights.
entries.firered:
Its two long pincer horns are powerful.
Once they grip an enemy, they won’t
release until the foe is torn.

the opponent.

until the prey is torn in half.

entries.sun:
It grips its prey in its pincers and splits them
apart. Although it is a powerful Pokémon, it
can’t deal with the cold.
entries.moon:
One solid blow from its horns is enough to split
apart a large tree. Its greatest rival in Alola
is Vikavolt.
entries.ultra-sun:
It gets into territorial disputes with Vikavolt.
For some reason, it apparently gets along well
with Heracross in Alola.
entries.ultra-moon:
Although it’s tough, it can’t handle cold well.
When night falls, it buries itself in leafage
and sleeps.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Grips its prey in its pincers and squeezes hard!
It can’t move if it’s cold out, so it lives in
warm places.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Grips its prey in its pincers and squeezes hard!
It can’t move if it’s cold out, so it lives in
warm places.
entries.sword:
These Pokémon judge one another based on
pincers. Thicker, more impressive pincers make
for more popularity with the opposite gender.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon clamps its pincers down on its prey
and then either splits the prey in half or flings
it away.

long tails.

at full speed.

These violent
POKéMON fight
with other mem­ bers of their herd
in order to prove
their strength.

it is rampaging at all times.

knock them down to calm itself.

entries.sun:
Historically, people in areas all over the world
have ridden Tauros, but the practice is said to
have started in Alola.
entries.moon:
Although it’s known to be a fierce Pokémon,
Tauros in the Alola region are said to possess
a measure of calmness.
entries.ultra-sun:
They live in groups. The one with the longest,
thickest, and most-scarred horns is the boss
of the herd.
entries.ultra-moon:
The climate seems to be related to the reason
Tauros in Alola are a little calmer than those in
other regions.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:

Once running, it won’t stop until it
hits something.

entries.sword:
When Tauros begins whipping itself with its tails,
it’s a warning that the Pokémon is about to
charge with astounding speed.
entries.shield:
The Tauros of the Galar region are volatile in
nature, and they won’t allow people to ride on
their backs.

POKéMON that can survive in any body of
water no matter how polluted it is.

Although weak and helpless, this Pokémon is

Its reckless leaps make it easy pickings for

Thanks to their strong hold on life, dirty water

With its astonishing capacity for
metamorphosis, it can get along with anything.
It does not get along well with its fellow Ditto.

While it can transform into anything, each Ditto

entries.lets-go-eevee:
It can evolve into a variety of forms.
Eevee’s genes are the key to solving
the mysteries of Pokémon evolution.
entries.sword:
It has the ability to alter the composition of its
body to suit its surrounding environment.
entries.shield:
Thanks to its unstable genetic makeup, this
special Pokémon conceals many different
possible evolutions.
entries.legends-arceus:
Harbors the potential to evolve into manifold forms.
Within Eevee lies the key to the mysteries of Pokémon
evolution—I'm certain of it.

entries.sun:
Its cells are composed of units much like water
molecules. It lives close to water and is often
mistaken for a mermaid.
entries.moon:
Blending in with the water and erasing all signs
of its presence, it patiently waits for its prey,
fish Pokémon.
entries.ultra-sun:
Clean, clear waters are its usual habitat. When
it’s about to be attacked by an invading enemy,
it dives into the water to hide.
entries.ultra-moon:
It detects nearby moisture with its fin. When its
fin begins trembling rapidly, that means rain will
fall in a few hours.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Its cell structure is similar to water molecules.
It melts into the water and becomes invisible.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Its cell structure is similar to water molecules.
It melts into the water and becomes invisible.
entries.sword:
When Vaporeon’s fins begin to vibrate, it is a
sign that rain will come within a few hours.
entries.shield:
Its body’s cellular structure is similar to the
molecular composition of water. It can melt
invisibly in water.
entries.legends-arceus:
Tests show that its cells closely resemble water molecules, which
perhaps explains its ability to conceal its form while submerged.
I believe the origins of mermaid folklore lie with this Pokémon.

bolts.
entries.blue:

MON that easily

electricity. This power is amplified by

thunderbolts. The bristling fur is made
of electrically charged needles.

entries.sun:
They send out electrical charges of about
10,000 volts. Because they are high-strung,
it can be difficult to grow close to them.
entries.moon:
When its fur stands on end, that’s a sign it’s
about to give off a jolt of electricity. Take care,
as sometimes lightning strikes next to it, too.
entries.ultra-sun:
Its lungs contain an organ that creates
electricity. The crackling sound of electricity
can be heard when it exhales.
entries.ultra-moon:
Its fur stands on end, becoming like needles
it fires at enemies. Once they’re weakened, it
finishes them off with a 10,000 volt shock.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
A sensitive Pokémon that easily becomes sad
or angry. Every time its mood changes, it
charges power.
entries.lets-go-eevee:

Bristles its fur into sharp, needlelike points when enraged.
One can hear electricity crackle in its breath when it exhales.

If it inhales deeply, that’s a sign it’s about to

cyberspace.

entries.yellow:

yet, however.

It is a manmade
POKéMON. Since it
doesn't breathe, people are eager
to try it in any
environment.

grammed with only
basic motions.

PORYGON is capable of reverting itself
entirely back to program data and
entering cyberspace. This POKéMON is copy-protected so it
cannot be duplicated by copying.

entries.sun:
Roughly 20 years ago, it was artificially created,
utilizing the latest technology of the time.
entries.moon:
It can convert its body into digital data,
which enables it to enter cyberspace.
entries.ultra-sun:
This Pokémon was created using the
cutting-edge science of 20 years ago, so
many parts of it have since become obsolete.
entries.ultra-moon:
It was built 20 years ago by scientists who
dreamed of exploring space. Their dreams have
yet to come true.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
The only Pokémon that people anticipate
can fly into space. None has managed
the feat yet, however.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
The only Pokémon that people anticipate
can fly into space. None has managed
the feat yet, however.
entries.sword:
State-of-the-art technology was used to create
Porygon. It was the first artificial Pokémon to be
created via computer programming.
entries.shield:
In recent years, this species has been very helpful
in cyberspace. These Pokémon will go around
checking to make sure no suspicious data exists.
entries.legends-arceus:
It has no discernible heartbeat and does not seem to draw
breath, and yet it appears to function without issue. I cannot
even begin to explain this utterly bizarre anomaly.

Omanyte lived in the seas of antiquity. Its
fossils have been found bearing bite marks from

entries.sword:
Because some Omanyte manage to escape after
being restored or are released into the wild by
people, this species is becoming a problem.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon is a member of an ancient, extinct
species. Omanyte paddles through water with its
10 tentacles, looking like it’s just drifting along.

entries.legends-arceus:
This glutton appears in villages without warning and devours the
entirety of their rice granaries—such occurrences have long been
counted among the gravest of disasters.

appear when the sky turns dark and lightning
showers down.
entries.sword:
This Pokémon has complete control over
electricity. There are tales of Zapdos nesting in
the dark depths of pitch-black thunderclouds.
entries.shield:
Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon. It’s said
that when Zapdos rubs its feathers together,
lightning will fall immediately after.

creates a dazzling
flash of flames.

entries.gold:
This legendary
POKéMON scatters
embers with every flap of its wings.
It is a thrilling
sight to behold.
entries.silver:

bird POKéMON is
said to bring early spring to
the wintry lands
it visits.
entries.crystal:

POKéMON. It is
said to migrate from the south

spring.
entries.ruby:
MOLTRES is a legendary bird POKéMON
that has the ability to control fire.
If this POKéMON is injured, it is said to dip its body in the molten magma of a
volcano to burn and heal itself.

until recently when a small
colony was found
living underwater.

to start with. It
repeatedly sheds its skin as it
steadily grows
longer.

full of life ener­

grows larger. Dur­ ing this process,
it is protected by
a rapid waterfall.
entries.ruby:

entries.sword:
Dratini dwells near bodies of rapidly flowing
water, such as the plunge pools of waterfalls.
As it grows, Dratini will shed its skin many times.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon was long considered to be no
more than a myth. The small lump on a Dratini’s
forehead is actually a horn that’s still coming in.

entries.red:
A mystical POKéMON
that exudes a
gentle aura. Has the ability
to change climate
conditions.
entries.blue:

that exudes a
gentle aura. Has the ability
to change climate
conditions.
entries.yellow:
According to a
witness, its body
was surrounded by a strange aura
that gave it a
mystical look.
entries.gold:
They say that if
it emits an aura
from its whole body, the weather
will begin to
change instantly.
entries.silver:
Its crystalline
orbs appear to
give this POKéMON the power to
freely control the
weather.
entries.crystal:
It is called the
divine POKéMON.
When its entire body brightens
slightly, the
weather changes.
entries.ruby:
DRAGONAIR stores an enormous amount
of energy inside its body.
It is said to alter weather conditions in its vicinity by discharging energy
from the crystals on its neck and tail.

energy inside its body. It is said to alter
the weather around it by loosing energy
from the crystals on its neck and tail.
entries.firered:
It is said to live in seas and lakes.
Even though it has no wings, it has been
seen flying occasionally.

entries.sun:
It has long been thought that its crystalline
orbs are imbued with the power to control
the weather.
entries.moon:
From time immemorial, it has been venerated by
agricultural peoples as an entity able to control
the weather.
entries.ultra-sun:
Lakes where Dragonair live are filled with
offerings from people, because they believe this
Pokémon is able to control the weather.
entries.ultra-moon:
Some say that if you see it at the start of the
year, flying through the sky and twisting its
body, you’ll be healthy all year long.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
According to a witness, its body was surrounded
by a strange aura that gave it a mystical look.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
According to a witness, its body was surrounded
by a strange aura that gave it a mystical look.
entries.sword:
This Pokémon lives in pristine oceans and lakes.
It can control the weather, and it uses this power
to fly into the sky, riding on the wind.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon gathers power in the orbs on its
tail and controls the weather. When enshrouded
by an aura, Dragonair has a mystical appearance.

This Pokémon saved a shipwrecked man, taking
him to a remote island—a paradise occupied
solely by Dragonite.

Incur the wrath of this normally calm Pokémon
at your peril, because it will smash everything
to smithereens before it’s satisfied.
entries.ultra-sun:

Pokémon “the sea incarnate.”
entries.ultra-moon:
You’ll often hear tales of this kindhearted

so it entirely avoids notice even if it approaches people.

If it loses a
fang, a new one
grows back in its place. There are
always 48 fangs
lining its mouth.

jaws wide when
attacking. If it loses any fangs
while biting, they
grow back in.

The tips of its
fangs are slanted
backward. Once those fangs clamp
down, the prey has
no hope of escape.
entries.ruby:
Once CROCONAW has clamped its jaws on
its foe, it will absolutely not let go.
Because the tips of its fangs are forked back like barbed fishhooks, they
become impossible to remove when 
they have sunk in.

sand to protect itself rather than fight back.

from its pack, it becomes incapable of
sleep due to fear.

entries.gold:
It makes a nest to
suit its long and
skinny body. The nest is impossible
for other POKéMON
to enter.

begins. Despite its short legs, it
is quick at hunt­
ing RATTATA.

It lives in narrow
burrows that fit
its slim body. The deeper the nests
go, the more maze­
like they become.

through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, this
POKéMON is very nimble and fleet.

entries.gold:
It always stands
on one foot. It
changes feet so fast, the movement
can rarely be
seen.
entries.silver:
It has a perfect
sense of time.
Whatever happens, it keeps rhythm by
precisely tilting
its head in time.
entries.crystal:
It begins to hoot
at the same time
every day. Some trainers use them
in place of
clocks.
entries.ruby:
HOOTHOOT has an internal organ that
senses and tracks the earth’s rotation.
Using this special organ, this POKéMON begins hooting at precisely the same
time every day.

entries.gold:
Its eyes are
specially adapted.
They concentrate even faint light
and enable it to
see in the dark.
entries.silver:
When it needs to
think, it rotates
its head 180 de­ grees to sharpen
its intellectual
power.
entries.crystal:
Its extremely soft
feathers make no
sound in flight. It silently sneaks
up on prey without
being detected.
entries.ruby:
NOCTOWL never fails at catching prey in
darkness. This POKéMON owes its
success to its superior vision that allows it to see in minimal light, and to
its soft,  supple wings that make no
sound in flight.

With eyes that can see in pitch-darkness, it
never lets its prey escape. Some even call it
“the emperor of dark nights.”
entries.ultra-moon:
When it turns its head entirely upside down,
you know it’s troubled by something. If you don’t
leave it be, it will peck you.

entries.gold:
It is very timid.
It will be afraid
to move if it is alone. But it will
be active if it is
in a group.
entries.silver:
When the weather
turns cold, lots
of LEDYBA gather from everywhere to
cluster and keep
each other warm.
entries.crystal:
It is timid and
clusters together
with others. The fluid secreted by
its feet indicates
its location.
entries.ruby:
LEDYBA secretes an aromatic fluid from
where its legs join its body. This fluid
is used for communicating with others. This POKéMON conveys its feelings to
others by altering the fluid’s scent.
entries.sapphire:

where its legs join its body. This fluid
is used for communicating with others. This POKéMON conveys its feelings to
others by altering the fluid’s scent.

they secrete from where the legs join the
body. They are said to convey feelings to

LEDYBA gather from everywhere to cluster

entries.sun:
They are timid and grow uneasy when not in a
swarm with others of their kind. The pattern on
their backs differs slightly from one to another.
entries.moon:
They communicate with one another using bodily
fluids that give off odors. When they’re angry,
their odor smells sour.
entries.ultra-sun:
This Pokémon is very sensitive to cold. In the
warmth of Alola, it appears quite lively.
entries.ultra-moon:
These very cowardly Pokémon join together and
use Reflect to protect their nest.

entries.gold:
When the stars
flicker in the
night sky, it flutters about,
scattering a
glowing powder.
entries.silver:
The star patterns
on its back grow
larger or smaller depending on the
number of stars in
the night sky.
entries.crystal:
In the daytime
when it gets warm,
it curls up inside a big leaf and
drifts off into
a deep slumber.
entries.ruby:
It is said that in lands with clean air,
where the stars fill the sky, there live
LEDIAN in countless numbers. There is a good reason for this - the
POKéMON uses the light of the stars
as its energy.

as its energy.

entries.sun:
While it’s believed that starlight provides it with
energy, this Pokémon also loves to eat berries.
In the daytime, it curls up in the grass to sleep.
entries.moon:
In battle, it throws punches with all four arms.
The power of each individual blow is piddly,
so it aims to win by quantity rather than quality.
entries.ultra-sun:
It’s said that the patterns on its back are
related to the stars in the night sky, but the
details of that relationship remain unclear.
entries.ultra-moon:
It flies through the night sky, sprinkling sparkly
dust. According to some, if that dust sticks to
you, good things will happen to you.

entries.gold:
It lies still in
the same pose for
days in its web, waiting for its
unsuspecting prey
to wander close.
entries.silver:
It spins a web
using fine--but
durable--thread. It then waits pa­
tiently for prey
to be trapped.
entries.crystal:
If prey becomes
ensnared in its
nest of spun string, it waits
motionlessly until
it becomes dark.
entries.ruby:
The web spun by SPINARAK can be
considered its second nervous system.
It is said that this POKéMON can determine what kind of prey is touching
its web just by the tiny vibrations it
feels through the web’s strands.

entries.sun:
It waits intently until its preferred prey, Cutiefly,
gets caught in its web. In fact, it’s quite a
patient Pokémon.
entries.moon:
Some fishermen weave its sturdy thread into
nets to catch fish Pokémon.
entries.ultra-sun:
With threads from its mouth, it fashions sturdy
webs that won’t break even if you set a rock
on them.
entries.ultra-moon:
Although the poison from its fangs isn’t that
strong, it’s potent enough to weaken prey that
gets caught in its web.

entries.gold:
It spins string
not only from its
rear but also from its mouth. It is
hard to tell which
end is which.
entries.silver:
A single strand of
a special string
is endlessly spun out of its rear.
The string leads
back to its nest.
entries.crystal:
Rather than mak­
ing a nest in one
specific spot, it wanders in search
of food after
darkness falls.
entries.ruby:
ARIADOS’s feet are tipped with tiny
hooked claws that enable it to scuttle
on ceilings and vertical walls. This POKéMON constricts the foe with
thin and strong silk webbing.

endlessly spun out of its rear. The string

entries.moon:
It spins thread from both its rear and its mouth.
Then it wraps its prey up in thread and sips
their bodily fluids at its leisure.
entries.ultra-sun:
Every night, it wanders around in search of
prey, whose movements it restrains by spewing
threads before it bites into them with its fangs.
entries.ultra-moon:
It spews threads from its mouth to catch its
prey. When night falls, it leaves its web to go
hunt aggressively.

entries.gold:
It flies so si­
lently through the
dark on its four wings that it may
not be noticed
even when nearby.
entries.silver:
The development of
wings on its legs
enables it to fly fast but also
makes it tough to
stop and rest.
entries.crystal:
As a result of its
pursuit of faster,
yet more silent flight, a new set
of wings grew on
its hind legs.
entries.ruby:
If this POKéMON is flying by fluttering
only a pair of wings on either the
forelegs or hind legs, it’s proof that CROBAT has been flying a long distance.
It switches the wings it uses if it is
tired.
entries.sapphire:
CROBAT sneaks up on its intended prey
using wings that barely make a sound.
This POKéMON rests by hanging on a tree branch with its rear legs that
serve as wings.
entries.emerald:
Over the course of evolution, its hind legs
turned into wings. By alternately resting
its front and rear wings, it can fly all day
without having to stop.
entries.firered:
The development of wings on its legs
enables it to fly fast but also makes it
tough to stop and rest.
entries.leafgreen:
It flies so silently through the dark on
its four wings that it may not be noticed
even when nearby.
entries.diamond:
Having four wings enables it to fly
faster and more quietly. It turns
active when the night comes.
entries.pearl:
A Pokémon that gained vastly
enhanced flying performance by
having its legs turn into wings.
entries.platinum:
The transformation of its legs into
wings made it better at flying, but
more clumsy at walking.
entries.heartgold:
It flies so silently through the
dark on its four wings that it may

quickly and quietly so it can sneak up
on prey without its noticing.
entries.white-2:
Having four wings allows it to fly more

entries.omega-ruby:
If this Pokémon is flying by fluttering only a pair of wings on

entries.alpha-sapphire:

branch with its rear legs that serve as wings.
entries.sun:
Both its legs became wings, and as a result,
it can’t move well on the ground. All it can do
is crawl around.
entries.moon:
Silent and swift in its four-winged flight, it bites
down on its prey before they realize what’s
happening. In a heartbeat, it drains their blood.
entries.ultra-sun:
Its fangs are so sharp, if it bites you in the dark
and sucks your blood, you won’t notice any pain
or realize you’ve been bitten.
entries.ultra-moon:
It feeds on the blood of living people and
Pokémon. If it can’t drink any blood for even a
short while, it becomes weak and unable to fly.
entries.sword:
Both of its legs have turned into wings. Without a
sound, Crobat flies swiftly toward its prey and
sinks its fangs into the nape of its target’s neck.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon flaps its four wings skillfully.
Crobat can fly through cramped caves without
needing to slow down.
entries.legends-arceus:
Its hind limbs have become another set of wings. Crobat
expertly maneuvers its four wings to dart in exquisite fashion
through even the most confined caves without losing any speed.

of its sprawling
territorial area, this POKéMON will
fiercely peck at
any intruder.

prey.

own territory. This POKéMON flies
around, patrolling its living space. If its territory is violated, it shows
no mercy in thoroughly punishing the
foe with its sharp claws.

The light it emits
is so bright that
it can illuminate the sea's surface
from a depth of
over three miles.
entries.silver:
It blinds prey
with an intense
burst of light, then swallows the
immobilized prey
in a single gulp.
entries.crystal:
This POKéMON uses
the bright part of
its body, which changed from a
dorsal fin, to
lure prey.
entries.ruby:
LANTURN is nicknamed “the deep-sea
star” for its illuminated antenna.
This POKéMON produces light by causing a chemical reaction between
bacteria and its bodily fluids inside
the antenna.
entries.sapphire:
LANTURN is known to emit light.
If you peer down into the dark sea from
a ship at night, you can sometimes see this POKéMON’s light rising from the
depths where it swims. It gives the sea
an appearance of a starlit night.
entries.emerald:

very bright. They are formed from a part of

entries.firered:

entries.moon:
This Pokémon flashes a bright light that blinds
its prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver
an electrical attack.
entries.ultra-sun:
When the bacteria living inside its antennae
absorb Lanturn’s bodily fluids, a strong
luminescent effect is produced.
entries.ultra-moon:
It lives far down in the depths of the ocean. It
blinds its prey with light, using the moment
