entries.gold:
It is not yet
skilled at storing
electricity. It may send out a
jolt if amused
or startled.
entries.silver:
Despite its small
size, it can zap
even adult humans. However, if it
does so, it also
surprises itself.
entries.crystal:
It is unskilled at
storing electric
power. Any kind of shock causes it to
discharge energy
spontaneously.
entries.ruby:
PICHU charges itself with electricity
more easily on days with thunderclouds
or when the air is very dry. You can hear the crackling of static
electricity coming off this POKéMON.
entries.sapphire:
When PICHU plays with others, it may
short out electricity with another
PICHU, creating a shower of sparks. In that event, this POKéMON will begin
crying, startled by the flash of sparks.
entries.emerald:
It is still inept at retaining electricity.
When it is startled, it discharges power
accidentally. It gets better at holding
power as it grows older.
entries.firered:
Despite its small size, it can zap even
adult humans. However, if it does so, it
also surprises itself.
entries.leafgreen:
It is not yet skilled at storing
electricity. It may send out a jolt if
amused or startled.
entries.diamond:
The electric pouches on its cheeks
are still small. They cannot store
much electricity yet.
entries.pearl:
It plays with others by touching
tails and setting off sparks. This
appears to be a test of courage.
entries.platinum:
The electric sacs in its cheeks are
small. If even a little electricity
leaks, it becomes shocked.

It is not yet skilled at controlling electricity.
If you take your eyes off it, it may shock itself.
entries.moon:
Despite this Pokémon’s cute appearance, those
who want to live with one should prepare to be
on the receiving end of its electric jolts.
entries.ultra-sun:
It still can’t use electricity well. When it’s
surprised or excited, it discharges
electricity unintentionally.
entries.ultra-moon:
It has electric sacs in its cheeks. When they’re
fully charged, Pichu plays very energetically.
entries.sword:
Despite its small size, it can zap even adult
humans. However, if it does so, it also
surprises itself.
entries.shield:
The electric sacs in its cheeks are small. If even a
little electricity leaks, it becomes shocked.
entries.legends-arceus:
Pichu stores electricity in the sacs on its cheeks but discharges it
inadvertently when agitated or excited. Being yet immature,
the Pokémon's handling of electricity is rather inept.

entries.gold:
Because of its
unusual, star-like
silhouette, people believe that it
came here on
a meteor.
entries.silver:
When numerous me­
teors illuminate
the night sky, sightings of
CLEFFA strangely
increase.
entries.crystal:
If the impact site
of a meteorite is
found, this POKéMON is certain
to be within the
immediate area.
entries.ruby:
On nights with many shooting stars,
CLEFFA can be seen dancing in a ring.
They dance through the night and stop only at the break of day, when these
POKéMON quench their thirst with the
morning dew.
entries.sapphire:

CLEFFA can be seen dancing in a ring.
They dance through the night and stop only at the break of day, when these
POKéMON quench their thirst with the
morning dew.

CLEFFA can be seen dancing in a ring.
They dance until daybreak, when they
quench their thirst with the morning dew.
entries.firered:
When numerous meteors illuminate the
night sky, sightings of CLEFFA strangely
increase.
entries.leafgreen:
Because of its unusual, starlike
silhouette, people believe that it came

It is believed to arrive riding on

entries.pearl:
Many appear when the night skies
are filled with shooting stars.
They disappear with sunrise.
entries.platinum:
It is often seen when shooting
stars fill the night skies. It’s said
to arrive riding on a shooting star.
entries.heartgold:

are often seen in places where
shooting stars have fallen.
entries.white-2:
According to local rumors, Cleffa
are often seen in places where
shooting stars have fallen.
entries.x:
Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people
believe that it came here on a meteor.
entries.y:
Many appear when the night skies are filled with
shooting stars. They disappear with sunrise.
entries.ultra-sun:
On nights with many shooting stars,
they gather in packs and dance in circles. If you
should see them, something good will happen!
entries.omega-ruby:

with the morning dew.
entries.alpha-sapphire:

with the morning dew.
entries.sun:

it gazes intently skyward, as if thinking of
its home.
entries.moon:
Because of its silhouette, it’s believed to be a
star reborn. For some reason, it loves Minior.
entries.ultra-moon:
Said to have ridden here on a shooting star,
Cleffa seem to appear in places where
meteorites have struck in the past.
entries.sword:
According to local rumors, Cleffa are often seen
in places where shooting stars have fallen.
entries.shield:
Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people
believe that it came here on a meteor.
entries.legends-arceus:
In silhouette, they resemble twinkling starlight. When shooting
stars rain from the night sky, Cleffa gather in numbers and dance
as though they are indeed incarnations of the stars.

body. If it starts
to roll, it will bounce all over
and be impossible
to stop.

flexible and elas­

where.

with its short
legs, it moves around by bouncing

tender body.

sufficiently developed. It would hurt
its throat if it were to sing too much. This POKéMON gargles with freshwater
from a clean stream.

that feels very much like a marshmallow.
From this body wafts a gently sweet fragrance that soothes and calms the
emotions of its foes.

might, its body steadily turns a deepening
pink color.

makes it bounce continuously--anytime,
anywhere.

entries.white-2:
Its body has a faintly sweet scent
and is bouncy and soft. If it bounces
even once, it cannot stop.
entries.x:
Instead of walking with its short legs, it moves
around by bouncing on its soft, tender body.
entries.y:
It has a very soft body. If it starts to roll, it will
bounce all over and be impossible to stop.
entries.omega-ruby:
Igglybuff’s vocal cords are not sufficiently developed. It would
hurt its throat if it were to sing too much. This Pokémon
gargles with freshwater from a clean stream.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Igglybuff has a soft and plushy body that feels very much like
a marshmallow. From this body wafts a gently sweet fragrance
that soothes and calms the emotions of its foes.
entries.sun:
It likes to sing but is not yet good at it.
With praise and encouragement, it will get
better little by little.
entries.moon:
It moves by bouncing along. As it moves a lot,
it sweats, and its body gives off a sweet aroma.
entries.ultra-sun:
It’s always practicing its singing because it
wants to improve. Even when it’s asleep,
it keeps singing in its dreams!
entries.ultra-moon:
Left to its own devices, it will constantly
practice singing. You should make it take a
break so it doesn’t hurt its throat.
entries.sword:
Igglybuff loves to sing. Its marshmallow-like body
gives off a faint sweet smell.
entries.shield:
Taking advantage of the softness of its body,
Igglybuff moves as if bouncing. Its body turns a
deep pink when its temperature rises.

entries.gold:
Because its wings
aren't yet fully
grown, it has to hop to get around.

not yet fully grown. If your eyes meet

even slightly, it will hop away to safety.

ability. The POKéMON flaps and leaps
onto tree branches that are taller than grown-up people to pick at the tree’s
new shoots.

entries.gold:
They say that it
stays still and
quiet because it is seeing both the
past and future at
the same time.
entries.silver:
In South America,
it is said that
its right eye sees the future and its
left eye views the
past.
entries.crystal:
Once it begins to
meditate at sun­
rise, the entire day will pass
before it will
move again.
entries.ruby:
XATU stands rooted and still in one
spot all day long. People believe that
this POKéMON does so out of fear of the terrible things it has foreseen in
the future.
entries.sapphire:
XATU is known to stand motionless while
staring at the sun all day long.
Some people revere it as a mystical POKéMON out of their belief that XATU
is in possession of the power to see
into the future.
entries.emerald:

its body, its fleece doubles in
volume. Touching
it will shock you.

continually. In
the summer, the fleece is fully
shed, but it grows
back in a week.

air in its soft
fur, allowing it to stay cool in
summer and warm
in winter.

together and builds a static charge.

tip of its tail grows.

head, compelling them to choose PIDGEOT

entries.omega-ruby:

to send signals back and forth with others far away.

is, which is why it usually keeps the light off.
entries.ultra-moon:
Its tail shines bright and strong. It has been
prized since long ago as a beacon for sailors.

entries.gold:
The tip of its
tail, which con­
tains oil that is lighter than wa­
ter, lets it swim
without drowning.

The end of its
tail serves as a
buoy that keeps it from drowning,
even in a vicious
current.

The fur on its
body naturally
repels water. It can stay dry, even
when it plays in
the water.
entries.ruby:
MARILL’s oil-filled tail acts much like
a life preserver. If you see just its
tail bobbing on the water’s surface, it’s a sure indication that this POKéMON
is diving beneath the water to feed on
aquatic plants.

fast-running stream, MARILL wraps its
tail around the trunk of a tree. This POKéMON’s tail is flexible and
configured to stretch.

fur. Because of the fur, it can swim
through water at high speed without being
slowed by the water’s resistance.

entries.emerald:
It lives in water virtually all day long.
Its body color and pattern act as
camouflage that makes it tough for
enemies to spot in water.
entries.gold:
By keeping still
and listening in­
tently, it can tell what is in
even wild, fast-
moving rivers.
entries.silver:
When it plays in
water, it rolls up
its elongated ears to prevent their
insides from get­
ting wet.
entries.crystal:
The bubble-like
pattern on its
stomach helps it camouflage itself
when it's in the
water.
entries.ruby:
AZUMARILL’s long ears are indispensable
sensors. By focusing its hearing, this
POKéMON can identify what kinds of prey are around, even in rough and
fast-running rivers.
entries.sapphire:
AZUMARILL can make balloons out of
air. It makes these air balloons if it
spots a drowning POKéMON. The air balloons enable the POKéMON in
trouble to breathe.

entries.gold:
Although it always
pretends to be a
tree, its composi­ tion appears to be
closer to a rock
than a plant.

It disguises it­
self as a tree to
avoid attack. It hates water, so it
will disappear if
it starts raining.

If a tree branch
shakes when there
is no wind, it's a SUDOWOODO, not a
tree. It hides
from the rain.
entries.ruby:
SUDOWOODO camouflages itself as a tree
to avoid being attacked by enemies.
However, because the forelegs remain green throughout the year, the POKéMON
is easily identified as a fake during
the winter.

entries.sun:
To avoid attack, it mimics a tree. It will run off
if splashed with water, which it hates.
entries.moon:
Apparently, the larger the green parts of this
Pokémon, the more collectors value it. It’s a
particular favorite among elderly people.
entries.ultra-sun:
It’s so popular with the elderly that there’s a
magazine devoted to this Pokémon. Fans obsess
over the particular length and angle of its arms.
entries.ultra-moon:
The result of its holding the same pose all the
time is arms that have become supple
yet strong.
entries.sword:
If a tree branch shakes when there is no wind, it’s
a Sudowoodo, not a tree. It hides from the rain.
entries.shield:
It disguises itself as a tree to avoid attack. It hates
water, so it will disappear if it starts raining.
entries.legends-arceus:
Though it pretends to be a tree, it fails to fool even children.
To the touch, its body feels more like rock than tree bark.
Sudowoodo's extreme aversion to water merits special note.

entries.gold:
If POLIWAG and
POLIWHIRL hear its
echoing cry, they respond by gather­
ing from far and
wide.

Whenever three or
more of these get
together, they sing in a loud
voice that sounds
like bellowing.
entries.crystal:

its throat to
croak out a tune, nearby POLIWAG and
POLIWHIRL gather
immediately.

proof of its status as a king. It is said
that the longer and more curled the hair, the more respect this POKéMON
earns from its peers.

entries.sun:
They gather on moonlit nights to form a large
chorus. Their cries sound angry and not at all
pleasant, but they are certainly distinctive.
entries.moon:
It’s the leader of Poliwag and Poliwhirl.
When Politoed roars, they all cower in fear.
entries.ultra-sun:
Although its cries sound like screams, a
composer created a beautiful ballad that was
influenced by the sounds.
entries.ultra-moon:
The longer and more luxurious the curled hair on
its head, the greater the number of Poliwag and
Poliwhirl that will obey it.
entries.sword:
At nightfall, these Pokémon appear on the shores
of lakes. They announce their territorial claims by
letting out cries that sound like shouting.
entries.shield:
The cry of a male is louder than that of a female.
Male Politoed with deep, menacing voices find
more popularity with the opposite gender.

do enjoy gentle
breezes, though.

next town.

strong winds, HOPPIP links its leaves with other HOPPIP to prepare against
being blown away.

around the world.

entries.platinum:
When exposed to the moon’s aura,
the rings on its body glow faintly
and it gains a mysterious power.
entries.heartgold:
When agitated, this Pokémon
protects itself by spraying
poisonous sweat from its pores.
entries.soulsilver:
When darkness falls, the rings
on the body begin to glow, striking
fear in the hearts of anyone nearby.
entries.black:

the rings on its body glow faintly
and it gains a mysterious power.
entries.white:

the rings on its body glow faintly

the rings on its body glow faintly
and it’s filled with a mysterious power.
entries.white-2:

the rings on its body glow faintly
and it’s filled with a mysterious power.

structure. It lurks in darkness for prey.
entries.y:

mysterious power.
entries.omega-ruby:
Umbreon evolved as a result of exposure to the moon’s waves.
It hides silently in darkness and waits for its foes to make a
move. The rings on its body glow when it leaps to attack.
entries.alpha-sapphire:

entries.sun:
When this Pokémon becomes angry, its pores
secrete a poisonous sweat, which it sprays at
its opponent’s eyes.
entries.moon:
With its black fur, it blends into the darkness.
It bides its time, and when prey appears, this
Pokémon goes for its throat, and then eats it.
entries.ultra-sun:
This Pokémon is nocturnal. Even in total
darkness, its large eyes can spot its
prey clearly!
entries.ultra-moon:
It lurks in the dark of night looking for prey.
At the moment it pounces, the rings on its
body glow dimly but ominously.
entries.sword:
When this Pokémon becomes angry, its pores
secrete a poisonous sweat, which it sprays at
its opponent’s eyes.
entries.shield:
On the night of a full moon, or when it gets
excited, the ring patterns on its body glow yellow.
entries.legends-arceus:
It is most active in the wee hours of the night, when moonlight
bathes the land. Its large eyes can pierce the darkness and
perceive prey with absolute clarity.

entries.gold:
Feared and loathed
by many, it is
believed to bring misfortune to all
those who see it
at night.
entries.silver:
It is said that
when chased, it
lures its attacker onto dark mountain
trails where the
foe will get lost.
entries.crystal:
It hides any shiny
object it finds in
a secret location. MURKROW and
MEOWTH loot one
another's stashes.
entries.ruby:
MURKROW was feared and loathed as the
alleged bearer of ill fortune.
This POKéMON shows strong interest in anything that sparkles or glitters.
It will even try to steal rings from
women.
entries.sapphire:

alleged bearer of ill fortune.

It will even try to steal rings from
women.

It appears near travelers to lure
them into deep forests. It is said

entries.platinum:
If spotted, it will lure an unwary
person into chasing it, then lose
the pursuer on mountain trails.

entries.sun:
They awaken at dusk and take wing in the
twilight, leading to the expression,
“Get home before the Murkrow fly.”
entries.moon:
Seen as a symbol of bad luck, it’s generally
disliked. Yet it gives presents—objects that
sparkle or shine—to Trainers it’s close to.
entries.ultra-sun:
It has a weakness for shiny things. It’s been
known to sneak into the nests of Gabite—noted
collectors of jewels—in search of treasure.
entries.ultra-moon:
It searches for shiny things for its boss.
Murkrow’s presence is said to be unlucky, so
many people detest it.
entries.legends-arceus:
Widely shunned as a bearer of ill fortune. Upon crossing paths
with this creature, I've been told one must chant ”Workrum,
Workrum—bad luck, don't come” as a protective incantation.

entries.gold:
It has incredible
intellect and in­
tuition. Whatever the situation, it
remains calm and
collected.
entries.silver:
When its head was
bitten, toxins
entered SLOWPOKE's head and unlocked
an extraordinary
power.
entries.crystal:
Every time it ya­
wns, SHELLDER
injects more poi­ son into it. The
poison makes it
more intelligent.
entries.ruby:
SLOWKING undertakes research every
day in an effort to solve the mysteries
of the world. However, this POKéMON apparently
forgets everything it has learned if
the SHELLDER on its head comes off.

A poisonous bite reacted with its system,
blessing it with the enhanced intellect of a
genius. It has full control of its psychic powers.
entries.moon:
This Pokémon is so famed for its intellect that a
proverb still persists in some regions: “When in
doubt, ask Slowking.”
entries.ultra-sun:
It’s constantly coming up with new ideas that
would change the world, but as soon as it
hits upon a new idea, it forgets it.
entries.ultra-moon:
It’s called “the sage of the sea.” It engages in
battles of wits with Oranguru, but the result is
usually a draw.
entries.sword:
Miraculously, this former Slowpoke’s latent
intelligence was drawn out when Shellder poison
raced through its brain.
entries.shield:
Slowking can solve any problem presented to it,
but no one can understand a thing Slowking says.

its back grows
large, it appears to lose the
ability to stand
on its hind legs.
entries.blue:

its back grows
large, it appears to lose the
ability to stand
on its hind legs.

The bulb on its
back grows by
drawing energy. It gives off an
aroma when it is
ready to bloom.
entries.gold:
Exposure to sun­
light adds to its
strength. Sunlight also makes the bud
on its back grow
larger.
entries.silver:
If the bud on its
back starts to
smell sweet, it is evidence that
the large flower
will soon bloom.
entries.crystal:
The bulb on its
back grows as it
absorbs nutrients. The bulb gives off
a pleasant aroma
when it blooms.
entries.ruby:
There is a bud on this POKéMON’s back.
To support its weight, IVYSAUR’s legs
and trunk grow thick and strong. If it starts spending more time lying
in the sunlight, it’s a sign that the
bud will bloom into a large flower soon.

kers to maintain
its balance. It apparently
slows down if
they are cut off.

Its hind feet are
webbed. They act
as flippers, so it can swim in
rivers and hunt
for prey.
entries.gold:
Gnaws on anything
with its tough
fangs. It can even topple concrete
buildings by gnaw­
ing on them.
entries.silver:
Its whiskers help
it to maintain
balance. Its fangs never stop grow­
ing, so it gnaws
to pare them down.
entries.crystal:
The webs on its
hind legs enable
it to cross rivers. It search­
es wide areas for
food.
entries.ruby:
RATICATE’s sturdy fangs grow steadily.
To keep them ground down, it gnaws
on rocks and logs. It may even chew on the walls of
houses.

swimmer. It can cross rivers and sometimes
even oceans.
entries.moon:
Its disposition is far more violent than its looks
would suggest. Don’t let your hand get too close
to its face, as it could bite your hand clean off.
entries.ultra-sun:
People say that it fled from its enemies by
using its small webbed hind feet to swim
from island to island in Alola.
entries.ultra-moon:
Its whiskers are essential for maintaining its
balance. No matter how friendly you are, it will
get angry and bite you if you touch its whiskers.

Its hind feet are webbed. They act as flippers,
so it can swim in rivers and hunt for prey.

entries.gold:
It likes playing
mischievous tricks
such as screaming and wailing to
startle people at
night.
entries.silver:
It loves to bite
and yank people's
hair from behind without warning,
just to see their
shocked reactions.
entries.crystal:
It loves to watch
people it's scar­
ed. It frightens them by screaming
loudly or appear­
ing suddenly.
entries.ruby:
MISDREAVUS frightens people with a
creepy, sobbing cry. The POKéMON
apparently uses its red spheres to absorb the fearful feelings of foes and
turn them into nutrition.
entries.sapphire:

that it absorbs into its red orbs.
In daytime, it sleeps in darkness.
entries.platinum:
A Pokémon that startles people in
the middle of the night. It gathers
fear as its energy.

It will use any means necessary to frighten
people and absorb their life energy. It practices
constantly to hone its skill in causing fear.
entries.moon:
If you hear a sobbing sound emanating from a
vacant room, it’s undoubtedly a bit of mischief
from Misdreavus.
entries.ultra-sun:
What gives meaning to its life is surprising
others. If you set your ear against the red orbs
around its neck, you can hear shrieking.
entries.ultra-moon:
What makes it happy is imitating the voices of
weeping people and scaring everyone. It doesn’t
deal well with folks who aren’t easily frightened.
entries.legends-arceus:
It conceals itself in darkness, sending chills up travelers' spines
with its childlike weeping. As it observes the frightened travelers
with glee, the red orbs upon its chest let off an eerie light.

entries.gold:
Their shapes look
like hieroglyphs
on ancient tab­ lets. It is said
that the two are
somehow related.
entries.silver:
Its flat, thin
body is always
stuck on walls. Its shape appears
to have some mean­
ing.
entries.crystal:
Because different
types of UNOWN
exist, it is said that they must
have a variety of
abilities.
entries.ruby:
This POKéMON is shaped like ancient
writing. It is a mystery as to which
came first, the ancient writings or the various UNOWN. Research into this
topic is ongoing but nothing is known.

It hates light and
shock. If attack­
ed, it inflates its body to pump
up its counter­
strike.

To keep its pitch-
black tail hidden,
it lives quietly in the darkness.
It is never first
to attack.

ceal its black
tail, it lives in a dark cave and
only moves about

entries.ruby:
If two or more WOBBUFFET meet, they will
turn competitive and try to outdo each
other’s endurance. However, they may try to see which one
can endure the longest without food.
TRAINERS need to beware of this habit.

attacks - it won’t attack on its own.
However, it won’t endure an attack on its tail. When that happens, the
POKéMON will try to take the foe with it
using DESTINY BOND.
entries.emerald:

ferociously if its black tail is attacked.
It makes its lair in caves where it waits
for nightfall.

If two or more Wobbuffet meet, they will turn competitive
and try to outdo each other’s endurance. However, they may
try to see which one can endure the longest without food.
Trainers need to beware of this habit.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Wobbuffet does nothing but endure attacks—it won’t attack on
its own. However, it won’t endure an attack on its tail. When
that happens, the Pokémon will try to take the foe with it using
Destiny Bond.
entries.sword:
It hates light and shock. If attacked, it inflates its
body to pump up its counterstrike.
entries.shield:
To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it lives quietly
in the darkness. It is never first to attack.

entries.gold:
Its tail has a
small brain of its
own. Beware! If you get close, it
may react to your
scent and bite.
entries.silver:
Its tail, which
also contains a
small brain, may bite on its own if
it notices an
alluring smell.
entries.crystal:
When it is in
danger, its tail
uses some sort of mysterious powers
to drive away the
enemy.
entries.ruby:
GIRAFARIG’s rear head also has a brain,
but it is small. The rear head attacks in
response to smells and sounds. Approaching this POKéMON from behind
can cause the rear head to suddenly
lash out and bite.
entries.sapphire:
GIRAFARIG’s rear head contains a tiny
brain that is too small for thinking.
However, the rear head doesn’t need to sleep, so it can keep watch over its
surroundings 24 hours a day.
entries.emerald:
A GIRAFARIG is an herbivore--it eats
grass and tree shoots. While it is eating,
its tail makes chewing and swallowing
motions as if it were also eating.

drops down to the ground and explodes
with no warning.

total mystery.

tree. It scatters pieces of its hard
shell to drive its
enemies away.

hanging on to a
fat tree trunk. It shoots out bits of
its shell when it
sees action.

hardened steel shell. The shell is opened
when the POKéMON is catching prey, but it does so at such a quick pace
that the shell’s inside cannot be seen.

In the moment that it gulps down its prey, the
inside of its shell is exposed, but to this day,

entries.gold:
When spotted, this
POKéMON escapes
backward by furi­ ously boring into
the ground with
its tail.

If spotted, it es­
capes by burrowing
with its tail. It can float just
slightly using its
wings.
entries.crystal:
It hides deep
inside caves where
no light ever reaches it and
remains virtually
motionless there.
entries.ruby:
DUNSPARCE has a drill for its tail.
It uses this tail to burrow into the
ground backwards. This POKéMON is known to make its nest
in complex shapes deep under the
ground.

Diglett and Dunsparce share one another’s
tunnels happily.
entries.ultra-moon:
When it sees a person, it digs a hole with its tail
to make its escape. If you happen to find one,
consider yourself lucky.
entries.sword:
This Pokémon’s tiny wings have some scientists
saying that Dunsparce used to fly through the sky
in ancient times.
entries.shield:
The nests Dunsparce live in are mazes of tunnels.
They never get lost in their own nests—they can
tell where they are by the scent of the dirt.

entries.gold:
It flies straight
at its target's
face then clamps down on the star­
tled victim to
inject poison.
entries.silver:
It usually clings
to cliffs. When it
spots its prey, it spreads its wings
and glides down to
attack.
entries.crystal:
It builds its nest
on a steep cliff.
When it is done gliding, it hops
along the ground
back to its nest.
entries.ruby:
GLIGAR glides through the air without
a sound as if it were sliding.
This POKéMON hangs on to the face of its foe using its clawed hind legs and
the large pincers on its forelegs, then
injects the prey with its poison barb.

entries.black:
It is thought its body transformed
as a result of iron accumulating
internally from swallowing soil.

Its body has been
compressed deep
under the ground. As a result, it is
even harder than a
diamond.
entries.silver:
It is said that if
an ONIX lives for
over 100 years, its composition
changes to become
diamond-like.
entries.crystal:
The many small
metal particles
that cover this POKéMON's body
reflect bright
light well.
entries.ruby:
STEELIX lives even further underground
than ONIX. This POKéMON is known to dig
towards the earth’s core. There are records of this POKéMON
reaching a depth of over six-tenths
of a mile underground.

entries.gold:
Although it looks
frightening, it is
actually kind and affectionate. It
is very popular
among women.
entries.silver:
It has an active,
playful nature.
Many women like to frolic with it
because of its af­
fectionate ways.
entries.crystal:
In truth, it is a
cowardly POKéMON.
It growls eagerly in order to hide
its fear from its
opponent.
entries.ruby:
By baring its fangs and making a scary
face, SNUBBULL sends smaller POKéMON
scurrying away in terror. However, this POKéMON seems a little
sad at making its foes flee.

Despite its intimidating face, it’s quite cowardly.
Its desperate attempts to appear threatening
make it popular with people.
entries.moon:
Its growls make its opponents uneasy. This
laid-back Pokémon tends to sleep half the day.
entries.ultra-sun:
It grows close to others easily and is also easily
spoiled. The disparity between its face and its
actions makes many young people wild about it.
entries.ultra-moon:
In contrast to its appearance, it’s quite
timid. When playing with other puppy
Pokémon, it sometimes gets bullied.

entries.platinum:

fly. Using its beak, it searches
in grass for prey.

grassy areas. It
has to flap its short wings at
high speed to
stay airborne.

stay airborne.

high. However, it

ritory.

wings to flush out

high speed.

they are warning each other of danger.

Pokémon appreciate Spearow for its vigorous
appetite and look after it.

Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around
very fast to protect its territory.

body weight. A single swing of one of these
pincers will crush a boulder completely.
entries.shield:

entries.legends-arceus:

has been shown to be stronger than forged steel.

entries.legends-arceus:
This Pokémon has an unparalleled horn. Heracross itself
demonstrates tremendous power—it's capable of throwing
several people trained in the traditional arts of war at once.

entries.y:

then smashes them with its rock-hard head.
entries.omega-ruby:
Octillery grabs onto its foe using its tentacles. This Pokémon
tries to immobilize it before delivering the finishing blow. If the
foe turns out to be too strong, Octillery spews ink to escape.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Octillery grabs onto its foe using its tentacles. This Pokémon
tries to immobilize it before delivering the finishing blow. If the
foe turns out to be too strong, Octillery spews ink to escape.
entries.ultra-sun:
The ink it spits when escaping is special.
It contains a substance that dulls the sense of
smell, so Pokémon with keen noses get lost.
entries.ultra-moon:
It usually sleeps in caves. The pitch-black ink
that Octillery spits is also used for cooking.
entries.sword:
It has a tendency to want to be in holes. It
prefers rock crags or pots and sprays ink from
them before attacking.
entries.shield:
It traps enemies with its suction-cupped
tentacles, then smashes them with its
rock-hard head.
entries.legends-arceus:
While Octillery still shoots water from its mouth, the drastic
anatomical difference between it and Remoraid meant that for
a long time, no one believed the former evolved from the latter.

entries.gold:
It carries food
all day long.
There are tales about lost people
who were saved by
the food it had.
entries.silver:
It nests at the
edge of sharp
cliffs. It spends all day carrying
food to its await­
ing chicks.
entries.crystal:
It always carries
its food with it,
wherever it goes. If attacked, it
throws its food at
the opponent.
entries.ruby:
DELIBIRD carries its food bundled up
in its tail. There once was a famous
explorer who managed to reach the peak of Mt. Everest thanks to one of these
POKéMON sharing its food.
entries.sapphire:

Delibird carries its food bundled up in its tail. There once was

world’s highest mountain, thanks to one of these Pokémon

entries.alpha-sapphire:
Delibird carries its food bundled up in its tail. There once was
a famous explorer who managed to reach the peak of the
world’s highest mountain, thanks to one of these Pokémon
sharing its food.
entries.sun:
Although it naturally prefers colder locales,
Delibird in Alola seem able to withstand the
heat to a certain extent.
entries.moon:
It has a generous habit of sharing its food with
people and Pokémon, so it’s always scrounging
around for more food.
entries.ultra-sun:
It shares its food with people who are stranded.
Because Delibird is omnivorous, sometimes
it gives those people bug Pokémon.
entries.ultra-moon:
It wraps food in its tail to carry it around.
The Delibird with the biggest tail is the boss
of the flock!
entries.sword:
It carries food all day long. There are tales about
lost people who were saved by the food it had.
entries.shield:
It has a generous habit of sharing its food with
people and Pokémon, so it’s always scrounging
around for more food.

entries.gold:
As it majestically
swims, it doesn't
care if REMORAID attach to it for
scavenging its
leftovers.
entries.silver:
Swimming freely in
open seas, it may
fly out of the water and over the
waves if it builds
up enough speed.
entries.crystal:
It swims along
freely, eating
things that swim into its mouth.
Its whole body is
very coarse.
entries.ruby:
On sunny days, schools of MANTINE can
be seen elegantly leaping over the
sea’s waves. This POKéMON is not bothered by the
REMORAID that hitches rides.
entries.sapphire:

sea’s waves. This POKéMON is not bothered by the

entries.diamond:

encounter a swarm of MANTINE
swimming as if they are in flight.
entries.pearl:
It swims elegantly, mindless of
REMORAID hitching on to its broad
fins. It has a docile nature.
entries.platinum:
While elegantly swimming in the sea,
it ignores REMORAID that cling to
its fins seeking food scraps.

from the surface of the ocean.

entries.ultra-sun:
Postcards and posters featuring Mantine
leaping elegantly above the waves are popular
souvenirs of Alola.
entries.ultra-moon:
Many people have taken up surfing because
they admire how magnificently Mantine swims.
entries.sword:
If it builds up enough speed swimming, it
can jump out above the waves and glide
for over 300 feet.
entries.shield:
As it majestically swims, it doesn’t care if
Remoraid attach to it to scavenge for its leftovers.
entries.legends-arceus:
This calm and gentle Pokémon swims gracefully through the sea.
After building speed, it can leap out of the water. It is often
misidentified as a bird Pokémon due to this behavior.

entries.gold:
Its sturdy wings
look heavy, but
they are actually hollow and light,
allowing it to fly
freely in the sky.
entries.silver:
After nesting in
bramble bushes,
the wings of its chicks grow hard
from scratches by
thorns.
entries.crystal:
The feathers that
it sheds are very
sharp. It is said that people once
used the feathers
as swords.
entries.ruby:
SKARMORY is entirely encased in hard,
protective armor. This POKéMON flies at
close to 190 mph. It slashes foes with its wings that
possess swordlike cutting edges.
entries.sapphire:
SKARMORY’s steel wings become tattered
and bashed in from repeated battles.
Once a year, the battered wings grow back completely, restoring the cutting
edges to their pristine state.
entries.emerald:
A POKéMON that has a body and wings of
steel. People in the past used feathers
fallen from SKARMORY to make swords and
knives.
entries.firered:
After nesting in bramble bushes, the wings
of its chicks grow hard from scratches by
thorns.
entries.leafgreen:
Its sturdy wings look heavy, but its bones
are hollow and light, allowing it to fly
freely in the sky.
entries.diamond:
Despite being clad entirely in
iron-hard armor, it flies at
speeds over 180 mph.
entries.pearl:
Despite being clad entirely in
iron-hard armor, it flies at
speeds over 180 mph.

actually thin and light, so it can

Skarmory is entirely encased in hard, protective armor.

entries.alpha-sapphire:
Skarmory’s steel wings become tattered and bashed in from

entries.sun:
Its feathers, which fall off as it grows, are thin
and sharp. In times long past, warriors used
them as swords.
entries.moon:
Its metal body is sturdy, but it does rust rather
easily. So on rainy days, this Pokémon prefers
to stay put in its nest.
entries.ultra-sun:
The wing feathers it sheds can be processed
and made into knives whose sharpness is
recognized by the finest chefs.
entries.ultra-moon:
Its body is draped in steel armor. It looks heavy,
but it can fly at speeds of up to 185 miles
an hour!
entries.sword:
The pointed feathers of these Pokémon are
sharper than swords. Skarmory and Corviknight
fight viciously over territory.
entries.shield:
People fashion swords from Skarmory’s shed
feathers, so this Pokémon is a popular element
in heraldic designs.

entries.gold:
It uses different
kinds of cries for
communicating with others of its kind
and for pursuing
its prey.
entries.silver:
To corner prey,
they check each
other's location using barks that
only they can
understand.
entries.crystal:
Around dawn, its
ominous howl
echoes through the area to announce
that this is its
territory.
entries.ruby:
HOUNDOUR hunt as a coordinated pack.
They communicate with each other using
a variety of cries to corner their prey. This POKéMON’s remarkable teamwork is
unparalleled.

It cooperates with others skillfully. When it

They make repeated eerie howls before dawn
to call attention to their pack.

entries.gold:
If you are burned
by the flames it
shoots from its mouth, the pain
will never go
away.
entries.silver:
Upon hearing its
eerie howls, other
POKéMON get the shivers and head
straight back to
their nests.
entries.crystal:
The pungent-
smelling flame
that shoots from its mouth results
from toxins burn­
ing in its body.
entries.ruby:
In a HOUNDOOM pack, the one with its
horns raked sharply towards the back
serves a leadership role. These POKéMON choose their leader by
fighting amongst themselves.
entries.sapphire:

They spew flames mixed with poison to finish
off their opponents. They divvy up their prey
evenly among the members of their pack.
entries.ultra-moon:
Identifiable by its eerie howls, people a long
time ago thought it was the grim reaper and
feared it.

entries.red:

and stealthily.
Eats the eggs of birds, such as
PIDGEY and
SPEAROW, whole.
entries.blue:
Moves silently
and stealthily.
Eats the eggs of birds, such as
PIDGEY and
SPEAROW, whole.

The older it gets,
the longer it
grows. At night, it wraps its long
body around tree
branches to rest.
entries.gold:
It can freely de­
tach its jaw to
swallow large prey whole. It can be­
come too heavy to
move, however.
entries.silver:
It always hides in
grass. When first
born, it has no poison, so its
bite is painful,
but harmless.
entries.crystal:
It flutters the
tip of its tongue
to seek out the scent of prey,
then swallows the
prey whole.
entries.ruby:
EKANS curls itself up in a spiral while
it rests.
Assuming this position allows it to quickly respond to a threat from any
direction with a glare from its upraised
head.

entries.gold:
It is said that it
usually hides in
underwater caves. It can create
whirlpools by
yawning.
entries.silver:
It sleeps deep on
the ocean floor to
build its energy. It is said to
cause tornadoes as
it wakes.
entries.crystal:
It stores energy
by sleeping at
underwater depths at which no other
life forms can
survive.
entries.ruby:
KINGDRA lives at extreme ocean depths
that are otherwise uninhabited.
It has long been believed that the yawning of this POKéMON creates
spiraling ocean currents.
entries.sapphire:
KINGDRA sleeps on the seafloor where
it is otherwise devoid of life.
When a storm arrives, the POKéMON is said to awaken and wander about in
search of prey.
entries.emerald:
It sleeps quietly, deep on the seafloor.
When it comes up to the surface, it
creates a huge whirlpool that can swallow
even ships.

With the arrival of a storm at sea, this Pokémon
will show itself on the surface. When a Kingdra
and a Dragonite meet, a fierce battle ensues.

Scales shed by this Pokémon have such a
splendorous gleam to them that they’ve been
given to royalty as gifts.

entries.gold:
It swings its long
snout around play­
fully, but because it is so strong,
that can be dan­
gerous.
entries.silver:
As a sign of af­
fection, it bumps
with its snout. However, it is so
strong, it may
send you flying.
entries.crystal:
During the desert­
ed morning hours,
it comes ashore where it deftly
uses its trunk to
take a shower.
entries.ruby:
For its nest, PHANPY digs a vertical pit 
in the ground at the edge of a river.
It marks the area around its nest with its trunk to let the others know that
the area has been claimed.
entries.sapphire:
PHANPY uses its long nose to shower
itself. When others gather around, they
thoroughly douse each other with water. These POKéMON can be seen drying their
soaking-wet bodies at the edge of
water.
entries.emerald:
PHANPY’s big ears serve as broad fans.
When it becomes hot, it flaps the ears
busily to cool down. Even the young are
very strong.
entries.firered:

send you flying.

For its nest, Phanpy digs a vertical pit in the ground at the
edge of a river. It marks the area around its nest with its trunk
to let the others know that the area has been claimed.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Phanpy uses its long nose to shower itself. When others
gather around, they thoroughly douse each other with water.
These Pokémon can be seen drying their soaking-wet
bodies at the edge of water.

entries.gold:
It has sharp, hard
tusks and a rugged
hide. Its TACKLE is strong enough
to knock down a
house.
entries.silver:
The longer and
bigger its tusks,
the higher its rank in its herd.
The tusks take
long to grow.
entries.crystal:
Because this
POKéMON's skin is
so tough, a normal attack won't even
leave a scratch on
it.
entries.ruby:
DONPHAN’s favorite attack is curling
its body into a ball, then charging at
its foe while rolling at high speed. Once it starts rolling, this POKéMON
can’t stop very easily.
entries.sapphire:
If DONPHAN were to tackle with its hard
body, even a house could be destroyed.
Using its massive strength, the POKéMON helps clear rock and mud slides
that block mountain trails.
entries.emerald:
A DONPHAN is so strong it can easily haul
a dump truck. Its hide has toughened to a
rock-hard state. An ordinary sort of
attack won’t even leave a scratch.

Porygon was updated with the most
cutting-edge technology available.
entries.moon:
Porygon was updated to a new version in
readiness for planetary development. But that
dream remains unrealized as yet.
entries.ultra-sun:
AI has been installed in it. It learns various
things all on its own, but it even remembers

entries.ultra-moon:
Even though it doesn’t die in the vacuum of
space, it can’t move around very well in
zero gravity.
entries.sword:
This is a Porygon that was updated with special
data. Porygon2 develops itself by learning about
many different subjects all on its own.
entries.shield:
After artificial intelligence was implemented in
Porygon2, the Pokémon began using a strange
language that only other Porygon2 understand.
entries.legends-arceus:
A bizarre item caused this Pokémon to evolve. While it now
exhibits many new gestures and expressions, its biology
remains inscrutable.

flow of air to create a strange
space where real­
ity is distorted.

its antlers will
gradually lose control of their
senses and be
unable to stand.

powder that aids
in sleeping.

after the priceless antlers.

its territory.

territory. In towns with many Smeargle, the walls

entries.ultra-moon:

drilled hard.

ground.

handstand to
throw off the opponent's timing,
it presents its
fancy kick moves.

speed, all the while delivering kicks.

time. The POKéMON travels faster
spinning than it does walking.

most sensitive
parts on its body. It always uses its
lips first to
examine things.

someone.

its lips develops
most quickly. It uses them to
try to identify
unknown objects.

also falls quite often.
Whenever the chance arrives, it will look for its reflection to make sure its
face hasn’t become dirty.

entries.ultra-sun:
When it examines things, before touching them
with its hands, it makes lip contact and then
diligently licks all the dirt off its lips.
entries.ultra-moon:
Highly perceptive sensors, Smoochum’s lips are
kept moist by its daily application of tree sap.
entries.sword:
If its face gets even slightly dirty, Smoochum will
bathe immediately. But if its body gets dirty,
Smoochum doesn’t really seem to care.
entries.shield:
This is a very curious Pokémon. Smoochum
decides what it likes and dislikes by touching
things with its lips.

entries.gold:
It rotates its
arms to generate
electricity, but it tires easily,
so it charges up
only a little bit.
entries.silver:
Even in the most
vicious storm,
this POKéMON plays happily if thunder
rumbles in the
sky.
entries.crystal:
It loves violent
thunder. The space
between its horns flickers bluish-
white when it is
charging energy.
entries.ruby:
ELEKID stores electricity in its body.
If it touches metal and accidentally
discharges all its built-up electricity, this POKéMON begins swinging its arms
in circles to recharge itself.
entries.sapphire:

can’t store the energy it makes.

entries.omega-ruby:
Elekid stores electricity in its body. If it touches metal and
accidentally discharges all its built-up electricity, this Pokémon

entries.alpha-sapphire:
Elekid stores electricity in its body. If it touches metal and
accidentally discharges all its built-up electricity, this Pokémon
begins swinging its arms in circles to recharge itself.
entries.sun:
When it’s in a house, electrical outlets serve as
its baby bottles. It sucks down electricity.
entries.moon:
This Pokémon is constantly fighting with
Togedemaru that try to steal its electricity.
It’s a pretty even match.
entries.ultra-sun:
When it hears the crash of thunder, Elekid’s
mood improves. It can be useful to record that
sound and play it when Elekid’s feeling down.
entries.ultra-moon:
When its horns shine a bluish white, that’s the
sign it’s fully charged. You’ll get a shocking
jolt if you touch it!
entries.sword:
When a storm approaches, this Pokémon gets
restless. Once Elekid hears the sound of thunder,
it gets full-on rowdy.
entries.shield:
It’s not good at storing electricity yet. This
Pokémon sneaks into people’s homes, looking
for electrical outlets to eat electricity from.
entries.legends-arceus:
They generate electricity by spinning their arms. During a
thunderstorm, if one hears the lively voices of children out in the
wilderness, what one is actually hearing are the voices of Elekid.

entries.red:

the ferocious
warning markings on its belly
differ from area
to area.
entries.blue:

the ferocious
warning markings on its belly
differ from area
to area.

patterns on its
belly have been studied. Six
variations have
been confirmed.
entries.gold:
Transfixing prey
with the face-like
pattern on its belly, it binds
and poisons the
frightened victim.
entries.silver:
With a very venge­
ful nature, it
won't give up the chase, no matter
how far, once it
targets its prey.
entries.crystal:
To intimidate
foes, it spreads
its chest wide and makes eerie sounds
by expelling air
from its mouth.
entries.ruby:

order to constrict things with its body.

volcanic eruption.

MAGBY’s state of health is determined
by observing the fire it breathes.
If the POKéMON is spouting yellow flames from its mouth, it is in good
health. When it is fatigued, black smoke
will be mixed in with the flames.

Many of these Pokémon can be seen in areas
with volcanic activity. Feeding can get them so
excited, they exhale flames of 1,100 degrees F.
entries.moon:
A famous potter lives with a Magby.
Apparently its soft flames produce fine works.
entries.ultra-sun:
When flames drip from its nose, that means it
has a cold. Have it lie down for a nice rest in
some magma.
entries.ultra-moon:
Its body temperature is always around 1,100
degrees Fahrenheit. If Magby falls into a small-
enough pond, the whole thing will dry up.
entries.sword:
This Pokémon is still small and timid.
Whenever Magby gets excited or surprised,
flames leak from its mouth and its nose.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon makes its home near volcanoes.
At the end of the day, Magby soaks in magma,
resting and recovering from the day’s fatigue.
entries.legends-arceus:
This Pokémon lives in volcanic areas. With each breath, sparks
spurt from its mouth and nose. When Magby is in good health,
its flames gain a yellow tint.

entries.gold:
Its milk is packed
with nutrition,
making it the ultimate beverage
for the sick or
weary.
entries.silver:
If it has just had
a baby, the milk
it produces con­ tains much more
nutrition than
usual.
entries.crystal:
In order to milk a
MILTANK, one must
have a knack for rhythmically pull­
ing up and down
on its udders.
entries.ruby:
MILTANK gives over five gallons of milk
on a daily basis. Its sweet milk is
enjoyed by children and grown-ups alike. People who can’t drink milk turn it into
yogurt and eat it instead.

Its milk is high in calories and packed with
nutrients. Therefore, if you drink too much of it,
you may wind up with a body like Miltank’s.
entries.moon:
Most people raise it for its milk, but it’s quite
tough and strong, so it’s also well suited
for battle.
entries.ultra-sun:
It produces over five gallons of milk a day. The
higher the quality of the pastures it lives in,
the richer and tastier its milk becomes.
entries.ultra-moon:
Its milk is delicious and chock-full of nutrients.
However, if you drink too much, it could make
your stomach hurt, so be careful.
entries.sword:
Miltank produces highly nutritious milk, so it’s
been supporting the lives of people and other
Pokémon since ancient times.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon needs to be milked every day,
or else it will fall ill. The flavor of Miltank milk
changes with the seasons.

entries.gold:
Anyone who takes
even one bite of
BLISSEY's egg be­ comes unfailingly
caring and pleas­
ant to everyone.

passionate nature.
If it sees a sick POKéMON, it will
nurse the sufferer
back to health.

of the delicious
eggs that BLISSEY provides will make
everyone around
smile with joy.

coat of fur. If it does so, this POKéMON
will rush over to the sad person, however far they may be, to share an
egg of happiness that brings a smile
to any face.

Their eggs are such a delicacy that some say

fetch the highest prices on the market.
entries.ultra-moon:
This Pokémon is overflowing with love. Only
Chansey that share a strong bond with their
Trainer can evolve, so people say.

Whenever a Blissey finds a weakened Pokémon,
it will share its egg and offer its care until the
other Pokémon is all better.
entries.shield:

happiness. It’s said that anyone who eats a
Blissey egg will start acting kindly to all others.
entries.legends-arceus:
A kindhearted Pokémon that will care for any sick person or
Pokémon until their health improves. The eggs it lays are
delicious and bring good fortune to those who eat them.

raises the trees in a forest with loving care.

entries.ruby:

following behind with unsteady
steps. This POKéMON breathes fire of over
1,800 degrees F, including fireballs
that leave the foe scorched black.

where it keeps its flame. Give it a hug -
it will be glowing with warmth. This POKéMON is covered all over by a

entries.emerald:

balls of fire it forms in its stomach.
A TORCHIC dislikes darkness because it
can’t see its surroundings.

entries.ruby:
COMBUSKEN toughens up its legs and
thighs by running through fields and
mountains. This POKéMON’s legs possess both speed
and power, enabling it to dole out ten
kicks in one second.

COMBUSKEN battles with the intensely
hot flames it spews from its beak and
with outstandingly destructive kicks. This POKéMON’s cry is very loud and
distracting.

It lashes out with 10 kicks per second.
Its strong fighting instinct compels it
to keep up its offensive until the
opponent gives up.

entries.ruby:
In battle, BLAZIKEN blows out intense
flames from its wrists and attacks foes
courageously. The stronger the foe, the more
intensely this POKéMON’s wrists burn.

BLAZIKEN has incredibly strong legs -
it can easily clear a 30-story building
in one leap. This POKéMON’s blazing punches leave

and kicks. Every several years, its old

jump clear over buildings.

entries.ruby:
The fin on MUDKIP’s head acts as highly
sensitive radar. Using this fin to sense
movements of water and air, this POKéMON can determine what is taking
place around it without using its eyes.
entries.sapphire:
In water, MUDKIP breathes using the
gills on its cheeks.
If it is faced with a tight situation in battle, this POKéMON will unleash its
amazing power - it can crush rocks
bigger than itself.
entries.emerald:
On land, it can powerfully lift large
boulders by planting its four feet and
heaving. It sleeps by burying itself in soil
at the water’s edge.
entries.firered:

water with powerful acceleration. It is
strong in spite of its size.

entries.ruby:
The surface of MARSHTOMP’s body is
enveloped by a thin, sticky film that
enables it to live on land. This POKéMON plays in mud on beaches
when the ocean tide is low.
entries.sapphire:
MARSHTOMP is much faster at traveling
through mud than it is at swimming.
This POKéMON’s hindquarters exhibit obvious development, giving it the
ability to walk on just its hind legs.
entries.emerald:
Its toughened hind legs enable it to stand
upright. Because it weakens if its skin
dries out, it replenishes fluids by playing
in mud.
entries.firered:
It is at its best when on muddy ground
with poor footing. It quickly overwhelms
foes struggling in mud.

excessively charged, RAICHU plants its
tail in the ground and discharges. Scorched patches of ground will be
found near this POKéMON’s nest.

This POKéMON exudes a weak electrical
charge from all over its body that makes

planting its tail in the ground.

If it stores too much electricity, its
behavior turns aggressive. To avoid this,
it occasionally discharges excess energy
and calms itself down.

100,000 volts. Careless contact can cause
even an Indian elephant to faint.

It can discharge bursts of electricity exceeding 100,000 volts—
a single strike with that amount of power would incapacitate one
of the Copperajah of my homeland.

entries.ruby:
SWAMPERT is very strong. It has enough
power to easily drag a boulder weighing
more than a ton. This POKéMON also has powerful vision
that lets it see even in murky water.
entries.sapphire:
SWAMPERT predicts storms by sensing
subtle differences in the sounds of
waves and tidal winds with its fins. If a storm is approaching, it piles up
boulders to protect itself.
entries.emerald:
If it senses the approach of a storm and
a tidal wave, it protects its seaside nest
by piling up boulders. It swims as fast as
a jet ski.
entries.firered:
Its arms are rock-hard. With one swing,
they can batter down its foe. It makes its
nest on beautiful beaches.

entries.ruby:
At first sight, POOCHYENA takes a bite
at anything that moves.
This POKéMON chases after prey until the victim becomes exhausted.
However, it may turn tail if the prey
strikes back.
entries.sapphire:
POOCHYENA is an omnivore - it will eat
anything. A distinguishing feature is
how large its fangs are compared to its body. This POKéMON tries to
intimidate its foes by making the hair
on its tail bristle out.
entries.emerald:
It savagely threatens foes with bared
fangs. It chases after fleeing targets
tenaciously. It turns tail and runs,
however, if the foe strikes back.
entries.firered:
It has a very tenacious nature. Its acute
sense of smell lets it chase a chosen
prey without ever losing track.
entries.leafgreen:

entries.ruby:
MIGHTYENA gives obvious signals when
it is preparing to attack. It starts to
growl deeply and then flattens its body. This POKéMON will bite savagely with its
sharply pointed fangs.

MIGHTYENA travel and act as a pack
in the wild. The memory of its life in the
wild compels the POKéMON to obey only those TRAINERS that it recognizes to
possess superior skill.
entries.emerald:
In the wild, MIGHTYENA live in a pack.
They never defy their leader’s orders.
They defeat foes with perfectly
coordinated teamwork.

entries.ruby:
ZIGZAGOON restlessly wanders
everywhere at all times. This POKéMON
does so because it is very curious. It becomes interested in anything
that it happens to see.
entries.sapphire:
The hair on ZIGZAGOON’s back is 
bristly. It rubs the hard back hair
against trees to leave its territorial markings.
This POKéMON may play dead to fool foes
in battle.
entries.emerald:
Rubbing its nose against the ground, it
always wanders about back and forth in
search of something. It is distinguished
by the zigzag footprints it leaves.

entries.ruby:
LINOONE always runs full speed and only
in straight lines. If facing an obstacle,
it makes a right-angle turn to evade it. This POKéMON is very challenged by
gently curving roads.
entries.sapphire:
When hunting, LINOONE will make a
beeline straight for the prey at a full
run. While this POKéMON is capable of topping 60 mph, it has to come to a
screeching halt before it can turn.

in a straight line. When it spots pond-
dwelling prey underwater, it quickly leaps
in and catches it with its sharp claws.

If facing an obstacle, it makes a right-angle turn to evade it.
This Pokémon is very challenged by gently curving roads.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
When hunting, Linoone will make a beeline straight for the
prey at a full run. While this Pokémon is capable of topping
60 mph, it has to come to a screeching halt before it can turn.
entries.sword:
Its fur is strong and supple. Shaving brushes
made with shed Linoone hairs are highly prized.
entries.shield:
It uses its explosive speed and razor-sharp claws
to bring down prey. Running along winding
paths is not its strong suit.

entries.ruby:
Using the spikes on its rear end,  
WURMPLE peels the bark off trees and
feeds on the sap that oozes out. This POKéMON’s feet are tipped with
suction pads that allow it to cling to
glass without slipping.
entries.sapphire:
WURMPLE is targeted by SWELLOW as
prey. This POKéMON will try to resist by
pointing the spikes on its rear at the attacking predator.
It will weaken the foe by leaking poison
from the spikes.
entries.emerald:
It sticks to tree branches and eats
leaves. The thread it spits from its mouth,
which becomes gooey when it touches
air, slows the movement of its foes.
entries.firered:
It lives amidst tall grass and in forests.
When attacked, it resists by pointing its
venomous spikes at the foe.
entries.leafgreen:
It lives amidst tall grass and in forests.
When attacked, it resists by pointing its
venomous spikes at the foe.
entries.diamond:
It loves to eat leaves. If it is
attacked by a STARLY, it will defend
itself with its spiked rear.
entries.pearl:
It spits a white silk that turns
sticky when it contacts air. It is
used to immobilize foes.
entries.platinum:
Often targeted by bird Pokémon,
it desperately resists by releasing
poison from its tail spikes.
entries.heartgold:

forests. It repels attacks by 
raising up the spikes on its rear.

Likes sap and is abundant in the wild. Why it evolves into

entries.ruby:
SILCOON tethers itself to a tree branch
using silk to keep from falling. There, 
this POKéMON hangs quietly while it awaits evolution.
It peers out of the silk cocoon through
a small hole.
entries.sapphire:
SILCOON was thought to endure hunger
and not consume anything before its
evolution. However, it is now thought that this POKéMON slakes its thirst by
drinking rainwater that collects on its
silk.
entries.emerald:
It prepares for evolution using the
energy it stored while it was a WURMPLE.
It keeps watch over the surroundings with
its two eyes.
entries.firered:
It conserves its energy by moving as
little as possible. It awaits evolution
while drinking only a little rainwater.
entries.leafgreen:
It conserves its energy by moving as
little as possible. It awaits evolution
while drinking only a little rainwater.
entries.diamond:
It anchors itself by wrapping
twigs with the silk from its body.
It motionlessly awaits evolution.
entries.pearl:

silk and waits for evolution. Its
hard cocoon repels attacks.
entries.platinum:
It wraps silk around the branches
of a tree. It drinks rainwater on
its silk while awaiting evolution.
entries.heartgold:

branches of a tree, it quiescently
awaits evolution.

Wraps itself in thin strings of silk while it stores energy for

entries.ruby:
BEAUTIFLY’s favorite food is the sweet
pollen of flowers. If you want to see
this POKéMON, just leave a potted flower by an open window. BEAUTIFLY
is sure to come looking for pollen.
entries.sapphire:
BEAUTIFLY has a long mouth like a coiled
needle, which is very convenient for
collecting pollen from flowers. This POKéMON rides the spring winds as
it flits around gathering pollen.
entries.emerald:
Its colorfully patterned wings are its
most prominent feature. It flies through
flower-covered fields collecting pollen.
It attacks ferociously when angered.
entries.firered:
Despite its appearance, it has an
aggressive nature. It attacks by jabbing
with its long, thin mouth.
entries.leafgreen:
Despite its appearance, it has an
aggressive nature. It attacks by jabbing
with its long, thin mouth.
entries.diamond:
It has an aggressive nature. It
stabs prey with its long, narrow
mouth to drain the prey’s fluids.
entries.pearl:
When flower fields bloom, it flits
around, collecting pollen. Despite
its appearance, it is savage.
entries.platinum:
Despite its looks, it is aggressive.
It jabs with its long, thin mouth if
disturbed while collecting pollen.
entries.heartgold:
Vibrantly patterned wings are its
prominent feature. It sucks sweet
flower nectar with its long mouth.

entries.legends-arceus:
A colorful and incredibly beautiful but also greedy Pokémon.
In an effort to keep its favorite food all to itself, it will chase
away Combee as they try to gather nectar.

entries.ruby:
CASCOON makes its protective cocoon
by wrapping its body entirely with a
fine silk from its mouth. Once the silk goes around its body, it hardens.
This POKéMON prepares for its evolution
inside the cocoon.
entries.sapphire:
If it is attacked, CASCOON remains
motionless however badly it may be
hurt. It does so because if it were to move, its body would be weak upon
evolution. This POKéMON will also not
forget the pain it endured.
entries.emerald:
To avoid detection by its enemies, it hides
motionlessly beneath large leaves and in
the gaps of branches. It also attaches
dead leaves to its body for camouflage.
entries.firered:
Its body, which is made of soft silk,
hardens over time. When cracks appear,
evolution is near.
entries.leafgreen:
Its body, which is made of soft silk,
hardens over time. When cracks appear,
evolution is near.
entries.diamond:
It is hot inside its cocoon. All
the cells in its body create the
energy for it to evolve.
entries.pearl:
Encased within its tough cocoon, it
endures attacks. It never forgets
the appearance of its foes.
entries.platinum:
It never forgets any attack it
endured while in the cocoon.
After evolution, it seeks payback.
entries.heartgold:
It endures attacks with patience,
because the more pain before
evolution, the sturdier it becomes.

The silk coating its body is thin but sufficiently strong. Cascoon's

entries.ruby:
DUSTOX is instinctively drawn to light.
Swarms of this POKéMON are attracted
by the bright lights of cities, where they wreak havoc by stripping the
leaves off roadside trees for food.
entries.sapphire:
When DUSTOX flaps its wings, a fine
dust is scattered all over. This dust is
actually a powerful poison that will even make a pro wrestler sick.
This POKéMON searches for food using
its antennae like radar.
entries.emerald:
It is a nocturnal POKéMON that flies from
fields and mountains to the attraction of
streetlights at night. It looses highly
toxic powder from its wings.
entries.firered:
It scatters horribly toxic dust when it
senses danger. They tend to gather in the
glow of streetlamps at night.
entries.leafgreen:
It scatters horribly toxic dust when it
senses danger. They tend to gather in the
glow of streetlamps at night.
entries.diamond:
A nocturnal Pokémon. Drawn by
streetlights, they messily eat the
leaves of trees lining boulevards.
entries.pearl:
It violently flutters its wings to
scatter toxic dust when attacked.
It becomes active after sunset.
entries.platinum:
Toxic powder is scattered with each
flap. At night, it is known to strip
leaves off trees lining boulevards.
entries.heartgold:

when it is attacked. It is a
nocturnal Pokémon.

entries.red:
Burrows deep
underground in
arid locations far from water.
It only emerges
to hunt for food.
entries.blue:

underground in

It only emerges
to hunt for food.

Its body is dry.
When it gets cold
at night, its hide is said to
become coated with
a fine dew.
entries.gold:
If it fell from a
great height, this
POKéMON could save itself by rolling
into a ball and
bouncing.
entries.silver:
Disliking water,
it lives in deep
burrows in arid areas. It can roll
itself instantly
into a ball.
entries.crystal:
It prefers dry,
sandy places
because it uses the sand to
protect itself
when threatened.
entries.ruby:
SANDSHREW’s body is configured to
absorb water without waste, enabling it
to survive in an arid desert. This POKéMON curls up to protect itself
from its enemies.
entries.sapphire:
SANDSHREW has a very dry hide that is
extremely tough. The POKéMON can roll
into a ball that repels any attack. At night, it burrows into the desert
sand to sleep.
entries.emerald:
When it curls up in a ball, it can make any
attack bounce off harmlessly. Its hide has
turned tough and solid as a result of
living in the desert.
entries.firered:
It burrows and lives underground.
If threatened, it curls itself up into a
ball for protection.

It lives in areas of limited rainfall. When danger

entries.ultra-moon:
When its skin gets wrinkled from moisture, it
heads for a volcano. It lies flat on a spot with a

Its body is dry. When it gets cold at night, its
hide is said to become coated with a fine dew.
entries.lets-go-eevee:

entries.sword:
It loves to bathe in the grit of dry, sandy areas.
By sand bathing, the Pokémon rids itself of dirt
and moisture clinging to its body.
entries.shield:
It burrows into the ground to create its nest. If
hard stones impede its tunneling, it uses its sharp
claws to shatter them and then carries on digging.

entries.y:
It searches about for clean water. If it does not
drink water for too long, the leaf on its head wilts.
entries.ruby:
LOTAD live in ponds and lakes, where
they float on the surface.
It grows weak if its broad leaf dies. On rare occasions, this POKéMON travels
on land in search of clean water.
entries.sapphire:
LOTAD is said to have dwelled on land
before. However, this POKéMON is
thought to have returned to water because the leaf on its head grew large
and heavy. It now lives by floating
atop the water.
entries.emerald:
This POKéMON lives in ponds with clean
water. It is known to ferry small POKéMON
across ponds by carrying them on the
broad leaf on its head.

entries.leafgreen:
It lives at the water’s edge where it is
sunny. It sleeps on a bed of water grass
by day and becomes active at night.
entries.ruby:
LOMBRE is nocturnal - it will get active
after dusk. It is also a mischief-maker.
When this POKéMON spots anglers, it tugs on their fishing lines from
beneath the surface and enjoys their
consternation.
entries.sapphire:
LOMBRE’s entire body is covered by a
slippery, slimy film. It feels horribly
unpleasant to be touched by this POKéMON’s hands.
LOMBRE is often mistaken for a human
child.
entries.emerald:
In the evening, it takes great delight in
popping out of rivers and startling people.
It feeds on aquatic moss that grows on
rocks in the riverbed.

entries.ruby:
LUDICOLO begins dancing as soon as
it hears cheerful, festive music.
This POKéMON is said to appear when it hears the singing of children on hiking
outings.
entries.sapphire:
Upon hearing an upbeat and cheerful
rhythm, the cells in LUDICOLO’s body
become very energetic and active. Even in battle, this POKéMON will
exhibit an amazing amount of power.
entries.emerald:
When it hears festive music, all the cells
in its body become stimulated, and it
begins moving in rhythm. It does not
quail even when it faces a tough opponent.
entries.firered:
The rhythm of bright, festive music
activates LUDICOLO’s cells, making it more
powerful.
entries.leafgreen:
The rhythm of bright, festive music
activates LUDICOLO’s cells, making it more
powerful.
entries.diamond:
If it hears festive music, all its
muscles fill with energy. It can’t
help breaking out into a dance.

entries.omega-ruby:
Ludicolo begins dancing as soon as it hears cheerful,
festive music. This Pokémon is said to appear when it
hears the singing of children on hiking outings.
entries.alpha-sapphire:

in battle, this Pokémon will exhibit an amazing amount

entries.shield:

entries.ruby:
SEEDOT attaches itself to a tree
branch using the top of its head.
It sucks moisture from the tree while hanging off the branch.
The more water it drinks, the glossier
this POKéMON’s body becomes.
entries.sapphire:
SEEDOT looks exactly like an acorn
when it is dangling from a tree branch.
It startles other POKéMON by suddenly moving.
This POKéMON polishes its body once a
day using leaves.
entries.emerald:
It hangs off branches and absorbs
nutrients. When it finishes eating, its
body becomes so heavy that it drops to
the ground with a thump.
entries.firered:
If it remains still, it becomes impossible
to distinguish from real nuts. It delights
in surprising foraging PIDGEY.

entries.ruby:
NUZLEAF live in densely overgrown
forests. They occasionally venture out
of the forest to startle people. This POKéMON dislikes having its long
nose pinched.
entries.sapphire:
This POKéMON pulls out the leaf on its
head and makes a flute with it.
The sound of NUZLEAF’s flute strikes fear and uncertainty in the hearts of
people lost in a forest.
entries.emerald:
A forest-dwelling POKéMON that is skilled
at climbing trees. Its long and pointed
nose is its weak point. It loses power if
the nose is gripped.
entries.firered:
They live in holes bored in large trees.
The sound of NUZLEAF’s grass flute fills
listeners with dread.

It lives quietly in the deep forest.
It is said to create chilly winter
winds with the fans it holds.
entries.ruby:
SHIFTRY is a mysterious POKéMON that
is said to live atop towering trees 
dating back over a thousand years. It creates terrific windstorms with
the fans it holds.
entries.sapphire:
SHIFTRY’s large fans generate awesome
gusts of wind at a speed close to 100
feet per second. The whipped-up wind blows anything away.
This POKéMON chooses to live quietly
deep in forests.
entries.emerald:
It is said to arrive on chilly, wintry winds.
Feared from long ago as the guardian of
forests, this POKéMON lives in a deep
forest where people do not venture.
entries.firered:
A POKéMON that was feared as a forest
guardian. It can read the foe’s mind and
take preemptive action.
entries.leafgreen:

entries.ruby:
TAILLOW courageously stands its
ground against foes, however strong
they may be. This gutsy POKéMON will remain defiant
even after a loss. On the other hand,
it cries loudly if it becomes hungry.
entries.sapphire:
TAILLOW is young - it has only just
left its nest. As a result, it sometimes
becomes lonesome and cries at night. This POKéMON feeds on WURMPLE that
live in forests.
entries.emerald:
Although it is small, it is very courageous.
It will take on a larger SKARMORY on an
equal footing. However, its will weakens if
it becomes hungry.
entries.firered:
It dislikes cold seasons. They migrate to
other lands in search of warmth, flying
over 180 miles a day.
entries.leafgreen:
It dislikes cold seasons. They migrate to

entries.ruby:
SWELLOW flies high above our heads,
making graceful arcs in the sky.
This POKéMON dives at a steep angle as soon as it spots its prey. The hapless
prey is tightly grasped by SWELLOW’s
clawed feet, preventing escape.
entries.sapphire:
SWELLOW is very conscientious about
the upkeep of its glossy wings.
Once two SWELLOW are gathered, they diligently take care of cleaning each
other’s wings.
entries.emerald:
A SWELLOW dives upon prey from far above.
It never misses its targets. It takes to
the skies in search of lands with a warm
climate.
entries.firered:
If its two tail feathers are standing at
attention, it is proof of good health.
It soars elegantly in the sky.
entries.leafgreen:

entries.ruby:
WINGULL has the habit of carrying prey
and valuables in its beak and hiding
them in all sorts of locations. This POKéMON rides the winds and flies
as if it were skating across the sky.
entries.sapphire:
WINGULL rides updrafts rising from the
sea by extending its long and narrow
wings to glide. This POKéMON’s long beak is useful for
catching prey.
entries.emerald:
It makes its nest on a sheer cliff at the
edge of the sea. It has trouble keeping
its wings flapping in flight. Instead, it
soars on updrafts.
entries.firered:
It rides upon ocean winds as if it were
a glider. In the winter, it hides food
around its nest.
entries.leafgreen:
It rides upon ocean winds as if it were
a glider. In the winter, it hides food

entries.diamond:

cliffs. Riding updrafts, it soars

entries.pearl:

wings, it soars as if it were a
glider. It folds its wings to rest.
entries.platinum:
It soars high in the sky, riding on
updrafts like a glider. It carries
food tucked in its bill.
entries.heartgold:

flapping its wings. It makes a nest
on sheer cliffs at the sea’s edge.

It spreads its wings to the wind and soars away

entries.moon:
Fishermen keep an eye out for Wingull in the
sky, because wherever they’re circling, the
ocean is sure to be teeming with fish Pokémon.
entries.ultra-sun:
With its long, thin wings, it catches updrafts
and flies like a glider high up into the sky.
entries.ultra-moon:
It builds nests in cliffs by the sea. It circles the
skies above the ocean looking for its favorite
food—Wishiwashi.

entries.black:
It is a messenger of the skies,
carrying small Pokémon and
eggs to safety in its bill.
entries.ruby:
PELIPPER is a flying transporter that
carries small POKéMON and eggs inside
its massive bill. This POKéMON builds its nest on steep
cliffs facing the sea.
entries.sapphire:
PELIPPER searches for food while in
flight by skimming the wave tops.
This POKéMON dips its large bill in the sea to scoop up food, then swallows
everything in one big gulp.
entries.emerald:
It skims the tops of waves as it flies.
When it spots prey, it uses its large beak
to scoop up the victim with water.
It protects its eggs in its beak.
entries.firered:

waves to rest its wings.

Its spacious beak is large enough for a
small child to fit right inside.
entries.moon:
Gathering food is the work of young males.
They store food in their capacious beaks and

entries.ultra-sun:
It places small Pokémon into its spacious beak
and carries them around. No one knows where

entries.ultra-moon:
It scoops up Wishiwashi in its huge beak and
swallows them whole. It can devour more than
30 at one go!

entries.red:
Curls up into a
spiny ball when
threatened. It can roll while
curled up to
attack or escape.
entries.blue:
Curls up into a
spiny ball when
threatened. It can roll while
curled up to
attack or escape.
entries.yellow:
It is skilled at
slashing enemies
with its claws. If broken, they
start to grow back
in a day.
entries.gold:
In an attempt to
hide itself, it
will run around at top speed to
kick up a blinding
dust storm.
entries.silver:
If it digs at an
incredible pace,
it may snap off its spikes and
claws. They grow
back in a day.
entries.crystal:
Adept at climbing
trees, it rolls
into a spiny ball, then attacks its
enemies from
above.
entries.ruby:
SANDSLASH’s body is covered by tough
spikes, which are hardened sections of
its hide. Once a year, the old spikes fall out, to be replaced with new spikes that
grow out from beneath the old ones.
entries.sapphire:
SANDSLASH can roll up its body as if it
were a ball covered with large spikes.
In battle, this POKéMON will try to make the foe flinch by jabbing it with its
spines. It then leaps at the stunned
foe to tear wildly with its sharp claws.
entries.emerald:
It curls up in a ball to protect itself from
enemy attacks. It also curls up to prevent
heatstroke during the daytime when
temperatures rise sharply.
entries.firered:
It is adept at attacking with the spines
on its back and its sharp claws while
quickly scurrying about.
entries.leafgreen:

fall out, to be replaced with new spikes that grow out from

Sandslash can roll up its body as if it were a ball covered

entries.sun:
Although they are sharp, its claws and spikes
often break off. They grow back the next day,
so it is not bothered by the temporary loss.
entries.moon:
It uses its claws to climb trees and then curls
its body into a spiny ball, ready to drop onto
any prey that appears.
entries.ultra-sun:
Its claws and horns often break off. The broken
claws and horns can be used to carve plows for
tilling farm fields.
entries.ultra-moon:
Thanks to its thick claws, it’s good at climbing
trees. There are plenty of Sandslash that park
themselves in trees and go right to sleep.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
It is skilled at slashing enemies with its claws.
If broken, they start to grow back in a day.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
It is skilled at slashing enemies with its claws.
If broken, they start to grow back in a day.
entries.sword:
The drier the area Sandslash lives in, the harder
and smoother the Pokémon’s spikes will feel
when touched.
entries.shield:
It climbs trees by hooking on with its sharp claws.
Sandslash shares the berries it gathers, dropping
them down to Sandshrew waiting below the tree.

entries.ruby:
RALTS senses the emotions of
people using the horns on its head.
This POKéMON rarely appears before people. But when it does, it draws
closer if it senses that the person has
a positive disposition.
entries.sapphire:
RALTS has the ability to sense the
emotions of people.
If its TRAINER is in a cheerful mood, this POKéMON grows cheerful and joyous
in the same way.
entries.emerald:

emotions of people and POKéMON with the
horns on its head. It takes cover if it
senses any hostility.

hostility.

entries.diamond:

sense human emotions. It is said to
appear in front of cheerful people.
entries.pearl:
It uses the horns on its head to
sense human emotions. It is said to
appear in front of cheerful people.
entries.platinum:
If its horns capture the warm
feelings of people or Pokémon,
its body warms up slightly.
entries.heartgold:
The horns on its head provide a
strong power that enables
it to sense people’s emotions.
entries.soulsilver:
The horns on its head provide
a strong power that enables
it to sense people’s emotions.

entries.x:
If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or
Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.
entries.y:
It is highly attuned to the emotions of people and
Pokémon. It hides if it senses hostility.
entries.omega-ruby:
Ralts senses the emotions of people using the horns on
its head. This Pokémon rarely appears before people.
But when it does, it draws closer if it senses that the person
has a positive disposition.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Ralts has the ability to sense the emotions of people. If its
Trainer is in a cheerful mood, this Pokémon grows cheerful
and joyous in the same way.
entries.sword:
It is highly attuned to the emotions of people
and Pokémon. It hides if it senses hostility.
entries.shield:
If its horns capture the warm feelings of people
or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.
entries.legends-arceus:
Tends to prefer people with a chipper disposition to those who
are gloomy, but it has shown no discrimination with regard to
age or gender. Needs more research.

entries.ruby:
It is said that a KIRLIA that is
exposed to the positive emotions of
its TRAINER grows beautiful. This POKéMON controls psychokinetic
powers with its highly developed brain.
entries.sapphire:
KIRLIA uses the horns on its head
to amplify its psychokinetic power.
When the POKéMON uses its power, the air around it becomes distorted,
creating mirages of nonexistent
scenery.
entries.emerald:
A KIRLIA has the psychic power to create 
a rip in the dimensions and see into the
future. It is said to dance with pleasure
on sunny mornings.
entries.firered:
The cheerful spirit of its TRAINER gives
it energy for its psychokinetic power.
It spins and dances when happy.
entries.leafgreen:
The cheerful spirit of its TRAINER gives
it energy for its psychokinetic power.
It spins and dances when happy.
entries.diamond:

Trainer’s feelings. It dances when
it is feeling happy.
entries.pearl:

Trainer’s feelings. It dances when
