entries.ruby:
HUNTAIL’s presence went unnoticed by
people for a long time because it lives
at extreme depths in the sea. This POKéMON’s eyes can see clearly
even in the murky dark depths of the
ocean.
entries.sapphire:
HUNTAIL’s tail is shaped like a fish.
It uses the tail to attract prey, then
swallows the prey whole with its large, gaping mouth.
This POKéMON swims by wiggling its
slender body like a snake.
entries.emerald:
To withstand the crushing pressure of
water deep under the sea, its spine is very
thick and sturdy. Its tail, which is shaped
like a small fish, has eyes that light up.
entries.firered:
It lives deep in the sea where no light
ever filters down. It lights up its small
fishlike tail to attract prey.

entries.ultra-moon:
Deep seas are their habitat. According to
tradition, when Huntail wash up onshore,

entries.ruby:
GOREBYSS lives in the southern seas
at extreme depths. Its body is built to
withstand the enormous pressure of water at incredible depths. Because of
this, this POKéMON’s body is unharmed
by ordinary attacks.
entries.sapphire:
Although GOREBYSS is the very picture
of elegance and beauty while swimming,
it is also cruel. When it spots prey, this POKéMON inserts its thin mouth into the
prey’s body and drains the prey of its
body fluids.
entries.emerald:
A GOREBYSS siphons the body fluids of prey
through its thin, tubular mouth. Its light
pink body color turns vivid when it
finishes feeding.
entries.firered:
Its swimming form is exquisitely elegant.
With its thin mouth, it feeds on seaweed
that grows between rocks.
entries.leafgreen:

The color of its body changes with the water

entries.ultra-moon:
It sucks bodily fluids out of its prey. The
leftover meat sinks to the seafloor, where it
becomes food for other Pokémon.

entries.ruby:
RELICANTH is a POKéMON species that
existed for a hundred million years
without ever changing its form. This ancient POKéMON feeds on
microscopic organisms with its
toothless mouth.
entries.sapphire:
RELICANTH is a rare species that was
discovered in deep-sea explorations.
This POKéMON’s body withstands the enormous water pressure of the ocean
depths. Its body is covered in tough
scales that are like craggy rocks.

A POKéMON that was once believed to have
been extinct. The species has not changed
its form for 100 million years. It walks on
the seafloor using its pectoral fins.

Relicanth is a rare species that was discovered in deep-sea
explorations. This Pokémon’s body withstands the enormous
water pressure of the ocean depths. Its body is covered in
tough scales that are like craggy rocks.
entries.sun:
Its form has remained the same for one hundred
million years. Its body is filled with fat, so it can
withstand the water pressure of the deep sea.
entries.moon:
It was fortuitously discovered during a deep sea
expedition. Its teeth have atrophied, so it now
survives on microscopic organisms it sucks up.
entries.ultra-sun:
Thought to have gone extinct, Relicanth was
given a name that is a variation of the name of
the person who discovered it.
entries.ultra-moon:
The reason it hasn’t changed at all in a hundred
million years is that it’s apparently already a
perfect life-form.
entries.sword:
Rock-hard scales and oil-filled swim bladders
allow this Pokémon to survive the intense water
pressure of the deep sea.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon was discovered during deep-sea
exploration. Its appearance hasn’t changed in
100,000,000 years, so it’s called a living fossil.

ious coat of fur.

white tail. The tail separates into six

The six tails become magnificently

never goes out. During the daytime,
when the temperatures rise, this POKéMON releases flames from its mouth
to prevent its body from growing too
hot.
entries.emerald:

orbs fly like will-o’-the-wisps. Just
before evolution, its six tails grow hot 
as if on fire.

When it grows, several new tails are

Inside Vulpix’s body burns a flame that never goes out.
During the daytime, when the temperatures rise, this

Its beautiful fur and tails have made it very
popular. As it grows, its tails split to form
more tails.
entries.moon:
From its mouth spew flames that seem to
resemble the spirits of the deceased. Some
people mistakenly think this fire is a ghost.
entries.ultra-sun:
Its beautiful tails have made it very popular.
However, if it’s not brushed diligently, it will
be a mass of tangles before you know it.
entries.ultra-moon:
It manipulates balls of fire to catch its prey.
If you raise one from when it’s young, it will
grow close to you like a puppy Pokémon.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Both its fur and its tails are beautiful.
As it grows, the tails split and form more tails.

entries.legends-arceus:
In its belly burns a fire, which Vulpix spits out in the form of
fireballs. When young, this Pokémon has but one white tail.
As the Pokémon matures, this single tail splits into six.

entries.ruby:
LUVDISC live in shallow seas in the
tropics. This heart-shaped POKéMON
earned its name by swimming after loving couples it spotted in the
ocean’s waves.
entries.sapphire:
LUVDISC’s heart-shaped body is a
symbol of love and romance.
It is said that any couple meeting this POKéMON is promised a loving
relationship that never ends.
entries.emerald:
LUVDISC make the branches of CORSOLA
their nests. There is a custom from long
ago of giving a LUVDISC as a gift to
express one’s feelings of love.
entries.firered:
During the spawning season, countless
LUVDISC congregate at coral reefs,
turning the waters pink.
entries.leafgreen:
During the spawning season, countless
LUVDISC congregate at coral reefs,
turning the waters pink.

that a couple finding this Pokémon
will be blessed with eternal love.

popular. In some places, you would

Luvdisc live in shallow seas in the tropics. This heart-shaped

Luvdisc’s heart-shaped body is a symbol of love and romance.
It is said that any couple meeting this Pokémon is promised a
loving relationship that never ends.
entries.sun:
If a Luvdisc is left on its own, it becomes
despondent, leaving itself open to attack.
That is when Pelipper snatch them up.
entries.moon:
Loving couples have a soft spot for this
Pokémon, so honeymoon hotels often release
this Pokémon into their pools.
entries.ultra-sun:
There was an era when it was overfished due to
the rumor that having one of its heart-shaped
scales would enable you to find a sweetheart.
entries.ultra-moon:
Luvdisc makes its home in coral reefs in warm
seas. It especially likes sleeping in the space
between Corsola’s branches.

entries.y:
Dreaming of one day flying, it practices by leaping
off cliffs every day.
entries.ruby:

in the sky. In doomed efforts to fly,
this POKéMON hurls itself off cliffs. As a result of its dives, its head has 
grown tough and as hard as tempered

entries.sapphire:
BAGON harbors a never-ending dream of
one day soaring high among the clouds.
As if trying to dispel its frustration over its inability to fly, this POKéMON
slams its hard head against huge rocks
and shatters them into pebbles.
entries.emerald:
Although it is small, this POKéMON is very
powerful because its body is a bundle of
muscles. It launches head-butts with its
ironlike skull.
entries.firered:
Its steel-hard head can shatter boulders.
It longingly hopes for wings to grow so it
can fly.
entries.leafgreen:
Its steel-hard head can shatter boulders.
It longingly hopes for wings to grow so it
can fly.
entries.diamond:
Dreaming of one day flying, it
practices by leaping off cliffs
every day.
entries.pearl:
Dreaming of one day flying, it
practices by leaping off cliffs
every day.
entries.platinum:
Dreaming of one day flying, it
practices by leaping off cliffs
every day.
entries.heartgold:
Its well-developed neck muscles
and ironlike head can smash
boulders into pieces.
entries.soulsilver:

entries.omega-ruby:
Bagon has a dream of one day soaring in the sky.
In doomed efforts to fly, this Pokémon hurls itself off cliffs.
As a result of its dives, its head has grown tough and as hard
as tempered steel.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Bagon harbors a never-ending dream of one day soaring high
among the clouds. As if trying to dispel its frustration over its
inability to fly, this Pokémon slams its hard head against huge
rocks and shatters them into pebbles.
entries.sun:
Its belief that it will be able to fly one day
is apparently the influence of information
carried in its genes.
entries.moon:
With its steel-hard stone head, it headbutts
indiscriminately. This is because of the stress
it feels at being unable to fly.
entries.ultra-sun:
Whenever it sees bird Pokémon flying through
the sky, it becomes envious and smashes its
surroundings to bits with headbutts.
entries.ultra-moon:
Some theories suggest that its behavior
of forcefully bashing its head into things
stimulates cells that affect its evolution.
entries.sword:
Bagon jumps off cliffs every day, trying to
grow stronger so that someday it will be able
to fly.
entries.shield:
Bagon is a solitary Pokémon that doesn’t form
groups with others of its kind. It also has a head
hard enough to cleave a boulder in one strike.

entries.ruby:
Inside SHELGON’s armor-like shell, cells
are in the midst of transformation
to create an entirely new body. This POKéMON’s shell is extremely heavy,
making its movements sluggish.
entries.sapphire:
Covering SHELGON’s body are outgrowths
much like bones. The shell is very hard
and bounces off enemy attacks. When awaiting evolution, this POKéMON
hides away in a cavern.
entries.emerald:
It hardly eats while it awaits evolution.
It becomes hardier by enduring hunger.
Its shell peels off the instant it begins
to evolve.
entries.firered:
Its armored body makes all attacks bounce
off. The armor is too tough, however,
making it heavy and somewhat sluggish.
entries.leafgreen:
Its armored body makes all attacks bounce
off. The armor is too tough, however,
making it heavy and somewhat sluggish.
entries.diamond:

have begun changing. The shell
peels off the instant it evolves.

peels off the instant it evolves.

entries.alpha-sapphire:
Covering Shelgon’s body are outgrowths much like bones.
The shell is very hard and bounces off enemy attacks.
When awaiting evolution, this Pokémon hides away in a cavern.
entries.sun:
The cells within its shell transform with
explosive speed, preparing it for evolution.
entries.moon:
They lurk deep within caves—motionless,
neither eating nor drinking. Why they don’t die is
not known.
entries.ultra-sun:
The cells within its body are changing at a
bewildering pace. Its hard shell is made from
the same substance as bone.
entries.ultra-moon:
Shelgon lives deep within caves. It stays shut
up in its hard shell, dreaming of the day it will
be able to fly.
entries.sword:
This Pokémon has covered its body in a hard
shell that has the same composition as bone.
Shelgon stores energy for evolution.
entries.shield:
Shelgon ignores its hunger entirely, never eating
any food. Apparently, Shelgon will evolve once
all its energy stores are used up.

entries.ruby:
SALAMENCE came about as a result of a
strong, long-held dream of growing
wings. It is said that this powerful desire triggered a sudden mutation in
this POKéMON’s cells, causing it to
sprout its magnificent wings.
entries.sapphire:
By evolving into SALAMENCE, this
POKéMON finally realizes its long-held
dream of growing wings. To express its joy, it flies and wheels
all over the sky while spouting flames
from its mouth.
entries.emerald:
After many long years, its cellular
structure underwent a sudden mutation to
grow wings. When angered, it loses all
thought and rampages out of control.
entries.firered:
It becomes uncontrollable if it is
enraged. It destroys everything with
shredding claws and fire.
entries.leafgreen:
It becomes uncontrollable if it is
enraged. It destroys everything with
shredding claws and fire.
entries.diamond:
As a result of its long-held dream
of flying, its cellular structure
changed, and wings grew out.
entries.pearl:
As a result of its long-held dream
of flying, its cellular structure
changed, and wings grew out.
entries.platinum:
As a result of its long-held dream
of flying, its cellular structure
changed, and wings grew out.
entries.heartgold:

entries.omega-ruby:
Salamence came about as a result of a strong, long-held
dream of growing wings. It is said that this powerful desire
triggered a sudden mutation in this Pokémon’s cells,
causing it to sprout its magnificent wings.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
By evolving into Salamence, this Pokémon finally
realizes its long-held dream of growing wings. To express
its joy, it flies and wheels all over the sky while spouting
flames from its mouth.
entries.sun:
When angered, it loses all sense of itself and
destroys everything around it. The destruction
will continue until Salamence has tired itself out.
entries.moon:
It flies around on its wings, which have grown in
at last. In its happiness, it gushes hot flames,
burning up the fields it passes over.
entries.ultra-sun:
Overjoyed at finally being able to fly, it flies all
over the place and usually doesn’t land until it’s
completely exhausted and needs to sleep.
entries.ultra-moon:
Thanks to its fervent wishes, the cells in its
body finally mutated, and at last it has its
heart’s desire—wings.
entries.sword:
Salamence is an unusual Pokémon in that it
was able to evolve a body with wings just by
constantly wishing to be able to fly.
entries.shield:
While basking in the joy of flight generally keeps
this Pokémon in high spirits, Salamence turns into
an uncontrollable menace if something angers it.

entries.ruby:
Instead of blood, a powerful magnetic
force courses throughout BELDUM’s
body. This POKéMON communicates with others by sending controlled pulses of
magnetism.
entries.sapphire:
BELDUM keeps itself floating by
generating a magnetic force that
repels earth’s natural magnetism. When it sleeps, this POKéMON anchors
itself to a cliff using the hooks on
its rear.
entries.emerald:
When BELDUM gather in a swarm, they move
in perfect unison as if they were but one
POKéMON. They communicate with each other
using brain waves.
entries.firered:
It uses magnetic waves to converse with
its kind. All the cells in its body are
magnetic.
entries.leafgreen:
It uses magnetic waves to converse with
its kind. All the cells in its body are
magnetic.

magnetic pulses. In a swarm, they

entries.alpha-sapphire:
Beldum keeps itself floating by generating a magnetic force

entries.sun:
Its cells are all magnets. It uses magnetism
to communicate with others of its kind.
entries.moon:
With magnetic traction, it pulls its opponents in
close. When they’re in range, it slashes them
with its rear claws.
entries.ultra-sun:
Instead of blood, magnetism flows through its
body. When it’s feeling bad, try giving it
a magnet.
entries.ultra-moon:
If you anger it, it will do more than rampage. It
will also burst out strong magnetism, causing
nearby machines to break.
entries.sword:
From its rear, Beldum emits a magnetic force that
rapidly pulls opponents in. They get skewered on
Beldum’s sharp claws.
entries.shield:
The cells in this Pokémon’s body are composed
of magnetic material. Instead of blood, magnetic
forces flow through Beldum’s body.

entries.ruby:
When two BELDUM fuse together, METANG
is formed. The brains of the BELDUM are
joined by a magnetic nervous system. By linking its brains magnetically,
this POKéMON generates strong
psychokinetic power.
entries.sapphire:
When two BELDUM fuse together, METANG
is formed. The brains of the BELDUM are
joined by a magnetic nervous system. This POKéMON turns its arms to the rear
for traveling at high speed.
entries.emerald:
The claws tipping its arms pack the
destructive power to tear through thick
iron sheets as if they were silk. It flies
at over 60 miles per hour.
entries.firered:
It floats midair using magnetism. Its body
is so tough, even a crash with a jet
plane won’t leave a scratch.
entries.leafgreen:
It floats midair using magnetism. Its body
is so tough, even a crash with a jet

together. Its steel body won’t be

The brains of the Beldum are joined by a magnetic
nervous system. This Pokémon turns its arms to the

entries.sun:
When two Beldum link together, their psychic
power is doubled. Their intelligence, however,
remains unchanged.
entries.moon:
It adores magnetic minerals, so it pursues
Nosepass at speeds exceeding 60 mph.
entries.ultra-sun:
With its two brains, it fires powerful psychic
energy to stop its prey in their tracks.
entries.ultra-moon:
It flies at high speeds around the skies. When it
finds its prey, Metang takes a firm grip with its
sharp claws and never lets go.
entries.sword:
Two Beldum have become stuck together via
their own magnetic forces. With two brains, the
resulting Metang has doubled psychic powers.
entries.shield:
Using magnetic forces to stay aloft, this Pokémon
flies at high speeds, weaving through harsh
mountain terrain in pursuit of prey.

entries.ruby:
METAGROSS has four brains in total.
Combined, the four brains can breeze
through difficult calculations faster than a supercomputer.
This POKéMON can float in the air by
tucking in its four legs.
entries.sapphire:
METAGROSS is the result of two METANG
achieving fusion. When hunting, this
POKéMON pins the prey to the ground under its massive body. It then eats
the helpless victim using the large 
mouth on its stomach.
entries.emerald:
METAGROSS has four brains that are joined
by a complex neural network. As a result of
integration, this POKéMON is smarter than
a supercomputer.
entries.firered:
It is formed by two METANG fusing.
Its four brains are said to be superior
to a supercomputer.
entries.leafgreen:

entries.alpha-sapphire:
Metagross is the result of two Metang achieving fusion.
When hunting, this Pokémon pins the prey to the ground under

large mouth on its stomach.
entries.sun:
It firmly pins its prey using its four claws and
large body. Then the teeth in the mouth on its
stomach chew the prey to bits.
entries.moon:
A linkage of two Metang, this Pokémon can
perform any calculation in a flash by utilizing
parallel processing in its four brains.
entries.ultra-sun:
It boasts not only psychic powers but also
fantastic strength. It grabs its prey with its four
legs and holds them in place with its claws.
entries.ultra-moon:
It analyzes its opponents with more accuracy
than a supercomputer, which enables it to
calmly back them into a corner.
entries.sword:
Because the magnetic powers of these Pokémon
get stronger in freezing temperatures, Metagross
living on snowy mountains are full of energy.
entries.shield:
Metagross is the result of the fusion of two
Metang. This Pokémon defeats its opponents
through use of its supercomputer-level brain.

If any part chips off in battle, it
attaches rocks to repair itself.

long ago. If this POKéMON’s body is
damaged in battle, it is said to seek out suitable rocks on its own to repair
itself.

locations.
entries.emerald:

in battle, REGIROCK repairs itself by

entries.ruby:
REGICE’s body was made during an ice
age. The deep-frozen body can’t be
melted, even by fire. This POKéMON controls frigid air of
minus 328 degrees F.

Its icy body is so cold, it will not melt
even if it is immersed in magma.

believe the ice was formed during an
ice age.

emerged onto the surface 10,000 years ago.

entries.ruby:
KYOGRE has the power to create massive
rain clouds that cover the entire sky

POKéMON that expanded the sea by

It took to sleep after a cataclysmic

mythology as the POKéMON that raised

of years in the earth’s ozone layer,

entries.ruby:
The DNA of a space virus underwent a
sudden mutation upon exposure to a
laser beam and resulted in DEOXYS. The crystalline organ on this POKéMON’s
chest appears to be its brain.

from space. It is highly intelligent and
wields psychokinetic powers. This POKéMON shoots lasers from the
crystalline organ on its chest.

puts anyone who
hears it to sleep.
entries.ruby:
JIGGLYPUFF’s vocal chords can freely
adjust the wavelength of its voice.
This POKéMON uses this ability to sing at precisely the right wavelength to
make its foes most drowsy.
entries.sapphire:
When this POKéMON sings, it never
pauses to breathe. If it is in a battle
against an opponent that does not easily fall asleep, JIGGLYPUFF cannot
breathe, endangering its life.
entries.emerald:
Nothing can avoid falling asleep hearing a
JIGGLYPUFF’s song. The sound waves of its
singing voice match the brain waves of
someone in a deep sleep.
entries.firered:
It captivates foes with its huge, round
eyes, then lulls them to sleep by singing
a soothing melody.
entries.leafgreen:

mysteriously soothing melody that lulls

that makes everyone drowsy.

Jigglypuff possess a vocal range that exceeds

Recordings of Jigglypuff’s strange lullabies can
be purchased from department stores. These
CDs can be found near the bedding area.
entries.ultra-moon:
The songs they sing are totally different
depending on the region they live in. Some even
sound like they’re shouting!
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Uses its cute round eyes to enrapture its foe.
It then sings a pleasing melody that lulls
the foe to sleep.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Uses its cute round eyes to enrapture its foe.

the foe to sleep.
entries.sword:
Jigglypuff has top-notch lung capacity, even by
comparison to other Pokémon. It won’t stop
singing its lullabies until its foes fall asleep.
entries.shield:
By freely changing the wavelength of its voice,
Jigglypuff sings a mysterious melody sure to
make any listener sleepy.

fire is put out when it sleeps.

Its fiery rear end is fueled by
gas made in its belly. Even rain
can’t extinguish the fire.
entries.platinum:
It is very agile. Before going to
sleep, it extinguishes the flame
on its tail to prevent fires.
entries.heartgold:
The gas made in its belly burns from
its rear end. The fire burns weakly
when it feels sick.

tail is but one weapon.

It uses unique fighting moves with
fire on its hands and feet. It will
take on any opponent.

A tall, hardy Pokémon with a dazzling appearance. It shrouds
itself in flame and battles as if engaged in dance—truly a sight

accepting food from people. Its
thick down guards it from cold.

A poor walker, it often falls down.
However, its strong pride makes it
puff up its chest without a care.

It doesn’t like to be taken care
of. It’s difficult to bond with since
it won’t listen to its Trainer.

It swims gracefully through the frigid sea and sings with a voice
like the roaring tide. It has powerful, sturdy wings and dignity
to match.

The three horns that extend from
its beak attest to its power. The
leader has the biggest horns.
entries.pearl:
It swims as fast as a jet boat.
The edges of its wings are sharp
and can slice apart drifting ice.
entries.platinum:
If anyone were to hurt its pride,
it would slash them with wings that
can cleave through an ice floe.
entries.heartgold:
It avoids unnecessary disputes,
but it will decimate anything that
threatens its pride.

who call it the Master of the Waves. Its wings are a match for
even master-crafted blades.

They flock in great numbers.
Though small, they flap their
wings with great power.

Usually with a large flock, it is
barely noticeable when alone.
Its cries are very strident.
entries.platinum:
Because they are weak individually,
they form groups. However, they
bicker if the group grows too big.
entries.heartgold:
They flock around mountains and
fields, chasing after bug Pokémon.
Their singing is noisy and annoying.

They live in the fields and mountains, gathering in large flocks.
Their cries are quite obnoxious. Though small, their wings are
strong—a strike from them leaves pain that persists for a week.

It lives in forests and fields.
Squabbles over territory occur
when flocks collide.

Recognizing their own weakness,
they always live in a group. When
alone, a STARAVIA cries noisily.

They maintain huge flocks, although
fierce scuffles break out between
various flocks.

They form remarkably large flocks and are constantly fighting
amongst themselves. I suspect that those with magnificent
plumes on their heads are the strong ones.

It has a savage nature. It will

are much larger.
entries.pearl:
The muscles in its wings and legs
are strong. It can easily fly while
gripping a small Pokémon.
entries.platinum:
It never stops attacking even
if it is injured. It fusses over the
shape of its comb.
entries.heartgold:
When STARAVIA evolve into
STARAPTOR, they leave the flock to
live alone. They have sturdy wings.

It has left the flock, having gained strength enough to survive on
its own. The astounding force with which Staraptor flies through
the air allows it to carry away large, burly targets.

perturb it. It is more agile and
active than it appears.
entries.pearl:
It constantly gnaws on logs and
rocks to whittle down its front
teeth. It nests alongside water.
entries.platinum:
A comparison revealed that
BIDOOF’s front teeth grow at
the same rate as RATTATA’s.

It lives in groups by the water. 
It chews up boulders and trees
around its nest with its incisors.

Bidoof has an unsophisticated face and is rarely flustered by

entries.red:
The body is soft
and rubbery. When
angered, it will suck in air and
inflate itself to
an enormous size.

and rubbery. When

without limit.

Their fur feels so
good that if two
of them snuggle together, they
won't want to be
separated.

It has a very fine
fur. Take care not
to make it angry, or it may inflate
steadily and hit

fur that covers

who feels it can't

entries.ruby:
WIGGLYTUFF has large, saucerlike eyes.
The surfaces of its eyes are always
covered with a thin layer of tears. If any dust gets in this POKéMON’s
eyes, it is quickly washed away.
entries.sapphire:
WIGGLYTUFF’s body is very flexible.
By inhaling deeply, this POKéMON can
inflate itself seemingly without end. Once inflated, WIGGLYTUFF bounces
along lightly like a balloon.
entries.emerald:
Its fur is the ultimate in luxuriousness.
Sleeping alongside a WIGGLYTUFF is simply
divine. Its body expands seemingly without
end when it inhales.

Its fur is extremely fine, dense, and
supple. The exquisitely pleasant fur
conveys an image of luxury.

Its fine fur feels so pleasant,
those who accidentally touch it
cannot take their hands away.
entries.x:
Their fur feels so good that if two of them snuggle
together, they won’t want to be separated.
entries.y:
The body is soft and rubbery. When angered,
it will suck in air and inflate itself to an
enormous size.
entries.omega-ruby:
Wigglytuff has large, saucerlike eyes. The surfaces of its eyes
are always covered with a thin layer of tears. If any dust gets in
this Pokémon’s eyes, it is quickly washed away.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Wigglytuff’s body is very flexible. By inhaling deeply,
this Pokémon can inflate itself seemingly without end.
Once inflated, Wigglytuff bounces along lightly like a balloon.
entries.sun:
It sheds its fine fur when the seasons change.
The fur is gathered and spun into a
luxurious yarn.
entries.moon:
As it inhales, it expands...and expands...and
expands. Wigglytuff compete to see which one
can inflate itself the most.
entries.ultra-sun:
Thanks to its bouncy body and fine fur,
this Pokémon is sought after. Holding one
in your arms while you sleep feels great.
entries.ultra-moon:
When it gets angry, it inhales with all its might,
and its body gradually inflates. Sometimes they
can grow 20 times larger!
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Its body is very elastic. By inhaling deeply,
it can continue to inflate itself without limit.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Its body is very elastic. By inhaling deeply,
it can continue to inflate itself without limit.
entries.sword:
The more air it takes in, the more it inflates. If
opponents catch it in a bad mood, it will inflate
itself to an enormous size to intimidate them.
entries.shield:
It’s proud of its fur, which is fine and delicate.
In particular, the curl on its forehead has a
texture that’s perfectly heavenly.

streams with bark and mud. It is
known as an industrious worker.
entries.pearl:
While its movements out of water
are sluggish, it can swim as fast
as any FEEBAS.
entries.platinum:
A river dammed by BIBAREL will
never overflow its banks, which
is appreciated by people nearby.

Shakes its body to generate electricity. Its stature belies its
aggression—one must be patient to tame this Pokémon.

Strong electricity courses through
the tips of its sharp claws. A light

gracious Pokémon, evenly sharing the spoils of the hunt with
others of its kind.

spot hiding prey--even those
taking shelter behind a wall.
entries.platinum:
It can see clearly through walls
to track down its prey and seek

Seeing through solid objects uses up a lot of

long periods of time to store up energy.
entries.legends-arceus:
They form packs, each having one male as leader. Legends say
that when Luxray's two eyes shimmer with gold, the Pokémon
can see through anything.

entries.diamond:

and endures the cold. In spring,
the bud opens and releases pollen.
entries.pearl:
It lives alongside clear ponds.
It scatters pollen that induces
harsh sneezing and runny noses.
entries.platinum:
Sensitive to changing temperature,
the bud is said to bloom when it
feels the sun’s warm touch.
entries.heartgold:
When it feels the sun’s warm touch,
it opens its bud to release pollen.
It lives alongside clear pools.

entries.shield:
This Pokémon is highly sensitive to temperature
changes. When its bud starts to open, that means

entries.legends-arceus:
When the sun's light strengthens, the bud atop this Pokémon's
head opens. This is a sign to the people that the harsh winter is
over, and the season of budding has begun.

aroma, then downs it with
thorny whips hidden in its arms.
entries.pearl:
With the movements of a dancer,
it strikes with whips that are
densely lined with poison thorns.
entries.platinum:
Each of its hands contains
different toxins, but both hands
can jab with near-fatal power.
entries.heartgold:
Its sweet aroma attracts prey.
Then it spews poison. The more
toxic it is, the sweeter its aroma.
entries.soulsilver:

entries.legends-arceus:
Hidden within the bouquet on each hand are thorned whips
loaded with virulent poison. Roserade moves gracefully as it
corners its prey and mercilessly lashes them with its whips.

ball-like fossil. It downs prey with
its head butts.
entries.platinum:
A lifelong jungle dweller from 100
million years ago, it would snap
obstructing trees with head butts.
entries.heartgold:
CRANIDOS toughen up their already
rock-hard heads by headbutting
one another.

ago. It used its skillful headbutts to
combat Aerodactyl.

In rock layers where Cranidos fossils are found,

are also often found.

A primeval Pokémon, it possesses a hard and
sturdy skull, lacking any intelligence within.
entries.ultra-moon:
Its hard skull is its distinguishing feature. It
snapped trees by headbutting them, and then
it fed on their ripe berries.
entries.legends-arceus:
An incredibly rare sight. They duel each other by ramming their
heads together, and the resulting sound echoes throughout the
area like the pealing of a bell.

entries.diamond:
Its powerful head butt has enough
power to shatter even the most
durable things upon impact.
entries.pearl:
Its skull is as hard as iron. It is
a brute that tears down jungle
trees while catching prey.
entries.platinum:
If two were to smash their heads
together, their foot-thick skulls
would keep them from fainting.
entries.heartgold:
Its skull withstands impacts of any
magnitude. As a result, its brain
never gets the chance to grow.

grown thick and hard. However, its brain has
shrunk in size compared with Cranidos’s.
entries.moon:
Records exist of a revived fossil that evolved
into Rampardos. It proceeded to escape and
then destroy a skyscraper with a headbutt.
entries.ultra-sun:
In ancient times, people would dig up fossils of
this Pokémon and use its skull, which is harder
than steel, to make helmets.
entries.ultra-moon:
This ancient Pokémon used headbutts skillfully.
Its brain was really small, so some theories
suggest that its stupidity led to its extinction.
entries.legends-arceus:
Very little is known about its biology. Can knock down massive
trees by smashing its beautiful, pearl-like crown against them.

entries.red:
Forms colonies in
perpetually dark
places. Uses ultrasonic waves
to identify and
approach targets.
entries.blue:
Forms colonies in
perpetually dark
places. Uses ultrasonic waves
to identify and
approach targets.
entries.yellow:
Emits ultrasonic
cries while it
flies. They act as a sonar used
to check for ob­
jects in its way.
entries.gold:
While flying, it
constantly emits
ultrasonic waves from its mouth to
check its sur­
roundings.
entries.silver:
Capable of flying
safely in dark
places, it emits ultrasonic cries
to check for any
obstacles.
entries.crystal:
During the day, it
gathers with
others and hangs from the ceilings
of old buildings
and caves.
entries.ruby:
ZUBAT remains quietly unmoving in a
dark spot during the bright daylight
hours. It does so because prolonged exposure to the sun causes its body to
become slightly burned.
entries.sapphire:
ZUBAT avoids sunlight because exposure
causes it to become unhealthy.
During the daytime, it stays in caves or under the eaves of old houses, sleeping
while hanging upside down.
entries.emerald:
While living in pitch-black caverns, their
eyes gradually grew shut and deprived
them of vision. They use ultrasonic waves
to detect obstacles.
entries.firered:
It has no eyes. Instead, it relies on
its ultrasonic cries for echo location to
flit about in darkness.
entries.leafgreen:
It forms colonies in perpetually dark 
places and uses ultrasonic waves to  
identify and approach targets.
entries.diamond:
Even though it has no eyes, it can
sense obstacles using ultrasonic
waves it emits from its mouth.
entries.pearl:
Disliking sunlight, it sleeps
deep in forests and caves
until sundown.
entries.platinum:
It checks its surroundings and
location using reflections of the
ultrasonic waves from its mouth.
entries.heartgold:
While flying, it constantly emits
ultrasonic waves from its mouth to
check its surroundings.

Capable of flying safely in dark
places, it emits ultrasonic cries
to check for any obstacles.

so to check its surroundings while flying, it
emits ultrasonic waves.
entries.moon:
When exposed to sunlight, they suffer burns.
The frequency of their ultrasonic waves can
differ slightly from colony to colony.
entries.ultra-sun:
It has no eyeballs, so it can’t see. It checks its
surroundings via the ultrasonic waves it emits
from its mouth.
entries.ultra-moon:
Their skin is so thin that they’ll be burned if
sunlight hits them. When it gets cold out, they
gather together to warm one another’s bodies.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Emits ultrasonic cries while it flies. They act as
a sonar used to check for objects in its way.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Emits ultrasonic cries while it flies. They act as
a sonar used to check for objects in its way.
entries.sword:
It emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check
its surroundings. Even in tight caves, Zubat flies
around with skill.
entries.shield:
Zubat live in caves, down where the sun’s light
won’t reach. In the morning, they gather together
to keep each other warm as they sleep.
entries.legends-arceus:
Makes its home in gloomy caves. Atrophied eyes have left this
Pokémon blind, so it scans its surroundings via sound waves that
it emits from its mouth as it flies.

around 100 million years ago. Its
facial hide is extremely hard.
entries.pearl:
It habitually polishes its face by
rubbing it against tree trunks. It
is weak to attacks from behind.
entries.platinum:
It is outstandingly armored. As a
result, it can eat grass and
berries without having to fight.

of a layer of clay that was older than
anyone knows. It has a sturdy face.

but almost none have shown signs of damage
to the face.
entries.moon:
This Pokémon lived in primeval jungles. Few
enemies would have been willing to square off
against its heavily armored face, so it’s thought.
entries.ultra-sun:
A mild-mannered, herbivorous Pokémon, it used
its face to dig up tree roots to eat. The skin on
its face was plenty tough.
entries.ultra-moon:
Although its fossils can be found in layers of
primeval rock, nothing but its face has ever
been discovered.
entries.legends-arceus:
Much remains unknown about this Pokémon, as few have ever
seen it. However, we know that it is calm and dislikes conflict,
and it enjoys polishing its face against trees and rocks.

entries.diamond:
Any frontal attack is repulsed.
It is a docile Pokémon that
feeds on grass and berries.
entries.pearl:
When attacked, they form a wall
with their shieldlike faces to
protect their young.
entries.platinum:
When they lined up side by side, no
foe could break through. They
shielded their young in that way.
entries.heartgold:
When attacked, they form a wall.
Their rock-hard faces serve to
protect them from the attacks.

While it can guard against any sort of attack

entries.moon:
It lived in the same environments as Rampardos.
Their fossils have been found together—
seemingly from after they’d fought to the finish.
entries.ultra-sun:
The bones of its face are huge and hard, so
they were mistaken for its spine until after this
Pokémon was successfully restored.
entries.ultra-moon:
This Pokémon is from roughly 100 million years
ago. Its terrifyingly tough face is harder
than steel.
entries.legends-arceus:
Its face is sturdy—as strong as diamond—and this hardness
offers a very stable defense. Much about this species is still
unknown, such as its natural habitat.

entries.diamond:
To shelter itself from cold, wintry
winds, it covers itself with a cloak
made of twigs and leaves.
entries.pearl:
If its cloak is broken in battle,
it quickly remakes the cloak with
materials nearby.
entries.platinum:
Even if it is born where there are
no cocooning materials, it somehow
always ends up with a cloak.
entries.heartgold:
It covers itself with a cloak to
shelter from the cold. When it’s
hot, its cloak is thinner.

became a part of this Pokémon’s
body. The cloak is never shed.

Its appearance changes depending
on where it evolved. The materials
on hand become a part of its body.

When evolving, its body takes in
surrounding materials. As a result,
there are many body variations.
entries.heartgold:
It is said that a WORMADAM that
evolves on a cold day will have a
thicker cloak.

gather any itself. Instead, it

steals honey from the COMBEE hive.

Scatters steel-colored scales as it flaps its wings. Despite

Mothim is not often seen around flower gardens.

A Pokémon formed by three others.
It busily carries sweet floral
honey to VESPIQUEN.
entries.pearl:
It collects and delivers honey to
its colony. At night, they cluster
to form a beehive and sleep.
entries.platinum:
The trio is together from birth.
It constantly gathers honey from
flowers to please VESPIQUEN.
entries.heartgold:
At night, COMBEE sleep in a group of
about a thousand, packed closely
together in a lump.

The members of the trio spend all their time

entries.shield:
It ceaselessly gathers nectar from sunrise to
sundown, all for the sake of Vespiquen and
the swarm.
entries.legends-arceus:
They swear fealty to a queen Pokémon and work diligently to
gather nectar. Each swarm produces a different flavor of honey.

Its abdomen is a honeycomb for
grubs. It raises its grubs on
honey collected by COMBEE.

When endangered, grubs from its
six-cell honeycomb strike back.
There is only one in a colony.
entries.platinum:
It releases various pheromones
to make the grubs in its body do
its bidding while fighting foes.
entries.heartgold:
It raises grubs in the holes in its
body. It secretes pheromones to
control COMBEE.

It skillfully commands its grubs in battles with its

entries.shield:

entries.legends-arceus:
Commands its subjects to build its hive. It will dispatch any
interlopers who dare sneak into its nest and use them as
nourishment for itself.

It makes fur balls that crackle
with static electricity. It stores
them with berries in tree holes.
entries.pearl:
It makes electricity with pouches
in its cheeks and shoots charges
from its tail. It lives atop trees.
entries.platinum:
A pair may be seen rubbing their
cheek pouches together in an
effort to share stored electricity.
entries.heartgold:
It’s one of the kinds of Pokémon 
with electric cheek pouches.
It shoots charges from its tail.

Pokémon, it still presents a danger should one touch its
electrified tail or cheeks.

entries.diamond:
It has a flotation sac that is
like an inflatable collar. It floats
on water with its head out.
entries.pearl:
It swims by rotating its two tails
like a screw. When it dives, its
flotation sac collapses.
entries.platinum:
It spins its two tails like a screw
to propel itself through water. The
tails also slice clinging seaweed.
entries.heartgold:
It inflates its flotation sac,
keeping its face above water in
order to watch for prey movement.
entries.soulsilver:
It inflates its flotation sac,

entries.legends-arceus:
It moves freely in the water by spinning its forked tail for
propulsion. The resemblance to the screw of a steamboat
is coincidental.

entries.diamond:
It floats using its well-developed
flotation sac. It assists in the
rescues of drowning people.
entries.pearl:
Its flotation sac developed as a
result of pursuing aquatic prey.
It can double as a rubber raft.
entries.platinum:
It is a common sight around
fishing ports. It is known to
rescue people and carry off prey.
entries.heartgold:
With its flotation sac inflated, it
can carry people on its back. It
deflates the sac before it dives.
entries.soulsilver:

Has a long, rather splendid flotation sac, which prevents
Floatzel from drowning even in stormy seas. One might glimpse
this species around fishing hamlets from time to time.

entries.red:
Once it strikes,
it will not stop
draining energy from the victim
even if it gets
too heavy to fly.
entries.blue:
Once it strikes,
it will not stop
draining energy from the victim
even if it gets
too heavy to fly.
entries.yellow:
It attacks in a
stealthy manner,
without warning. Its sharp fangs
are used to bite
and suck blood.
entries.gold:
However hard its
victim's hide may
be, it punctures with sharp fangs
and gorges itself
with blood.
entries.silver:
It can drink more
than 10 ounces of
blood at once. If it has too much,
it gets heavy and
flies clumsily.
entries.crystal:
When it plunges
its fangs into its
prey, it instantly draws and gulps
down more than ten
ounces of blood.
entries.ruby:
GOLBAT loves to drink the blood of
living things. It is particularly active
in the pitch black of night. This POKéMON flits around in the night
skies, seeking fresh blood.
entries.sapphire:
GOLBAT bites down on prey with its four
fangs and drinks the victim’s blood.
It becomes active on inky dark moonless nights, flying around to
attack people and POKéMON.
entries.emerald:
Its fangs easily puncture even thick
animal hide. It loves to feast on the blood
of people and POKéMON. It flits about in
darkness and strikes from behind.
entries.firered:
It clamps down on its prey with needle-
sharp fangs and drains over 10 ounces of
blood in one gulp.
entries.leafgreen:
Once it bites, it will not stop draining
energy from the victim even if it gets too
heavy to fly.
entries.diamond:
It loves the blood of humans and
Pokémon. It flies around at night
in search of neck veins.
entries.pearl:
Once it starts sucking blood, it
does not stop until it is full. It
flies at night in search of prey.
entries.platinum:
Its sharp fangs puncture the
toughest of hides and have small
holes for greedily sucking blood.
entries.heartgold:
However hard its victim’s hide may be,
it punctures with sharp fangs
and gorges itself with blood.

blood at once. If it has too much,

entries.black-2:

drains a nearly fatal amount of blood.

entries.omega-ruby:
Golbat loves to drink the blood of living things. It is particularly
active in the pitch black of night. This Pokémon flits around in
the night skies, seeking fresh blood.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Golbat bites down on prey with its four fangs and drinks
the victim’s blood. It becomes active on inky dark
moonless nights, flying around to attack people and Pokémon.
entries.sun:
Its thick fangs are hollow like straws, making
them unexpectedly fragile. These fangs are
specialized for sucking blood.
entries.moon:
Sometimes they drink so much blood, they can’t
fly anymore. Then they fall to the ground and
become food for other Pokémon.
entries.ultra-sun:
Every once in a while, you’ll see a Golbat that’s
missing some fangs. This happens when hunger
drives it to try biting a Steel-type Pokémon.
entries.ultra-moon:
They can suck down over 10 ounces of blood in
one go. They have been known to drink so much
blood that they can no longer fly.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
It attacks in a stealthy manner,
without warning. Its sharp fangs
are used to bite and to suck blood.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
It attacks in a stealthy manner,
without warning. Its sharp fangs
are used to bite and to suck blood.
entries.sword:
It loves to drink other creatures’ blood. It’s said
that if it finds others of its kind going hungry,
it sometimes shares the blood it’s gathered.
entries.shield:
Its feet are tiny, but this Pokémon walks skillfully.
It sneaks up on sleeping prey before sinking in its
fangs and slurping up blood.
entries.legends-arceus:
It sinks its sharp fangs into other creatures and slurps up their
blood. A closer look at the fangs reveals that they are hollow
and akin to straws.

The small ball holds the nutrients
needed for evolution. Apparently,
it is very sweet and tasty.
entries.pearl:
Sunlight colors it red. When the
small ball is drained of nutrients,
it shrivels to herald evolution.
entries.platinum:
The small ball is not only filled with
nutrients, it is also tasty. STARLY
try to peck it off.
entries.heartgold:
It evolves by sucking the energy
out of the small ball where it had
been storing nutrients.
entries.soulsilver:
It evolves by sucking the energy
out of the small ball where it had
been storing nutrients.

entries.shield:
The deeper a Cherubi’s red, the more nutrients it
has stockpiled in its body. And the sweeter and
tastier its small ball!
entries.legends-arceus:
Once the fruit growing alongside the main body is large and
plump, Cherubi will use the nutrients within to evolve. The fruit
then detaches, becoming nourishment for other creatures.

entries.diamond:
It blooms during times of strong
sunlight. It tries to make up for
everything it endured as a bud.
entries.pearl:
It is docile as a bud, but turns
cheerful when it blooms. It folds
back into a bud if sunlight wanes.
entries.platinum:
If it senses strong sunlight, it
opens its folded petals to absorb
the sun’s rays with its whole body.
entries.heartgold:
During times of strong sunlight,
its bud blooms, its petals open
fully, and it becomes very active.
entries.soulsilver:
During times of strong sunlight,
its bud blooms, its petals open
fully, and it becomes very active.

As a bud, it barely moves. It sits still, placidly
waiting for sunlight to appear.
entries.shield:
Its folded petals are pretty tough. Bird Pokémon
can peck at them all they want, and Cherrim
won’t be bothered at all.
entries.legends-arceus:
Motionless, save for the occasional quiver. A rich array of
Pokémon can be found gathered around it, drawn by the
scent exuded from Cherrim's folded petals.

region to region. In the Sinnoh
region, two types are confirmed.
entries.pearl:
It lives along bodies of water.
Its body shape has changed to
suit its habitat.
entries.platinum:
Beware of pushing strongly on
its squishy body, as it makes a
mysterious purple fluid ooze out.

the seashore. Its color and form differ according
to its habitat and the quality of its food.

Purple mucus sticks to the hands of anyone
who touches it. Take care, as the substance is
troublesome to wash off.
entries.ultra-sun:
While they normally live in the sea, they can
function on land, too, until their skin dries out.
entries.ultra-moon:
When it senses danger, a purple liquid oozes out
of it. The liquid is thought to be something like
greasy sweat.
entries.sword:
This Pokémon’s habitat shapes its physique.
According to some theories, life in warm ocean
waters causes this variation to develop.
entries.shield:
Subjecting this Pokémon to a strong force
causes it to secrete a strange purple fluid.
Though harmless, the fluid is awfully sticky.
entries.legends-arceus:
Found in abundance on seashores bordering warm waters.
Shellos are unexpectedly friendly and will crawl toward any
person they see. Take care not to get coated in mucus!

entries.diamond:
It has a pliable body without any
bones. If any part of its body is
torn off, it grows right back.
entries.pearl:
It apparently had a huge shell for
protection in ancient times.
It lives in shallow tidal pools.
entries.platinum:
Long ago, its entire back was
shielded with a sturdy shell. There
are traces of it left in its cells.
entries.heartgold:
When its natural enemy attacks,
it oozes purple fluid and escapes.
entries.soulsilver:
When its natural enemy attacks,
it oozes purple fluid and escapes.
entries.black:
Long ago, its entire back was
shielded with a sturdy shell. There
are traces of it left in its cells.
entries.white:
Long ago, its entire back was
shielded with a sturdy shell. There
are traces of it left in its cells.

Long ago, its entire back was
shielded with a sturdy shell. There
are traces of it left in its cells.
entries.white-2:

shielded with a sturdy shell. There
are traces of it left in its cells.
entries.x:
When its natural enemy attacks, it oozes purple
fluid and escapes.
entries.y:
It apparently had a huge shell for protection in
ancient times. It lives in shallow tidal pools.
entries.omega-ruby:
When its natural enemy attacks, it oozes purple
fluid and escapes.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
It apparently had a huge shell for protection in
ancient times. It lives in shallow tidal pools.
entries.sun:
It has strong regenerative capabilities. Even if
parts of it are bitten off by fish Pokémon, it will
return to normal within a few hours.
entries.moon:
Plankton, invisible to the naked eye, is its main
food source. It comes onto the land periodically,
but the reason for this is not known.
entries.ultra-sun:
Long ago, it had a shell on its back. There’s now
a vestigial plate on its back that’s hard but thin.
entries.ultra-moon:
Their shape and color change, depending on
their environment and diet. There are many of
them at beaches where the waves are calm.
entries.sword:
Its search for food sometimes leads it onto land,
where it leaves behind a sticky trail of slime as it
passes through.
entries.shield:
The softness of its body helps disperse the force
of impacts, so although its body is uncommonly
squishy, it’s also surprisingly resilient.
entries.legends-arceus:
Eats beach sand for nourishment. Should one Gastrodon
encounter another of a different color, a fierce battle will inevitably ensue.

entries.diamond:
To eat, it deftly shucks nuts
with its two tails. It rarely uses
its arms now.
entries.pearl:
They work in large colonies and
make rings by linking their
tails, apparently in friendship.
entries.platinum:
Split into two, the tails are so
adept at handling and doing things,
AMBIPOM rarely uses its hands.
entries.heartgold:
They live on large trees. They are
said to communicate by connecting
their tails to those of others.
entries.soulsilver:
It is very difficult to dodge the
consecutive strikes of its two tails.
entries.black:
Split into two, the tails are so
adept at handling and doing things,
Ambipom rarely uses its hands.
entries.white:
Split into two, the tails are so
adept at handling and doing things,
Ambipom rarely uses its hands.
entries.black-2:
Split into two, the tails are so
adept at handling and doing things,
Ambipom rarely uses its hands.
entries.white-2:
Split into two, the tails are so
adept at handling and doing things,
Ambipom rarely uses its hands.
entries.x:
They work in large colonies and make rings by
linking their tails, apparently in friendship.
entries.y:
To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails.
It rarely uses its arms now.
entries.omega-ruby:
They work in large colonies and make rings by
linking their tails, apparently in friendship.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails.
It rarely uses its arms now.
entries.ultra-sun:
In their search for comfortable trees, they get
into territorial disputes with groups of
Passimian. They win about half the time.
entries.ultra-moon:
It uses its tails for everything. If it wraps both
of its tails around you and gives you a squeeze,
that’s proof it really likes you.
entries.legends-arceus:
To affirm their kinship, members of this species will form a ring
by linking their newly doubled tails together. On rare occasions,
humans have been accepted into such rings.

entries.diamond:
A Pokémon formed by the spirits
of people and Pokémon. It loves
damp, humid seasons.
entries.pearl:
It tugs on the hands of children
to steal them away. However, it
gets pulled around instead.
entries.platinum:
Because of the way it floats
aimlessly, an old folktale calls it a
“Signpost for Wandering Spirits.”
entries.heartgold:
It is whispered that any child who
mistakes DRIFLOON for a balloon and
holds on to it could wind up missing.
entries.soulsilver:
It is whispered that any child who
mistakes DRIFLOON for a balloon and
holds on to it could wind up missing.
entries.black:
Because of the way it floats
aimlessly, an old folktale calls it a
“Signpost for Wandering Spirits.”
entries.white:
Because of the way it floats
aimlessly, an old folktale calls it a
“Signpost for Wandering Spirits.”
entries.black-2:
These Pokémon are called the
“Signpost for Wandering Spirits.”
Children holding them sometimes vanish.
entries.white-2:
These Pokémon are called the
“Signpost for Wandering Spirits.”
Children holding them sometimes vanish.
entries.x:
A Pokémon formed by the spirits of people and
Pokémon. It loves damp, humid seasons.
entries.y:
These Pokémon are called the “Signpost for
Wandering Spirits.” Children holding them
sometimes vanish.
entries.omega-ruby:
A Pokémon formed by the spirits of people and Pokémon.
It loves damp, humid seasons.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
These Pokémon are called the “Signpost for
Wandering Spirits.” Children holding them
sometimes vanish.
entries.sun:
Stories go that it grabs the hands of small
children and drags them away to the afterlife.
It dislikes heavy children.
entries.moon:
If for some reason its body bursts, its soul spills
out with a screaming sound.
entries.ultra-sun:
Its round body is stuffed with souls and
expands each time it leads someone away.
entries.ultra-moon:
Wandering souls gathered together to form this
Pokémon. When trying to make friends with
children, Drifloon grabs them by the hand.
entries.sword:
Perhaps seeking company, it approaches children.
However, it often quickly runs away again when
the children play too roughly with it.
entries.shield:
The gathering of many souls gave rise to this
Pokémon. During humid seasons, they seem to
appear in abundance.
entries.legends-arceus:
Said to lure away young children and carry them off to the
afterlife. Some whisper that Drifloon are formed of reincarnated
human souls, but these rumors are as yet unconfirmed.

entries.black:
At dusk, swarms of them are
carried aloft on winds. When
noticed, they suddenly vanish.
entries.diamond:
It’s drowzy in daytime, but flies
off in the evening in big groups.
No one knows where they go.
entries.pearl:
It carries people and Pokémon
when it flies. But since it only
drifts, it can end up anywhere.
entries.platinum:
At dusk, swarms of them are
carried aloft on winds. When
noticed, they suddenly vanish.
entries.heartgold:
It can generate and release gas
within its body. That’s how it can
control the altitude of its drift.
entries.soulsilver:
It can generate and release gas
within its body. That’s how it can
control the altitude of its drift.
entries.white:
At dusk, swarms of them are
carried aloft on winds. When
noticed, they suddenly vanish.
entries.black-2:
They carry people and Pokémon,
but the wind can catch them, so
there can’t be a fixed destination.
entries.white-2:
They carry people and Pokémon,
but the wind can catch them, so
there can’t be a fixed destination.
entries.x:
It carries people and Pokémon when it flies.
But since it only drifts, it can end up anywhere.
entries.y:
It’s drowsy in daytime, but flies off in the evening in
big groups. No one knows where they go.
entries.omega-ruby:
It carries people and Pokémon when it flies.
But since it only drifts, it can end up anywhere.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
It’s drowsy in daytime, but flies off in the evening in
big groups. No one knows where they go.
entries.sun:
There was once an incident in which a man
took a trip riding a Drifblim, only to go missing.
entries.moon:
Even while under careful observation, large
flocks of Drifblim flying at dusk will inexplicably
disappear from view.
entries.ultra-sun:
There’s a rumor that if you catch a Drifblim
floating on the wind at dusk, you’ll be carried
away to the afterlife.
entries.ultra-moon:
The raw material for the gas inside its body
is souls. When its body starts to deflate, it’s
thought to carry away people and Pokémon.
entries.sword:
Some say this Pokémon is a collection of souls
burdened with regrets, silently drifting through
the dusk.
entries.shield:
It grabs people and Pokémon and carries them
off somewhere. Where do they go?
Nobody knows.
entries.legends-arceus:
It drifts along at dusk, perfectly silent. Its transient, melancholy
aspect touches some people deeply—every so often, one will
come upon a song or poem devoted to Drifblim.

entries.diamond:
It slams foes by sharply uncoiling
its rolled ears. It stings enough
to make a grown-up cry in pain.
entries.pearl:
When it senses danger, it perks up
its ears. On cold nights, it sleeps
with its head tucked into its fur.
entries.platinum:
Its ears are always rolled up. They
can be forcefully extended to
shatter even a large boulder.
entries.heartgold:
You can tell how it feels by the way
it rolls its ears. When it’s scared,
both ears are rolled up.
entries.soulsilver:
You can tell how it feels by the way
it rolls its ears. When it’s scared,
both ears are rolled up.
entries.black:
Its ears are always rolled up. They
can be forcefully extended to
shatter even a large boulder.
entries.white:
Its ears are always rolled up. They
can be forcefully extended to
shatter even a large boulder.
entries.black-2:
By extending its rolled-up ears
and striking the ground, it can
bound so high it surprises itself.
entries.white-2:
By extending its rolled-up ears
and striking the ground, it can
bound so high it surprises itself.
entries.x:
Its ears are always rolled up. They can be forcefully
extended to shatter even a large boulder.
entries.y:
When it senses danger, it perks up its ears.
On cold nights, it sleeps with its head tucked into
its fur.
entries.omega-ruby:
Its ears are always rolled up. They can be forcefully
extended to shatter even a large boulder.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
When it senses danger, it perks up its ears.
On cold nights, it sleeps with its head tucked into
its fur.
entries.ultra-sun:
Its arms and legs are weak, but when it rolls its
ears up tight and then unleashes them with its
full force, it can smash boulders to dust.
entries.ultra-moon:
The reason it keeps one ear rolled up is so it
can launch a swift counterattack if it’s attacked
by an enemy.
entries.sword:
If both of Buneary’s ears are rolled up, something
is wrong with its body or mind. It’s a sure sign the
Pokémon is in need of care.
entries.shield:
Buneary can attack by rolling up their ears and
then striking with the force created by unrolling
them. This attack becomes stronger with training.
entries.legends-arceus:
My hypothesis as to why Buneary rolls up its ears is that its
hearing is far too keen. I surmise that the Pokémon protects its
hearing by limiting the sound that may enter its ears.

entries.diamond:
An extremely cautious Pokémon.
It cloaks its body with its fluffy
ear fur when it senses danger.
entries.pearl:
It is very conscious of its looks
and never fails to groom its ears.
It runs with sprightly jumps.
entries.platinum:
The ears appear to be delicate. If
they are touched roughly, it kicks
with its graceful legs.
entries.heartgold:
It sheds its fur twice a year.
Its winter fur is soft and fluffy.
entries.soulsilver:
It sheds its fur twice a year.
Its winter fur is soft and fluffy.
entries.black:
The ears appear to be delicate. If
they are touched roughly, it kicks
with its graceful legs.
entries.white:
The ears appear to be delicate. If
they are touched roughly, it kicks
with its graceful legs.
entries.black-2:
Extremely cautious,
it quickly bounds off
when it senses danger.
entries.white-2:
Extremely cautious,
it quickly bounds off
when it senses danger.
entries.x:
Extremely cautious, it quickly bounds off
when it senses danger.
entries.y:
The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched
roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.
entries.omega-ruby:
Extremely cautious, it quickly bounds off when it
senses danger.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched
roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.
entries.ultra-sun:
Lopunny regrows its coat twice a year. Mufflers
and hats made from its fur are really warm.
entries.ultra-moon:
It’s notably wary and has a dislike of fighting,
but at the same time, it can deliver powerful
kicks with its lithe legs.
entries.sword:
Lopunny is constantly monitoring its surroundings.
If danger approaches, this Pokémon responds
with superdestructive kicks.
entries.shield:
Once hot seasons are over, Lopunny’s coat will
be replaced with fur that holds a lot of insulating
air in preparation for colder weather.
entries.legends-arceus:
Its fur is warm and yet remarkably light. This Pokémon kicks as
though it were a master of karate, driving back its opponents
with ease.

entries.diamond:
Its cries sound like incantations.
Those hearing it are tormented
by headaches and hallucinations.
entries.pearl:
It chants incantations. While they
usually torment targets, some
chants bring happiness.
entries.platinum:
Its cry sounds like an incantation.
It is said the cry may rarely be
imbued with happiness-giving power.
entries.heartgold:
Its cries sound like incantations
to torment the foe. It appears
where you least expect it.
entries.soulsilver:
Its cries sound like incantations
to torment the foe. It appears
where you least expect it.
entries.black:
Its cry sounds like an incantation.
It is said the cry may rarely be
imbued with happiness-giving power.

It is said the cry may rarely be
imbued with happiness-giving power.

It chants incantations. While they usually torment

entries.alpha-sapphire:
Its cries sound like incantations to torment the foe.
It appears where you least expect it.
entries.sun:
It appears as if from nowhere—muttering
incantations, placing curses, and giving
people terrifying visions.
entries.moon:
Mismagius have been known to cast spells to
make people fall in love, so some people search
for this Pokémon as if their life depended on it.
entries.ultra-sun:
Feared for its wrath and the curses it spreads,
this Pokémon will also, on a whim, cast spells
that help people.
entries.ultra-moon:
Its muttered curses can cause awful headaches
or terrifying visions that torment others.
entries.legends-arceus:
The incantations Mismagius chants can ward against misfortune,
so a custom exists of inviting it into one's home. Incur the
Pokémon's displeasure, however, and disaster will surely ensue.

entries.red:
During the day,
it keeps its face
buried in the ground. At night,
it wanders around
sowing its seeds.
entries.blue:
During the day,
it keeps its face
buried in the ground. At night,
it wanders around
sowing its seeds.
entries.yellow:
It may be mistaken
for a clump of
weeds. If you try to yank it out of
the ground, it
shrieks horribly.
entries.gold:
Awakened by moon­
light, it roams 
actively at night. In the day, it
stays quietly
underground.
entries.silver:
If exposed to
moonlight, it
starts to move. It roams far and
wide at night to
scatter its seeds.
entries.crystal:
During the day, it
stays in the cold
underground to avoid the sun.
It grows by bath­
ing in moonlight.
entries.ruby:
During the daytime, ODDISH buries
itself in soil to absorb nutrients from 
the ground using its entire body. The more fertile the soil, the glossier
its leaves become.
entries.sapphire:
ODDISH searches for fertile, nutrient-
rich soil, then plants itself.
During the daytime, while it is planted, this POKéMON’s feet are thought to
change shape and become similar to
the roots of trees.
entries.emerald:
This POKéMON grows by absorbing moonlight.
During the daytime, it buries itself in the
ground, leaving only its leaves exposed to
avoid detection by its enemies.
entries.firered:
Its scientific name is “Oddium Wanderus.”
At night, it is said to walk nearly 1,000
feet on its two roots.
entries.leafgreen:
During the day, it keeps its face buried
in the ground. At night, it wanders around
sowing its seeds.
entries.diamond:
It often plants its root feet in the
ground during the day and sows
seeds as it walks about at night.

entries.diamond:
Becoming active at night, it is
known to swarm with numerous
MURKROW in tow.
entries.pearl:
It makes its MURKROW cronies
bring it food. It idles its time
away, grooming itself in its nest.
entries.platinum:
If one utters a deep cry, many
MURKROW gather quickly. For this,
it is called “Summoner of Night.”
entries.heartgold:
It is merciless by nature. It is said
that it never forgives the mistakes
of its MURKROW followers.
entries.soulsilver:
It is merciless by nature. It is said
that it never forgives the mistakes
of its MURKROW followers.
entries.black:
If one utters a deep cry, many
Murkrow gather quickly. For this,
it is called “Summoner of Night.”

Murkrow gather quickly. For this,
it is called “Summoner of Night.”

entries.x:
If one utters a deep cry, many Murkrow gather
quickly. For this, it is called “Summoner of Night.”
entries.y:
Becoming active at night, it is known to swarm with
numerous Murkrow in tow.
entries.omega-ruby:
If one utters a deep cry, many Murkrow gather
quickly. For this, it is called “Summoner of Night.”
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Becoming active at night, it is known to swarm with
numerous Murkrow in tow.
entries.sun:
A single cry from this nocturnal Pokémon, and
more than a hundred of its Murkrow cronies
will assemble.
entries.moon:
If its Murkrow cronies fail to catch food for it,
or if it feels they have betrayed it, it will hunt
them down wherever they are and punish them.
entries.ultra-sun:
It will absolutely not forgive failure from or
betrayal by its goons. It has no choice in this
if it wants to maintain the order of the flock.
entries.ultra-moon:
Its goons take care of most of the fighting for it.
The only time it dirties its own hands is in
delivering a final blow to finish off an opponent.
entries.legends-arceus:
One cry from this Pokémon, and a murder of Murkrow come
flying. At such times, one would think the curtain of night had
fallen, plunging the world into jet-black darkness.

entries.diamond:
It claws if displeased and purrs
when affectionate. Its fickleness
is very popular among some.
entries.pearl:
With its sharp glare, it puts
foes in a mild hypnotic state.
It is a very fickle Pokémon.
entries.platinum:
It hides its spiteful tendency of
hooking its claws into the nose of
its Trainer if it isn’t fed.
entries.heartgold:
When it’s happy, GLAMEOW
demonstrates beautiful movements
of its tail, like a dancing ribbon.
entries.soulsilver:
When it’s happy, GLAMEOW
demonstrates beautiful movements
of its tail, like a dancing ribbon.

entries.legends-arceus:
Bewitches humans with its helical tail and piercing gaze.
Its hidden claws are quite sharp as well, making this Pokémon
an exceedingly tricky opponent if antagonized.

entries.diamond:
It is a brazen brute that barges
its way into another Pokémon’s
nest and claims it as its own.
entries.pearl:
To make itself appear intimidatingly
beefy, it tightly cinches its waist
with its twin tails.
entries.platinum:
It binds its body with its tails to
make itself look bigger. If it locks
eyes, it will glare ceaselessly.
entries.heartgold:
It would claim another Pokémon’s
nest as its own if it finds a nest
sufficiently comfortable.
entries.soulsilver:
It would claim another Pokémon’s
nest as its own if it finds a nest

entries.legends-arceus:
Though impudent and difficult to tame, Purugly enjoys great
popularity due to its fur, the beauty of which surpasses
even velveteen.

entries.diamond:
It emits cries by agitating an orb
at the back of its throat.
It moves with flouncing hops.
entries.pearl:
Each time it hops, it makes a
ringing sound. It deafens foes by
emitting high-frequency cries.
entries.platinum:
There is an orb inside its mouth.
When it hops, the orb bounces all
over and makes a ringing sound.
entries.heartgold:
It emits high-frequency cries that 
people can’t hear. Once it starts,
it can cry for an awfully long time.
entries.soulsilver:

entries.legends-arceus:
This Pokémon gave me an excruciating headache when it
seemingly cried out without making a sound. Perhaps there are
some sounds that the human ear is simply incapable of hearing.

The stench of the fluid it lets fly from the tip

entries.legends-arceus:
Sprays a poisonous fluid to take down prey. Sometimes, unable
to stomach the stench of its own fluid, it leaves the bested
prey uneaten.

discovered in ancient tombs. It is
unknown if they are related.
entries.pearl:
X-ray photos were taken to check
its body structure. Nothing
appeared, however.
entries.platinum:
There are researchers who believe
this Pokémon reflected like a mirror
in the distant past.

Ancient people believed that the
pattern on BRONZOR’s back

It appears in ancient ruins. The pattern on its

Galar region, so it remains shrouded in mystery.
entries.shield:
Polishing Bronzor to a shine makes its surface
reflect the truth, according to common lore.
Be that as it may, Bronzor hates being polished.
entries.legends-arceus:
Floats using a mysterious energy. The pattern engraved upon its
back is held as sacred and can sometimes be found in imagery
from ancient cemeteries and other such timeworn places.

entries.diamond:
One caused a news sensation when
it was dug up at a construction
site after a 2,000-year sleep.
entries.pearl:
It can summon rain clouds.
People long ago revered it as the
bringer of plentiful harvests.
entries.platinum:
It brought rains by opening portals
to another world. It was revered
as a bringer of plentiful harvests.
entries.heartgold:
Ancient people believed that
petitioning BRONZONG for rain
was the way to make crops grow.

that rings out like the tolling of a bell.
entries.shield:
Many scientists suspect that this Pokémon
originated outside the Galar region, based on
the patterns on its body.
entries.legends-arceus:
Some believe that its bell-like cry opens holes to another world.
It has been revered as a deity since ancient times.

It looks as if it is always crying.
It is actually adjusting its body’s
fluid levels by eliminating excess.
entries.pearl:
It prefers arid environments. It
leaks water from its eyes to
adjust its body’s fluid levels.
entries.platinum:
It prefers an arid atmosphere. It
leaks water that looks like tears
when adjusting its moisture level.
entries.heartgold:
In order to adjust the level of fluids in
its body, it exudes water from its eyes.
This makes it appear to be crying.
entries.soulsilver:

its body, it exudes water from its eyes.

It does not deal well with water, so it lives in dry
locales. Since its surroundings tend to lack
greenery, it stands out noticeably.
entries.moon:
From its eyes, it can expel excess moisture from
its body. This liquid is similar in composition to
human sweat.
entries.ultra-sun:
It discharges moisture from its eyes, making it
look like it’s crying—apparently an effective way
of getting enemies to let down their guard.
entries.ultra-moon:
If its body gets too damp, it will die. So, in a
process reminiscent of sweating, its eyes
expel moisture.
entries.sword:
It expels both sweat and tears from its eyes.
The sweat is a little salty, while the tears have
a slight bitterness.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon lives in dry, rocky areas. As its
green spheres dry out, their dull luster increases.
entries.legends-arceus:
Its tears elicit sympathy from those who see them, but do
not be deceived! This expulsion of body water is merely a
physiological mechanism for keeping itself in good health.

entries.diamond:
It habitually mimics foes. Once
mimicked, the foe cannot take its
eyes off this Pokémon.
entries.pearl:
It likes places where people
gather. It mimics foes to confuse
them, then makes its getaway.
entries.platinum:
It mimics the expressions and
motions of those it sees to
understand the feelings of others.
entries.heartgold:
In an attempt to confuse its enemy,
it mimics the enemy’s movements. Then
it wastes no time in making itself scarce!

entries.ultra-moon:
When this gifted mimic surprises an opponent,
Mime Jr. feels so happy that it ends up
forgetting it was imitating something.
entries.sword:
It mimics everyone it sees, but it puts extra
effort into copying the graceful dance steps
of Mr. Rime as practice.
entries.shield:
It looks for a Mr. Rime that’s a good dancer
and carefully copies the Mr. Rime’s steps
like an apprentice.
entries.legends-arceus:
Known to turn up in bustling marketplaces now and again.
It mimics people much as a child would, then watches how they
react, eyes sparkling.

that is used to
attract prey.

rock. It may wander around others’

that it thinks is an egg. It’s bothered
by how curly its hair looks.

entries.moon:
It’s too small to lay eggs yet. As a surrogate,

entries.ultra-sun:
Usually it’s a well-behaved Pokémon, but if you
take its round rock away, it will cry and fuss
and throw a big old tantrum.
entries.ultra-moon:
When it sees something round and white,
Happiny puts it into the pouch on its stomach. It

shaped stone in its belly pouch. Happiny will
treasure this stone.
entries.shield:
Happiny’s willing to lend its precious round stone
to those it’s friendly with, but if the stone isn’t
returned, Happiny will cry and throw a tantrum.
entries.legends-arceus:
In imitation of Chansey, it keeps a round stone tucked into its
belly pouch and cherishes it dearly. It gets along well with
children and will sometimes play house with them for fun.

words. If they gather, they all
learn the same saying.

It keeps rhythm by flicking its
tail feathers like a metronome.
It imitates human speech.
entries.platinum:
Its tongue is just like a human’s.
As a result, it can cleverly mimic
human speech.
entries.heartgold:
It mimics the cries of other Pokémon to
trick them into thinking it’s one of them.
This way they won’t attack it.

odd keystone as punishment for
misdeeds 500 years ago.

Its constant mischief and misdeeds
resulted in it being bound to an Odd
Keystone by a mysterious spell.

It was formed by uniting 108 spirits.
It has been bound to the Odd Keystone
to keep it from doing any mischief.

Exactly 108 spirits gathered to become this
Pokémon. Apparently there are some ill-natured
spirits in the mix.
entries.shield:
All Spiritomb’s mischief and misdeeds compelled
a traveler to use a mysterious spell to bind
Spiritomb to an odd keystone.
entries.legends-arceus:
It lays curses by thinking wicked thoughts. Writings tell that this
Pokémon was born out of the assembly of five score and eight
malevolent spirits.

entries.diamond:
It nests in small, horizontal holes
in cave walls. It pounces to catch
prey that stray too close.
entries.pearl:
It once lived in the tropics. To
avoid the cold, it lives in caves
warmed by geothermal heat.
entries.platinum:
It attacks using its huge mouth.
While its attacks are powerful, it
hurts itself out of clumsiness, too.
entries.heartgold:
It nests in horizontal holes warmed by
geothermal heat. Foes who get too close
can expect to be pounced on and bitten.

geothermal heat. Foes who get too close
can expect to be pounced on and bitten.

Even so, when the weather gets cold, it will
huddle close with others of its kind.
entries.moon:
It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy
passes by, it leaps out and chomps them. The
force of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.
entries.ultra-sun:
It reacts to anything that moves—flies right at it
and bites it. Sometimes it injures itself, but it
doesn’t care too much.
entries.ultra-moon:
Its original home is an area much hotter than
Alola. If you’re planning to live with one, your
heating bill will soar.
entries.sword:
Gible prefers to stay in narrow holes in the sides
of caves heated by geothermal energy. This way,
Gible can stay warm even during a blizzard.
entries.shield:
Gible attacks anything that moves, and it drags
whatever it catches into the crevice that is its lair.
Despite the big mouth, Gible’s stomach is small.
entries.legends-arceus:
It nests in caves untouched by sunlight. Its sharp teeth may fall
out when worn away or after an impact, but they regrow within
a few days.

entries.diamond:
There is a long-held belief that
medicine made from its scales will
heal even incurable illnesses.
entries.pearl:
It habitually digs up and hoards
gems in its nest. Its loot is
constantly targeted by thieves.
entries.platinum:
It loves sparkly things. It seeks
treasures in caves and hoards the
loot in its nest.
entries.heartgold:
As it digs to expand its nest, it
habitually digs up gems that it
then hoards in its nest.

then hoards in its nest.

treasures in caves and hoards the
loot in its nest.

entries.sun:
In rare cases, it molts and sheds its scales.
Medicine containing its scales as an ingredient
will make a weary body feel invigorated.
entries.moon:
Shiny objects are its passion. It can be found in
its cave, scarcely moving, its gaze fixed on the
jewels it’s amassed or Carbink it has caught.
entries.ultra-sun:
It loves shiny things. When it finds a Sableye
trying to catch a Carbink, Gabite becomes
furiously angry and attacks the Sableye.
entries.ultra-moon:
It sheds its skin and gradually grows larger. Its
scales can be ground into a powder and used
as raw materials for traditional medicine.
entries.sword:
This Pokémon emits ultrasonic waves from a
protrusion on either side of its head to probe
pitch-dark caves.
entries.shield:
Jewels are buried in the caves these Pokémon
nest in, but you’ll be torn apart by claws and
fangs the moment you enter one of these caves.
entries.legends-arceus:
Though Gabite are usually of a violent disposition, when I gave
one a glass bead it had been eyeing covetously, it suddenly
became quite docile.

entries.diamond:
When it folds up its body and
extends its wings, it looks like a
jet plane. It flies at sonic speed.
entries.pearl:
It flies at speeds equal to a jet
fighter plane. It never allows its
prey to escape.
entries.platinum:
It is said that when one runs at
high speed, its wings create blades
of wind that can fell nearby trees.
entries.heartgold:
Its body is covered in fine scales that
reduce drag, enabling it to fly at
high speeds.
entries.soulsilver:
Its body is covered in fine scales that
reduce drag, enabling it to fly at
high speeds.

entries.alpha-sapphire:
It flies at speeds equal to a jet fighter plane.
