entries.sun:
It can fly at speeds rivaling jet planes.
It dives into flocks of bird Pokémon and
gulps the entire flock down whole.
entries.moon:
The protuberances on its head serve as
sensors. It can even detect distant prey.
entries.ultra-sun:
It flies at the speed of sound while searching
for prey, and it has midair battles with
Salamence as the two compete for food.
entries.ultra-moon:
Its fine scales don’t just reduce wind
resistance—their sharp edges also cause injury
to any opponent who attacks it.
entries.sword:
Garchomp makes its home in volcanic mountains.
It flies through the sky as fast as a jet airplane,
hunting down as much prey as it can.
entries.shield:
Garchomp is fast both underground and above.
It can bring down prey and return to its den
before its body has chilled from being outside.
entries.legends-arceus:
Soars across the heavens at blinding speed—a magnificent sight!
It has a feral disposition. Utmost caution is required if one
meets a Garchomp out in the wilds.

entries.diamond:
It wolfs down its weight in food
once a day, swallowing food whole
with almost no chewing.
entries.pearl:
It hides food under its long body
hair. However, it forgets it has
hidden the food.
entries.platinum:
In its desperation to gulp down
food, it forgets about the food it
has hidden under its fur.
entries.heartgold:
It conceals food under the long fur on
its body. It carts around this food
stash and swallows it without chewing.
entries.soulsilver:
It conceals food under the long fur on
its body. It carts around this food
stash and swallows it without chewing.

It carts around this food stash and swallows it

entries.alpha-sapphire:
It conceals food under the long fur on its body.

entries.sun:
It needs to consume its own weight in food
every day. As far as flavor is concerned,
it’s indifferent.
entries.moon:
When it finds something that looks like it might
be edible, it goes right ahead and swallows it
whole. That’s why it gets fatter day by day.
entries.ultra-sun:
It hides food under its long fur, but it
sometimes forgets about it and causes
a stinky disturbance.
entries.ultra-moon:
Anything that looks edible, Munchlax will go on
and swallow whole. Its stomach is tough enough
to handle it even if the food has gone rotten.
entries.sword:
Stuffing itself with vast amounts of food is its
only concern. Whether the food is rotten or
fresh, yummy or tasteless—it does not care.
entries.shield:
It stores food beneath its fur. It might share
just one bite, but only if it really trusts you.
entries.legends-arceus:
Its robust stomach allows it to nonchalantly devour even rotted
matter. It pays frequent visits to villages, seeking out food
scraps intended for compost.

entries.diamond:
The aura that emanates from its
body intensifies to alert others
if it is afraid or sad.
entries.pearl:
Its body is lithe yet powerful.
It can crest three mountains and
cross two canyons in one night.
entries.platinum:
It has the peculiar power of being
able to see emotions such as joy
and rage in the form of waves.
entries.heartgold:
They communicate with one another
using their auras. They are able to run
all through the night.
entries.soulsilver:
They communicate with one another
using their auras. They are able to run
all through the night.

It has the peculiar power of being
able to see emotions such as joy
and rage in the form of waves.
entries.white:
It has the peculiar power of being
able to see emotions such as joy
and rage in the form of waves.
entries.black-2:
It uses the shapes of auras,
which change according to emotion,
to communicate with others.
entries.white-2:
It uses the shapes of auras,
which change according to emotion,
to communicate with others.
entries.x:
It uses the shapes of auras, which change
according to emotion, to communicate with others.

entries.omega-ruby:
It uses the shapes of auras, which change

entries.alpha-sapphire:
The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to

entries.sun:
It can discern the physical and emotional states
of people, Pokémon, and other natural things
from the shape of their aura waves.
entries.moon:
It’s tough enough to run right through the night,
and it’s also a hard worker, but it’s still just
a youngster.
entries.ultra-sun:
It knows how people and Pokémon feel by
looking at their auras. It doesn’t approach
dangerous opponents.
entries.ultra-moon:
It uses waves called auras to communicate with
others of its kind. It doesn’t make any noise
during this time, so its enemies can’t detect it.
entries.sword:
It’s exceedingly energetic, with enough stamina
to keep running all through the night. Taking it
for walks can be a challenging experience.
entries.shield:
It can use waves called auras to gauge how
others are feeling. These same waves can also tell
this Pokémon about the state of the environment.
entries.legends-arceus:
Though infantile in appearance, it has the mysterious ability to
read the minds of humans. The pure of heart are met with
Riolu's approval, while those of ill nature earn only its loathing.

entries.diamond:
It has the ability to sense the
auras of all things.
It understands human speech.
entries.pearl:
By catching the aura emanating
from others, it can read their
thoughts and movements.
entries.platinum:
A well-trained one can sense auras
to identify and take in the feelings
of creatures over half a mile away.
entries.heartgold:
It’s said that no foe can remain invisible
to LUCARIO, since it can detect auras.
Even foes it could not otherwise see.
entries.soulsilver:
It’s said that no foe can remain invisible
to LUCARIO, since it can detect auras.
Even foes it could not otherwise see.

of creatures over half a mile away.
entries.white:

By reading the auras of all things,
it can tell how others are feeling
from over half a mile away.
entries.white-2:
By reading the auras of all things,
it can tell how others are feeling
from over half a mile away.
entries.x:
By catching the aura emanating from others, it can
read their thoughts and movements.
entries.y:
By reading the auras of all things, it can tell how

entries.omega-ruby:
By catching the aura emanating from others, it can

entries.alpha-sapphire:
By reading the auras of all things, it can tell how

entries.sun:
Not only does it perceive auras, but it has also
gained the power to control them. It employs
them in battle.
entries.moon:
They can detect the species of a living being—
and its emotions—from over half a mile away.
They control auras and hunt their prey in packs.
entries.ultra-sun:
It concentrates its mental energy and fires off
mysterious waves called auras, which can crush
boulders of large size to dust.
entries.ultra-moon:
Lucario reads its opponent’s feelings with its
aura waves. It finds out things it would rather
not know, so it gets stressed out easily.
entries.sword:
It controls waves known as auras, which are
powerful enough to pulverize huge rocks.
It uses these waves to take down its prey.
entries.shield:
It can tell what people are thinking. Only Trainers
who have justice in their hearts can earn this
Pokémon’s trust.
entries.legends-arceus:
A most gallant-looking creature. It emits energy waves and
controls them with precision, using them to sense even faraway
beings. I have given the name ”aura” to this power.

entries.diamond:
It lives in arid places. Instead
of perspiration, it expels grainy
sand from its body.
entries.pearl:
It enshrouds itself with sand to
protect itself from germs.
It does not enjoy getting wet.
entries.platinum:
It shuts its nostrils tight then
travels through sand as if walking.
They form colonies of around ten.
entries.heartgold:
It shrouds itself in sand to ward off
germs. It travels easily through the
sands of the desert.

entries.sword:
It moves through the sands with its mouth open,
swallowing sand along with its prey. It gets rid of
the sand by spouting it from its nose.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon is active during the day and passes
the cold desert nights burrowed snugly into
the sand.
entries.legends-arceus:
Though large and languid, Hippopotas is difficult to detect
due to its tendency to burrow into and lurk beneath the soil.
When agitated or excited, it expels sand from its nostrils.

entries.sword:
It has the world’s largest petals. With every step,
the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.
entries.red:

petals, the more
toxic pollen it contains. Its big
head is heavy and
hard to hold up.

flower petals to

is very loud.

into bloom with a

sonous pollen.

petals, it scat­
ters toxic pollen into the air,

yellow.
entries.ruby:
VILEPLUME’s toxic pollen triggers
atrocious allergy attacks. That’s why
it is advisable never to approach any attractive flowers in a jungle, however
pretty they may be.
entries.sapphire:
VILEPLUME has the world’s largest
petals. They are used to attract prey
that are then doused with toxic spores. Once the prey are immobilized, this
POKéMON catches and devours them.
entries.emerald:
In seasons when it produces more pollen,
the air around a VILEPLUME turns yellow
with the powder as it walks. The pollen is
highly toxic and causes paralysis.
entries.firered:
Its petals are the largest in the world.
It fiendishly scatters allergy-causing
pollen from its petals.
entries.leafgreen:
The larger its petals, the more toxic
pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy
and hard to hold up.

Its huge mouth is almost seven
feet across. It has enough power
to completely crush a car.
entries.platinum:
It is surprisingly quick to anger.
It holds its mouth agape as a
display of its strength.
entries.heartgold:
It brandishes its gaping mouth in a
display of fearsome strength. It raises
vast quantities of sand while attacking.

Stones can get stuck in the ports on their bodies.
Dwebble help dislodge such stones, so
Hippowdon look after these Pokémon.
entries.shield:
When roused to violence by its rage, it spews out
the quantities of sand it has swallowed and
whips up a sandstorm.
entries.legends-arceus:
Short-tempered and easily moved to violence. It whips up
whirlwinds of sand to crush its foes' spirits, then goes in for
the attack.

It grips prey with its tail claws
and injects poison. It tenaciously
hangs on until the poison takes.
entries.pearl:
It lives in arid lands. It buries
itself in sand and lies in wait for
unsuspecting prey.
entries.platinum:
As soon as the tail claws close,
its needle tips secrete poison.
It can survive a year without food.
entries.heartgold:
It burrows under the sand to lie in
wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject
its prey with a savage poison.

After burrowing into the sand, it waits patiently
for prey to come near. This Pokémon and
Sizzlipede share common descent.
entries.shield:
It attacks using the claws on its tail. Once locked
in its grip, its prey is unable to move as this
Pokémon’s poison seeps in.
entries.legends-arceus:
Its claws are not only razor-sharp but poisonous, making Skorupi
a highly dangerous Pokémon. It seems to be weakened by cold
temperatures, however.

tips of its claws release poison.
entries.pearl:
Its body is encased in a sturdy
shell. Its head rotates 180
degrees, eliminating blind spots.
entries.platinum:
Possessing a sturdy build, it takes
pride in its strength, taking down
foes without using toxins.
entries.heartgold:
It attacks people and Pokémon that
cross the desert. This has only
furthered its bad reputation.

going on rampages with its car-crushing strength.
entries.shield:
It’s so vicious that it’s called the Sand Demon.
Yet when confronted by Hippowdon, Drapion
keeps a low profile and will never pick a fight.
entries.legends-arceus:
Has a brutish, ferocious temperament. With immense strength
and a sturdy shell off which swords will bounce, it rampages
about and wreaks havoc.

entries.diamond:
Its cheeks hold poison sacs.
It tries to catch foes off guard
to jab them with toxic fingers.
entries.pearl:
Inflating its poison sacs, it
makes an eerie blubbering sound
for intimidation.
entries.platinum:
It rarely fights fairly, but that is
strictly to ensure survival. It is
popular as a mascot.
entries.heartgold:
Fluid squeezed from its finger, albeit
poisonous, is a significant ingredient in
remedies for lower-back pain.

entries.shield:
Once diluted, its poison becomes medicinal.
This Pokémon came into popularity after a
pharmaceutical company chose it as a mascot.
entries.legends-arceus:
A poison wielder with a dastardly personality. Despite such
qualities, this species is afforded a measure of popularity due
to its peculiar cry and comical features.

so vile that even a scratch could
prove fatal.

foes, it weaves its flexible body in close,
then lunges out with its poisonous claws.

Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a
scratch could prove fatal.
entries.omega-ruby:
It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks,
the stored poison is churned for greater potency.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a
scratch could prove fatal.
entries.sword:
It bounces toward opponents and gouges them
with poisonous claws. No more than a scratch
is needed to knock out its adversaries.
entries.shield:
It booms out a victory croak when its prey
goes down in defeat. This Pokémon and
Seismitoad are related species.
entries.legends-arceus:
Its crimson claws contain a virulent toxin. This toxin can be made
into a tonic by diluting it, mixing it with several types of wild
grass, and boiling it down over two days.

entries.diamond:
It attracts prey with its sweet-
smelling saliva, then chomps down.
It takes a whole day to eat prey.
entries.pearl:
Hanging from branches using its
tentacles, it looks like a plant.
It awaits prey, mouth wide open.
entries.platinum:
It binds itself to trees in marshes.
It attracts prey with its sweet-
smelling drool and gulps them down.
entries.heartgold:
It walks around on its tentacles in
search of a tree branch where it
can dangle down and ambush prey.
entries.soulsilver:
It walks around on its tentacles in
search of a tree branch where it
can dangle down and ambush prey.

Using its tentacles to lash itself to
trees, it lies in wait for prey, luring it
close with sweet-smelling drool.

entries.legends-arceus:
Though this is a plant Pokémon, it has a gluttonous and unruly
temperament. Carnivine attacks its prey with its cavernous maw
wide open.

entries.diamond:
After long exposure to sunlight,
the patterns on its tail fins shine
vividly when darkness arrives.
entries.pearl:
The way its two tail fins flutter
while it swims has earned it the
nickname “BEAUTIFLY of the Sea.”
entries.platinum:
The line running down its side can
store sunlight. It shines vividly at
night.
entries.heartgold:
Swimming and fluttering its two tail fins,
it looks like a BEAUTIFLY. At night, the
patterns on its tail fins softly shine.
entries.soulsilver:
Swimming and fluttering its two tail fins,
it looks like a BEAUTIFLY. At night, the
patterns on its tail fins softly shine.

entries.sun:
It absorbs sunlight with the pink areas of its
skin, which then shine. This appears to be a
form of camouflage.
entries.moon:
Its double tail fins propel its energetic jumps.
When it breaks the surface of the sea, Wingull
swoop down to grab it on the fly.
entries.ultra-sun:
When night falls, their pink patterns begin to
shine. They’re popular with divers, so there are
resorts that feed them to keep them close.
entries.ultra-moon:
It lures in prey with its shining tail fins. It stays
near the surface during the day and moves to
the depths when night falls.
entries.legends-arceus:
What a gorgeous sight this Pokémon is as it swims with its long,
pink-painted caudal fins fluttering behind it. Finneon's beautiful
appearance has led to its nickname: ”finery fish.”

entries.diamond:
It lives on the deep-sea floor.
It attracts prey by flashing the
patterns on its four tail fins.
entries.pearl:
To avoid detection by predators,
it crawls along the seafloor using
the two fins on its chest.
entries.platinum:
It crawls along the seafloor using
its long front fins like legs. It
competes for food with LANTURN.
entries.heartgold:
LUMINEON swimming in the darkness
of the deep sea look like stars shining
in the night sky.
entries.soulsilver:
LUMINEON swimming in the darkness
of the deep sea look like stars shining
in the night sky.
entries.black:
It crawls along the seafloor using
its long front fins like legs. It
competes for food with Lanturn.

its long front fins like legs. It
competes for food with Lanturn.

entries.alpha-sapphire:
To avoid detection by predators, it crawls along the

entries.sun:
With its shining light, it lures its prey close.
However, the light also happens to attract
ferocious fish Pokémon—its natural predators.
entries.moon:
This deep-sea Pokémon lives at the bottom of
the sea. Its fins haul it over the seabed in
search of its favorite food—Starmie.
entries.ultra-sun:
Deep down at the bottom of the ocean, prey is
scarce. Lumineon get into fierce disputes with
Lanturn over food.
entries.ultra-moon:
They traverse the deep waters as if crawling
over the seafloor. The fantastic lights of its
fins shine like stars in the night sky.
entries.legends-arceus:
Uses its gleaming fins to hunt its prey. The view of Lumineon
schooling near the surface of the sea at night is breathtaking—
it's as though there were shining stars right there.

entries.diamond:
A friendly Pokémon that captures
the subtle flows of seawater using
its two antennae.
entries.pearl:
Scientists discovered that the
distinctive patterns on its back
differ by region.
entries.platinum:
People organize tours to see this
Pokémon frolic and skim the tops
of waves with REMORAID.
entries.heartgold:
When it swims close to the surface of the
ocean, people aboard ships are able to
observe the pattern on its back.
entries.soulsilver:
When it swims close to the surface of the
ocean, people aboard ships are able to
observe the pattern on its back.
entries.black:
People organize tours to see this
Pokémon frolic and skim the tops
of waves with Remoraid.
entries.white:
People organize tours to see this
Pokémon frolic and skim the tops
of waves with Remoraid.
entries.black-2:
The pattern on its back
varies by region. It often
swims in a school of Remoraid.
entries.white-2:
The pattern on its back
varies by region. It often
swims in a school of Remoraid.

The pattern on its back varies by region.
It often swims in a school of Remoraid.

entries.omega-ruby:
The pattern on its back varies by region.
It often swims in a school of Remoraid.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
When it swims close to the surface of the ocean,

entries.ultra-sun:
It’s highly friendly and easily tamed. Tours that
take people swimming with Mantyke are a
super-popular beach activity.
entries.ultra-moon:
Mantyke are friendly toward people and will
approach boats closely. The patterns on their
backs differ depending on their habitat.
entries.sword:
Mantyke living in Galar seem to be somewhat
sluggish. The colder waters of the seas in this
region may be the cause.
entries.shield:
It swims along with a school of Remoraid, and
they’ll all fight together to repel attackers.
entries.legends-arceus:
Though ball-like in shape, this Pokémon is a proficient swimmer.
I have discovered that if a Mantyke spends much time with
schools of Remoraid, it will eventually achieve evolution.

entries.diamond:
It lives on snowy mountains.
Having had little contact with
humans, it is boldly inquisitive.
entries.pearl:
In the spring, it grows berries
with the texture of frozen treats
around its belly.
entries.platinum:
Seemingly curious about people,
they gather around footsteps they
find on snowy mountains.
entries.heartgold:
During cold seasons, it migrates to the
mountain’s lower reaches. It returns to
the snow-covered summit in the spring.
entries.soulsilver:
During cold seasons, it migrates to the
mountain’s lower reaches. It returns to
the snow-covered summit in the spring.

entries.sword:
It lives on snowy mountains. It sinks its legs into
the snow to absorb water and keep its own
temperature down.
entries.shield:
The berries that grow around its belly are like
ice pops. Galarian Darumaka absolutely love
these berries.
entries.legends-arceus:
One is likely to encounter this Pokémon while out in the snow.
There are stories of Snover appearing in human settlements but
doing no harm—rather, they bond with the children.

entries.red:
Burrows to suck
tree roots. The
mushrooms on its back grow by draw­
ing nutrients from
the bug host.
entries.blue:
Burrows to suck
tree roots. The
mushrooms on its back grow by draw­
ing nutrients from
the bug host.
entries.yellow:
Burrows under the
ground to gnaw on
tree roots. The mushrooms on its
back absorb most
of the nutrition.
entries.gold:
It is doused with
mushroom spores
when it is born. As its body grows,
mushrooms sprout
from its back.
entries.silver:
As its body grows
large, oriental
mushrooms named tochukaso start
sprouting out of
its back.
entries.crystal:
The tochukaso
growing on this
POKéMON's back orders it to
extract juice from
tree trunks.
entries.ruby:
PARAS has parasitic mushrooms growing
on its back called tochukaso. They grow
large by drawing nutrients from the BUG POKéMON host. They are highly valued as
a medicine for extending life.

valued as a medicine for extending life.

mushrooms growing on its back. They grow
by drawing nutrients from the host. They
are valued as a medicine for long life.
entries.firered:
Growing out of the bug’s back are
mushrooms called tochukaso. The mushrooms
grow with the bug host.

Bug Pokémon host. They are highly valued as a medicine

entries.alpha-sapphire:
Paras has parasitic mushrooms growing on its back called

Bug Pokémon host. They are highly valued as a medicine

entries.sun:
No matter how much it eats, the mushrooms
growing on its back steal away most of
the nutrients it consumes.
entries.moon:
Mushrooms called tochukaso sprout from its
back. They can be dried and powdered to make
a medicine used to extend life.
entries.ultra-sun:
Whether it’s due to a lack of moisture or a lack
of nutrients, in Alola the mushrooms on Paras
don’t grow up quite right.
entries.ultra-moon:
The mushrooms, known as tochukaso, are
controlling the bug. Even if the bug bugs the
mushrooms, they tell it to bug off.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Burrows under the ground to gnaw on
tree roots. The mushrooms on its back
absorb most of the nutrition.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Burrows under the ground to gnaw on
tree roots. The mushrooms on its back
absorb most of the nutrition.
entries.legends-arceus:
Sometimes seen at the foot of trees in humid forests.
The mushrooms on its back—called tochukaso—are not present
on infant specimens and instead emerge as Paras matures.

entries.diamond:
It whips up blizzards in mountains
that are always buried in snow.
It is the abominable snowman.
entries.pearl:
It blankets wide areas in snow by
whipping up blizzards. It is also
known as “The Ice Monster.”
entries.platinum:
They appear when the snow flowers
bloom. When the petals fall, they
retreat to places unknown again.
entries.heartgold:
It lives a quiet life on mountains that
are perpetually covered in snow.
It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.
entries.soulsilver:
It lives a quiet life on mountains that
are perpetually covered in snow.
It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.

bloom. When the petals fall, they
retreat to places unknown again.

entries.y:

entries.omega-ruby:
It blankets wide areas in snow by whipping up
blizzards. It is also known as “The Ice Monster.”
entries.alpha-sapphire:
It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually
covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping
up blizzards.
entries.sword:
If it sees any packs of Darumaka going after
Snover, it chases them off, swinging its sizable
arms like hammers.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon is known to bring blizzards.
A shake of its massive body is enough to
cause whiteout conditions.
entries.legends-arceus:
A powerful Pokémon that can split huge boulders with ease.
Dislikes associating with others and chooses to live quietly deep
within the mountains, playing with the snow.

entries.diamond:
They live in cold regions, forming
groups of four or five that hunt
prey with impressive coordination.
entries.pearl:
It sends signals to others by
carving odd patterns in frost-
covered trees and ice.
entries.platinum:
Evolution made it even more
devious. It communicates by clawing
signs in boulders.
entries.heartgold:
It lives in snowy regions. It carves
patterns in trees with its claws as
a signal to others.
entries.soulsilver:
It lives in snowy regions. It carves
patterns in trees with its claws as
a signal to others.
entries.black:
Evolution made it even more
devious. It communicates by clawing
signs in boulders.
entries.white:
Evolution made it even more
devious. It communicates by clawing
signs in boulders.
entries.black-2:
They communicate by clawing
signs in boulders and work
together to surround enemies.
entries.white-2:
They communicate by clawing
signs in boulders and work
together to surround enemies.
entries.x:
It lives in snowy regions. It carves patterns in trees
with its claws as a signal to others.
entries.y:
They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or
five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.
entries.omega-ruby:
It lives in snowy regions. It carves patterns in trees
with its claws as a signal to others.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or
five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.
entries.sun:
They travel in groups of four or five, leaving
signs for one another on trees and rocks. They
bring down their prey with coordinated attacks.
entries.moon:
They dwell in cold places. This Pokémon’s main
food source in Alola is Vulpix and Sandshrew,
which they carefully divide among their group.
entries.ultra-sun:
One Weavile will trip a Sandshrew and flip it
over, and then another Weavile will deal the
finishing blow with its sharp claws.
entries.ultra-moon:
Thanks to its increased intelligence, scrapping
over food is a thing of the past. A scratch from
its claws will give you a case of frostbite!
entries.sword:
They attack their quarry in packs. Prey as large
as Mamoswine easily fall to the teamwork of
a group of Weavile.
entries.shield:
With its claws, it leaves behind signs for its
friends to find. The number of distinct signs
is said to be over 500.
entries.legends-arceus:
This species corners prey as a pack, under the guidance of
a leader. Weavile displays increased cunning, leading me to
speculate that its evolution caused further brain development.

entries.diamond:
It evolved from exposure to a
special magnetic field.
Three units generate magnetism.
entries.pearl:
It evolved from exposure to a
special magnetic field.
Three units generate magnetism.
entries.platinum:
A group tried to use scientific
means to make MAGNEZONE evolve,
but their efforts ended in failure.
entries.heartgold:
Exposure to a special magnetic field
changed MAGNETON’s molecular
structure, turning it into MAGNEZONE.
entries.soulsilver:
Exposure to a special magnetic field
changed MAGNETON’s molecular
structure, turning it into MAGNEZONE.
entries.black:
A group tried to use scientific
means to make Magnezone evolve,
but their efforts ended in failure.
entries.white:
A group tried to use scientific
means to make Magnezone evolve,
but their efforts ended in failure.
entries.black-2:
Sometimes the magnetism emitted by
Magnezone is too strong, making them
attract each other so they cannot move.
entries.white-2:
Sometimes the magnetism emitted by
Magnezone is too strong, making them
attract each other so they cannot move.
entries.x:
Sometimes the magnetism emitted by Magnezone is
too strong, making them attract each other so they
cannot move.
entries.y:
It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic
field. Three units generate magnetism.
entries.omega-ruby:
Sometimes the magnetism emitted by Magnezone is
too strong, making them attract each other so they
cannot move.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic
field. Three units generate magnetism.
entries.sun:
Three units generate magnetism. There have
been many mistaken reports of UFO sightings
when Magnezone flies through the night sky.
entries.moon:
As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon
seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin,
while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.
entries.ultra-sun:
It uses radar to monitor its territory. Intruders
are quickly disposed of with a hyper beam.
entries.ultra-moon:
There are still people who believe that this
Pokémon came from outer space. It emanates
a powerful magnetic field.
entries.sword:
Some say that Magnezone receives signals from
space via the antenna on its head and that it’s
being controlled by some mysterious being.
entries.shield:
It’s thought that a special magnetic field changed
the molecular structure of this Pokémon’s body,
and that’s what caused the Pokémon’s evolution.
entries.legends-arceus:
I theorize that a special magnetic field influenced this Pokémon,
changing its molecular structure and causing it to evolve. It emits
strange radio waves toward space from its antenna.

entries.diamond:
It wraps things with its extensible
tongue. Getting too close to it
will leave you soaked with drool.
entries.pearl:
It wraps things with its extensible
tongue. Getting too close to it
will leave you soaked with drool.
entries.platinum:
The long tongue is always soggy
with slobber. The saliva contains
a solvent that causes numbness.
entries.heartgold:
Its saliva can decompose anything.
It wraps its long tongue around things
to coat them with its sticky saliva.
entries.soulsilver:
It has space in its throat to store
saliva. It can also roll up its tongue
and store it in the same spot.
entries.black:
The long tongue is always soggy
with slobber. The saliva contains
a solvent that causes numbness.
entries.white:
The long tongue is always soggy
with slobber. The saliva contains
a solvent that causes numbness.
entries.black-2:
Their saliva contains lots of components
that can dissolve anything. The numbness
caused by their lick does not dissipate.
entries.white-2:
Their saliva contains lots of components
that can dissolve anything. The numbness
caused by their lick does not dissipate.

dissolve anything. The numbness caused by their
lick does not dissipate.
entries.omega-ruby:
It wraps things with its extensible tongue. Getting
too close to it will leave you soaked with drool.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Their saliva contains lots of components that can
dissolve anything. The numbness caused by their
lick does not dissipate.
entries.ultra-sun:
A contest is under way to determine which one
can stick its tongue out the farthest. The
current record is...more than 82 feet.
entries.ultra-moon:
It uses its tongue much more skillfully than its
hands or its feet. It can deftly pick up a
single small bean with its tongue.
entries.sword:
Lickilicky’s strange tongue can stretch to many
times the length of its body. No one has figured
out how Lickilicky’s tongue can stretch so far.
entries.shield:
Lickilicky can do just about anything with its
tongue, which is as dexterous as the human hand.
In contrast, Lickilicky’s use of its fingers is clumsy.
entries.legends-arceus:
Its tongue can extend and contract freely, and it is capable of
reaching lengths over 10 times Lickilicky's height. Beware of the
saliva, as it contains corrosive elements.

It puts rocks in holes in its palms
and uses its muscles to shoot them.
GEODUDE are shot at rare times.
entries.pearl:
It puts rocks in holes in its palms
and uses its muscles to shoot them.
GEODUDE are shot at rare times.

It can launch a rock held in its
hand like a missile by tightening
then expanding muscles instantly.
entries.heartgold:
From holes in its palms, it fires out
GEODUDE. Its carapace 
can withstand volcanic eruptions.

rare times.
entries.sword:
It can load up to three projectiles per arm into
the holes in its hands. What launches out of those
holes could be either rocks or Roggenrola.
entries.shield:
It relies on its carapace to deflect incoming
attacks and throw its enemy off balance. As soon
as that happens, it drives its drill into the foe.
entries.legends-arceus:
This Pokémon evolved through use of a curious item. Its rocklike
hide is composed of a mysterious substance and can withstand a
blow from a masterwork sword with nary a scratch.

entries.diamond:

arms made of vines. Losing arms to

Tangrowth has two arms that it can extend as it
pleases. Recent research has shown that these
arms are, in fact, bundles of vines.
entries.shield:
Vine growth is accelerated for Tangrowth living in
warm climates. If the vines grow long, Tangrowth
shortens them by tearing parts of them off.
entries.legends-arceus:
Draped with long vines, it resembles a shrub in appearance.
It swings bundles of vines as though they were arms, wrapping
them around prey to ensnare them.

and then lets loose a high-voltage current.
Its foes are burned to a crisp in an instant.
entries.moon:
When it gets excited, it thumps its chest. With
every thud, thunder roars and electric sparks
shower all around.
entries.ultra-sun:
It grips its tail, which spews electricity, and
then beats down opponents with the power of
its electrified fist.
entries.ultra-moon:
A single Electivire can provide enough electricity
for all the buildings in a big city for a year.
entries.sword:
The amount of electrical energy this Pokémon
produces is proportional to the rate of its pulse.
The voltage jumps while Electivire is battling.
entries.shield:
In terms of electrical-energy output, Electivire
is one of the best among all Electric Pokémon.
It discharges high-voltage currents from its tails.
entries.legends-arceus:
Its evolution was induced by an unusual item, and its electrical
output rises along with its heart rate. From its tails, it can
unleash an electric current measuring 20,000 volts.

arms. It lives in volcanic craters.

what is known, a single pair of male and female

From its arm, it launches fireballs hotter than

melt when it fires a whole barrage.

There are still quite a few factories that rely on
the flames provided by Magmortar to
process metals.
entries.ultra-moon:
Magmortar takes down its enemies by shooting
fireballs, which burn them to a blackened crisp.
It avoids this method when hunting prey.
entries.sword:
When Magmortar inhales deeply, the fire burning
in its belly intensifies, rising in temperature to
over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
entries.shield:
Living in the crater of a volcano has caused this
Pokémon’s body to resemble its environment—
it has an organ similar to a magma chamber.
entries.legends-arceus:
Use of a strange item caused this Pokémon to evolve. Fireballs
launched from the ends of its tubelike arms are hot enough to
melt an iron pot in an instant.

These Pokémon are never seen anywhere near

Known as a bringer of blessings, it’s
been depicted on good-luck charms
since ancient times.
entries.legends-arceus:
Scant few have ever sighted this Pokémon. After studying what
literature remains, I am certain Togekiss will reveal itself when
peace reigns in the land.

Its jaw power is incredible. It is

Extremely violent. When hunting, it wastes none of its energy,
aiming only for prey's most vulnerable spots. Any who manage

host bug. Prefers
damp places.

by the mushrooms on its back. They
appear to do all
the thinking.

It stays mostly in
dark, damp places,
the preference not of the bug, but
of the big mush­
rooms on its back.

scatters.

When nothing's
left to extract

entries.ruby:
PARASECT is known to infest large trees
en masse and drain nutrients from the
lower trunk and roots. When an infested tree dies, they move
onto another tree all at once.

The large mushroom on its back controls it.
It often fights over territory with Shiinotic.
entries.moon:
It scatters toxic spores from its mushroom cap.
Once harvested, these spores can be steeped
and boiled down to prepare herbal medicines.
entries.ultra-sun:
The bug is mostly dead, with the mushroom on
its back having become the main body. If the
mushroom comes off, the bug stops moving.
entries.ultra-moon:
Its poisonous spores are also used in traditional
medicine. Apparently, spores produced in Alola
are not of very good quality.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
The bug host is drained of energy by

appears to do all the thinking.
entries.lets-go-eevee:

appears to do all the thinking.
entries.legends-arceus:
Mushroom-lacking specimens of this Pokémon lie unmoving in
the forest, lending credence to the hypothesis that the large
mushroom is in control of Parasect's actions.

always enveloped in clear air.

photosynthesis to produce clean air.

Its cellular composition is closer to that of a
plant than an animal. It uses photosynthesis to
produce its energy supply without eating food.
entries.moon:
The younger they are, the more they smell like
fresh grass. With age, their fragrance takes on
the odor of fallen leaves.
entries.ultra-sun:
Although it doesn’t like disputes, it will sharpen
the leaf on its tail into a blade and fight if it has
to protect its friends.
entries.ultra-moon:
It gets its nutrition from photosynthesis. It lives
a quiet life deep in forests where clean
rivers flow.
entries.sword:
Galarians favor the distinctive aroma that drifts
from this Pokémon’s leaves. There’s a popular
perfume made using that scent.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon’s tail is blade sharp, with a
fantastic cutting edge that can slice right
though large trees.
entries.legends-arceus:
Cells similar to those of plants have been found in its fur.
Its hard tail can fell a large tree with one stroke, and the tail's
sharpness exceeds even that of a sword crafted by a master.

its hairs stand like needles.

It can control its body temperature at will.

It freezes its fur into icicles, spiky and sharp,

It protects itself by freezing its fur into sharp
needles. It can drop its body temperature below
–75 degrees Fahrenheit.
entries.ultra-moon:
It can instantaneously freeze any moisture
that’s around it, creating ice pellets to shoot at
its prey.
entries.sword:
Any who become captivated by the beauty of
the snowfall that Glaceon creates will be frozen
before they know it.
entries.shield:
The coldness emanating from Glaceon causes
powdery snow to form, making it quite a popular
Pokémon at ski resorts.
entries.legends-arceus:
Glaceon is able to lower its body temperature very quickly.
It freezes the atmosphere, creating diamond dust that glitters
like gems while it flutters and dances around.

It glides soundlessly on pitch-black wings and sinks sharp fangs

from as far back as 10,000 years ago. For a
while, it was thought to have gone extinct.

As the weather grows colder, its ice tusks
grow longer, thicker, and more impressive.
entries.legends-arceus:
This species reached its zenith during the period known as the
ice age. I suspect that Hisui's frigid climate is in harmony with
Mamoswine's constitution, thus awakening hidden potential.

Its program was modified to facilitate
extra-dimensional activities, but that led to

entries.ultra-sun:
Its behavior is noticeably unstable, which is
apparently due to the incompetence of the
engineer who updated its programming.
entries.ultra-moon:
A faulty update was added to its programming.
Its behavior is noticeably strange, so the
experiment may have been a failure.
entries.sword:
Porygon-Z had a program installed to allow it to
move between dimensions, but the program also
caused instability in Porygon-Z’s behavior.
entries.shield:
Some say an additional program made this
Pokémon evolve, but even academics can’t agree
on whether Porygon-Z is really an evolution.
entries.legends-arceus:
A curious item induced this evolution. The Pokémon's offensive
capabilities have greatly increased, but the strangeness of its
behavior has magnified in equal measure. This worries me.

The blades extending from its elbows are sharper than the
finest swords. Its swordsmanship, albeit self-taught, is
astonishingly impressive.

the iron sand that forms its luscious mustache. Using this iron
sand, Probopass forms hard stones with which it smites its prey.

Comes to those whose lives have come to an end and escorts
their souls to the afterlife. Known to mistakenly take the souls of
those who yet have life left in them, albeit rarely.

After a woman met her end on a snowy mountain,
her regrets lingered on. From them, this Pokémon
was born. Its favorite food is frozen souls.
entries.shield:
It spits out cold air of nearly −60 degrees
Fahrenheit to freeze its quarry. It brings frozen
prey back to its lair and neatly lines them up.
entries.legends-arceus:
A Pokémon inhabited by the soul of a woman who died bearing
a grudge in the snowy mountains. Legends of Froslass placing
deathly curses on misbehaving men send shivers down my spine.

This Pokémon from the Unova region uses the shell on its belly
as a weapon to cut down its foes. Thus, I've conferred upon this
shell the name ”scalchop”.

flowing double-scalchop technique.

Scalchop techniques differ from one
Dewott to another. It never
neglects maintaining its scalchops.

in defeat.

One swing of the sword incorporated in
its armor can fell an opponent. A simple
glare from one of them quiets everybody.
entries.white:
Part of the armor on its anterior legs
becomes a giant sword. Its cry alone
is enough to intimidate most enemies.
entries.black-2:
In the time it takes a foe to blink,
it can draw and sheathe the seamitars
attached to its front legs.

Hard of heart and deft of blade, this rare form of Samurott is
a product of the Pokémon's evolution in the region of Hisui. Its
turbulent blows crash into foes like ceaseless pounding waves.

entries.black:
Using food stored in cheek pouches,
they can keep watch for days. They use
their tails to communicate with others.
entries.white:
Extremely cautious, they take shifts to
maintain a constant watch of their nest.
They feel insecure without a lookout.
entries.black-2:
Extremely cautious, one of them
will always be on the lookout, but it
won’t notice a foe coming from behind.

stand high, and they spit the seeds of

entries.black:
It faces strong opponents with great
courage. But, when at a disadvantage in
a fight, this intelligent Pokémon flees.
entries.white:
The long hair around its face provides
an amazing radar that lets it sense
subtle changes in its surroundings.
entries.black-2:
Though it is a very brave Pokémon,
it’s also smart enough to check its
foe’s strength and avoid battle.
entries.white-2:
Though it is a very brave Pokémon,
it’s also smart enough to check its
foe’s strength and avoid battle.

entries.sun:
Because it doesn’t yelp, it’s extremely popular
with Trainers who live in apartment buildings.
entries.moon:
The long fur surrounding its face functions as
radar, enabling it to probe the condition of its
battle opponents.
entries.ultra-sun:
This Pokémon has excellent judgment.
If it decides it can’t defeat an opponent,
it immediately turns tail and vamooses.
entries.ultra-moon:
This Pokémon is popular with beginners
because it’s intelligent, obedient to its Trainer’s
commands, and easy to raise.
entries.sword:
This Pokémon is courageous but also cautious.
It uses the soft fur covering its face to collect
information about its surroundings.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon is far brighter than the average
child, and Lillipup won’t forget the love it
receives or any abuse it suffers.

entries.black:
It has black, cape-like fur that is
very hard and decreases the amount
of damage it receives.
entries.white:
It loyally follows its Trainer’s
orders. For ages, they have helped
Trainers raise Pokémon.
entries.black-2:
This very loyal Pokémon
helps Trainers, and it also
takes care of other Pokémon.
entries.white-2:
This very loyal Pokémon
helps Trainers, and it also
takes care of other Pokémon.

entries.sun:
Its dense black fur grows continuously. The high
cost of keeping its hard fur properly groomed
makes this a troublesome Pokémon to train.
entries.moon:
This Pokémon obeys its master’s orders
faithfully. However, it refuses to listen to
anything said by a person it doesn’t respect.
entries.ultra-sun:
The longer its black fur grows, the harder and
more impervious it gets. Claws and fangs can’t
easily penetrate it.
entries.ultra-moon:
It has been living with people for so long that
portrayals of it can be found on the walls of
caves from long, long ago.
entries.sword:
Herdier is a very smart and friendly Pokémon.
So much so that there’s a theory that Herdier was
the first Pokémon to partner with people.
entries.shield:
The black fur that covers this Pokémon’s body
is dense and springy. Even sharp fangs bounce
right off.

entries.black:
It rescues people stranded by
blizzards in the mountains. Its
shaggy fur shields it from the cold.
entries.white:
This extremely wise Pokémon excels
at rescuing people stranded at sea or
in the mountains.
entries.black-2:
Being wrapped in its long fur is so
comfortable that a person would be fine
even overnight on a wintry mountain.
entries.white-2:
Being wrapped in its long fur is so
comfortable that a person would be fine

entries.sun:
Intelligent, good-natured, and valiant,
it’s a trustworthy partner on rescue teams.
entries.moon:
With this wise Pokémon, there could be no
concern that it would ever attack people. Some
parents even trust it to babysit.
entries.ultra-sun:
It pays no mind to the cold, thanks to its long
warm coat. Stoutland in Alola look a
little uncomfortable.
entries.ultra-moon:
Its fur is long and thick. A long time ago in cold
regions, every household kept a Stoutland.
entries.sword:
These Pokémon seem to enjoy living with humans.
Even a Stoutland caught in the wild will warm up
to people in about three days.
entries.shield:
Stoutland is immensely proud of its impressive
moustache. It’s said that moustache length is what
determines social standing among this species.

entries.black:
They steal from people for fun, but their
victims can’t help but forgive them.
Their deceptively cute act is perfect.
entries.white:
Its cute act is a ruse. When victims let
down their guard, they find their items
taken. It attacks with sharp claws.
entries.black-2:
Their cute act is a ruse. They trick
people and steal their valuables
just to see the looks on their faces.

entries.shield:

behavior come away with stinging scratches from
its claws and stinging pride from its laughter.

miles.

triplets dig over

like underground.

emerged from one body. As a result,
each triplet thinks exactly like the other two triplets.
They work cooperatively to burrow
endlessly.

This set of triplets moves cooperatively.
It’s the power of teamwork that enables
this Pokémon to dig to a depth of 60 miles.
entries.moon:
Despite the closeness between this Pokémon
and farmers and other people, no one has ever
seen the parts of it concealed underground.
entries.ultra-sun:
While the three of them normally get along
splendidly, on rare occasions a huge fight will
break out over which head gets to eat first.
entries.ultra-moon:
Dugtrio’s heads are sleek and smooth and
incredibly hard. It can dig through any soil with

entries.lets-go-pikachu:

leaves are known to relieve stress.

If you’re scattering food for them, be careful—
several hundred of them can gather at once.
entries.shield:
It’s forgetful and not very bright, but many
Trainers love it anyway for its friendliness
and sincerity.

It washes its face regularly to keep the coin on
its forehead spotless. It doesn’t get along with
Galarian Meowth.

entries.sun:
It lies around all day, becoming active near dusk.
At night, it wanders the city in search of
loose change.
entries.moon:
It loves shiny things. It often fights with
Murkrow over prey they’re both trying to catch.
entries.ultra-sun:
When visiting a junkyard, you may catch sight
of it having an intense fight with Murkrow over
shiny objects.
entries.ultra-moon:
It loves coins, so if you give it one, you can
make friends with Meowth easily. But it’s fickle,
so you can’t count on that friendship lasting.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Appears to be more active at night. It loves
round and shiny things. It can’t stop itself from
picking them up.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Appears to be more active at night. It loves
round and shiny things. It can’t stop itself from
picking them up.
entries.sword:
It loves to collect shiny things. If it’s in a good
mood, it might even let its Trainer have a look
at its hoard of treasures.

entries.black:
It can return to its Trainer’s location
regardless of the distance
separating them.
entries.white:
Many people believe that, deep in the
forest where Tranquill live, there is
a peaceful place where there is no war.
entries.black-2:
No matter where in the world it goes,
it knows where its nest is, so it
never gets separated from its Trainer.
entries.white-2:
No matter where in the world it goes,

never gets separated from its Trainer.

entries.sword:
It can fly moderately quickly. No matter how far
it travels, it can always find its way back to its
master and its nest.
entries.shield:
These bright Pokémon have acute memories.
Apparently delivery workers often choose them
as their partners.

entries.black:
Males swing their head plumage to
threaten opponents. The females’ flying
abilities surpass those of the males.
entries.white:
Males have plumage on their heads.
They will never let themselves feel close
to anyone other than their Trainers.
entries.black-2:
Males swing the plumage on
their heads to threaten others,
but females are better at flying.

Males swing the plumage on

entries.sword:
Unfezant are exceptional fliers. The females
are known for their stamina, while the males
outclass them in terms of speed.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon is intelligent and intensely proud.
People will sit up and take notice if you become
the Trainer of one.

entries.x:
When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear.
It can catch lightning with its mane and store
the electricity.
entries.black:
Its mane shines when it discharges
electricity. They use their flashing
manes to communicate with one another.

it will appear. It can catch lightning

Its mane shines when it discharges
electricity. They use the frequency and

entries.black:
They have lightning-like movements.
When Zebstrika run at full speed,
the sound of thunder reverberates.
entries.white:
This ill-tempered Pokémon is dangerous
because when it’s angry, it shoots
lightning from its mane in all directions.

When this ill-tempered Pokémon
runs wild, it shoots lightning
from its mane in all directions.

When this ill-tempered Pokémon

entries.black:
Its ear is hexagonal in shape.
Compressed underground,
its body is as hard as steel.
entries.white:
They were discovered a hundred years
ago in an earthquake fissure. Inside
each one is an energy core.
entries.black-2:
The hexagonal-shaped hole is its ear.
It has a tendency to walk in the
direction the sound is coming from.
entries.white-2:
The hexagonal-shaped hole is its ear.
It has a tendency to walk in the
direction the sound is coming from.
entries.x:

entries.alpha-sapphire:

entries.sun:
Born deep within the ground, it compares itself
with similar species, such as Geodude and
Carbink, to settle which has the hardest body.
entries.moon:
The hexagonal cavity is its ear. It walks in the
direction of sounds it hears, but if the sounds
cease, it panics and topples over.
entries.ultra-sun:
The hexagonal hole is its ear. Deep in that ear is
an energy core, so if you stick your hand in
there, Roggenrola will be very angry!
entries.ultra-moon:
It was found in a fissure in a layer of exposed
rock. The material that makes up its body is
dirt from several hundred years ago.
entries.sword:
It’s as hard as steel, but apparently a long soak in
water will cause it to soften a bit.
entries.shield:
When it detects a noise, it starts to move.
The energy core inside it makes this Pokémon
slightly warm to the touch.

entries.black:
When it overflows with power,
the orange crystal on its body glows.
It looks for underground water in caves.
entries.white:
Because its energy was too great to be
contained, the energy leaked and formed
orange crystals.
entries.black-2:
When it is healthy, its core sticks out.
Always facing the same way, it swiftly
moves front to back and left to right.
entries.white-2:
When it is healthy, its core sticks out.
Always facing the same way, it swiftly
moves front to back and left to right.
entries.x:
Because its energy was too great to be contained,
the energy leaked and formed orange crystals.
entries.y:
When it is healthy, its core sticks out. Always facing
the same way, it swiftly moves front to back and left
to right.
entries.omega-ruby:
Because its energy was too great to be contained,
the energy leaked and formed orange crystals.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
When it is healthy, its core sticks out. Always facing

to right.
entries.sun:
Its orange crystal is a mass of energy.
Just one crystal fragment would provide
enough fuel for a hundred dump trucks.
entries.moon:
It explores caves in search of underground
water. It’s not comfortable around water, so
this Pokémon takes great care in lapping it up.
entries.ultra-sun:
The energy overflowing from its body has
turned into orange crystals that are hard
enough to smash diamonds.
entries.ultra-moon:
Its orange crystals are lumps of powerful
energy. They’re valuable, so Boldore is
sometimes targeted for them.
entries.sword:
If you see its orange crystals start to glow, be
wary. It’s about to fire off bursts of energy.
entries.shield:
It relies on sound in order to monitor what’s in its
vicinity. When angered, it will attack without ever
changing the direction it’s facing.

entries.black:
Compressing the energy from its
internal core lets it fire off an attack
capable of blowing away a mountain.
entries.white:
The solar energy absorbed by its body’s
orange crystals is magnified internally
and fired from its mouth.
entries.black-2:
The solar rays it absorbs are
processed in its energy core
and fired as a ball of light.
entries.white-2:
The solar rays it absorbs are
processed in its energy core
and fired as a ball of light.
entries.x:
The solar rays it absorbs are processed in its
energy core and fired as a ball of light.
entries.y:
Compressing the energy from its internal core
lets it fire off an attack capable of blowing away
a mountain.
entries.omega-ruby:
The solar rays it absorbs are processed in its
energy core and fired as a ball of light.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Compressing the energy from its internal core
lets it fire off an attack capable of blowing away
a mountain.
entries.sun:
The blasts of energy it makes from sunbeams
have terrifying power. However, it’s not able to
fire its blasts at night or on rainy days.
entries.moon:
Known for its hefty horsepower, this Pokémon
is a popular partner for construction workers.
entries.ultra-sun:
When it fires off energy with all its might, the
power creates countless fissures on its body.
entries.ultra-moon:
It absorbs rays of sunlight and shoots out
energy. It’s usually lurking deep beneath
the surface.
entries.sword:
This hardy Pokémon can often be found on
construction sites and in mines, working
alongside people and Copperajah.
entries.shield:
Although its energy blasts can blow away
a dump truck, they have a limitation—
they can only be fired when the sun is out.

entries.black:
Its habitat is dark forests and caves.
It emits ultrasonic waves from its
nose to learn about its surroundings.
entries.white:
Suction from its nostrils enables it to
stick to cave walls during sleep. It
leaves a heart-shaped mark behind.
entries.black-2:
The heart-shaped mark left on a body
after a Woobat has been attached to it
is said to bring good fortune.
entries.white-2:
The heart-shaped mark left on a body
after a Woobat has been attached to it
is said to bring good fortune.
entries.x:

ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about
its surroundings.
entries.y:
The heart-shaped mark left on a body after a
Woobat has been attached to it is said to bring
good fortune.
entries.omega-ruby:

entries.alpha-sapphire:
The heart-shaped mark left on a body after a
Woobat has been attached to it is said to bring
good fortune.
entries.sword:
While inside a cave, if you look up and see lots
of heart-shaped marks lining the walls, it’s
evidence that Woobat live there.
entries.shield:
It emits ultrasonic waves as it flutters about,
searching for its prey—bug Pokémon.

entries.black:
It emits sound waves of various
frequencies from its nose, including
some powerful enough to destroy rocks.
entries.white:
Anyone who comes into contact with the
ultrasonic waves emitted by a courting
male experiences a positive mood shift.
entries.black-2:
It shakes its tail vigorously when it
emits ultrasonic waves strong enough
to reduce concrete to rubble.
entries.white-2:
It shakes its tail vigorously when it
emits ultrasonic waves strong enough
to reduce concrete to rubble.

waves strong enough to reduce concrete to rubble.

entries.alpha-sapphire:
Anyone who comes into contact with the ultrasonic
waves emitted by a courting male experiences a
positive mood shift.
entries.sword:
Emitting powerful sound waves tires it out.
Afterward, it won’t be able to fly for a
little while.
entries.shield:
The auspicious shape of this Pokémon’s nose
apparently led some regions to consider
Swoobat a symbol of good luck.

entries.black:
It can dig through the ground
at a speed of 30 mph. It could give
a car running aboveground a good race.
entries.white:
It makes its way swiftly through the soil
by putting both claws together and
rotating at high speed.
entries.black-2:
By spinning its body, it can dig
straight through the ground
at a speed of 30 mph.
entries.white-2:
By spinning its body, it can dig
straight through the ground
at a speed of 30 mph.

It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting
both claws together and rotating at high speed.

By spinning its body, it can dig straight through the
ground at a speed of 30 mph.

It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting

entries.alpha-sapphire:
By spinning its body, it can dig straight through the
ground at a speed of 30 mph.
entries.sword:
It brings its claws together and whirls around at
high speed before rushing toward its prey.
entries.shield:
It’s a digger, using its claws to burrow through the
ground. It causes damage to vegetable crops, so
many farmers have little love for it.

entries.red:
Although its fur
has many admirers,
it is tough to raise as a pet
because of its
fickle meanness.
entries.blue:
Although its fur
has many admirers,
it is tough to raise as a pet
because of its
fickle meanness.
entries.yellow:
The gem in its
forehead glows on
its own! It walks with all the grace
and elegance of a
proud queen.
entries.gold:
Many adore it for
its sophisticated
air. However, it will lash out and
scratch for little
reason.
entries.silver:
Its lithe muscles
allow it to walk
without making a sound. It
attacks in an
instant.
entries.crystal:
Behind its lithe,
elegant appearance
lies a barbaric side. It will tear
apart its prey on
a mere whim.
entries.ruby:
PERSIAN has six bold whiskers that give
it a look of toughness. The whiskers  
sense air movements to determine what is in the POKéMON’s surrounding
vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed
by the whiskers.
entries.sapphire:
PERSIAN has six bold whiskers that give
it a look of toughness. The whiskers  
sense air movements to determine what is in the POKéMON’s surrounding
vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed
by the whiskers.
entries.emerald:
A PERSIAN’s six bold whiskers sense air
movements to determine what is in its
vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed
by the whiskers.
entries.firered:
Has a vicious temperament. Beware if it
raises its tail straight up. It is a signal
that it is about to pounce and bite.
entries.leafgreen:
Although its fur has many admirers, it is
tough to raise as a pet because of its
fickle meanness.
entries.diamond:
A very haughty Pokémon. Among
fans, the size of the jewel in its
forehead is a topic of much talk.

fans, the size of the jewel in its
forehead is a topic of much talk.

without making a sound. It
attacks in an instant.

entries.sun:
It has a violent temperament. It will attack
anything that looks it in the eye. Its sharp
claws inflict deep wounds.
entries.moon:
It has a high opinion of itself, although not to
the same extent as the Alolan Persian. It’s quite
difficult to make friends with this Pokémon.
entries.ultra-sun:
Although the jewel on its forehead appears to
be a different color than those of Alolan
Persian, it’s mostly made of the same material.
entries.ultra-moon:
This Pokémon is popular with rich people.
It’s also targeted by hunters who are after
the jewel in its forehead.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
The gem in its forehead glows on its own!
It walks with all the grace and elegance
of a proud queen.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
The gem in its forehead glows on its own!
It walks with all the grace and elegance
of a proud queen.
entries.sword:
Getting this prideful Pokémon to warm up to you
takes a lot of effort, and it will claw at you the
moment it gets annoyed.
entries.shield:
Its elegant and refined behavior clashes with that
of the barbaric Perrserker. The relationship
between the two is one of mutual disdain.

entries.black:
It can help in tunnel construction.
Its drill has evolved into steel strong
enough to bore through iron plates.
entries.white:
More than 300 feet below the surface,
they build mazelike nests. Their activity
can be destructive to subway tunnels.
entries.black-2:
Forming a drill with its steel claws
and head, it can bore through a steel
plate, no matter how thick it is.
entries.white-2:
Forming a drill with its steel claws
and head, it can bore through a steel
plate, no matter how thick it is.
entries.x:
It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has
evolved into steel strong enough to bore through
iron plates.
entries.y:
More than 300 feet below the surface, they build
mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to
subway tunnels.
entries.omega-ruby:
It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has
evolved into steel strong enough to bore through
iron plates.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
More than 300 feet below the surface, they build
mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to
subway tunnels.
entries.sword:
It’s not uncommon for tunnels that appear to
have formed naturally to actually be a result
of Excadrill’s rampant digging.
entries.shield:
Known as the Drill King, this Pokémon can
tunnel through the terrain at speeds of over
90 mph.

entries.black:
It touches others with the feelers on
its ears, using the sound of their
heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.
entries.white:
Its auditory sense is astounding. It has
a radarlike ability to understand its
surroundings through slight sounds.
entries.black-2:
Using the feelers on its ears,
it can tell how someone is feeling
or when an egg might hatch.
entries.white-2:
Using the feelers on its ears,
it can tell how someone is feeling
or when an egg might hatch.
entries.x:
Using the feelers on its ears, it can tell how
someone is feeling or when an egg might hatch.
entries.y:
It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using
the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they
are feeling.

Using the feelers on its ears, it can tell how
someone is feeling or when an egg might hatch.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using
the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they
are feeling.
entries.sword:
Audino’s sense of hearing is superb. Not even a
pebble rolling along over a mile away will escape
Audino’s ears.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon has a kind heart. By touching with
its feelers, Audino can gauge other creatures’
feelings and physical conditions.

entries.black:
It fights by swinging a piece of lumber
around. It is close to evolving when it
can handle the lumber without difficulty.
entries.white:
These Pokémon appear at building
sites and help out with construction.
They always carry squared logs.
entries.black-2:
Always carrying squared logs,
they help out with construction.
As they grow, they carry bigger logs.
entries.white-2:
Always carrying squared logs,
they help out with construction.
As they grow, they carry bigger logs.

These Pokémon appear at building sites and help
out with construction. They always carry
squared logs.
entries.y:
Always carrying squared logs, they help out with
construction. As they grow, they carry bigger logs.
entries.omega-ruby:
These Pokémon appear at building sites and help
out with construction. They always carry
squared logs.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Always carrying squared logs, they help out with
construction. As they grow, they carry bigger logs.
entries.sword:
It loves helping out with construction projects.
It loves it so much that if rain causes work to halt,
it swings its log around and throws a tantrum.
entries.shield:
Timburr that have started carrying logs that are
about three times their size are nearly ready
to evolve.

entries.black:
This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly
built that even a group of wrestlers
could not make it budge an inch.
entries.white:
They strengthen their bodies by
carrying steel beams. They show off
their big muscles to their friends.
entries.black-2:
With strengthened bodies,
they skillfully wield steel beams
to take down buildings.
entries.white-2:
With strengthened bodies,
they skillfully wield steel beams
to take down buildings.
entries.x:
With strengthened bodies, they skillfully wield steel
beams to take down buildings.
entries.y:
This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that
even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge
an inch.
entries.omega-ruby:
With strengthened bodies, they skillfully wield steel
beams to take down buildings.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that
even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge
an inch.
entries.sword:
It shows off its muscles to Machoke and other
Gurdurr. If it fails to measure up to the other
Pokémon, it lies low for a little while.
entries.shield:
Gurdurr excels at demolition—construction is not
its forte. In any case, there’s skill in the way this
Pokémon wields its metal beam.

entries.black:
It is thought that Conkeldurr taught
humans how to make concrete more
than 2,000 years ago.
entries.white:
They use concrete pillars as walking
canes. They know moves that enable them
to swing the pillars freely in battle.
entries.black-2:
Rather than rely on force,
they master moves that utilize the
centrifugal force of spinning concrete.
entries.white-2:
Rather than rely on force,
they master moves that utilize the
centrifugal force of spinning concrete.
entries.x:
It is thought that Conkeldurr taught humans how to
make concrete more than 2,000 years ago.
entries.y:
Rather than rely on force, they master moves that
utilize the centrifugal force of spinning concrete.
entries.omega-ruby:
It is thought that Conkeldurr taught humans how to
make concrete more than 2,000 years ago.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Rather than rely on force, they master moves that

entries.sword:
Concrete mixed by Conkeldurr is much more
durable than normal concrete, even when the
compositions of the two materials are the same.
entries.shield:
When going all out, this Pokémon throws aside
its concrete pillars and leaps at opponents to
pummel them with its fists.

entries.black:
They warn others of danger by
vibrating their cheeks to create
a high-pitched sound.
entries.white:
By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound
waves imperceptible to humans. It uses
the rhythm of these sounds to talk.
entries.black-2:
By vibrating its cheeks, it emits
sound waves imperceptible to humans
and warns others of danger.
entries.white-2:
By vibrating its cheeks, it emits
sound waves imperceptible to humans
and warns others of danger.

imperceptible to humans and warns others
of danger.

imperceptible to humans. It uses the rhythm of
these sounds to talk.

By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves
imperceptible to humans and warns others
of danger.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves
imperceptible to humans. It uses the rhythm of
these sounds to talk.
entries.sword:
Graceful ripples running across the water’s
surface are a sure sign that Tympole are singing
in high-pitched voices below.
entries.shield:
It uses sound waves to communicate with
others of its kind. People and other Pokémon
species can’t hear its cries of warning.

entries.black:
When they vibrate the bumps on their
heads, they can make waves in water
or earthquake-like vibrations on land.
entries.white:
It lives in the water and on land.
It uses its long, sticky tongue
to capture prey.
entries.black-2:
It lives in the water and on land.
It uses its long, sticky tongue
to immobilize its opponents.
entries.white-2:
It lives in the water and on land.
It uses its long, sticky tongue
to immobilize its opponents.

vibrations on land.

entries.omega-ruby:
When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, they

vibrations on land.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long,
sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.
entries.sword:
It weakens its prey with sound waves intense
enough to cause headaches, then entangles
them with its sticky tongue.
entries.shield:
On occasion, their cries are sublimely pleasing to
the ear. Palpitoad with larger lumps on their
bodies can sing with a wider range of sounds.

entries.black:
They shoot paralyzing liquid from their
head bumps. They use vibration to hurt
their opponents.
entries.white:
It increases the power of its punches by
vibrating the bumps on its fists. It can
turn a boulder to rubble with one punch.
entries.black-2:
By putting power into its bumps,
it creates vibrations and increases
the power of its punches.
entries.white-2:
By putting power into its bumps,
it creates vibrations and increases
the power of its punches.
entries.x:
It increases the power of its punches by vibrating
the bumps on its fists. It can turn a boulder to
rubble with one punch.
entries.y:
They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps.
They use vibration to hurt their opponents.
entries.omega-ruby:
It increases the power of its punches by vibrating
the bumps on its fists. It can turn a boulder to
rubble with one punch.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps.
They use vibration to hurt their opponents.
entries.sword:
The vibrating of the bumps all over its body
causes earthquake-like tremors. Seismitoad and
Croagunk are similar species.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon is popular among the elderly,
who say the vibrations of its lumps are great
for massages.

entries.black:
When it tightens its belt, it becomes
stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave
their own belts.
entries.white:
When they encounter foes bigger than
themselves, they try to throw them.
They always travel in packs of five.
entries.black-2:
When it encounters a foe bigger than
itself, it wants to throw it.
It changes belts as it gets stronger.
entries.white-2:
When it encounters a foe bigger than
itself, it wants to throw it.
It changes belts as it gets stronger.
entries.x:
When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild
Throh use vines to weave their own belts.
entries.y:
When it encounters a foe bigger than itself, it wants
to throw it. It changes belts as it gets stronger.
entries.omega-ruby:
When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild
Throh use vines to weave their own belts.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
When it encounters a foe bigger than itself, it wants
to throw it. It changes belts as it gets stronger.
entries.sword:
It performs throwing moves with first-rate skill.
Over the course of many battles, Throh’s belt
grows darker as it absorbs its wearer’s sweat.
entries.shield:
They train in groups of five. Any member that
can’t keep up will discard its belt and leave
the group.

entries.black:
The sound of Sawk punching boulders
and trees can be heard all the way from
the mountains where they train.
entries.white:
Tying their belts gets them pumped and
makes their punches more destructive.
Disturbing their training angers them.
entries.black-2:
Desiring the strongest karate chop,
they seclude themselves in
mountains and train without sleeping.
entries.white-2:
Desiring the strongest karate chop,
they seclude themselves in
mountains and train without sleeping.
entries.x:
Desiring the strongest karate chop, they seclude
themselves in mountains and train without sleeping.
entries.y:
Tying their belts gets them pumped and makes their
punches more destructive. Disturbing their training
angers them.
entries.omega-ruby:
Desiring the strongest karate chop, they seclude
themselves in mountains and train without sleeping.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Tying their belts gets them pumped and makes their
punches more destructive. Disturbing their training
angers them.
entries.sword:
If you see a Sawk training in the mountains in its
single-minded pursuit of strength, it’s best to
quietly pass by.
entries.shield:
The karate chops of a Sawk that’s trained itself
to the limit can cleave the ocean itself.

entries.red:
While lulling its
enemies with its
vacant look, this wily POKéMON will
use psychokinetic
powers.
entries.blue:
While lulling its
enemies with its
vacant look, this wily POKéMON will
use psychokinetic
powers.
entries.yellow:
Always tormented
by headaches.
It uses psychic powers, but it is
not known if it
intends to do so.
entries.gold:
It has mystical
powers but doesn't
recall that it has used them. That is
why it always
looks puzzled.
entries.silver:
If its chronic
headache peaks, it
may exhibit odd powers. It seems
unable to recall
such an episode.
entries.crystal:
The only time it
can use its psy­
chic power is when its sleeping brain
cells happen to
wake.
entries.ruby:
PSYDUCK uses a mysterious power.
When it does so, this POKéMON 
generates brain waves that are supposedly only seen in sleepers.
This discovery spurred controversy
among scholars.
entries.sapphire:
If it uses its mysterious power,
PSYDUCK can’t remember having done so.
It apparently can’t form a memory of such an event because it goes into
an altered state that is much like
deep sleep.
entries.emerald:
When its headache intensifies, it starts
using strange powers. However, it has no
recollection of its powers, so it always
looks befuddled and bewildered.
entries.firered:
It is constantly wracked by a headache.
When the headache turns intense, it begins
using mysterious powers.
entries.leafgreen:
While lulling its enemies with its vacant
look, this wily POKéMON will use
psychokinetic powers.
entries.diamond:
If its usual headache worsens, it
starts exhibiting odd powers. It
can’t remember doing so, however.
entries.pearl:
It never remembers using its
odd powers, so it always tilts
its head in puzzlement.
entries.platinum:
Overwhelmed by enigmatic abilities,
it suffers a constant headache. It
sometimes uses mysterious powers.
entries.heartgold:
It has mystical powers but doesn’t
recall that it has used them.
That is why it always looks puzzled.
entries.soulsilver:
If its chronic headache peaks, it
may exhibit odd powers. It seems
unable to recall such an episode.
entries.black:
Overwhelmed by enigmatic abilities,
it suffers a constant headache. It
sometimes uses mysterious powers.
entries.white:
Overwhelmed by enigmatic abilities,
it suffers a constant headache. It
sometimes uses mysterious powers.
entries.black-2:
When headaches stimulate its brain
cells, which are usually inactive,
it can use a mysterious power.
entries.white-2:
When headaches stimulate its brain
cells, which are usually inactive,
it can use a mysterious power.

When the headache turns intense,
it begins using mysterious powers.

It has mystical powers but doesn’t recall that it has
used them. That is why it always looks puzzled.
entries.omega-ruby:
Psyduck uses a mysterious power. When it does so, this

in sleepers. This discovery spurred controversy
among scholars.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
If it uses its mysterious power, Psyduck can’t remember
having done so. It apparently can’t form a memory of such

like deep sleep.
entries.sun:
As a result of headaches so fierce they cause it
to cry, it sometimes uses psychokinesis without
meaning to.
entries.moon:
This Pokémon is troubled by constant
headaches. The more pain it’s in, the more
powerful its psychokinesis becomes.
entries.ultra-sun:
Using psychokinesis gives it a headache, so it
normally passes the time spacing out and doing
as little as possible.
entries.ultra-moon:
It has been found that its brain cells are
10 times more active when Psyduck is
experiencing a headache.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Always tormented by headaches. It uses
psychic powers, but whether it intends to
do so is not known.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Always tormented by headaches. It uses
psychic powers, but whether it intends to
do so is not known.
entries.sword:
Psyduck is constantly beset by headaches. If the
Pokémon lets its strange power erupt, apparently
the pain subsides for a while.
entries.shield:
As Psyduck gets stressed out, its headache gets
progressively worse. It uses intense psychic
energy to overwhelm those around it.
entries.legends-arceus:
Suffers perpetual headaches. If the agony grows too great,
Psyduck's latent power erupts, contrary to Psyduck's intent.
Ergo, I am exploring ways to ease the pain.

entries.black:
Leavanny dress it in clothes they made
for it when it hatched. It hides its head
in its hood while it is sleeping.
entries.white:
This Pokémon makes clothes for itself.
It chews up leaves and sews them with
sticky thread extruded from its mouth.
entries.black-2:
Since this Pokémon makes its own
clothes out of leaves, it is a popular
mascot for fashion designers.
entries.white-2:
Since this Pokémon makes its own
clothes out of leaves, it is a popular
mascot for fashion designers.

from its mouth.

entries.alpha-sapphire:
Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of

entries.black:
Forests where Swadloon live have superb
foliage because the nutrients they make
from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.
entries.white:
It protects itself from the cold
by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on
the move, eating leaves in forests.
entries.black-2:
Preferring dark, damp places,
it spends the entire day eating
fallen leaves that lie around it.
entries.white-2:
Preferring dark, damp places,
it spends the entire day eating
fallen leaves that lie around it.

because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves

entries.alpha-sapphire:
It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in
leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves
in forests.

entries.black:
Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves
clothing for it from leaves, using the
cutters on its arms and sticky silk.
entries.white:
It keeps its eggs warm with heat from
fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves
to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.
entries.black-2:
Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves
clothing for it from leaves by using the
sticky silk secreted from its mouth.
entries.white-2:
Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves
clothing for it from leaves by using the
sticky silk secreted from its mouth.
entries.x:
Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing
for it from leaves by using the sticky silk secreted
from its mouth.

leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings

entries.alpha-sapphire:
It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting
