for Sewaddle.

entries.black:
Its bite injects a potent poison, enough
to paralyze large bird Pokémon that try
to prey on it.
entries.white:
It discovers what is going on around it
by using the feelers on its head and tail.
It is brutally aggressive.
entries.black-2:
Using the feelers on its head and tail,
it picks up vibrations in the air to
determine its prey’s location and state.
entries.white-2:
Using the feelers on its head and tail,
it picks up vibrations in the air to
determine its prey’s location and state.
entries.x:
It discovers what is going on around it by using the
feelers on its head and tail. It is brutally aggressive.
entries.y:
Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze
large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.
entries.omega-ruby:
It discovers what is going on around it by using the
feelers on its head and tail. It is brutally aggressive.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze
large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.
entries.sword:
Venipede and Sizzlipede are similar species,
but when the two meet, a huge fight ensues.
entries.shield:
Its fangs are highly venomous. If this Pokémon
finds prey it thinks it can eat, it leaps for them
without any thought of how things might turn out.

entries.black:
Protected by a hard shell, it spins
its body like a wheel and crashes
furiously into its enemies.
entries.white:
It is usually motionless, but when
attacked, it rotates at high speed and
then crashes into its opponent.
entries.black-2:
Storing energy for evolution, it sits.
But, when predators approach, it
moves to stab them with poison spikes.
entries.white-2:
Storing energy for evolution, it sits.
But, when predators approach, it
moves to stab them with poison spikes.
entries.x:
Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a
wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.
entries.y:
It is usually motionless, but when attacked,
it rotates at high speed and then crashes into
its opponent.
entries.omega-ruby:
Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a
wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
It is usually motionless, but when attacked,
it rotates at high speed and then crashes into
its opponent.
entries.sword:
This Pokémon spins itself rapidly and charges into
its opponents. Its top speed is just over 60 mph.
entries.shield:
Whirlipede protects itself with a sturdy shell and
poisonous spikes while it stores up the energy it’ll
need for evolution.

entries.black:
With quick movements, it chases down
its foes, attacking relentlessly with
its horns until it prevails.
entries.white:
Highly aggressive, it uses the claws
near its neck to dig into its opponents
and poison them.
entries.black-2:
It clasps its prey with the claws
on its neck until it stops moving.
Then it finishes it off with deadly poison.
entries.white-2:
It clasps its prey with the claws
on its neck until it stops moving.
Then it finishes it off with deadly poison.
entries.x:
It clasps its prey with the claws on its neck until it
stops moving. Then it finishes it off with
deadly poison.
entries.y:
With quick movements, it chases down its foes,
attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.
entries.omega-ruby:
It clasps its prey with the claws on its neck until it
stops moving. Then it finishes it off with
deadly poison.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
With quick movements, it chases down its foes,
attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.
entries.sword:
Scolipede latches on to its prey with the claws on
its neck before slamming them into the ground
and jabbing them with its claws’ toxic spikes.
entries.shield:
Scolipede engage in fierce territorial battles with
Centiskorch. At the end of one of these battles,
the victor makes a meal of the loser.

entries.black:
When attacked, it escapes by shooting
cotton from its body. The cotton serves
as a decoy to distract the attacker.
entries.white:
They go wherever the wind takes them.
On rainy days, their bodies are heavier,
so they take shelter beneath big trees.
entries.black-2:
Perhaps because they feel more at ease
in a group, they stick to others they
find. They end up looking like a cloud.
entries.white-2:
Perhaps because they feel more at ease
in a group, they stick to others they
find. They end up looking like a cloud.
entries.x:
When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from
its body. The cotton serves as a decoy to distract
the attacker.
entries.y:
Perhaps because they feel more at ease in a group,
they stick to others they find. They end up looking
like a cloud.
entries.omega-ruby:
When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from
its body. The cotton serves as a decoy to distract
the attacker.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Perhaps because they feel more at ease in a group,
they stick to others they find. They end up looking
like a cloud.
entries.sun:
When it finds others of its kind, they all stick
together. When enough of them have collected,
the mass resembles a cumulonimbus cloud.
entries.moon:
Pillows and beds stuffed with cotton exhaled
by Cottonee are soft and puffy, light and airy—
altogether top quality.
entries.ultra-sun:
To protect itself, it shoots cotton from its body.
When it gets wet in the rain, its cotton grows
moist and heavy, and it can’t move as well.
entries.ultra-moon:
When attacked, it expels cotton from its
body to create a diversion. The cotton it loses
grows back in quickly.
entries.sword:
It shoots cotton from its body to protect itself.
If it gets caught up in hurricane-strength winds,
it can get sent to the other side of the Earth.
entries.shield:
Weaving together the cotton of both Cottonee
and Eldegoss produces exquisite cloth that’s
highly prized by many luxury brands.

entries.black:
Like the wind, it can slip through any
gap, no matter how small. It leaves
balls of white fluff behind.
entries.white:
Riding whirlwinds, they appear.
These Pokémon sneak through gaps into
houses and cause all sorts of mischief.
entries.black-2:
They appear along with whirlwinds. They
pull pranks, such as moving furniture
and leaving balls of cotton in homes.
entries.white-2:
They appear along with whirlwinds. They
pull pranks, such as moving furniture
and leaving balls of cotton in homes.
entries.x:
They appear along with whirlwinds. They pull
pranks, such as moving furniture and leaving balls
of cotton in homes.
entries.y:
Like the wind, it can slip through any gap,
no matter how small. It leaves balls of white
fluff behind.
entries.omega-ruby:
They appear along with whirlwinds. They pull
pranks, such as moving furniture and leaving balls
of cotton in homes.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Like the wind, it can slip through any gap,
no matter how small. It leaves balls of white
fluff behind.
entries.sun:
It rides on the wind and slips into people’s
homes. After it has turned a room into a cotton-
filled mess, it giggles to itself and takes off.
entries.moon:
This Pokémon appears, riding upon the wind.
But if the wind gusts up, it’ll blow the cotton on
this Pokémon’s head clean off.
entries.ultra-sun:
This nuisance sneaks into people’s homes,
where it hides important things and scatters
cotton all over the place.
entries.ultra-moon:
Whimsicott doesn’t live in a fixed location. It
floats around on whirling winds, appearing all
over the place to perform its mischief.
entries.sword:
It scatters cotton all over the place as a prank. If
it gets wet, it’ll become too heavy to move and
have no choice but to answer for its mischief.
entries.shield:
As long as this Pokémon bathes in sunlight, its
cotton keeps growing. If too much cotton fluff
builds up, Whimsicott tears it off and scatters it.

entries.black:
The leaves on its head are very bitter.
Eating one of these leaves is known
to refresh a tired body.
entries.white:
Since they prefer moist, nutrient-rich
soil, the areas where Petilil live are
known to be good for growing plants.
entries.black-2:
The leaves on its head grow right back
even if they fall out. These bitter
leaves refresh those who eat them.
entries.white-2:
The leaves on its head grow right back
even if they fall out. These bitter
leaves refresh those who eat them.
entries.x:
The leaves on its head are very bitter. Eating one
of these leaves is known to refresh a tired body.
entries.y:
Since they prefer moist, nutrient-rich soil, the areas
where Petilil live are known to be good for
growing plants.
entries.omega-ruby:
The leaves on its head are very bitter. Eating one
of these leaves is known to refresh a tired body.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Since they prefer moist, nutrient-rich soil, the areas
where Petilil live are known to be good for
growing plants.
entries.sun:
Although the leaves on its head are bitter
enough to cause dizziness, they provide relief
from weariness—even more so when boiled.
entries.moon:
By pruning the leaves on its head with
regularity, this Pokémon can be grown into a
fine plump shape.
entries.ultra-sun:
Some say if you dry the leaves on its head, boil
them down, and drink the infusion, your vigor
will return, so Petilil is popular with the elderly.
entries.ultra-moon:
They prefer clean water and soil. When the
environment they live in turns bad, the whole
bunch will up and move to a new area.
entries.sword:
Petilil appears around sources of clean water.
Boiling leaves from this Pokémon’s head results in
a liquid that’s sometimes used as a bug repellent.
entries.shield:
The deeper the color of a Petilil’s leaves, the
healthier the Pokémon is. Petilil sometimes makes
its home in a well-tended field or flowerbed.
entries.legends-arceus:
The leaves on its head are highly valued for medicinal purposes.
Dry the leaves in the sun, boil them, and then drink the bitter
decoction for remarkably effective relief from fatigue.

entries.black:
Even veteran Trainers face a challenge
in getting its beautiful flower to bloom.
This Pokémon is popular with celebrities.
entries.white:
The fragrance of the garland on its head
has a relaxing effect. It withers if a
Trainer does not take good care of it.
entries.black-2:
The fragrance of the garland on its head
has a relaxing effect, but taking
care of it is very difficult.
entries.white-2:
The fragrance of the garland on its head
has a relaxing effect, but taking
care of it is very difficult.
entries.x:
The fragrance of the garland on its head has a
relaxing effect. It withers if a Trainer does not take
good care of it.
entries.y:
Even veteran Trainers face a challenge in getting its
beautiful flower to bloom. This Pokémon is popular
with celebrities.
entries.omega-ruby:
The fragrance of the garland on its head has a
relaxing effect. It withers if a Trainer does not take
good care of it.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Even veteran Trainers face a challenge in getting its
beautiful flower to bloom. This Pokémon is popular
with celebrities.
entries.sun:
No matter how much time and money is spent
raising it, its flowers are the most beautiful
when they bloom in the wild.
entries.moon:
As soon as it finds a male to be its partner,
the beautiful flower on its head darkens,
droops, and withers away.
entries.ultra-sun:
The fragrance of its flower differs slightly
depending on the soil where it grew up.
Sniffing the aroma calms your heart and mind.
entries.ultra-moon:
It’s well liked by other Pokémon because of its
beauty. The flower on its head needs constant
care, or it will soon wither and rot.
entries.sword:
It’s believed that even first-rate gardeners have a
hard time getting the flower on a Lilligant’s head
to bloom.
entries.shield:
Essential oils made from Lilligant flowers
have a sublime scent, but they’re also
staggeringly expensive.
entries.legends-arceus:
I suspect that its well-developed legs are the result of a life
spent on mountains covered in deep snow. The scent it exudes
from its flower crown heartens those in proximity.

entries.red:
Often seen swim­
ming elegantly by
lake shores. It is often mistaken
for the Japanese
monster, Kappa.
entries.blue:
Often seen swim­
ming elegantly by
lake shores. It is often mistaken
for the Japanese
monster, Kappa.
entries.yellow:
Its slim and long
limbs end in broad
flippers. They are used for swim­
ming gracefully
in lakes.
entries.gold:
When it swims at
full speed using
its long, webbed limbs, its fore­
head somehow be­
gins to glow.
entries.silver:
It appears by
waterways at dusk.
It may use tele­ kinetic powers if
its forehead glows
mysteriously.
entries.crystal:
It swims grace­
fully along on the
quiet, slow-moving rivers and lakes
of which it is so
fond.
entries.ruby:
The webbed flippers on its forelegs and
hind legs and the streamlined body of
GOLDUCK give it frightening speed. This POKéMON is definitely much faster
than even the most athletic swimmer.
entries.sapphire:
GOLDUCK is the fastest swimmer among
all POKéMON. It swims effortlessly, even
in a rough, stormy sea. It sometimes rescues people from
wrecked ships floundering in high seas.
entries.emerald:
A GOLDUCK is an adept swimmer.
It sometimes joins competitive swimmers
in training. It uses psychic powers when
its forehead shimmers with light.
entries.firered:
The forelegs are webbed, helping to make
it an adept swimmer. It can be seen
swimming elegantly in lakes, etc.
entries.leafgreen:
Often seen swimming elegantly by
lakeshores. It is often mistaken for the
Japanese monster Kappa.
entries.diamond:
A Pokémon that lives in lakes.
It swims faster than any human
swimming champion.
entries.pearl:
The flippers of its well-developed
limbs give it shocking speed. It is
the best swimmer among Pokémon.
entries.platinum:
It is seen swimming dynamically and
elegantly using its well-developed
limbs and flippers.
entries.heartgold:
When it swims at full speed using
its long, webbed limbs, its forehead
somehow begins to glow.
entries.soulsilver:
It appears by waterways at dusk.
It may use telekinetic powers if
its forehead glows mysteriously.
entries.black:
It is seen swimming dynamically and
elegantly using its well-developed
limbs and flippers.
entries.white:
It is seen swimming dynamically and
elegantly using its well-developed
limbs and flippers.
entries.black-2:
When its forehead shines mysteriously,
Golduck can use the full extent
of its power.
entries.white-2:
When its forehead shines mysteriously,
Golduck can use the full extent
of its power.
entries.x:
It appears by waterways at dusk.
It may use telekinetic powers
if its forehead glows mysteriously.
entries.y:
The forelegs are webbed, helping to make it an
adept swimmer. It can be seen swimming elegantly
in lakes, etc.
entries.omega-ruby:
The webbed flippers on its forelegs and hind legs and the
streamlined body of Golduck give it frightening speed.
This Pokémon is definitely much faster than even the most
athletic swimmer.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Golduck is the fastest swimmer among all Pokémon. It swims
effortlessly, even in a rough, stormy sea. It sometimes rescues
people from wrecked ships floundering in high seas.
entries.sun:
It is said that the red part of its forehead
grants supernatural powers to those who
possess one, so it was over-hunted in the past.
entries.moon:
It swims along the banks of lakes and catches
fish Pokémon. It takes them to the shore and
quietly eats them up.
entries.ultra-sun:
Even fast-swimming fish Pokémon can be
disabled by Golduck. It brings them to a
standstill and seizes them.
entries.ultra-moon:
A professional swimmer, it can continue
swimming for two days straight by waving its
long tail skillfully.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Its long, slim limbs end in broad flippers.
They are used for swimming gracefully in lakes.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Its long, slim limbs end in broad flippers.
They are used for swimming gracefully in lakes.
entries.sword:
This Pokémon lives in gently flowing rivers. It
paddles through the water with its long limbs,
putting its graceful swimming skills on display.
entries.shield:
Old tales tell of Golduck punishing those that
defiled its river. The guilty were dragged into
the water and taken away.
entries.legends-arceus:
Its body is strong, and it has webbing on its hands and feet.
Golduck can swim easily through rough seas, clawing its way
through the high waves.

entries.black:
Red and blue Basculin get along so
poorly, they’ll start fighting instantly.
These Pokémon are very hostile.
entries.white:
Red and blue Basculin usually do not
get along, but sometimes members of one
school mingle with the other’s school.
entries.black-2:
Red- and blue-striped Basculin are
very violent and always fighting.
They are also remarkably tasty.
entries.white-2:
Red- and blue-striped Basculin are
very violent and always fighting.
They are also remarkably tasty.
entries.x:
Red- and blue-striped Basculin are very violent and
always fighting. They are also remarkably tasty.
entries.y:
Red and blue Basculin usually do not get along,
but sometimes members of one school mingle with
the other’s school.
entries.omega-ruby:
Red- and blue-striped Basculin are very violent and
always fighting. They are also remarkably tasty.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Red and blue Basculin usually do not get along,
but sometimes members of one school mingle with
the other’s school.
entries.ultra-sun:
Savage, violent Pokémon, red and blue Basculin
are always fighting each other over territory.
entries.ultra-moon:
When a school of Basculin appears in a lake,
everything else disappears, except for Corphish
and Crawdaunt. That’s how violent Basculin are.
entries.sword:
Anglers love the fight this Pokémon puts up on
the hook. And there are always more to catch—
many people release them into lakes illicitly.
entries.shield:
In the past, it often appeared on the dinner
table. The meat of red-striped Basculin is on the
fatty side, and it’s more popular with the youth.
entries.legends-arceus:
Though it differs from other Basculin in several respects,
including demeanor—this one is gentle—I have categorized
it as a regional form given the vast array of shared qualities.

entries.black:
They live buried in the sands of the
desert. The sun-warmed sands prevent
their body temperature from dropping.
entries.white:
It moves along below the sand’s surface,
except for its nose and eyes. A dark
membrane shields its eyes from the sun.
entries.black-2:
They live hidden under hot desert
sands in order to keep their body
temperature from dropping.
entries.white-2:
They live hidden under hot desert
sands in order to keep their body
temperature from dropping.
entries.x:
It moves along below the sand’s surface, except
for its nose and eyes. A dark membrane shields its
eyes from the sun.
entries.y:
They live buried in the sands of the desert.
The sun-warmed sands prevent their body
temperature from dropping.
entries.omega-ruby:
It moves along below the sand’s surface, except
for its nose and eyes. A dark membrane shields its
eyes from the sun.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
They live buried in the sands of the desert.
The sun-warmed sands prevent their body
temperature from dropping.
entries.sun:
It submerges itself in sand and moves as if
swimming. This wise behavior keeps its enemies
from finding it and maintains its temperature.
entries.moon:
It conceals itself in the sand and chomps down
on the legs of any prey that unwarily walk over
it. Its favorite food is Trapinch.
entries.ultra-sun:
Alola, where it’s warm all year round, is a
comfortable environment for this Pokémon.
Sometimes you’ll even see it outside of deserts.
entries.ultra-moon:
Sandile’s still not good at hunting, so it mostly
eats things that have collapsed in the desert.
It’s called “the cleaner of the desert.”
entries.sword:
The desert gets cold at night, so when the sun
sets, this Pokémon burrows deep into the sand
and sleeps until sunrise.
entries.shield:
Sandile is small, but its legs and lower body are
powerful. Pushing sand aside as it goes, Sandile
moves through the desert as if it’s swimming.

entries.black:
They live in groups of a few individuals.
Protective membranes shield their eyes
from sandstorms.
entries.white:
The special membrane covering its eyes
can sense the heat of objects, so it can
see its surroundings even in darkness.
entries.black-2:
Protected by thin membranes, their eyes
can see even in the dead of night.
They live in groups of a few individuals.
entries.white-2:
Protected by thin membranes, their eyes
can see even in the dead of night.
They live in groups of a few individuals.
entries.x:
They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective
membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.
entries.y:
The special membrane covering its eyes can sense
the heat of objects, so it can see its surroundings
even in darkness.
entries.omega-ruby:
They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective

entries.alpha-sapphire:
The special membrane covering its eyes can sense
the heat of objects, so it can see its surroundings
even in darkness.
entries.sun:
They move in groups of a few individuals.
A female is often the leader of the group, and
the males will gather food.
entries.moon:
Thanks to the special membrane covering its
eyes, it can see its surroundings clearly, even in
the middle of the night.
entries.ultra-sun:
Krokorok really hates it when its body gets
cold. On nights when the temperature drops,
it digs deep into the desert sands.
entries.ultra-moon:
It buries some of its prey in the sand to use as
emergency meals when its hunts
are unsuccessful.
entries.sword:
Krokorok has specialized eyes that enable it to
see in the dark. This ability lets Krokorok hunt in
the dead of night without getting lost.
entries.shield:
Although this Pokémon has specialized eyes that
allow it to see in the dark, Krokorok won’t move
much at night—the desert gets cold after sunset.

entries.black:
They never allow prey to escape.
Their jaws are so powerful, they can
crush the body of an automobile.
entries.white:
It can expand the focus of its eyes,
enabling it to see objects in the far
distance as if it were using binoculars.
entries.black-2:
Very violent Pokémon, they try
to clamp down on anything that
moves in front of their eyes.
entries.white-2:
Very violent Pokémon, they try
to clamp down on anything that
moves in front of their eyes.
entries.x:
Very violent Pokémon, they try to clamp down on
anything that moves in front of their eyes.
entries.y:
They never allow prey to escape. Their jaws
are so powerful, they can crush the body of
an automobile.
entries.omega-ruby:
Very violent Pokémon, they try to clamp down on
anything that moves in front of their eyes.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
They never allow prey to escape. Their jaws
are so powerful, they can crush the body of
an automobile.
entries.sun:
Its unique faculty of sight can detect small prey
more than 30 miles away, even in the midst of
a sandstorm.
entries.moon:
After clamping down with its powerful jaws,
it twists its body around to rip its prey in half.
entries.ultra-sun:
When it spots prey, even at a distance of over
30 miles, it swims through the desert as if it
were water, then jumps out and chomps them.
entries.ultra-moon:
It conceals itself in sandstorms that Flygon
whip up and waits patiently for prey to appear.
entries.sword:
This Pokémon is known as the Bully of the Sands.
Krookodile’s mighty jaws can bite through heavy
plates of iron with almost no effort at all.
entries.shield:
While terribly aggressive, Krookodile also has
the patience to stay hidden under sand for days,
lying in wait for prey.

entries.black:
When its internal fire is burning, it
cannot calm down and it runs around.
When the fire diminishes, it falls asleep.
entries.white:
Darumaka’s droppings are hot, so
people used to put them in their
clothes to keep themselves warm.
entries.black-2:
When it sleeps, it pulls its limbs
into its body and its internal fire
goes down to 1,100° F.
entries.white-2:
When it sleeps, it pulls its limbs
into its body and its internal fire
goes down to 1,100° F.
entries.x:

entries.alpha-sapphire:
When it sleeps, it pulls its limbs into its

entries.sword:
It derives its power from fire burning inside
its body. If the fire dwindles, this Pokémon will
immediately fall asleep.
entries.shield:
This popular symbol of good fortune will never
fall over in its sleep, no matter how it’s pushed
or pulled.

entries.black:
Its internal fire burns at 2,500° F,
making enough power that it can
destroy a dump truck with one punch.
entries.white:
When weakened in battle, it transforms
into a stone statue. Then it sharpens
its mind and fights on mentally.
entries.black-2:
When one is injured in a fierce battle,
it hardens into a stone-like form.
Then it meditates and sharpens its mind.
entries.white-2:
When one is injured in a fierce battle,
it hardens into a stone-like form.
Then it meditates and sharpens its mind.

entries.alpha-sapphire:
Its internal fire burns at 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit,
making enough power that it can destroy a dump

entries.sword:
The thick arms of this hot-blooded Pokémon
can deliver punches capable of obliterating a
dump truck.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon’s power level rises along with the
temperature of its fire, which can reach 2,500
degrees Fahrenheit.

entries.black:
It uses an up-tempo song and dance
to drive away the bird Pokémon that
prey on its flower seeds.
entries.white:
Arid regions are their habitat.
They move rhythmically, making
a sound similar to maracas.
entries.black-2:
When it moves rhythmically,
it makes a sound similar to maracas,
making the surprised Pokémon flee.
entries.white-2:
When it moves rhythmically,
it makes a sound similar to maracas,
making the surprised Pokémon flee.
entries.x:
It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away
the bird Pokémon that prey on its flower seeds.
entries.y:

rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.
entries.omega-ruby:
It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away
the bird Pokémon that prey on its flower seeds.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Arid regions are their habitat. They move
rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.
entries.sword:
With noises that could be mistaken for the rattles
of maracas, it creates an upbeat rhythm, startling
bird Pokémon and making them fly off in a hurry.
entries.shield:
Once each year, this Pokémon scatters its seeds.
They’re jam-packed with nutrients, making them
a precious food source out in the desert.

entries.black:
This Pokémon can easily melt holes in
hard rocks with a liquid secreted from
its mouth.
entries.white:
It makes a hole in a suitable rock. If
that rock breaks, the Pokémon remains
agitated until it locates a replacement.
entries.black-2:
When it finds a stone of a suitable
size, it secretes a liquid from its
mouth to open up a hole to crawl into.
entries.white-2:
When it finds a stone of a suitable
size, it secretes a liquid from its
mouth to open up a hole to crawl into.
entries.x:
It makes a hole in a suitable rock. If that rock
breaks, the Pokémon remains agitated until it
locates a replacement.
entries.y:
When it finds a stone of a suitable size, it secretes

crawl into.
entries.omega-ruby:
It makes a hole in a suitable rock. If that rock
breaks, the Pokémon remains agitated until it
locates a replacement.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
When it finds a stone of a suitable size, it secretes
a liquid from its mouth to open up a hole to
crawl into.
entries.sword:
When it finds a stone appealing, it creates a hole
inside it and uses it as its home. This Pokémon is
the natural enemy of Roggenrola and Rolycoly.
entries.shield:
It first tries to find a rock to live in, but if there
are no suitable rocks to be found, Dwebble may
move in to the ports of a Hippowdon.

entries.black:
Competing for territory, Crustle
fight viciously. The one whose boulder
is broken is the loser of the battle.
entries.white:
It possesses legs of enormous strength,
enabling it to carry heavy slabs for many
days, even when crossing arid land.
entries.black-2:
When its boulder is broken
in battles for territory, it feels
unsure and begins to weaken.
entries.white-2:
When its boulder is broken
in battles for territory, it feels
unsure and begins to weaken.

It possesses legs of enormous strength, enabling it
to carry heavy slabs for many days, even when
crossing arid land.

The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of
the battle.
entries.omega-ruby:
It possesses legs of enormous strength, enabling it
to carry heavy slabs for many days, even when
crossing arid land.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously.
The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of
the battle.
entries.sword:
This highly territorial Pokémon prefers dry
climates. It won’t come out of its boulder on
rainy days.
entries.shield:
Its thick claws are its greatest weapons.
They’re mighty enough to crack
Rhyperior’s carapace.

entries.black:
Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so
it can reduce damage by defensively
pulling its skin up to its neck.
entries.white:
It immediately headbutts anyone that
makes eye contact with it. Its skull is
massively thick.
entries.black-2:
Proud of its sturdy skull,
it suddenly headbutts everything,
but its weight makes it unstable, too.
entries.white-2:
Proud of its sturdy skull,
it suddenly headbutts everything,
but its weight makes it unstable, too.

entries.alpha-sapphire:
Proud of its sturdy skull, it suddenly headbutts

entries.ultra-sun:
They move in small groups, walking around lazily.
Anyone who makes eye contact gets smacked
with a headbutt.
entries.ultra-moon:
It stretches its saggy skin up to its neck to
protect itself. The saggier their skin, the more
respect they garner.
entries.sword:
If it locks eyes with you, watch out! Nothing and
no one is safe from the reckless headbutts of this
troublesome Pokémon.
entries.shield:
It protects itself with its durable skin. It’s thought
that this Pokémon will evolve once its skin has
completely stretched out.

entries.red:
Extremely quick to
anger. It could
be docile one moment then
thrashing away
the next instant.
entries.blue:
Extremely quick to
anger. It could
be docile one moment then
thrashing away
the next instant.
entries.yellow:
An agile POKéMON
that lives in
trees. It angers easily and will
not hesitate to
attack anything.
entries.gold:
It is extremely
ill-tempered.
Groups of them will attack any
handy target for
no reason.
entries.silver:
It's unsafe to ap­
proach if it gets
violently enraged for no reason and
can't distinguish
friends from foes.
entries.crystal:
It lives in groups
in the treetops.
If it loses sight of its group, it
becomes infuriated
by its loneliness.
entries.ruby:
When MANKEY starts shaking and its
nasal breathing turns rough, it’s a sure
sign that it is becoming angry. However, because it goes into a
towering rage almost instantly, it is
impossible for anyone to flee its wrath.
entries.sapphire:
When MANKEY starts shaking and its
nasal breathing turns rough, it’s a sure
sign that it is becoming angry. However, because it goes into a
towering rage almost instantly, it is
impossible for anyone to flee its wrath.
entries.emerald:
When it starts shaking and its nasal
breathing turns rough, it’s a sure sign
of anger. However, since this happens
instantly, there is no time to flee.
entries.firered:
Light and agile on its feet, and ferocious
in temperament. When angered, it flies into
an uncontrollable frenzy.
entries.leafgreen:
Extremely quick to anger. It could be
docile one moment, then thrashing away 
the next instant.
entries.diamond:
It lives in treetop colonies.
If one becomes enraged, the whole
colony rampages for no reason.

If one becomes enraged, the whole

can’t distinguish friends from foes.

colony rampages for no reason.

When Mankey starts shaking and its nasal breathing turns

because it goes into a towering rage almost instantly,

entries.alpha-sapphire:
When Mankey starts shaking and its nasal breathing turns

it is impossible for anyone to flee its wrath.
entries.sun:
It can spontaneously become enraged. Everyone
near it clears out as it rampages, and the
resulting loneliness makes it angrier still.
entries.moon:
Its raging tires it out and causes it to fall asleep,
but the anger resonating in its dreams causes it
to wake up—which infuriates it all over again.
entries.ultra-sun:
The smallest of things could cause it to lose its
temper. Because it doesn’t hold in its stress,
this Pokémon can live a long time.
entries.ultra-moon:
If one gets angry, all the others around it will
get angry, so silence is a rare visitor in a troop
of Mankey.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
An agile Pokémon that lives in trees. It angers
easily and will not hesitate to attack anything.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
An agile Pokémon that lives in trees. It angers
easily and will not hesitate to attack anything.

entries.black:
Groups of them beat up anything
that enters their territory. Each can
spit acidic liquid from its mouth.
entries.white:
It can smash concrete blocks with its
kicking attacks. The one with the biggest
crest is the group leader.
entries.black-2:
It pulls up its shed skin to protect
itself while it kicks. The bigger the
crest, the more respected it is.
entries.white-2:
It pulls up its shed skin to protect
itself while it kicks. The bigger the
crest, the more respected it is.

It can smash concrete blocks with its kicking

group leader.
entries.ultra-sun:
This Pokémon may be rude, but it takes very
good care of its family, its friends, and its turf.
entries.ultra-moon:
It taunts its opponents by spitting. It has a
certain territory that it never leaves its whole
life long.
entries.sword:
As halfhearted as this Pokémon’s kicks may seem,
they pack enough power to shatter Conkeldurr’s
concrete pillars.
entries.shield:
While mostly known for having the temperament
of an aggressive ruffian, this Pokémon takes very
good care of its family, friends, and territory.

entries.black:
They never vary the route they fly,
because their memories of guarding
an ancient city remain steadfast.
entries.white:
The guardians of an ancient city, they
use their psychic power to attack
enemies that invade their territory.
entries.black-2:
The guardians of an ancient city, they
always fly the same route while
keeping watch for invaders.
entries.white-2:
The guardians of an ancient city, they
always fly the same route while
keeping watch for invaders.

The guardians of an ancient city, they always fly

entries.sword:
Psychic power allows these Pokémon to fly. Some
say they were the guardians of an ancient city.
Others say they were the guardians’ emissaries.
entries.shield:
A discovery was made in the desert where
Sigilyph fly. The ruins of what may have been
an ancient city were found beneath the sands.

entries.black:
Each of them carries a mask that used
to be its face when it was human.
Sometimes they look at it and cry.
entries.white:
These Pokémon arose from the spirits of
people interred in graves in past ages.
Each retains memories of its former life.
entries.black-2:
These Pokémon arose from the spirits of
people interred in graves. Each retains
memories of its former life.

when it was human. Sometimes they look at it
and cry.

These Pokémon arose from the spirits of people

former life.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face
when it was human. Sometimes they look at it
and cry.
entries.sword:
It wanders through ruins by night, carrying a mask
that’s said to have been the face it had when it
was still human.
entries.shield:
The spirit of a person from a bygone age became
this Pokémon. It rambles through ruins, searching
for someone who knows its face.

entries.black:
It has been said that they swallow those
who get too close and turn them into
mummies. They like to eat gold nuggets.
entries.white:
They pretend to be elaborate coffins
to teach lessons to grave robbers.
Their bodies are covered in pure gold.
entries.black-2:
Grave robbers who mistake them
for real coffins and get too close
end up trapped inside their bodies.
entries.white-2:
Grave robbers who mistake them
for real coffins and get too close
end up trapped inside their bodies.
entries.x:
It has been said that they swallow those who get
too close and turn them into mummies. They like to
eat gold nuggets.
entries.y:
Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and
get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.
entries.omega-ruby:
It has been said that they swallow those who get
too close and turn them into mummies. They like to
eat gold nuggets.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and
get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.
entries.sword:
This Pokémon has a body of sparkling gold.
People say it no longer remembers that it was
once human.
entries.shield:
There are many depictions of Cofagrigus
decorating ancient tombs. They’re symbols
of the wealth that kings of bygone eras had.

entries.black:
Restored from a fossil, this Pokémon
can dive to depths beyond half a mile.
entries.white:
About 100 million years ago, these
Pokémon swam in oceans. It is thought
they also went on land to attack prey.
entries.black-2:
This Pokémon was restored from a fossil.
It swam skillfully and dove
to depths beyond half a mile.
entries.white-2:
This Pokémon was restored from a fossil.
It swam skillfully and dove
to depths beyond half a mile.
entries.x:
About 100 million years ago, these Pokémon swam
in oceans. It is thought they also went on land to
attack prey.
entries.y:
Restored from a fossil, this Pokémon can dive to
depths beyond half a mile.
entries.omega-ruby:
About 100 million years ago, these Pokémon swam
in oceans. It is thought they also went on land to
attack prey.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Restored from a fossil, this Pokémon can dive to
depths beyond half a mile.
entries.sun:
Based on studies of its skeletal structure, it can
apparently dive to ocean depths of over half
a mile.
entries.moon:
Reputed to be the ancestor of most turtle
Pokémon, it lived in warm seas approximately
a hundred million years ago.
entries.ultra-sun:
It was restored from an ancient fossil. Tirtouga
lived in the sea but came up onto the land to
search for prey.
entries.ultra-moon:
Its hunting grounds encompassed a broad area,
from the land to more than half a mile deep in
the ocean.
entries.sword:
This Pokémon inhabited ancient seas. Although
it can only crawl, it still comes up onto land in
search of prey.
entries.shield:
Tirtouga is considered to be the ancestor of
many turtle Pokémon. It was restored to life
from a fossil.

entries.black:
They can live both in the ocean and on
land. A slap from one of them is enough
to open a hole in the bottom of a tanker.
entries.white:
Incredible jaw strength enables them
to chew up steel beams and rocks
along with their prey.
entries.black-2:
It could knock out a foe with a slap from
one of its developed front appendages
and chew it up, shell or bones and all.
entries.white-2:
It could knock out a foe with a slap from
one of its developed front appendages
and chew it up, shell or bones and all.
entries.x:
They can live both in the ocean and on land. A slap
from one of them is enough to open a hole in the
bottom of a tanker.
entries.y:
It could knock out a foe with a slap from one of its
developed front appendages and chew it up, shell
or bones and all.
entries.omega-ruby:
They can live both in the ocean and on land. A slap
from one of them is enough to open a hole in the
bottom of a tanker.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
It could knock out a foe with a slap from one of its
developed front appendages and chew it up, shell
or bones and all.
entries.sun:
It constructed its sturdy shell by crunching and
swallowing the hard shells or bones of its prey.
entries.moon:
Active both on land and in the sea, this
Pokémon drags its land-based prey into the
water to finish it off.
entries.ultra-sun:
Its jaws are terrifyingly powerful. It could eat
Omastar and Omanyte whole and not be
bothered in the slightest by their shells.
entries.ultra-moon:
Carracosta eats every last bit of the prey it
catches, even the shells and bones, to further
strengthen its sturdy shell.
entries.sword:
Carracosta completely devours its prey—bones,
shells, and all. Because of this, Carracosta’s own
shell grows thick and sturdy.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon emerges from the water in search
of prey despite the fact that it moves more
slowly on land.

entries.black:
Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon,
they were unable to fly and moved about
by hopping from one branch to another.
entries.white:
Revived from a fossil, this Pokémon
is thought to be the ancestor of all
bird Pokémon.
entries.black-2:
It was revived from an ancient fossil.
Not able to fly, it lived in treetops and
hopped from one branch to another.
entries.white-2:
It was revived from an ancient fossil.
Not able to fly, it lived in treetops and
hopped from one branch to another.
entries.x:
Revived from a fossil, this Pokémon is thought to
be the ancestor of all bird Pokémon.
entries.y:
Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, they were
unable to fly and moved about by hopping from one
branch to another.
entries.omega-ruby:
Revived from a fossil, this Pokémon is thought to
be the ancestor of all bird Pokémon.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, they were
unable to fly and moved about by hopping from one
branch to another.
entries.sun:
It is the ancestor of all bird Pokémon. Archen
itself could not actually fly but moved by
hopping from treetop to treetop.
entries.moon:
To all appearances flightless, it was able to
glide down from tall treetops to snag its prey.
entries.ultra-sun:
Once thought to be the ancestor of all bird
Pokémon, some of the latest research suggests
that may not be the case.
entries.ultra-moon:
Restored from a fossil, this ancient bird
Pokémon has wings but can’t yet fly.
entries.sword:
This Pokémon was successfully restored from a
fossil. As research suggested, Archen is unable
to fly. But it’s very good at jumping.
entries.shield:
Archen is said to be the ancestor of bird
Pokémon. It lived in treetops, eating berries
and bug Pokémon.

entries.black:
They are intelligent and will cooperate
to catch prey. From the ground, they
use a running start to take flight.
entries.white:
It runs better than it flies.
It catches prey by running at speeds
comparable to those of an automobile.
entries.black-2:
It runs better than it flies.
It takes off into the sky by
running at a speed of 25 mph.
entries.white-2:
It runs better than it flies.
It takes off into the sky by
running at a speed of 25 mph.
entries.x:
They are intelligent and will cooperate to catch
prey. From the ground, they use a running start to
take flight.
entries.y:
It runs better than it flies. It takes off into the sky
by running at a speed of 25 mph.
entries.omega-ruby:
They are intelligent and will cooperate to catch
prey. From the ground, they use a running start to
take flight.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
It runs better than it flies. It takes off into the sky
by running at a speed of 25 mph.
entries.sun:
Although apparently able to fly, they tended
to run along the ground, averaging speeds of
roughly 25 mph.
entries.moon:
They hunted in flocks. When one Archeops had
the prey cornered, another would swoop on it.
entries.ultra-sun:
This ancient Pokémon’s plumage is delicate,
so if anyone other than an experienced
professional tries to restore it, they will fail.
entries.ultra-moon:
Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, the
muscles it uses to flap its wings are still weak,
so it needs a long runway in order to take off.
entries.sword:
It needs a running start to take off. If Archeops
wants to fly, it first needs to run nearly 25 mph,
building speed over a course of about 2.5 miles.
entries.shield:
Though capable of flight, Archeops was
apparently better at hunting on the ground.

entries.black:
Inhaling the gas they belch will make
you sleep for a week. They prefer
unsanitary places.
entries.white:
The combination of garbage bags and
industrial waste caused the chemical
reaction that created this Pokémon.
entries.black-2:
Wanting more garbage, they
follow people who litter.
They always belch poison gas.
entries.white-2:
Wanting more garbage, they
follow people who litter.
They always belch poison gas.
entries.x:
The combination of garbage bags and industrial
waste caused the chemical reaction that created
this Pokémon.
entries.y:
Inhaling the gas they belch will make you sleep for
a week. They prefer unsanitary places.
entries.omega-ruby:
The combination of garbage bags and industrial
waste caused the chemical reaction that created
this Pokémon.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Inhaling the gas they belch will make you sleep for
a week. They prefer unsanitary places.
entries.sun:
Unsanitary places are what they like best.
They can be spotted in Alola, often with Grimer
in hot pursuit.
entries.moon:
It gorges on trash until its stomach is full. Then
it belches toxic gas. An unlucky whiff of gas will
put a person in the hospital.
entries.ultra-sun:
Poisonous gas leaks out of it when it breathes.
Muk that catch a whiff of that stench will
come drooling.
entries.ultra-moon:
If a young Pokémon or child breathes in the
toxic gas that Trubbish belches out, it could be
a life-threatening situation.
entries.sword:
Its favorite places are unsanitary ones. If you
leave trash lying around, you could even find
one of these Pokémon living in your room.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon was born from a bag stuffed with
trash. Galarian Weezing relish the fumes belched
by Trubbish.

entries.black:
It clenches opponents with its left arm
and finishes them off with foul-smelling
poison gas belched from its mouth.
entries.white:
They absorb garbage and make it part
of their bodies. They shoot a poisonous
liquid from their right-hand fingertips.
entries.black-2:
Consuming garbage makes
new kinds of poison gases
and liquids inside their bodies.
entries.white-2:
Consuming garbage makes
new kinds of poison gases
and liquids inside their bodies.
entries.x:
It clenches opponents with its left arm and finishes
them off with foul-smelling poison gas belched from
its mouth.
entries.y:
Consuming garbage makes new kinds of poison
gases and liquids inside their bodies.
entries.omega-ruby:
It clenches opponents with its left arm and finishes
them off with foul-smelling poison gas belched from
its mouth.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Consuming garbage makes new kinds of poison
gases and liquids inside their bodies.
entries.sun:
Beware the poisonous liquid it shoots from its
right arm. If even a little of it gets on you, you’ll
experience the effects of the unidentified toxin.
entries.moon:
For a time, their numbers increased explosively
in Alola. Since the arrival of Grimer, their
population has decreased dramatically.
entries.ultra-sun:
It locks opponents in place with its left hand,
immobilizing them by entirely dousing their
bodies with poisonous liquid.
entries.ultra-moon:
Some say the reason Garbodor in Alola are a
little stronger than their counterparts elsewhere
is the presence of Muk, their natural enemy.
entries.sword:
This Pokémon eats trash, which turns into poison
inside its body. The main component of the
poison depends on what sort of trash was eaten.
entries.shield:
The toxic liquid it launches from its right arm
is so virulent that it can kill a weakened
creature instantly.

entries.red:
Always furious
and tenacious to
boot. It will not abandon chasing
its quarry until
it is caught.
entries.blue:
Always furious
and tenacious to
boot. It will not abandon chasing
its quarry until
it is caught.
entries.yellow:
It stops being
angry only when
nobody else is around. To view
this moment is
very difficult.
entries.gold:
If approached
while asleep, it
may awaken and angrily give chase
in a groggy state
of semi-sleep.
entries.silver:
It becomes wildly
furious if it even
senses someone looking at it. It
chases anyone that
meets its glare.
entries.crystal:
It will beat up
anyone who makes
it mad, even if it has to chase them
until the end of
the world.
entries.ruby:
When PRIMEAPE becomes furious, its
blood circulation is boosted. In turn,
its muscles are made even stronger. However, it also becomes much less
intelligent at the same time.
entries.sapphire:
When PRIMEAPE becomes furious, its
blood circulation is boosted. In turn,
its muscles are made even stronger. However, it also becomes much less
intelligent at the same time.
entries.emerald:
When it becomes furious, its blood
circulation becomes more robust, and
its muscles are made stronger. But it
also becomes much less intelligent.
entries.firered:
It is always outrageously furious. If it
gives chase, it will tenaciously track the
target no matter how far.
entries.leafgreen:
Always furious and tenacious to boot.
It will not abandon chasing its quarry
until it catches up.
entries.diamond:
It grows angry if you see its eyes
and gets angrier if you run. If you
beat it, it gets even madder.
entries.pearl:
It grows angry if you see its eyes
and gets angrier if you run. If you
beat it, it gets even madder.
entries.platinum:
It grows angry if you see its eyes
and gets angrier if you run. If you
beat it, it gets even madder.
entries.heartgold:
If approached while asleep,
it may awaken and angrily give chase
in a groggy state of semi-sleep.
entries.soulsilver:
It becomes wildly furious if it even
senses someone looking at it. It
chases anyone that meets its glare.
entries.black:
It grows angry if you see its eyes
and gets angrier if you run. If you
beat it, it gets even madder.
entries.white:
It grows angry if you see its eyes
and gets angrier if you run. If you
beat it, it gets even madder.
entries.black-2:
It grows angry if you see its eyes
and gets angrier if you run. If you
beat it, it gets even madder.
entries.white-2:
It grows angry if you see its eyes
and gets angrier if you run. If you
beat it, it gets even madder.
entries.x:
It stops being angry only when nobody else is
around. To view this moment is very difficult.
entries.y:
It is always outrageously furious. If it gives chase,
it will tenaciously track the target no matter
how far.
entries.omega-ruby:
When Primeape becomes furious, its blood circulation is
boosted. In turn, its muscles are made even stronger.
However, it also becomes much less intelligent at the
same time.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
When Primeape becomes furious, its blood circulation
is boosted. In turn, its muscles are made even stronger.
However, it also becomes much less intelligent at the
same time.
entries.sun:
It has been known to become so angry that
it dies as a result. Its face looks peaceful in
death, however.
entries.moon:
Some researchers theorize that Primeape
remains angry even when inside a Poké Ball.
entries.ultra-sun:
It will never forgive opponents who have
angered it. Even after it has beaten them down
until they can’t move, it never ever forgives.
entries.ultra-moon:
The blood vessels in its brain are sturdier than
those of other Pokémon, so it can stay healthy
despite its constant raging.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
It stops being angry only when nobody else
is around. To view this moment is very difficult.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
It stops being angry only when nobody else
is around. To view this moment is very difficult.

entries.black:
It changes into the forms of others
to surprise them. Apparently, it
often transforms into a silent child.
entries.white:
To protect themselves from danger,
they hide their true identities by
transforming into people and Pokémon.
entries.black-2:
It changes so it looks just
like its foe, tricks it, and then
uses that opportunity to flee.
entries.white-2:
It changes so it looks just
like its foe, tricks it, and then
uses that opportunity to flee.
entries.x:
It changes so it looks just like its foe, tricks it, and
then uses that opportunity to flee.
entries.y:
To protect themselves from danger, they hide their
true identities by transforming into people
and Pokémon.
entries.omega-ruby:
It changes so it looks just like its foe, tricks it, and
then uses that opportunity to flee.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
To protect themselves from danger, they hide their
true identities by transforming into people
and Pokémon.
entries.ultra-sun:
This Pokémon has a cowardly disposition, so
when it’s not around friends, it basically
always stays transformed as something else.
entries.ultra-moon:
If a normally talkative child suddenly stops
talking, it may have been replaced by Zorua.
entries.sword:
Zorua is a timid Pokémon. This disposition seems
to be what led to the development of Zorua’s
ability to take on the forms of other creatures.
entries.shield:
Zorua sometimes transforms into a person and
goes into cities to search for food. When Zorua
does this, it usually takes on the form of a child.
entries.legends-arceus:
A once-departed soul, returned to life in Hisui. Derives power
from resentment, which rises as energy atop its head and takes
on the forms of foes. In this way, Zorua vents lingering malice.

entries.black:
Bonds between these Pokémon are very
strong. It protects the safety of its
pack by tricking its opponents.
entries.white:
Each has the ability to fool a large
group of people simultaneously. They
protect their lair with illusory scenery.
entries.black-2:
Stories say those who tried
to catch Zoroark were trapped
in an illusion and punished.
entries.white-2:
Stories say those who tried
to catch Zoroark were trapped
in an illusion and punished.
entries.x:
Each has the ability to fool a large group of people
simultaneously. They protect their lair with
illusory scenery.
entries.y:
Bonds between these Pokémon are very strong.
It protects the safety of its pack by tricking
its opponents.
entries.omega-ruby:
Each has the ability to fool a large group of people
simultaneously. They protect their lair with
illusory scenery.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Bonds between these Pokémon are very strong.
It protects the safety of its pack by tricking
its opponents.
entries.ultra-sun:
It doesn’t just transform itself—it also has the
power to make hundreds of people see
its illusions.
entries.ultra-moon:
If it thinks humans are going to discover its den,
Zoroark shows them visions that make them
wander around in the woods.
entries.sword:
This Pokémon cares deeply about others of its
kind, and it will conjure terrifying illusions to
keep its den and pack safe.
entries.shield:
Seeking to ease the burden of their solitude,
lonely Trainers tell Zoroark to show illusions
to them.
entries.legends-arceus:
With its disheveled white fur, it looks like an embodiment of
death. Heedless of its own safety, Zoroark attacks its nemeses
with a bitter energy so intense, it lacerates Zoroark's own body.

entries.black:
They greet one another by rubbing each
other with their tails, which are always
kept well groomed and clean.
entries.white:
These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat.
They are always sweeping and dusting,
using their tails as brooms.
entries.black-2:
Minccino greet each other
by grooming one another
thoroughly with their tails.
entries.white-2:
Minccino greet each other
by grooming one another
thoroughly with their tails.
entries.x:
Minccino greet each other by grooming one another
thoroughly with their tails.
entries.y:
These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat. They are
always sweeping and dusting, using their tails
as brooms.
entries.omega-ruby:
Minccino greet each other by grooming one another
thoroughly with their tails.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat. They are
always sweeping and dusting, using their tails
as brooms.
entries.ultra-sun:
A clean freak that will not allow even the
slightest mess, it uses its tail like a mop to
thoroughly clean any and all filth.
entries.ultra-moon:
When its tail has gotten dirty from self-cleaning
or from cleaning its nest, Minccino spends a
whole day washing its tail in clean spring water.
entries.sword:
The way it brushes away grime with its tail
can be helpful when cleaning. But its focus on
spotlessness can make cleaning more of a hassle.
entries.shield:
They pet each other with their tails as a form of
greeting. Of the two, the one whose tail is fluffier
is a bit more boastful.

entries.black:
Their white fur is coated in a special oil
that makes it easy for them to
deflect attacks.
entries.white:
Their white fur feels amazing to touch.
Their fur repels dust and prevents
static electricity from building up.
entries.black-2:
Cinccino’s body is coated
in a special oil that helps it
deflect attacks, such as punches.
entries.white-2:
Cinccino’s body is coated
in a special oil that helps it
deflect attacks, such as punches.
entries.x:
Their white fur feels amazing to touch. Their fur
repels dust and prevents static electricity from
building up.
entries.y:
Cinccino’s body is coated in a special oil that helps
it deflect attacks, such as punches.
entries.omega-ruby:
Their white fur feels amazing to touch. Their fur
repels dust and prevents static electricity from
building up.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Cinccino’s body is coated in a special oil that helps
it deflect attacks, such as punches.
entries.ultra-sun:
The white parts of its coat are covered in an oil
secreted from its body, so this Pokémon can
slide right away from its enemies’ attacks.
entries.ultra-moon:
The oil that seeps from its body is really
smooth. For people troubled by bad skin,
this oil is an effective treatment.
entries.sword:
Its body secretes oil that this Pokémon spreads
over its nest as a coating to protect it from dust.
Cinccino won’t tolerate even a speck of the stuff.
entries.shield:
A special oil that seeps through their fur helps
them avoid attacks. The oil fetches a high price
at market.

entries.black:
Their ribbonlike feelers increase their
psychic power. They are always staring
at something.
entries.white:
They intently observe both Trainers and
Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking
at something that only Gothita can see.
entries.black-2:
It stares intently at everything.
It can become so obsessed with
watching that it doesn’t notice attacks.
entries.white-2:
It stares intently at everything.
It can become so obsessed with
watching that it doesn’t notice attacks.
entries.x:
Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic
power. They are always staring at something.
entries.y:
They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon.
Apparently, they are looking at something that only
Gothita can see.
entries.omega-ruby:
Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic
power. They are always staring at something.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon.
Apparently, they are looking at something that only
Gothita can see.
entries.sword:
Though they’re still only babies, there’s psychic
power stored in their ribbonlike feelers, and
sometimes they use that power to fight.
entries.shield:
Even when nobody seems to be around, Gothita
can still be heard making a muted cry. Many believe
it’s speaking to something only it can see.

entries.black:
They use hypnosis to control people and
Pokémon. Tales of Gothorita leading
people astray are told in every corner.
entries.white:
Starlight is the source of their power.
At night, they mark star positions by
using psychic power to float stones.
entries.black-2:
According to many old tales, it creates
friends for itself by controlling
sleeping children on starry nights.
entries.white-2:
According to many old tales, it creates
friends for itself by controlling
sleeping children on starry nights.
entries.x:
Starlight is the source of their power. At night,
they mark star positions by using psychic power
to float stones.
entries.y:
According to many old tales, it creates friends for
itself by controlling sleeping children on
starry nights.
entries.omega-ruby:
Starlight is the source of their power. At night,
they mark star positions by using psychic power
to float stones.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
According to many old tales, it creates friends for
itself by controlling sleeping children on
starry nights.
entries.sword:
It’s said that when stars shine in the night sky,
this Pokémon will spirit away sleeping children.
Some call it the Witch of Punishment.
entries.shield:
On nights when the stars shine, this Pokémon’s
psychic power is at its strongest. It’s unknown just
what link Gothorita has to the greater universe.

entries.black:
Starry skies thousands of light-years
away are visible in the space distorted
by their intense psychic power.
entries.white:
They can predict the future from the
placement and movement of the stars.
They can see Trainers’ life spans.
entries.black-2:
It can see the future from the movement
of the stars. When it learns its
Trainer’s life span, it cries in sadness.
entries.white-2:
It can see the future from the movement
of the stars. When it learns its
Trainer’s life span, it cries in sadness.
entries.x:
Starry skies thousands of light-years away are
visible in the space distorted by their intense
psychic power.
entries.y:
They can predict the future from the placement and
movement of the stars. They can see Trainers’
life spans.
entries.omega-ruby:
Starry skies thousands of light-years away are
visible in the space distorted by their intense
psychic power.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
They can predict the future from the placement and
movement of the stars. They can see Trainers’
life spans.
entries.sword:
It has tremendous psychic power, but it dislikes
conflict. It’s also able to predict the future based
on the movement of the stars.
entries.shield:
A criminal who was shown his fate by a Gothitelle
went missing that same day and was never
seen again.

entries.black:
They drive away attackers by unleashing
psychic power. They can use telepathy
to talk with others.
entries.white:
Because their bodies are enveloped
in a special liquid, they can survive
in any environment.
entries.black-2:
Because their bodies are enveloped
in a special liquid, they are fine in any
environment, no matter how severe.
entries.white-2:
Because their bodies are enveloped
in a special liquid, they are fine in any
environment, no matter how severe.
entries.x:
Because their bodies are enveloped in a special
liquid, they are fine in any environment, no matter
how severe.
entries.y:
They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic
power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.
entries.omega-ruby:
Because their bodies are enveloped in a special
liquid, they are fine in any environment, no matter
how severe.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic
power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.
entries.sword:
It communicates with others telepathically.
Its body is encapsulated in liquid, but if it takes
a heavy blow, the liquid will leak out.
entries.shield:
Many say that the special liquid covering this
Pokémon’s body would allow it to survive in
the vacuum of space.

entries.black:
Since they have two divided brains,
at times they suddenly try to take two
different actions at once.
entries.white:
When their brains, now divided in two,
are thinking the same thoughts, these
Pokémon exhibit their maximum power.
entries.black-2:
When their two divided brains
think the same thoughts,
their psychic power is maximized.
entries.white-2:
When their two divided brains
think the same thoughts,
their psychic power is maximized.

suddenly try to take two different actions at once.

When their two divided brains think the same

entries.sword:
Its psychic power can supposedly cover a range
of more than half a mile—but only if its two
brains can agree with each other.
entries.shield:
Its brain has split into two, and the two
halves rarely think alike. Its actions are
utterly unpredictable.

entries.black:
When Reuniclus shake hands, a network
forms between their brains, increasing
their psychic power.
entries.white:
These remarkably intelligent Pokémon
fight by controlling arms that can
grip with rock-crushing power.
entries.black-2:
They use psychic power to control their
arms, which are made of a special liquid.
They can crush boulders psychically.
entries.white-2:
They use psychic power to control their
arms, which are made of a special liquid.
They can crush boulders psychically.

psychic power.
entries.sword:
While it could use its psychic abilities in battle,
this Pokémon prefers to swing its powerful arms
around to beat opponents into submission.
entries.shield:
It’s said that drinking the liquid surrounding
Reuniclus grants wisdom. Problem is, the liquid is
highly toxic to anything besides Reuniclus itself.

its space.

its territory.

trustworthy na­
ture. It fear­ lessly stands up
to bigger and
stronger foes.

it will fearlessly
bark at any oppo­ nent to protect
its own trainer
from harm.
entries.crystal:
It controls a big
territory. If it
detects an unknown smell, it roars
loudly to force
out the intruder.
entries.ruby:
GROWLITHE has a superb sense of smell.
Once it smells anything, this POKéMON
won’t forget the scent, no matter what. It uses its advanced olfactory sense
to determine the emotions of other
living things.

won’t forget the scent, no matter what. It uses its advanced olfactory sense
to determine the emotions of other
living things.

Its superb sense of smell ensures that
this POKéMON won’t forget any scent,
no matter what. It uses its sense of smell
to detect the emotions of others.
entries.firered:
Very friendly and faithful to people.
It will try to repel enemies by barking
and biting.
entries.leafgreen:
It is very protective of its territory.
It will bark and bite to repel intruders
from its space.

given an order by its Trainer.

entries.sun:
It’s both clever and loyal, but if a stranger tries
to invade its territory, it barks threateningly.
entries.moon:
It looks cute, but when you approach another
Trainer’s Growlithe, it will bark at you and bite.
entries.ultra-sun:
While it’s quite friendly toward humans once it’s
grown used to them, in the wild it must be quite
fierce to defend its territory from Rockruff.
entries.ultra-moon:
It has lived alongside humans since ages ago.
Its bones have been found in excavations of
ruins from the Stone Age.

entries.shield:
Extremely loyal, it will fearlessly bark at any

entries.legends-arceus:
They patrol their territory in pairs. I believe the igneous
rock components in the fur of this species are the result of
volcanic activity in its habitat.

entries.black:
These bird Pokémon are excellent divers.
They swim around in the water eating
their favorite food--peat moss.
entries.white:
When attacked, it uses its feathers
to splash water, escaping under cover
of the spray.
entries.black-2:
They are better at swimming than flying,
and they happily eat their favorite food,
peat moss, as they dive underwater.
entries.white-2:
They are better at swimming than flying,
and they happily eat their favorite food,
peat moss, as they dive underwater.
entries.x:
When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water,
escaping under cover of the spray.
entries.y:
They are better at swimming than flying, and they
happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they
dive underwater.
entries.omega-ruby:
When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water,
escaping under cover of the spray.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
They are better at swimming than flying, and they
happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they
dive underwater.

entries.black:
Swanna start to dance at dusk.
The one dancing in the middle is
the leader of the flock.
entries.white:
It administers sharp, powerful pecks
with its bill. It whips its long neck to
deliver forceful repeated strikes.
entries.black-2:
Despite their elegant appearance,
they can flap their wings strongly
and fly for thousands of miles.
entries.white-2:
Despite their elegant appearance,
they can flap their wings strongly
and fly for thousands of miles.

entries.black:
The temperature of their breath
is -58° F. They create snow crystals and
make snow fall in the areas around them.
entries.white:
This Pokémon formed from icicles
bathed in energy from the morning sun.
It sleeps buried in snow.
entries.black-2:
Theoretically, this Pokémon formed from
icicles bathed in energy from the morning
sun. Their breath is -58° F.
entries.white-2:
Theoretically, this Pokémon formed from
icicles bathed in energy from the morning
sun. Their breath is -58° F.
entries.x:
The temperature of their breath is -58 degrees
Fahrenheit. They create snow crystals and make
snow fall in the areas around them.
entries.y:
This Pokémon formed from icicles bathed in energy
from the morning sun. It sleeps buried in snow.
entries.omega-ruby:
The temperature of their breath is -58 degrees
Fahrenheit. They create snow crystals and make
snow fall in the areas around them.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
This Pokémon formed from icicles bathed in energy

entries.sun:
Born of an icicle, this Pokémon uses its frosty
breath to make ice crystals, causing snow
to fall.
entries.moon:
It feels pleasantly cool when embraced. This
Pokémon is treasured by households in
warm regions.
entries.ultra-sun:
It exhales cold air that is at –58 degrees
Fahrenheit. When it’s in a warm place, it shrinks
little by little.
entries.ultra-moon:
When the morning sun hit an icicle, it wished not
to melt, and thus Vanillite was born. At night, it
buries itself in snow to sleep.
entries.sword:
Unable to survive in hot areas, it makes itself
comfortable by breathing out air cold enough to
cause snow. It burrows into the snow to sleep.
entries.shield:
Supposedly, this Pokémon was born from an
icicle. It spews out freezing air at −58 degrees
Fahrenheit to make itself more comfortable.

entries.black:
Snowy mountains are this Pokémon’s
habitat. During an ancient ice age, they
moved to southern areas.
entries.white:
It conceals itself from enemy eyes
by creating many small ice particles
and hiding among them.
entries.black-2:
They cool down the surrounding air
and create ice particles, which
they use to freeze their foes.
entries.white-2:
They cool down the surrounding air
and create ice particles, which
they use to freeze their foes.
entries.x:
They cool down the surrounding air and create ice
particles, which they use to freeze their foes.
entries.y:
Snowy mountains are this Pokémon’s habitat.
During an ancient ice age, they moved to
southern areas.
entries.omega-ruby:
They cool down the surrounding air and create ice
particles, which they use to freeze their foes.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Snowy mountains are this Pokémon’s habitat.
During an ancient ice age, they moved to
southern areas.
entries.sun:
Hot days cause its body to melt. It can be
restored by refreezing it, but the process
leaves its body slightly warped.
entries.moon:
This Pokémon has existed since the Ice Age. It
controls particles of ice, freezes its opponents,
and then shatters them with a headbutt.
entries.ultra-sun:
It sprays its enemies with grains of ice to freeze
them. Most Vanillish in Alola are smaller
than average.
entries.ultra-moon:
This hearty Pokémon survived the Ice Age.
It’s incredibly popular in very hot regions.
entries.sword:
By drinking pure water, it grows its icy body.
This Pokémon can be hard to find on days with
warm, sunny weather.
entries.shield:
It blasts enemies with cold air reaching −148
degrees Fahrenheit, freezing them solid. But it
spares their lives afterward—it’s a kind Pokémon.

entries.black:
Swallowing large amounts of water, they
make snow clouds inside their bodies and
attack their foes with violent blizzards.
entries.white:
If both heads get angry simultaneously,
this Pokémon expels a blizzard, burying
everything in snow.
entries.black-2:
Swallowing large amounts of water, they
make snow clouds inside their bodies and,
when angry, cause violent blizzards.
entries.white-2:
Swallowing large amounts of water, they
make snow clouds inside their bodies and,
when angry, cause violent blizzards.
entries.x:
If both heads get angry simultaneously, this
Pokémon expels a blizzard, burying everything
in snow.
entries.y:
Swallowing large amounts of water, they make
snow clouds inside their bodies and, when angry,
cause violent blizzards.
entries.omega-ruby:
If both heads get angry simultaneously, this
Pokémon expels a blizzard, burying everything
in snow.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Swallowing large amounts of water, they make
snow clouds inside their bodies and, when angry,
cause violent blizzards.
entries.sun:
Each of its two heads has a brain, and when
they are in agreement, it attacks its enemies
by exhaling a violent blizzard.
entries.moon:
Even if it loses one of its heads, it can live
relatively problem-free. It makes snow clouds
inside its body.
entries.ultra-sun:
It blasts blizzards from its two mouths. It can
create snow anywhere, so it gets a lot of love
from skiers and snowboarders.
entries.ultra-moon:
Vanilluxe is born when two Vanillish, half-melted
by the day’s light, stick to each other and
freeze together in the cold return of night.
entries.sword:
When its anger reaches a breaking point, this
Pokémon unleashes a fierce blizzard that freezes
every creature around it, be they friend or foe.
entries.shield:
People believe this Pokémon formed when two
Vanillish stuck together. Its body temperature is
roughly 21 degrees Fahrenheit.

entries.black:
The color and scent of their fur changes
to match the mountain grass. When they
sense hostility, they hide in the grass.
entries.white:
The turning of the seasons changes the
color and scent of this Pokémon’s fur.
People use it to mark the seasons.
entries.black-2:
Their coloring changes according to the
seasons and can be slightly affected by
the temperature and humidity as well.
entries.white-2:
Their coloring changes according to the
seasons and can be slightly affected by
the temperature and humidity as well.
entries.x:
Their coloring changes according to the seasons
and can be slightly affected by the temperature and
humidity as well.
entries.y:
The turning of the seasons changes the color and
scent of this Pokémon’s fur. People use it to mark
the seasons.
entries.omega-ruby:
Their coloring changes according to the seasons
and can be slightly affected by the temperature and

entries.alpha-sapphire:
The turning of the seasons changes the color and
scent of this Pokémon’s fur. People use it to mark
the seasons.

entries.black:
They migrate according to the seasons.
People can tell the season by looking at
Sawsbuck’s horns.
entries.white:
The plants growing on its horns change
according to the season. The leaders of
the herd possess magnificent horns.
entries.black-2:
They migrate according to the seasons,
so some people call Sawsbuck
the harbingers of spring.
entries.white-2:
They migrate according to the seasons,
so some people call Sawsbuck
the harbingers of spring.

entries.black:
The energy made in its cheeks’ electric
pouches is stored inside its membrane
and released while it is gliding.
entries.white:
They live on treetops and glide using
the inside of a cape-like membrane
while discharging electricity.
entries.black-2:
It glides on its outstretched membrane
while shocking foes with the electricity
stored in the pouches on its cheeks.
entries.white-2:
It glides on its outstretched membrane
while shocking foes with the electricity
stored in the pouches on its cheeks.

entries.sun:
It glides using its cape-like membrane.
Electrical energy scatters from it, shocking
its friends and foes alike.
entries.moon:
It grills berries and bug Pokémon with electric
shocks and makes a meal of them. It usually
nests in the holes gouged in trees by Pikipek.
entries.ultra-sun:
They store up electricity to fly through the air.
When thunder cracks at night, sometimes there
are almost enough of them to blot out the sky.
entries.ultra-moon:
As it flies, it scatters electricity around, so bird
Pokémon keep their distance. That’s why
Emolga can keep all its food to itself.
entries.sword:
As Emolga flutters through the air, it crackles
with electricity. This Pokémon is cute, but it can
cause a lot of trouble.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon absolutely loves sweet berries.
Sometimes it stuffs its cheeks full of so much
food that it can’t fly properly.

entries.black:
These mysterious Pokémon evolve when
they receive electrical stimulation while
they are in the same place as Shelmet.
entries.white:
When they feel threatened, they spit
an acidic liquid to drive attackers away.
This Pokémon targets Shelmet.
entries.black-2:
For some reason they evolve when
they receive electrical energy while
they are attacking Shelmet.
entries.white-2:
For some reason they evolve when
they receive electrical energy while
they are attacking Shelmet.

receive electrical stimulation while they are in the

For some reason they evolve when they receive

entries.sword:
Its strange physiology reacts to electrical energy
in interesting ways. The presence of a Shelmet
will cause this Pokémon to evolve.
entries.shield:
It spits a liquid from its mouth to melt through
Shelmet’s shell. Karrablast doesn’t eat the shell—
it eats only the contents.

entries.black:
They fly around at high speed, striking
with their pointed spears. Even when in
trouble, they face opponents bravely.
entries.white:
These Pokémon evolve by wearing the
shell covering of a Shelmet. The steel
armor protects their whole body.
entries.black-2:
Wearing the shell covering they stole
from Shelmet, they defend themselves
and attack with two lances.
entries.white-2:
Wearing the shell covering they stole
from Shelmet, they defend themselves
and attack with two lances.

they defend themselves and attack with two lances.

their whole body.
entries.sword:
They use shells they’ve stolen from Shelmet
to arm and protect themselves. They’re very
popular Pokémon in the Galar region.
entries.shield:
It charges its enemies, lances at the ready.
An image of one of its duels is captured in a famous
painting of Escavalier clashing with Sirfetch’d.

entries.red:
A POKéMON that
has been admired
since the past for its beauty.
It runs agilely
as if on wings.
entries.blue:
A POKéMON that
has been admired
since the past for its beauty.
It runs agilely
as if on wings.
entries.yellow:
A legendary POKé­
MON in China.
Many people are charmed by its
grace and beauty
while running.
entries.gold:
This legendary
Chinese POKEMON is
considered magnif­ icent. Many people
are enchanted by
its grand mane.
entries.silver:
Its magnificent
bark conveys a
sense of majesty. Anyone hearing it
can't help but
grovel before it.
entries.crystal:
An ancient picture
scroll shows that
people were attracted to its
movement as it ran
through prairies.
entries.ruby:
ARCANINE is known for its high speed.
It is said to be capable of running over
6,200 miles in a single day and night. The fire that blazes wildly within this
POKéMON’s body is its source of power.

POKéMON’s body is its source of power.

over 6,200 miles in a single day and night.
The fire that blazes wildly within its body
is its source of power.
entries.firered:
A POKéMON that is described in Chinese
legends. It is said to race at an
unbelievable speed.
entries.leafgreen:
A POKéMON that has long been admired
for its beauty. It runs agilely as if
on wings.

has captured the hearts of
people since long ago.
