entries.sun:
Overflowing with beauty and majesty,
this strong Pokémon appears in ancient
Eastern folklore.
entries.moon:
The fire burning inside its body serves as the
energy to fuel it as it runs great distances.
It appears in many legends.
entries.ultra-sun:
Legends tell of its fighting alongside a general
and conquering a whole country.
entries.ultra-moon:
There are so many old tales about them that
they’re called legendary Pokémon, but there are
way more of them around than you’d expect.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
A legendary Pokémon in the East. Many people
are charmed by the grace and beauty of
its running.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
A legendary Pokémon in the East. Many people
are charmed by the grace and beauty of
its running.
entries.sword:
The sight of it running over 6,200 miles
in a single day and night has captivated
many people.
entries.shield:
A Pokémon that has long been admired for its
beauty. It runs agilely as if on wings.
entries.legends-arceus:
Snaps at its foes with fangs cloaked in blazing flame. Despite its
bulk, it deftly feints every which way, leading opponents on a
deceptively merry chase as it all but dances around them.

entries.black:
It lures people in with its Poké Ball
pattern, then releases poison spores.
Why it resembles a Poké Ball is unknown.
entries.white:
For some reason, this Pokémon resembles
a Poké Ball. They release poison spores
to repel those who try to catch them.
entries.black-2:
It lures Pokémon with its pattern
that looks just like a Poké Ball
then releases poison spores.
entries.white-2:
It lures Pokémon with its pattern
that looks just like a Poké Ball
then releases poison spores.

Poké Ball is unknown.

releases poison spores. Why it resembles a

It lures Pokémon with its pattern that looks just like
a Poké Ball, then releases poison spores.
entries.sword:
No one knows what the Poké Ball–like pattern on
Foongus means or why Foongus has it.
entries.shield:
The spores released from this Pokémon’s hands
are highly poisonous, but when thoroughly dried,
the spores can be used as stomach medicine.

entries.black:
It lures prey close by dancing and
waving its arm caps, which resemble
Poké Balls, in a swaying motion.
entries.white:
They show off their Poké Ball caps to
lure prey, but very few Pokémon are
fooled by this.
entries.black-2:
It moves the caps on both arms
and does a dance to lure prey.
It prefers damp places.
entries.white-2:
It moves the caps on both arms
and does a dance to lure prey.
It prefers damp places.

They show off their Poké Ball caps to lure prey,
but very few Pokémon are fooled by this.

arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a
swaying motion.

but very few Pokémon are fooled by this.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
It lures prey close by dancing and waving its
arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a
swaying motion.
entries.sword:
This Pokémon puffs poisonous spores at its foes.
If the spores aren’t washed off quickly, they’ll
grow into mushrooms wherever they land.
entries.shield:
Amoonguss generally doesn’t move much. It
tends to stand still near Poké Balls that have
been dropped on the ground.

entries.black:
With its thin, veil-like arms wrapped
around the body of its opponent,
it sinks to the ocean floor.
entries.white:
They paralyze prey with poison,
then drag them down to their lairs,
five miles below the surface.
entries.black-2:
If its veil-like arms stun and wrap
a foe, that foe will be dragged miles
below the surface, never to return.
entries.white-2:
If its veil-like arms stun and wrap
a foe, that foe will be dragged miles
below the surface, never to return.

entries.ultra-sun:
It wraps its veillike arms and legs around prey
swimming by and drags them down to the
depths of the ocean.
entries.ultra-moon:
Using the invisible poison spikes on its veillike
arms and legs, it paralyzes its enemies and
causes them to drown.
entries.sword:
It envelops its prey in its veillike arms and draws
it down to the deeps, five miles below the
ocean’s surface.
entries.shield:
Legend has it that the residents of a sunken
ancient city changed into these Pokémon.

entries.black:
The fate of the ships and crew that
wander into Jellicent’s habitat:
all sunken, all lost, all vanished.
entries.white:
They propel themselves by expelling
absorbed seawater from their bodies.
Their favorite food is life energy.
entries.black-2:
Its body is mostly seawater.
It’s said there’s a castle of ships
Jellicent have sunk on the seafloor.
entries.white-2:
Its body is mostly seawater.
It’s said there’s a castle of ships
Jellicent have sunk on the seafloor.
entries.x:
Its body is mostly seawater. It’s said there’s a
castle of ships Jellicent have sunk on the seafloor.
entries.y:
The fate of the ships and crew that wander into
Jellicent’s habitat: all sunken, all lost, all vanished.
entries.omega-ruby:
Its body is mostly seawater. It’s said there’s a

entries.alpha-sapphire:

entries.ultra-sun:
Jellicent is always hanging around fancy cruise
ships and tankers, hoping to drag away its prey.
entries.ultra-moon:
Fishermen are terrified of Jellicent.
It’s rumored to drag them into the sea
and steal their lives away.
entries.sword:
Most of this Pokémon’s body composition is
identical to sea water. It makes sunken ships
its lair.
entries.shield:
Whenever a full moon hangs in the night sky,
schools of Jellicent gather near the surface of
the sea, waiting for their prey to appear.

entries.black:
The special membrane enveloping
Alomomola has the ability to heal wounds.
entries.white:
Floating in the open sea is how they live.
When they find a wounded Pokémon,
they embrace it and bring it to shore.
entries.black-2:
It gently holds injured and weak
Pokémon in its fins. Its special
membrane heals their wounds.
entries.white-2:
It gently holds injured and weak
Pokémon in its fins. Its special
membrane heals their wounds.
entries.x:
Floating in the open sea is how they live.
When they find a wounded Pokémon,
they embrace it and bring it to shore.
entries.y:
It gently holds injured and weak Pokémon in its
fins. Its special membrane heals their wounds.
entries.omega-ruby:
Floating in the open sea is how they live.
When they find a wounded Pokémon,
they embrace it and bring it to shore.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
It gently holds injured and weak Pokémon in its
fins. Its special membrane heals their wounds.
entries.sun:
It uses its special mucus to close the wounds of
injured Pokémon. The reason for this behavior
remains unknown.
entries.moon:
They float upon the open sea. Many water
Pokémon gather in the area around Alomomola.
entries.ultra-sun:
Fishermen take them along on long voyages,
because if you have an Alomomola with you,
there’ll be no need for a doctor or medicine.
entries.ultra-moon:
The reason it helps Pokémon in a weakened
condition is that any Pokémon coming after
them may also attack Alomomola.

entries.black:
Joltik that live in cities have learned
a technique for sucking electricity
from the outlets in houses.
entries.white:
They attach themselves to large-bodied
Pokémon and absorb static electricity,
which they store in an electric pouch.
entries.black-2:
Since it can’t generate its own
electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied
Pokémon and absorbs static electricity.
entries.white-2:
Since it can’t generate its own
electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied
Pokémon and absorbs static electricity.

entries.sword:
Joltik can be found clinging to other Pokémon.
It’s soaking up static electricity because it can’t
produce a charge on its own.
entries.shield:
Joltik latch on to other Pokémon and suck out
static electricity. They’re often found sticking to
Yamper’s hindquarters.

entries.black:
When attacked, they create an
electric barrier by spitting out
many electrically charged threads.
entries.white:
They employ an electrically charged web
to trap their prey. While it is immobilized
by shock, they leisurely consume it.
entries.black-2:
It creates barriers from electrified silk
that stun foes. This works as a weapon
as well as a defense.
entries.white-2:
It creates barriers from electrified silk
that stun foes. This works as a weapon
as well as a defense.

It launches electrified fur from its abdomen as its
means of attack. Opponents hit by the fur could
be in for three full days and nights of paralysis.
entries.shield:
It lays traps of electrified threads near the nests
of bird Pokémon, aiming to snare chicks that are
not yet good at flying.

entries.black:
When threatened, it attacks by
shooting a barrage of spikes, which gives
it a chance to escape by rolling away.
entries.white:
They stick their spikes into cave
walls and absorb the minerals
they find in the rock.
entries.black-2:
It absorbs the iron it finds in the
rock while clinging to the ceiling.
It shoots spikes when in danger.
entries.white-2:
It absorbs the iron it finds in the

entries.sword:
It defends itself by launching spikes, but its
aim isn’t very good at first. Only after a lot of
practice will it improve.
entries.shield:
Mossy caves are their preferred dwellings.
Enzymes contained in mosses help Ferroseed’s
spikes grow big and strong.

entries.black:
It fights by swinging around its three
spiky feelers. A hit from these steel
spikes can reduce a boulder to rubble.
entries.white:
They attach themselves to cave
ceilings, firing steel spikes at targets
passing beneath them.
entries.black-2:
By swinging around its three
spiky feelers and shooting spikes,
it can obliterate an opponent.

entries.sword:
This Pokémon scrapes its spikes across rocks,
and then uses the tips of its feelers to absorb
the nutrients it finds within the stone.
entries.shield:
Its spikes are harder than steel. This Pokémon
crawls across rock walls by stabbing the spikes
on its feelers into the stone.

entries.black:
The two minigears that mesh together
are predetermined. Each will rebound
from other minigears without meshing.
entries.white:
Interlocking two bodies and
spinning around generates
the energy they need to live.

Two bodies comprise a fixed pair.
They spin around each other
to generate energy.

Two bodies comprise a fixed pair.

to generate energy.

The two minigears that compose this Pokémon

each other.
entries.shield:
It’s suspected that Klink were the inspiration
behind ancient people’s invention of the
first gears.

entries.red:
Spits fire that
is hot enough to
melt boulders. Known to cause
forest fires
unintentionally.
entries.blue:

is hot enough to

blast of super
hot fire, the red flame at the tip
of its tail burns
more intensely.
entries.gold:
If CHARIZARD be­
comes furious, the
flame at the tip of its tail flares
up in a whitish-
blue color.
entries.silver:
Breathing intense,
hot flames, it can
melt almost any­ thing. Its breath
inflicts terrible
pain on enemies.
entries.crystal:
It uses its wings
to fly high. The
temperature of its fire increases as
it gains exper­
ience in battle.
entries.ruby:
CHARIZARD flies around the sky in
search of powerful opponents.
It breathes fire of such great heat that it melts anything. However, it
never turns its fiery breath on any
opponent weaker than itself.
entries.sapphire:

never turns its fiery breath on any

entries.emerald:
A CHARIZARD flies about in search of
strong opponents. It breathes intense
flames that can melt any material. However,
it will never torch a weaker foe.
entries.firered:
Its wings can carry this POKéMON close to
an altitude of 4,600 feet. It blows out
fire at very high temperatures.
entries.leafgreen:
It spits fire that is hot enough to melt
boulders. It may cause forest fires by

burns hotter if it has

entries.red:
Its newly grown
legs prevent it
from running. It appears to prefer
swimming than
trying to stand.
entries.blue:
Its newly grown
legs prevent it
from running. It appears to prefer

The direction of
the spiral on the
belly differs by area. It is more
adept at swimming
than walking.

Because it is in­
ept at walking on
its newly grown legs, it always 
swims around in
water.
entries.silver:
The direction of
its belly spiral
differs by area. The equator is
thought to have an
effect on this.
entries.crystal:
The swirl on its
belly is its
insides showing through the skin.
It looks clearer
after it eats.
entries.ruby:
POLIWAG has a very thin skin. It is
possible to see the POKéMON’s spiral
innards right through the skin. Despite its thinness, however, the skin
is also very flexible. Even sharp fangs
bounce right off it.

entries.sun:
The swirl on its belly is its internal organs
showing through. If the swirl is tinged white,
that means it’s affected by some disease.
entries.moon:
It’s still not very good at walking. Its Trainers
should train this Pokémon to walk every day.
entries.ultra-sun:
Despite the danger, it wants to come up on land.
So it does its best to waddle along, but when
an enemy finds it, it rushes back to the water.
entries.ultra-moon:
The direction of the swirl on their stomachs
differs depending on where they live. Poliwag
aficionados can tell them apart at a glance.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
The direction of the spiral on the belly differs by

entries.lets-go-eevee:
The direction of the spiral on the belly differs by

entries.sword:
For Poliwag, swimming is easier than walking.
The swirl pattern on its belly is actually part of
the Pokémon’s innards showing through the skin.
entries.shield:
In rivers with fast-flowing water, this Pokémon will
cling to a rock by using its thick lips, which act
like a suction cup.

entries.black:
By changing the direction in which it
rotates, it communicates its feelings to
others. When angry, it rotates faster.
entries.white:
Spinning minigears are rotated at high
speed and repeatedly fired away. It is
dangerous if the gears don’t return.
entries.black-2:
A minigear and big gear comprise its
body. If the minigear it launches at
a foe doesn’t return, it will die.

perfectly with the outer part of the big gear, and

entries.shield:
Many companies in the Galar region choose
Klang as their logo. This Pokémon is considered
the symbol of industrial technology.

entries.white:
The gear with the red core is
rotated at high speed for a
rapid energy charge.
entries.black:
Its red core functions as an energy
tank. It fires the charged energy
through its spikes into an area.
entries.black-2:

the energy from the red core charges
the minigear to make it ready to fire.

entries.shield:

entries.black:
While one alone doesn’t have much power,
a chain of many Tynamo can be as
powerful as lightning.

These Pokémon move in schools. They
have an electricity-generating organ, so
they discharge electricity if in danger.

electricity, so a group of them gathers
to unleash a powerful electric shock.

entries.black:

to squeeze its opponent’s brain,
causing unendurable headaches.

This Pokémon had never been seen until
it appeared from far in the desert
50 years ago.

Rumors of its origin are linked to a UFO
crash site in the desert 50 years ago.

This Pokémon is shrouded in mystery. It’s said
to have appeared from a UFO that fell from the
sky about 50 years ago.

will appear on the screen. That scenery is said

entries.shield:

ago. Its highly developed brain enables it to
exert its psychic powers.

Apparently, it communicates by flashing
its three different-colored fingers.

to control an opponent’s brain
and tamper with its memories.

The flame on its head keeps its body slightly
warm. This Pokémon takes lost children by the
hand to guide them to the spirit world.
entries.shield:
The younger the life this Pokémon absorbs,
the brighter and eerier the flame on its
head burns.

entries.black:
This ominous Pokémon is feared.
Through cities it wanders, searching
for the spirits of the fallen.
entries.white:
It arrives near the moment of death
and steals spirit from the body.
entries.black-2:
The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful
fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting
for people to pass on.
entries.white-2:
The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful

entries.sword:
This Pokémon appears just before someone
passes away, so it’s feared as an emissary
of death.
entries.shield:
It lurks in cities, pretending to be a lamp.
Once it finds someone whose death is near,
it will trail quietly after them.

entries.black:
It absorbs a spirit, which it then burns.
By waving the flames on its arms,
it puts its foes into a hypnotic trance.
entries.white:
Being consumed in Chandelure’s flame
burns up the spirit, leaving the
body behind.
entries.black-2:
The spirits burned up in its
ominous flame lose their way
and wander this world forever.
entries.white-2:
The spirits burned up in its
ominous flame lose their way
and wander this world forever.

entries.sword:
This Pokémon haunts dilapidated mansions.
It sways its arms to hypnotize opponents with
the ominous dancing of its flames.
entries.shield:
In homes illuminated by Chandelure instead of
lights, funerals were a constant occurrence—
or so it’s said.

less danger.

of any enemy in battle.

Although it can live on land, it prefers to stay in
the water, where it has fewer natural enemies.

It marches over the land in search of bug
Pokémon to eat. Then it takes them underwater
so it can dine on them where it’s safe.

Although it has become capable of living on
land, it spends its time in the water, where
its prey, fish Pokémon, are plentiful.

Staring at the swirl on its belly causes drowsiness.

This Pokémon’s sweat is a slimy mucus. When
captured, Poliwhirl can slither from its enemies’
grasp and escape.

entries.black:
They use their tusks to crush the
berries they eat. Repeated regrowth
makes their tusks strong and sharp.
entries.white:
They mark their territory by leaving
gashes in trees with their tusks. If a
tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.

Its large tusks have a tendency to
break, but each time they grow back,
they grow in harder and sturdier.
entries.white-2:
Its large tusks have a tendency to
break, but each time they grow back,
they grow in harder and sturdier.

and sharp.

These Pokémon nest in the ground and use their
tusks to crush hard berries. Crushing berries is
also how they test each other’s strength.
entries.shield:
They play with each other by knocking their large
tusks together. Their tusks break sometimes, but
they grow back so quickly that it isn’t a concern.

Since a broken tusk will not grow back,
they diligently sharpen their tusks on
river rocks after they’ve been fighting.
entries.white:
Their tusks can shatter rocks.
Territory battles between Fraxure
can be intensely violent.

After battle, this Pokémon carefully sharpens its
tusks on river rocks. It needs to take care of its
tusks—if one breaks, it will never grow back.
entries.shield:
Its skin is as hard as a suit of armor. Fraxure’s
favorite strategy is to tackle its opponents,
stabbing them with its tusks at the same time.

entries.black:
They are kind but can be relentless
when defending territory. They challenge
foes with tusks that can cut steel.
entries.white:
Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even
if used to cut steel beams. These
Pokémon are covered in hard armor.
entries.black-2:
Its tusks are incredibly destructive.
They can easily slice through a thick,
sturdy steel column every time.
entries.white-2:
Its tusks are incredibly destructive.
They can easily slice through a thick,
sturdy steel column every time.

entries.sword:
Its resilient tusks are its pride and joy. It licks up
dirt to take in the minerals it needs to keep its
tusks in top condition.
entries.shield:
While usually kindhearted, it can be terrifying if
angered. Tusks that can slice through steel beams
are how Haxorus deals with its adversaries.

entries.black:
When it is not feeling well, its mucus
gets watery and the power of its
Ice-type moves decreases.
entries.white:
Its nose is always running. It sniffs the
snot back up because the mucus
provides the raw material for its moves.
entries.black-2:
Their snot is a barometer of health.
When healthy, their snot is sticky and
the power of their ice moves increases.
entries.white-2:
Their snot is a barometer of health.

the power of their ice moves increases.

When this Pokémon is in good health, its snot

entries.shield:
It sniffles before performing a move, using its
frosty snot to provide an icy element to any
move that needs it.

entries.black:

Very able in the water, it swims around
in northern seas and catches prey.
entries.white:
It freezes its breath to create
fangs and claws of ice to fight with.
Cold northern areas are its habitat.
entries.black-2:
They love the cold seas of the north.
They create pathways across the ocean
waters by freezing their own breath.
entries.white-2:
They love the cold seas of the north.
They create pathways across the ocean

It swims through frigid seas, searching for prey.

are harder than steel.
entries.shield:
It swims energetically through frigid seas.
When it gets tired, it freezes the seawater
with its breath so it can rest on the ice.

entries.black:

turns into steam and vanishes. When its
temperature lowers, it returns to ice.
entries.white:
They are born in snow clouds.
They use chains made of
ice crystals to capture prey.
entries.black-2:
They are composed of ice crystals.
They capture prey with chains of ice,
freezing the prey at -148° F.

They are composed of ice crystals.

When the weather gets hot, these Pokémon turn

closing the lid of its shell. It can spit

It evolves when bathed in an
electric-like energy along with
Karrablast. The reason is still unknown.
entries.black-2:
When it and Karrablast are together,
and both receive electrical stimulation,
they both evolve.
entries.white-2:
When it and Karrablast are together,

When it and Karrablast are together, and both

entries.alpha-sapphire:
It evolves when bathed in an electric-like energy
along with Karrablast. The reason is still unknown.
entries.sword:
When attacked, it tightly shuts the lid of its shell.
This reaction fails to protect it from Karrablast,
however, because they can still get into the shell.
entries.shield:
It has a strange physiology that responds to
electricity. When together with Karrablast,
Shelmet evolves for some reason.

entries.black:
When its body dries out, it weakens.
So, to prevent dehydration, it wraps
itself in many layers of thin membrane.
entries.white:
Having removed its heavy shell,
it becomes very light and can fight
with ninja-like movements.
entries.black-2:
When its body dries out, it weakens.
So it wraps a membrane around itself
for protection while it spits poison.

entries.sword:
It moves with blinding speed and lobs poison at
foes. Featuring Accelgor as a main character is
a surefire way to make a movie or comic popular.
entries.shield:
Discarding its shell made it nimble. To keep
itself from dehydrating, it wraps its body in
bands of membrane.

entries.black:
Its skin is very hard, so it is unhurt
even if stepped on by sumo wrestlers.
It smiles when transmitting electricity.
entries.white:
It conceals itself in the mud of the
seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch
it, it delivers a jolt of electricity.
entries.black-2:
When its opponent can’t be paralyzed,
it contorts itself with unexpected speed
and flops away.
entries.white-2:

Thanks to bacteria that lived in the mud flats with
it, this Pokémon developed the organs it uses to
generate electricity.
entries.shield:
For some reason, this Pokémon smiles slightly
when it emits a strong electric current from the
yellow markings on its body.

entries.black:
In fights, they dominate with onslaughts
of flowing, continuous attacks. With
their sharp claws, they cut enemies.
entries.white:
They have mastered elegant combos.
As they concentrate, their battle moves
become swifter and more precise.
entries.black-2:
It takes pride in the speed at which it
can use moves. What it loses in power,
it makes up for in quantity.
entries.white-2:
It takes pride in the speed at which it
can use moves. What it loses in power,
it makes up for in quantity.

entries.alpha-sapphire:
In fights, they dominate with onslaughts of flowing,
continuous attacks. With their sharp claws, they
cut enemies.
entries.ultra-sun:
They can often be seen in packs in the morning,
slowly moving their bodies through a series
of poses.
entries.ultra-moon:
They seclude themselves in the mountains and
devote themselves to training. The form of their
kicks and chops differs from pack to pack.
entries.sword:
In one minute, a well-trained Mienfoo can chop
with its arms more than 100 times.
entries.shield:
Though small, Mienfoo’s temperament is fierce.
Any creature that approaches Mienfoo carelessly
will be greeted with a flurry of graceful attacks.

entries.red:
An adept swimmer
at both the front
crawl and breast stroke. Easily
overtakes the best
human swimmers.
entries.blue:
An adept swimmer
at both the front
crawl and breast stroke. Easily
overtakes the best
human swimmers.
entries.yellow:
Swims powerfully
using all the
muscles in its body. It can even
overtake champion
swimmers.
entries.gold:
This strong and
skilled swimmer is
even capable of crossing the
Pacific Ocean just
by kicking.
entries.silver:
Although an ener­
getic, skilled
swimmer that uses all of its mus­
cles, it lives on
dry land.
entries.crystal:
It can use its
well-developed
arms and legs to run on the surface
of the water for a
split second.
entries.ruby:
POLIWRATH’s highly developed, brawny
muscles never grow fatigued, however
much it exercises. It is so tirelessly strong, this POKéMON
can swim back and forth across the
Pacific Ocean without effort.

muscles never grow fatigued, however

can swim back and forth across the
Pacific Ocean without effort.

fatigued, however much it exercises.
This POKéMON can swim back and forth
across the Pacific Ocean without effort.
entries.firered:
An adept swimmer, it knows the front
crawl, butterfly, and more. It is faster
than the best human swimmers.
entries.leafgreen:
A swimmer adept at both the front crawl
and breaststroke. Easily overtakes the
best human swimmers.
entries.diamond:
With its extremely tough muscles,
it can keep swimming in the Pacific
Ocean without resting.

Poliwrath’s highly developed, brawny muscles never grow

entries.sun:
Poliwrath in the Alola region are strong
swimmers that use the breaststroke. Many
children learn to swim by imitating Poliwrath.
entries.moon:
Its percentage of body fat is nearly zero. Its
body is entirely muscle, which makes it heavy
and forces its swimming prowess to develop.
entries.ultra-sun:
It’s quite a gifted swimmer, even among
Water-type Pokémon, but it normally spends its
time on land.
entries.ultra-moon:
The muscles it has developed through swimming
are thick and powerful. When it lands a square
punch, it can turn huge boulders to dust.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Swims powerfully using all the muscles in its
body. It can even overtake world-class swimmers.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Swims powerfully using all the muscles in its
body. It can even overtake world-class swimmers.
entries.sword:
Its body is solid muscle. When swimming through
cold seas, Poliwrath uses its impressive arms to
smash through drift ice and plow forward.
entries.shield:
Poliwrath is skilled at both swimming and martial
arts. It uses its well-trained arms to dish out
powerful punches.

entries.black:
It wields the fur on its arms like a whip.
Its arm attacks come with such rapidity
that they cannot even be seen.
entries.white:
They use the long fur on their arms
as a whip to strike their opponents.
entries.black-2:
Using the long fur on its arms like whips,
it launches into combo attacks that,
once started, no one can stop.
entries.white-2:
Using the long fur on its arms like whips,
it launches into combo attacks that,
once started, no one can stop.

attacks come with such rapidity that they cannot
even be seen.

Using the long fur on its arms like whips, it
launches into combo attacks that, once started,
no one can stop.

attacks come with such rapidity that they cannot
even be seen.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Using the long fur on its arms like whips, it
launches into combo attacks that, once started,
no one can stop.
entries.ultra-sun:
It overwhelms its opponents with continuous
attacks and then slowly stores up power
before delivering the finishing blow.
entries.ultra-moon:
When Mienshao lets out a bizarre wail, you’re in
danger. A flurry of kicks and chops too fast to
see is about to be unleashed!
entries.sword:
When Mienshao comes across a truly challenging
opponent, it will lighten itself by biting off the
fur on its arms.
entries.shield:
Delivered at blinding speeds, kicks from this
Pokémon can shatter massive boulders into
tiny pieces.

entries.black:
It warms its body by absorbing sunlight
with its wings. When its body temperature
falls, it can no longer move.
entries.white:
It races through narrow caves, using
its sharp claws to catch prey. The skin
on its face is harder than a rock.
entries.black-2:
It runs through the narrow tunnels
formed by Excadrill and Onix.
It uses its sharp claws to catch prey.
entries.white-2:
It runs through the narrow tunnels
formed by Excadrill and Onix.
It uses its sharp claws to catch prey.
entries.x:
It races through narrow caves, using its sharp claws
to catch prey. The skin on its face is harder than
a rock.
entries.y:
It warms its body by absorbing sunlight with its
wings. When its body temperature falls, it can no
longer move.
entries.omega-ruby:
It races through narrow caves, using its sharp claws
to catch prey. The skin on its face is harder than
a rock.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
It warms its body by absorbing sunlight with its
wings. When its body temperature falls, it can no
longer move.
entries.ultra-sun:
The red skin on its face is harder than rock.
In narrow caves, it squares off against its
enemies and charges face-first right into them.
entries.ultra-moon:
It infiltrates tunnels that Pokémon like Diglett
and Dugtrio have dug and quietly waits for prey
to pass through.
entries.sword:
Druddigon lives in caves, but it never skips
sunbathing—it won’t be able to move if its body
gets too cold.
entries.shield:
Druddigon are vicious and cunning. They take up
residence in nests dug out by other Pokémon,
treating the stolen nests as their own lairs.

entries.black:
The energy that burns inside it
enables it to move, but no one has yet
been able to identify this energy.
entries.white:
These Pokémon are thought to have been
created by the science of an ancient
and mysterious civilization.
entries.black-2:
Ancient science fashioned this
Pokémon from clay. It’s been
active for thousands of years.
entries.white-2:
Ancient science fashioned this
Pokémon from clay. It’s been
active for thousands of years.
entries.x:
The energy that burns inside it enables it to move,
but no one has yet been able to identify
this energy.
entries.y:
Ancient science fashioned this Pokémon from clay.
It’s been active for thousands of years.
entries.omega-ruby:
The energy that burns inside it enables it to move,
but no one has yet been able to identify
this energy.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Ancient science fashioned this Pokémon from clay.
It’s been active for thousands of years.
entries.ultra-sun:
Its movements are powered by a mysterious
energy. It has continued to move since ancient
times, so its power may soon run out.
entries.ultra-moon:
Although ancient people apparently built it by
working with clay, the source of its energy
is unclear.
entries.sword:
They were sculpted from clay in ancient times.
No one knows why, but some of them are driven
to continually line up boulders.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon was created from clay. It received
orders from its master many thousands of years
ago, and it still follows those orders to this day.

entries.black:
It flies across the sky at Mach speeds.
Removing the seal on its chest makes
its internal energy go out of control.
entries.white:
It is said that Golurk were ordered
to protect people and Pokémon
by the ancient people who made them.
entries.black-2:
Golurk were created to protect
people and Pokémon.
They run on a mysterious energy.
entries.white-2:
Golurk were created to protect
people and Pokémon.
They run on a mysterious energy.
entries.x:
It is said that Golurk were ordered to protect
people and Pokémon by the ancient people who
made them.
entries.y:
It flies across the sky at Mach speeds. Removing
the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go
out of control.
entries.omega-ruby:
It is said that Golurk were ordered to protect
people and Pokémon by the ancient people who
made them.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
It flies across the sky at Mach speeds. Removing
the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go
out of control.
entries.ultra-sun:
Some say that ancient people invented Golurk
to serve as a laborer. It follows its master’s
orders faithfully.
entries.ultra-moon:
When the seal on its chest is removed, it rages
indiscriminately, turning the whole town around
it into a mountain of rubble.
entries.sword:
Artillery platforms built into the walls of ancient
castles served as perches from which Golurk
could fire energy beams.
entries.shield:
There’s a theory that inside Golurk is a perpetual
motion machine that produces limitless energy,
but this belief hasn’t been proven.

entries.black:
Blades comprise this Pokémon’s entire
body. If battling dulls the blades, it
sharpens them on stones by the river.
entries.white:
They fight at Bisharp’s command.
They cling to their prey and inflict
damage by sinking their blades into it.
entries.black-2:
Ignoring their injuries, groups attack
by sinking the blades that cover their
bodies into their prey.
entries.white-2:
Ignoring their injuries, groups attack
by sinking the blades that cover their
bodies into their prey.
entries.x:
Blades comprise this Pokémon’s entire body.
If battling dulls the blades, it sharpens them on
stones by the river.
entries.y:
Ignoring their injuries, groups attack by sinking
the blades that cover their bodies into their prey.
entries.omega-ruby:
Blades comprise this Pokémon’s entire body.
If battling dulls the blades, it sharpens them on
stones by the river.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Ignoring their injuries, groups attack by sinking
the blades that cover their bodies into their prey.
entries.ultra-sun:
After shredding its prey, it sharpens its blades
on a stone by the river. Each Pawniard has its
own favorite sharpening stone.
entries.ultra-moon:
It follows Bisharp’s orders to a tee when it
attacks enemies. After slashing an opponent,
Pawniard clangs both of its blades together.
entries.sword:
It uses river stones to maintain the cutting edges
of the blades covering its body. These sharpened
blades allow it to bring down opponents.
entries.shield:
A pack of these Pokémon forms to serve a
Bisharp boss. Each Pawniard trains diligently,
dreaming of one day taking the lead.

entries.black:
It leads a group of Pawniard.
It battles to become the boss, but will
be driven from the group if it loses.
entries.white:
Bisharp pursues prey in the company of a
large group of Pawniard. Then Bisharp
finishes off the prey.
entries.black-2:
This pitiless Pokémon commands a group
of Pawniard to hound prey into immobility.
It then moves in to finish the prey off.
entries.white-2:
This pitiless Pokémon commands a group
of Pawniard to hound prey into immobility.
It then moves in to finish the prey off.
entries.x:
This pitiless Pokémon commands a group of
Pawniard to hound prey into immobility. It then
moves in to finish the prey off.
entries.y:
Bisharp pursues prey in the company of a large
group of Pawniard. Then Bisharp finishes off
the prey.
entries.omega-ruby:
This pitiless Pokémon commands a group of
Pawniard to hound prey into immobility. It then
moves in to finish the prey off.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Bisharp pursues prey in the company of a large
group of Pawniard. Then Bisharp finishes off
the prey.
entries.ultra-sun:
No matter how strong the Bisharp, it’s said
that if the blade on its head is chipped, it will
retire from its position as the boss.
entries.ultra-moon:
It leads a group of Pawniard. Bisharp doesn’t
even change its expression when it deals
the finishing blow to an opponent.
entries.sword:
It’s accompanied by a large retinue of Pawniard.
Bisharp keeps a keen eye on its minions, ensuring
none of them even think of double-crossing it.
entries.shield:
Violent conflicts erupt between Bisharp and
Fraxure over places where sharpening stones
can be found.

entries.black:
Their fluffy fur absorbs damage,
even if they strike foes with a
fierce headbutt.
entries.white:
They charge wildly and headbutt
everything. Their headbutts have enough
destructive force to derail a train.
entries.black-2:
They are known to charge so wildly
that if a train were to enter their
territory, they would send it flying.
entries.white-2:
They are known to charge so wildly
that if a train were to enter their
territory, they would send it flying.
entries.x:
They charge wildly and headbutt everything.
Their headbutts have enough destructive force to
derail a train.
entries.y:
Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike
foes with a fierce headbutt.
entries.omega-ruby:
They charge wildly and headbutt everything.
Their headbutts have enough destructive force to
derail a train.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike
foes with a fierce headbutt.
entries.sword:
These Pokémon can crush a car with no more
than a headbutt. Bouffalant with more hair on
their heads hold higher positions within the herd.
entries.shield:
These Pokémon live in herds of about 20
individuals. Bouffalant that betray the herd will
lose the hair on their heads for some reason.

entries.omega-ruby:
They crush berries with their talons. They bravely
stand up to any opponent, no matter how strong
it is.
entries.black:
They crush berries with their talons.
They bravely stand up to any opponent,
no matter how strong it is.
entries.white:
They will challenge anything, even strong
opponents, without fear. Their frequent
fights help them become stronger.
entries.black-2:
It stands up to massive opponents, not
out of courage, but out of recklessness.
But that is how it gets stronger.
entries.white-2:
It stands up to massive opponents, not
out of courage, but out of recklessness.
But that is how it gets stronger.
entries.x:
They crush berries with their talons. They bravely
stand up to any opponent, no matter how strong
it is.
entries.y:
They will challenge anything, even strong
opponents, without fear. Their frequent fights help
them become stronger.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
They will challenge anything, even strong
opponents, without fear. Their frequent fights help
them become stronger.
entries.sun:
They pick fights indiscriminately. They grow
stronger and more powerful each time they
faint or are injured.
entries.moon:
With its sharp claws, this Pokémon pierces its
prey, and then it pecks at them. Although it also
consumes berries, it’s a carnivore at heart.
entries.ultra-sun:
With its powerful legs and sturdy claws, it can
crack even the hard shells of Shellder and pluck
out their insides.
entries.ultra-moon:
Known as a natural-born warrior, soon after its
hatching, it will challenge its parent to a fight in
order to gain their acceptance.
entries.sword:
If it spies a strong Pokémon, Rufflet can’t resist
challenging it to a battle. But if Rufflet loses,
it starts bawling.
entries.shield:
A combative Pokémon, it’s ready to pick a fight
with anyone. It has talons that can crush
hard berries.
entries.legends-arceus:
Its chick-like looks belie its hotheadedness. It challenges its
parents at every opportunity, desperate to prove its strength.

entries.black:
They fight for their friends without any
thought about danger to themselves.
One can carry a car while flying.
entries.white:
The more scars they have, the more
respect these brave soldiers of the sky 
get from their peers.
entries.black-2:
For the sake of its friends, this brave
warrior of the sky will not stop battling,
even if injured.
entries.white-2:
For the sake of its friends, this brave
warrior of the sky will not stop battling,
even if injured.
entries.x:
For the sake of its friends, this brave warrior of the
sky will not stop battling, even if injured.
entries.y:
They fight for their friends without any thought
about danger to themselves. One can carry a car
while flying.
entries.omega-ruby:
For the sake of its friends, this brave warrior of the
sky will not stop battling, even if injured.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
They fight for their friends without any thought
about danger to themselves. One can carry a car
while flying.
entries.sun:
With its brave disposition, it fears nothing—not
even death. Ancient Alolan people respected
it, referring to it as “the hero of the sky.”
entries.moon:
It’s thought that people disturbed their habitats
in the past, so Braviary banded together to
fight back.
entries.ultra-sun:
The more scars it has on its front, the more
heroic it’s considered to be. Those with many
scars on their back are mocked by the flock.
entries.ultra-moon:
Known as “the hero of the skies,” this
Pokémon is so proud and so brave that it will
never retreat, even when it’s injured.
entries.sword:
Known for its bravery and pride, this majestic
Pokémon is often seen as a motif for various
kinds of emblems.
entries.shield:
Because this Pokémon is hotheaded and
belligerent, it’s Corviknight that’s taken
the role of transportation in Galar.
entries.legends-arceus:
Screaming a bloodcurdling battle cry, this huge and ferocious
bird Pokémon goes out on the hunt. It blasts lakes with shock
waves, then scoops up any prey that float to the water's surface.

entries.y:
Their wings are too tiny to allow them to fly.
They guard their posteriors with bones that were
gathered by Mandibuzz.
entries.black:
Its wings are too tiny to allow it to fly.
As the time approaches for it to evolve,
it discards the bones it was wearing.
entries.white:
They tend to guard their posteriors
with suitable bones they have found.
They pursue weak Pokémon.
entries.black-2:
Their wings are too tiny to allow them to
fly. They guard their posteriors with
bones that were gathered by Mandibuzz.
entries.white-2:
Their wings are too tiny to allow them to
fly. They guard their posteriors with
bones that were gathered by Mandibuzz.
entries.x:
Its wings are too tiny to allow it to fly. As the time
approaches for it to evolve, it discards the bones
it was wearing.
entries.omega-ruby:
Its wings are too tiny to allow it to fly. As the time
approaches for it to evolve, it discards the bones
it was wearing.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Their wings are too tiny to allow them to fly.
They guard their posteriors with bones that were
gathered by Mandibuzz.
entries.sun:
It protects its plump posterior with the bones
of prey it has consumed. As it grows, it 
replaces the bones.
entries.moon:
It can’t fly yet and must wait until its wings have
developed more. Since it’s still at a playful age,
it hops around friskily.
entries.ultra-sun:
Mandibuzz gives it the bones it wears. Vullaby’s
wings are short, so it can’t fly yet, but it jumps
around, dreaming of wide open skies.
entries.ultra-moon:
Its healthy appetite leads to visible growth
spurts. It often has to replace the bones it
wears as its size increases.
entries.sword:
It wears a bone to protect its rear.
It often squabbles with others of its kind over
particularly comfy bones.
entries.shield:
Vullaby grow quickly. Bones that have gotten too
small for older Vullaby to wear often get passed
down to younger ones in the nest.

entries.red:
Using its ability
to read minds, it
will identify impending danger
and TELEPORT to
safety.
entries.blue:
Using its ability
to read minds, it
will identify impending danger
and TELEPORT to
safety.
entries.yellow:
Sleeps 18 hours a
day. If it senses
danger, it will teleport itself to
safety even as it
sleeps.
entries.gold:
It senses impend­
ing attacks and
TELEPORTS away to safety before the
actual attacks can
strike.
entries.silver:
If it decides to
TELEPORT randomly,
it creates the illusion that it
has created copies
of itself.
entries.crystal:
It hypnotizes
itself so that it
can teleport away when it senses
danger, even
if it is asleep.
entries.ruby:
ABRA sleeps for eighteen hours a day.
However, it can sense the presence of
foes even while it is sleeping. In such a situation, this POKéMON
immediately teleports to safety.
entries.sapphire:
ABRA needs to sleep for eighteen hours
a day. If it doesn’t, this POKéMON loses
its ability to use telekinetic powers. If it is attacked, ABRA escapes using
TELEPORT while it is still sleeping.
entries.emerald:
A POKéMON that sleeps 18 hours a day.
Observation revealed that it uses
TELEPORT to change its location once
every hour.
entries.firered:
It sleeps for 18 hours a day. It uses a
variety of extrasensory powers even
while asleep.
entries.leafgreen:
Using its ability to read minds, it will
sense impending danger and TELEPORT to
safety.
entries.diamond:
It sleeps for 18 hours a day.
Even when awake, it teleports
itself while remaining seated.
entries.pearl:
Even while asleep, it maintains a
telepathic radar. It teleports
when it is threatened.
entries.platinum:
Using its psychic power is such a
strain on its brain that it needs
to sleep for 18 hours a day.
entries.heartgold:
It senses impending attacks and
teleports away to safety before the
actual attacks can strike.
entries.soulsilver:
If it decides to teleport randomly,
it evokes the illusion that it
has created copies of itself.
entries.black:
Using its psychic power is such a
strain on its brain that it needs
to sleep for 18 hours a day.
entries.white:
Using its psychic power is such a
strain on its brain that it needs
to sleep for 18 hours a day.

Using its psychic power is such a
strain on its brain that it needs
to sleep for 18 hours a day.

It sleeps for 18 hours a day. It uses a variety of

entries.y:
It senses impending attacks and teleports away to
safety before the actual attacks can strike.
entries.omega-ruby:
Abra sleeps for eighteen hours a day. However, it can sense
the presence of foes even while it is sleeping. In such a
situation, this Pokémon immediately teleports to safety.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Abra needs to sleep for eighteen hours a day. If it doesn’t,
this Pokémon loses its ability to use telekinetic powers. If it is
attacked, Abra escapes using Teleport while it is still sleeping.
entries.sun:
It sleeps 18 hours a day. Even while sleeping,
it will teleport itself to treetops and pick and
eat berries there.
entries.moon:
It can teleport itself to safety while it’s asleep,
but when it wakes, it doesn’t know where it is,
so it panics.
entries.ultra-sun:
It uses various psychic powers even while it’s
sleeping, so you can’t tell whether or not
it’s awake.
entries.ultra-moon:
It can read others’ minds and will teleport away
when danger approaches. You must clear your
mind if you want to catch it.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Sleeps 18 hours a day. If it senses danger,
it will teleport itself to safety even as it sleeps.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Sleeps 18 hours a day. If it senses danger,
it will teleport itself to safety even as it sleeps.
entries.sword:
This Pokémon uses its psychic powers while it
sleeps. The contents of Abra’s dreams affect the
powers that the Pokémon wields.
entries.shield:
Abra can teleport in its sleep. Apparently
the more deeply Abra sleeps, the farther its
teleportations go.
entries.legends-arceus:
Spends 18 hours of the day sleeping. Even while asleep, Abra
can control its psychic powers—should danger approach, the
Pokémon will simply teleport away.

entries.black:
It makes a nest out of bones it finds.
It grabs weakened prey in its talons
and hauls it to its nest of bones.
entries.white:
Watching from the sky, they swoop to
strike weakened Pokémon on the ground.
They decorate themselves with bones.
entries.black-2:
They fly in circles around the sky.
When they spot prey, they attack and
carry it back to their nest with ease.
entries.white-2:
They fly in circles around the sky.
When they spot prey, they attack and
carry it back to their nest with ease.
entries.x:
They fly in circles around the sky. When they spot
prey, they attack and carry it back to their nest
with ease.
entries.y:
Watching from the sky, they swoop to strike
weakened Pokémon on the ground. They decorate
themselves with bones.
entries.omega-ruby:
They fly in circles around the sky. When they spot
prey, they attack and carry it back to their nest
with ease.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Watching from the sky, they swoop to strike
weakened Pokémon on the ground. They decorate
themselves with bones.
entries.sun:
They adorn themselves beautifully with bones.
This is supposedly an effort to attract males,
but no male Mandibuzz have ever been found.
entries.moon:
It circles in the sky, keeping a keen eye out for
Pokémon in a weakened state. Its choicest food
is Cubone.
entries.ultra-sun:
It skillfully arranges the bones of its prey to
construct its nest. Most of the bones
are Cubone.
entries.ultra-moon:
It’s always searching for food for Vullaby. When
it finds a weak Pokémon, Mandibuzz swoops it
right off to its nest.
entries.sword:
Although it’s a bit of a ruffian, this Pokémon will
take lost Vullaby under its wing and care for them
till they’re ready to leave the nest.
entries.shield:
They adorn themselves with bones. There seem
to be fashion trends among them, as different
bones come into and fall out of popularity.

entries.black:
It breathes through a hole in its tail
while it burns with an internal fire.
Durant is its prey.
entries.white:
Using their very hot, flame-covered
tongues, they burn through Durant’s
steel bodies and consume their insides.
entries.black-2:
It draws in air through its tail,
transforms it into fire, and uses it like
a tongue. It melts Durant and eats them.
entries.white-2:
It draws in air through its tail,
transforms it into fire, and uses it like
a tongue. It melts Durant and eats them.
entries.x:
Using their very hot, flame-covered tongues,
they burn through Durant’s steel bodies and
consume their insides.
entries.y:
It draws in air through its tail, transforms it into fire,
and uses it like a tongue. It melts Durant and
eats them.
entries.omega-ruby:
Using their very hot, flame-covered tongues,
they burn through Durant’s steel bodies and
consume their insides.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
It draws in air through its tail, transforms it into fire,
and uses it like a tongue. It melts Durant and
eats them.
entries.sword:
There’s a hole in its tail that allows it to draw in
the air it needs to keep its fire burning. If the
hole gets blocked, this Pokémon will fall ill.
entries.shield:
A flame serves as its tongue, melting through the
hard shell of Durant so that Heatmor can devour
their insides.

entries.black:
They attack in groups, covering
themselves in steel armor to
protect themselves from Heatmor.
entries.white:
Durant dig nests in mountains.
They build their complicated,
interconnected tunnels into mazes.
entries.black-2:
Individuals each play different roles in
driving Heatmor, their natural predator,
away from their colony.
entries.white-2:
Individuals each play different roles in
driving Heatmor, their natural predator,
away from their colony.
entries.x:
Individuals each play different roles in driving
Heatmor, their natural predator, away from
their colony.
entries.y:
They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel
armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.
entries.omega-ruby:
Individuals each play different roles in driving
Heatmor, their natural predator, away from
their colony.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel
armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.
entries.sword:
They lay their eggs deep inside their nests.
When attacked by Heatmor, they retaliate
using their massive mandibles.
entries.shield:
With their large mandibles, these Pokémon can
crunch their way through rock. They work
together to protect their eggs from Sandaconda.

entries.black:
It tends to bite everything, and it
is not a picky eater. Approaching it
carelessly is dangerous.
entries.white:
They cannot see, so they tackle and bite
to learn about their surroundings.
Their bodies are covered in wounds.
entries.black-2:
Lacking sight, it’s unaware of its
surroundings, so it bumps into things
and eats anything that moves.
entries.white-2:
Lacking sight, it’s unaware of its
surroundings, so it bumps into things
and eats anything that moves.

so it bumps into things and eats anything
that moves.
entries.omega-ruby:
They cannot see, so they tackle and bite to learn
about their surroundings. Their bodies are covered
in wounds.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Lacking sight, it’s unaware of its surroundings,
so it bumps into things and eats anything
that moves.
entries.sword:
When it encounters something, its first urge is
usually to bite it. If it likes what it tastes, it will
commit the associated scent to memory.
entries.shield:
Because it can’t see, this Pokémon is constantly
biting at everything it touches, trying to keep
track of its surroundings.

entries.alpha-sapphire:
After it has eaten up all the food in its territory,
it moves to another area. Its two heads do not
get along.
entries.black:
After it has eaten up all the food in
its territory, it moves to another
area. Its two heads do not get along.
entries.white:
Since their two heads do not get along
and compete with each other for food,
they always eat too much.
entries.black-2:
The two heads do not get along.
Whichever head eats more than
the other gets to be the leader.
entries.white-2:
The two heads do not get along.
Whichever head eats more than
the other gets to be the leader.
entries.x:
The two heads do not get along. Whichever head
eats more than the other gets to be the leader.
entries.y:
After it has eaten up all the food in its territory,
it moves to another area. Its two heads do not
get along.
entries.omega-ruby:
The two heads do not get along. Whichever head
eats more than the other gets to be the leader.
entries.sword:
While hunting for prey, Zweilous wanders its
territory, its two heads often bickering over
which way to go.
entries.shield:
Their two heads will fight each other over a
single piece of food. Zweilous are covered in
scars even without battling others.

entries.black:
This brutal Pokémon travels the skies on
its six wings. Anything that moves seems
like a foe to it, triggering its attack.
entries.white:
The heads on their arms do not have
brains. They use all three heads to
consume and destroy everything.
entries.black-2:
It responds to movement by attacking.
This scary, three-headed Pokémon
devours everything in its path!
entries.white-2:
It responds to movement by attacking.
This scary, three-headed Pokémon
devours everything in its path!
entries.x:
The heads on their arms do not have brains.
They use all three heads to consume and
destroy everything.
entries.y:
It responds to movement by attacking. This scary,
three-headed Pokémon devours everything in
its path!
entries.omega-ruby:
The heads on their arms do not have brains.
They use all three heads to consume and
destroy everything.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
It responds to movement by attacking. This scary,
three-headed Pokémon devours everything in
its path!
entries.sword:
There are a slew of stories about villages that
were destroyed by Hydreigon. It bites anything
that moves.
entries.shield:
The three heads take turns sinking their teeth into
the opponent. Their attacks won’t slow until their
target goes down.

entries.black:
This Pokémon was believed to have
been born from the sun. When it evolves,
its entire body is engulfed in flames.

of their battles, since they use their

and saved Pokémon from freezing.

entries.shield:

raging flames. Ancient murals depict Volcarona as
a deity of fire.

entries.black:

an unruly Pokémon obey it.

boy who couldn’t control his psychic powers

There are rumors that a child with mystical powers became
a Kadabra; however, this remains unverified. I suspect that
the spoon Kadabra holds enhances its brain waves.

cause headaches to anyone nearby.

Its brain cells continue to increase in number
until its death. The older the Alakazam, the
larger its head.

spoons it carries. Each spoon is an original that

that this Pokémon used these powers to create
the spoons it holds.

The longer Alakazam lives, the larger and heavier its head
becomes. Our tests have shown that the strength of its psychic
powers correlates positively to the weight of its head.

of a snack. It intimidates opponents

hotter than 390 degrees Fahrenheit.

of a snack. It intimidates opponents
by puffing hot air out of its ears.

twig on fire and launches into battle.
entries.y:

friction sets the twig alight. The flame
is used to send signals to its allies.

entries.x:

its branch to achieve a focused state,
which allows it to see into the future.
entries.y:
Using psychic power, it generates a
fiery vortex of 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit,
incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.

It protects its skin by covering its body in

it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

these stars can split metal in two.
entries.y:
It appears and vanishes with a ninja’s grace.
It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while
slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.

It has ears like shovels. Digging holes
strengthens its ears so much that they
can sever thick roots effortlessly.

can sever thick roots effortlessly.

It excels at digging holes. Using its ears, it can
dig a nest 33 feet deep in one night.
entries.shield:
It’s very sensitive to danger. The sound of
Corviknight’s flapping will have Bunnelby
digging a hole to hide underground in moments.

entries.red:

its muscles.
It trains in all styles of martial
arts to become
even stronger.

arts to become
even stronger.

Very powerful in
spite of its small
size. Its mastery of many types of
martial arts makes
it very tough.
entries.gold:
Always brimming
with power, it
passes time by lifting boulders.
Doing so makes it
even stronger.
entries.silver:
It loves to work
out and build its
muscles. It is never satisfied,
even if it trains
hard all day long.

It trains by
lifting rocks in
the mountains. It can even pick up a
GRAVELER with

entries.ruby:
MACHOP’s muscles are special - they
never get sore no matter how much they
are used in exercise. This POKéMON has sufficient power to
hurl a hundred adult humans.
entries.sapphire:
MACHOP exercises by hefting around
a GRAVELER as if it were a barbell.
There are some MACHOP that travel the world in a quest to master all
kinds of martial arts.
entries.emerald:
It continually undertakes strenuous
training to master all forms of martial
arts. Its strength lets it easily hoist
a sumo wrestler onto its shoulders.
entries.firered:
Its whole body is composed of muscles.
Even though it’s the size of a human
child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.

stronger.

It hefts a GRAVELER repeatedly to

uses every type of martial arts.
entries.pearl:
Its muscles never cramp however
much it trains. It lives in the

entries.platinum:
Though small in stature, it is
powerful enough to easily heft and
throw a number of GEODUDE at once.

it passes time by lifting boulders.

Machop’s muscles are special—they never get sore no matter

entries.alpha-sapphire:
Machop exercises by hefting around a Graveler as if it were

entries.sun:
It loves working out. As it gazes at its muscles,
which continue to swell day by day, it becomes
more and more dedicated to its training.
entries.moon:
With its superhuman strength, it’s able to throw
a hundred people all at the same time. Its
strength comes from lifting Graveler every day.
entries.ultra-sun:
Once this Pokémon has gained enough
confidence and muscle from training with its
friends, it challenges Makuhita to a battle.
entries.ultra-moon:
It likes food that’s highly nutritious because its
instincts drive it to build muscle efficiently.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Very powerful in spite of its small size.
Its mastery of many types of martial arts
makes it very tough.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Very powerful in spite of its small size.
Its mastery of many types of martial arts
makes it very tough.
entries.sword:
Its whole body is composed of muscles.
Even though it’s the size of a human child, it can
hurl 100 grown-ups.
entries.shield:
Always brimming with power, it passes time by
lifting boulders. Doing so makes it even stronger.
entries.legends-arceus:
Though as small as a child, it has strength enough to easily throw
a well-built adult. Striving to become ever stronger, Machop
trains by carrying a Graveler on its shoulders.

entries.x:
With their powerful ears, they can heft
boulders of a ton or more with ease.
They can be a big help at construction sites.
entries.y:
As powerful as an excavator, its ears
can reduce dense bedrock to rubble.
When it’s finished digging, it lounges lazily.
entries.omega-ruby:
With their powerful ears, they can heft
boulders of a ton or more with ease.
They can be a big help at construction sites.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
As powerful as an excavator, its ears
can reduce dense bedrock to rubble.
When it’s finished digging, it lounges lazily.
entries.sword:
With power equal to an excavator, it can dig
through dense bedrock. It’s a huge help during
tunnel construction.
entries.shield:
The fur on its belly retains heat exceptionally
well. People used to make heavy winter clothing
from fur shed by this Pokémon.

entries.x:
These friendly Pokémon send signals
to one another with beautiful chirps
and tail-feather movements.
entries.y:
Despite the beauty of its lilting voice, it’s
merciless to intruders that enter its territory.
entries.omega-ruby:
These friendly Pokémon send signals
to one another with beautiful chirps
and tail-feather movements.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Despite the beauty of its lilting voice, it’s
merciless to intruders that enter its territory.
entries.sun:
This amiable Pokémon is easy to train.
But when battle is joined, it shows its
ferocious side.
entries.moon:
When it’s excited, its temperature can double,
spiking hormone production in its body.
entries.ultra-sun:
While it’s an amiable Pokémon, if you touch it
unexpectedly, it will heat up its body in an
instant, and you’ll be burned.
entries.ultra-moon:
Its body is always warm. Trainers who live in
cold areas apparently sleep with it in their bed.
entries.sword:
Its melodious cries are actually warnings.
Fletchling will mercilessly peck at anything
that enters its territory.
entries.shield:
When this Pokémon gets excited, its body
temperature increases sharply. If you touch a
Fletchling with bare hands, you might get burned.

entries.x:
From its beak, it expels embers that set
the tall grass on fire. Then it pounces on
the bewildered prey that pop out of the grass.
entries.y:
The hotter the flame sac on its belly,
the faster it can fly, but it takes some
time to get the fire going.
entries.omega-ruby:
From its beak, it expels embers that set
the tall grass on fire. Then it pounces on
the bewildered prey that pop out of the grass.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
The hotter the flame sac on its belly,
the faster it can fly, but it takes some
time to get the fire going.
entries.sun:
From its beak, it fires embers at its prey. Once
it has caught them, it grills them at high heat
before feasting upon them.
entries.moon:
It will not tolerate other Fletchinder entering its
territory, which has a radius of several miles.
entries.ultra-sun:
It scatters embers in the tall grass. Then bug
Pokémon, frightened by the flames, come
flying out, and Fletchinder gobbles them up.
entries.ultra-moon:
Its speed right after takeoff already puts it in
the top speed class of all bird Pokémon.
entries.sword:
Fletchinder launches embers into the den of
its prey. When the prey comes leaping out,
Fletchinder’s sharp talons finish it off.
entries.shield:
Fletchinder are exceedingly territorial and
aggressive. These Pokémon fight among
themselves over feeding grounds.

entries.x:
In the fever of an exciting battle, it
showers embers from the gaps between
its feathers and takes to the air.
entries.y:
When attacking prey, it can reach speeds
of up to 310 mph. It finishes its prey off
with a colossal kick.
entries.omega-ruby:
In the fever of an exciting battle, it
showers embers from the gaps between
its feathers and takes to the air.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
When attacking prey, it can reach speeds
of up to 310 mph. It finishes its prey off
with a colossal kick.
entries.sun:
Its favorite foods are Wingull and Pikipek.
It attacks with a powerful kick and grasps them
firmly in its talons.
entries.moon:
It zooms directly at its prey at flight speeds of
close to 310 mph, while fiery embers scatter
from gaps in its feathers.
entries.ultra-sun:
Its tough wings don’t allow fire to pass through
them. A long time ago, firefighters’ outfits were
made from Talonflame wings.
entries.ultra-moon:
Bird Pokémon make up most of its diet.
It approaches at high speeds and smacks them
down to the ground with its powerful kick.
entries.sword:
Talonflame mainly preys upon other bird
Pokémon. To intimidate opponents, it sends
embers spewing from gaps between its feathers.
entries.shield:
Talonflame dives toward prey at speeds of up to
310 mph and assaults them with powerful kicks,
giving the prey no chance to escape.

entries.x:
When under attack from bird Pokémon,
it spews a poisonous black powder
that causes paralysis on contact.
entries.y:
The powder that covers its body
regulates its temperature, so it
can live in any region or climate.
entries.omega-ruby:
When under attack from bird Pokémon,
it spews a poisonous black powder
that causes paralysis on contact.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
The powder that covers its body
regulates its temperature, so it
can live in any region or climate.

entries.x:
It lives hidden within thicket shadows.
When predators attack, it quickly bristles the fur
covering its body in an effort to threaten them.
entries.y:
The beaks of bird Pokémon can’t begin
to scratch its stalwart body.
To defend itself, it spews powder.
entries.omega-ruby:

When predators attack, it quickly bristles the fur
covering its body in an effort to threaten them.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
The beaks of bird Pokémon can’t begin

entries.x:
Vivillon with many different patterns are
found all over the world. These patterns
are affected by the climate of their habitat.
entries.y:
The patterns on this Pokémon’s wings
depend on the climate and topography
of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.
entries.omega-ruby:
Vivillon with many different patterns are
found all over the world. These patterns
are affected by the climate of their habitat.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
The patterns on this Pokémon’s wings
depend on the climate and topography
of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.

entries.x:
The stronger the opponent it faces,
the more heat surges from its mane
and the more power flows through its body.
entries.y:
They set off on their own from their pride
and live by themselves to become stronger.
These hot-blooded Pokémon are quick to fight.
entries.omega-ruby:
The stronger the opponent it faces,
the more heat surges from its mane
and the more power flows through its body.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
They set off on their own from their pride
and live by themselves to become stronger.
These hot-blooded Pokémon are quick to fight.
entries.ultra-sun:
When they’re young, they live with a pride. Once
they’re able to hunt prey on their own, they’re
kicked out and have to make their own way.
entries.ultra-moon:
This hot-blooded Pokémon is filled with
curiosity. When it gets angry or starts
fighting, its short mane gets hot.

entries.x:
The male with the largest mane of fire
is the leader of the pride.
entries.y:
With fiery breath of more than 10,000 degrees
Fahrenheit, they viciously threaten any challenger.
The females protect the pride’s cubs.
entries.omega-ruby:
The male with the largest mane of fire
is the leader of the pride.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
With fiery breath of more than 10,000 degrees
Fahrenheit, they viciously threaten any challenger.
The females protect the pride’s cubs.
entries.ultra-sun:
The males are usually lazy, but when attacked
by a strong foe, a male will protect its friends
with no regard for its own safety.
entries.ultra-moon:
The temperature of its breath is over 10,000
degrees Fahrenheit, but Pyroar doesn’t use it on
its prey. This Pokémon prefers to eat raw meat.

entries.x:
It draws out and controls the hidden power
of flowers. The flower Flabébé holds
is most likely part of its body.
entries.y:
When it finds a flower it likes, it dwells on
that flower its whole life long. It floats in the
wind’s embrace with an untroubled heart.
entries.omega-ruby:
It draws out and controls the hidden power
of flowers. The flower Flabébé holds
is most likely part of its body.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
When it finds a flower it likes, it dwells on

entries.ultra-sun:
It’s not safe without the power of a flower, but
it will keep traveling around until it finds one
with the color and shape it wants.
entries.ultra-moon:
Flabébé wears a crown made from pollen it’s
collected from its flower. The crown has hidden
healing properties.

entries.red:
Its muscular body
is so powerful, it
must wear a power save belt to be
able to regulate
its motions.
entries.blue:
Its muscular body
is so powerful, it
must wear a power save belt to be
able to regulate
its motions.
entries.yellow:

its waist holds
back its energy. Without it, this
POKéMON would be
unstoppable.
entries.gold:
It always goes at
its full power,
but this very tough and durable
POKéMON never gets
tired.
entries.silver:
The muscles cover­
ing its body teem
with power. Even when still, it
exudes an amazing
sense of strength.
entries.crystal:
This tough POKéMON
always stays in
the zone. Its muscles become
thicker after
every battle.
entries.ruby:
MACHOKE’s thoroughly toned muscles
possess the hardness of steel.
This POKéMON has so much strength, it can easily hold aloft a sumo wrestler
on just one finger.
entries.sapphire:
MACHOKE undertakes bodybuilding every
day even as it helps people with tough,
physically demanding labor. On its days off, this POKéMON heads to
the fields and mountains to exercise
and train.
entries.emerald:
A belt is worn by a MACHOKE to keep its
overwhelming power under control.
Because it is so dangerous, no one has
ever removed the belt.
entries.firered:
Its formidable body never gets tired.
It helps people by doing work such as
the moving of heavy goods.
entries.leafgreen:
Its muscular body is so powerful, it must
wear a power-save belt to be able to
regulate its motions.
entries.diamond:
MACHOKE’s boundless power is very
dangerous, so it wears a belt that
suppresses its energy.
entries.pearl:
It can lift a dump truck with one
hand. Using that power, it helps
people with heavy jobs.
entries.platinum:
It happily carries heavy cargo to
toughen up. It willingly does hard
work for people.
entries.heartgold:
It always goes at its full power,
but this very tough and durable
Pokémon never gets tired.
entries.soulsilver:
The muscles covering its body teem
with power. Even when still, it

It can lift a dump truck with one hand. Using that
power, it helps people with heavy jobs.
