Its tail is large and covered with a rich,
thick fur. The tail becomes increasingly
deeper in color as WARTORTLE ages. The scratches on its shell are evidence
of this POKéMON’s toughness as a
battler.
entries.emerald:
Its large tail is covered with rich, thick
fur that deepens in color with age.
The scratches on its shell are evidence
of this POKéMON’s toughness in battle.
entries.firered:
This POKéMON is very popular as a pet.
Its fur-covered tail is a symbol of its
longevity.
entries.leafgreen:
It often hides in water to stalk unwary
prey. For fast swimming, it moves its
ears to maintain balance.
entries.diamond:
It is said to live 10,000 years.
Its furry tail is popular as a
symbol of longevity.
entries.pearl:
It is said to live 10,000 years.
Its furry tail is popular as a
symbol of longevity.
entries.platinum:
It is said to live 10,000 years.
Its furry tail is popular as a
symbol of longevity.
entries.heartgold:
It is a well-established symbol of
longevity. If its shell has algae on it,
that WARTORTLE is very old.
entries.soulsilver:
It cleverly controls its furry
ears and tail to maintain its
balance while swimming.
entries.black:
It is said to live 10,000 years.
Its furry tail is popular as a
symbol of longevity.
entries.white:
It is said to live 10,000 years.
Its furry tail is popular as a
symbol of longevity.
entries.black-2:
It is said to live 10,000 years.
Its furry tail is popular as a
symbol of longevity.
entries.white-2:
It is said to live 10,000 years.
Its furry tail is popular as a
symbol of longevity.
entries.x:
When tapped, this Pokémon will pull in its head,
but its tail will still stick out a little bit.
entries.y:
It is said to live 10,000 years. Its furry tail is
popular as a symbol of longevity.
entries.omega-ruby:
Its tail is large and covered with a rich, thick fur. The tail
becomes increasingly deeper in color as Wartortle ages.
The scratches on its shell are evidence of this Pokémon’s
toughness as a battler.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Its tail is large and covered with a rich, thick fur. The tail
becomes increasingly deeper in color as Wartortle ages.
The scratches on its shell are evidence of this Pokémon’s
toughness as a battler.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
When tapped on its head, this Pokémon will pull
it in, but its tail will still stick out a little bit.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
When tapped on its head, this Pokémon will pull
it in, but its tail will still stick out a little bit.
entries.sword:
It is recognized as a symbol of longevity. If its
shell has algae on it, that Wartortle is very old.
entries.shield:
It cleverly controls its furry ears and tail to
maintain its balance while swimming.

entries.red:
The SHELLDER that
is latched onto
SLOWPOKE's tail is said to feed
on the host's left
over scraps.
entries.blue:
The SHELLDER that
is latched onto
SLOWPOKE's tail is said to feed
on the host's left
over scraps.
entries.yellow:
Lives lazily by
the sea. If the
SHELLDER on its tail comes off,
it becomes a
SLOWPOKE again.
entries.gold:
If the tail-biting
SHELLDER is thrown
off in a harsh battle, it reverts
to being an ordi­
nary SLOWPOKE.
entries.silver:
Naturally dull to
begin with, it
lost its ability to feel pain due
to SHELLDER's
seeping poison.
entries.crystal:
An attached
SHELLDER won't let
go because of the tasty flavor that
oozes out of its
tail.
entries.ruby:
SLOWBRO’s tail has a SHELLDER firmly
attached with a bite. As a result, the
tail can’t be used for fishing anymore. This causes SLOWBRO to grudgingly swim
and catch prey instead.
entries.sapphire:
SLOWBRO’s tail has a SHELLDER firmly
attached with a bite. As a result, the
tail can’t be used for fishing anymore. This causes SLOWBRO to grudgingly swim
and catch prey instead.
entries.emerald:
Its tail has a SHELLDER firmly attached
with a bite. As a result, the tail can’t be
used for fishing anymore. This forces it
to reluctantly swim and catch prey.
entries.firered:
When a SLOWPOKE went hunting in the sea,
its tail was bitten by a SHELLDER. That
made it evolve into SLOWBRO.
entries.leafgreen:
The SHELLDER that latches onto
SLOWPOKE’s tail is said to feed on the
host’s leftover scraps.
entries.diamond:
Though usually dim witted, it
seems to become inspired if the
SHELLDER on its tail bites down.
entries.pearl:
Though usually dim witted, it
seems to become inspired if the
SHELLDER on its tail bites down.
entries.platinum:
Though usually dim witted, it
seems to become inspired if the
SHELLDER on its tail bites down.
entries.heartgold:
If the tail-biting SHELLDER is thrown
off in a harsh battle, it reverts to
being an ordinary SLOWPOKE.
entries.soulsilver:
Naturally dull to begin with, it
lost its ability to feel pain due
to SHELLDER’s seeping poison.
entries.black:
Though usually dim witted, it
seems to become inspired if the
Shellder on its tail bites down.
entries.white:
Though usually dim witted, it
seems to become inspired if the
Shellder on its tail bites down.
entries.black-2:
Though usually dim witted, it
seems to become inspired if the
Shellder on its tail bites down.
entries.white-2:
Though usually dim witted, it
seems to become inspired if the
Shellder on its tail bites down.
entries.x:
An attached Shellder won’t let go because of
the tasty flavor that oozes out of its tail.
entries.y:
When a Slowpoke went hunting in the sea, its tail
was bitten by a Shellder. That made it evolve
into Slowbro.
entries.omega-ruby:
Slowbro’s tail has a Shellder firmly attached with a bite.
As a result, the tail can’t be used for fishing anymore.
This causes Slowbro to grudgingly swim and catch
prey instead.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Slowbro’s tail has a Shellder firmly attached with a bite.
As a result, the tail can’t be used for fishing anymore. This
causes Slowbro to grudgingly swim and catch prey instead.
entries.sun:
It spaces out while gazing at the sea.
With Shellder’s poison flowing through its body,
it becomes even spacier.
entries.moon:
Whenever Shellder bites down hard on its tail,
it gives Slowbro a flash of inspiration...which it
forgets a moment later.
entries.ultra-sun:
Spacing out is basically all it does. It turns back
into Slowpoke if its tail, along with Shellder,
breaks off.
entries.ultra-moon:
Shellder, in its greed to suck out more and more
sweetness from Slowbro’s tail, has
metamorphosed into a spiral-shaped shell.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Lives lazily by the sea. If the Shellder on its tail
comes off, it becomes a Slowpoke again.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Lives lazily by the sea. If the Shellder on its tail
comes off, it becomes a Slowpoke again.
entries.sword:
Slowpoke became Slowbro when a Shellder bit
on to its tail. Sweet flavors seeping from the tail
make the Shellder feel as if its life is a dream.
entries.shield:
Being bitten by a Shellder shocked this Pokémon
into standing on two legs. If the Shellder lets go,
it seems Slowbro will turn back into a Slowpoke.

entries.sun:
Reminiscent of the Ultra Beasts, this life-form,
apparently asleep underground, is thought to
have come from another world in ancient times.
entries.moon:
Light is apparently the source of its energy.
It has an extraordinarily vicious disposition
and is constantly firing off laser beams.
entries.ultra-sun:
It looks somehow pained as it rages around in
search of light, which serves as its energy.
It’s apparently from another world.
entries.ultra-moon:
Light is the source of its energy. If it isn’t
devouring light, impurities build up in it and on it,
and Necrozma darkens and stops moving.
entries.sword:
It survives by absorbing light. After a long time
spent slumbering underground, impurities
accumulated within it, causing its body to darken.
entries.shield:
It needs light to survive, and it goes on a
rampage seeking it out. Its laser beams will
cut anything to pieces.

entries.sun:
This artificial Pokémon, constructed more than
500 years ago, can understand human speech
but cannot itself speak.
entries.moon:
Its mechanized body is merely a vessel. Its true
self is its Soul-Heart, an artificial soul.
entries.ultra-sun:
It synchronizes its consciousness with others
to understand their feelings. This faculty makes
it useful for taking care of people.
entries.ultra-moon:
Built roughly 500 years ago by a scientist,
the part called the Soul-Heart is the
actual life-form.

entries.sun:
Able to conceal itself in shadows, it never
appears before humans, so its very existence
was the stuff of myth.
entries.moon:
It lurks in the shadows of others, copying their
movements and powers. This Pokémon is craven
and cowering.
entries.ultra-sun:
It slips into the shadows of others and mimics
their powers and movements. As it improves, it
becomes stronger than those it’s imitating.
entries.ultra-moon:
It sinks into the shadows of people and
Pokémon, where it can understand their feelings
and copy their capabilities.
entries.sword:
By slipping into the shadow of a martial arts
master and copying their movements, this
Pokémon learned the ultimate techniques.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon can conceal itself in any shadow,
so it went undiscovered for a long time.

entries.ultra-sun:
This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be
chosen as a first partner in its own world.
entries.ultra-moon:
An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it
cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with
poison from the needles on its head.

entries.ultra-sun:
It stores hundreds of liters of poisonous liquid
inside its body. It is one of the organisms known
as UBs.
entries.ultra-moon:
One kind of Ultra Beast, it fires a glowing,
venomous liquid from its needles. This liquid
is also immensely adhesive.

entries.ultra-sun:
It appeared from an Ultra Wormhole. Each one
appears to be made up of many life-forms
stacked one on top of each other.
entries.ultra-moon:
When stone walls started moving and attacking,
the brute’s true identity was this mysterious
life-form, which brings to mind an Ultra Beast.

entries.ultra-sun:
It slithers toward people. Then, without warning,
it triggers the explosion of its own head.
It’s apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.
entries.ultra-moon:
A UB that appeared from an Ultra Wormhole, it
causes explosions, then takes advantage of
opponents’ surprise to rob them of their vitality.

entries.ultra-sun:
It electrifies its claws and tears its opponents
apart with them. Even if they dodge its attack,
they’ll be electrocuted by the flying sparks.
entries.ultra-moon:
It approaches its enemies at the speed of
lightning, then tears them limb from limb with
its sharp claws.
entries.sword:
It runs as fast as lightning strikes, shredding its
opponents with its high-voltage claws.
entries.shield:
Electricity sparks from the pads on its limbs.
Wherever Zeraora runs, lightning flashes and
thunder echoes.

entries.lets-go-pikachu:
It melts particles of iron and other metals found
in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its
body of molten steel.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
It melts particles of iron and other metals found
in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its
body of molten steel.
entries.sword:
It dissolves and eats metal. Circulating liquid
metal within its body is how it generates energy.
entries.shield:
They live as a group, but when the time comes,
one strong Meltan will absorb all the others
and evolve.

entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Revered long ago for its capacity to create iron
from nothing, for some reason it has come back
to life after 3,000 years.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Revered long ago for its capacity to create iron
from nothing, for some reason it has come back
to life after 3,000 years.
entries.sword:
At the end of its life-span, Melmetal will rust and
fall apart. The small shards left behind will
eventually be reborn as Meltan.
entries.shield:
Centrifugal force is behind the punches of
Melmetal’s heavy hex-nut arms. Melmetal is said
to deliver the strongest punches of all Pokémon.

entries.red:
Uses anti-gravity
to stay suspended.
Appears without warning and uses
THUNDER WAVE and
similar moves.
entries.blue:
Uses anti-gravity
to stay suspended.
Appears without warning and uses
THUNDER WAVE and
similar moves.
entries.yellow:
It is born with
the ability to
defy gravity. It floats in air on
powerful electro­
magnetic waves.
entries.gold:
It is attracted by
electromagnetic
waves. It may approach trainers
if they are using
their POKéGEAR.
entries.silver:
The units at the
sides of its body
generate anti­ gravity energy to
keep it aloft in
the air.
entries.crystal:
The electricity
emitted by the
units on each side of its body cause
it to become a
strong magnet.
entries.ruby:
MAGNEMITE attaches itself to power
lines to feed on electricity.
If your house has a power outage, check your circuit breakers. You may
find a large number of this POKéMON
clinging to the breaker box.
entries.sapphire:
MAGNEMITE floats in the air by emitting
electromagnetic waves from the units
at its sides. These waves block gravity. This POKéMON becomes incapable of
flight if its internal electrical supply
is depleted.
entries.emerald:
The units at its sides are extremely
powerful magnets. They generate enough
magnetism to draw in iron objects from
over 300 feet away.
entries.firered:
It moves while constantly hovering.
It discharges THUNDER WAVE and so on
from the units at its sides.
entries.leafgreen:
Uses antigravity to stay suspended.
Appears without warning and uses THUNDER
WAVE and similar moves.
entries.diamond:
The units at its sides generate
electromagnetic waves that keep it
airborne. It feeds on electricity.
entries.pearl:
The units at its sides generate
electromagnetic waves that keep it
airborne. It feeds on electricity.
entries.platinum:
The faster the units at its sides
rotate, the greater the magnetic
force they generate.
entries.heartgold:
It is attracted by electromagnetic
waves. It may approach Trainers
if they are using their Pokégear.
entries.soulsilver:
The units at the sides of its body
generate antigravity energy to
keep it aloft in the air.
entries.black:
The faster the units at its sides
rotate, the greater the magnetic
force they generate.
entries.white:
The faster the units at its sides
rotate, the greater the magnetic
force they generate.
entries.black-2:
The electromagnetic waves emitted by
the units at the sides of its head expel
antigravity, which allows it to float.
entries.white-2:
The electromagnetic waves emitted by
the units at the sides of its head expel
antigravity, which allows it to float.
entries.x:
The units at the sides of its body generate
antigravity energy to keep it aloft in the air.
entries.y:
It moves while constantly hovering. It discharges
Thunder Wave and so on from the units at its sides.
entries.ultra-sun:
It’s frequently the cause of power outages,
which is why some power plants send out
electrical signals that it can’t stand.
entries.omega-ruby:
Magnemite attaches itself to power lines to feed on electricity.
If your house has a power outage, check your circuit breakers.
You may find a large number of this Pokémon clinging to the
breaker box.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Magnemite floats in the air by emitting electromagnetic waves
from the units at its sides. These waves block gravity. This
Pokémon becomes incapable of flight if its internal electrical
supply is depleted.
entries.sun:
They gather in places where electricity is
available. They can be found clinging to the
steel towers used to support power lines.
entries.moon:
It sends out electromagnetic waves, which let it
float through the air. Touching it while it’s eating
electricity will give you a full-body shock.
entries.ultra-moon:
Perhaps because electrical lines are often
buried these days, the number of Magnemite
attacks on power plants has increased.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
It is hatched with the ability to defy gravity.
It floats while emitting powerful
electromagnetic waves.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
It is hatched with the ability to defy gravity.
It floats while emitting powerful
electromagnetic waves.
entries.sword:
At times, Magnemite runs out of electricity and
ends up on the ground. If you give batteries to a
grounded Magnemite, it’ll start moving again.
entries.shield:
It subsists on electricity. As Magnemite flies, it
emits electromagnetic waves from the units on
each side of its body.
entries.legends-arceus:
A bizarre Pokémon with but a single eye embedded in an iron
sphere. I suspect this creature levitates due to the magnetism it
emits from its arms, which resemble horseshoe-shaped magnets.

entries.sword:
When it uses its special stick to strike up a beat,
the sound waves produced carry revitalizing
energy to the plants and flowers in the area.
entries.shield:
It attacks with rapid beats of its stick.
As it strikes with amazing speed, it gets
more and more pumped.

entries.sword:
The faster a Thwackey can beat out a rhythm
with its two sticks, the more respect it wins from
its peers.
entries.shield:
When it’s drumming out rapid beats in battle, it
gets so caught up in the rhythm that it won’t even
notice that it’s already knocked out its opponent.

entries.sword:
By drumming, it taps into the power of its special
tree stump. The roots of the stump follow its
direction in battle.
entries.shield:
The one with the best drumming techniques
becomes the boss of the troop. It has a gentle
disposition and values harmony among its group.

entries.sword:
A warm-up of running around gets fire energy
coursing through this Pokémon’s body. Once that
happens, it’s ready to fight at full power.
entries.shield:
It has special pads on the backs of its feet, and
one on its nose. Once it’s raring to fight, these
pads radiate tremendous heat.

entries.sword:
Its thick and fluffy fur protects it from the cold
and enables it to use hotter fire moves.
entries.shield:
It kicks berries right off the branches of trees
and then juggles them with its feet, practicing
its footwork.

entries.sword:
It juggles a pebble with its feet, turning it into a
burning soccer ball. Its shots strike opponents
hard and leave them scorched.
entries.shield:
It’s skilled at both offense and defense, and it
gets pumped up when cheered on. But if it starts
showboating, it could put itself in a tough spot.

entries.sword:
When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack
the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers
won’t be able to resist weeping.
entries.shield:
When it gets wet, its skin changes color,
and this Pokémon becomes invisible as if
it were camouflaged.

entries.sword:
A clever combatant, this Pokémon battles using
water balloons created with moisture secreted
from its palms.
entries.shield:
Highly intelligent but also very lazy,
it keeps enemies out of its territory
by laying traps everywhere.

entries.sword:
It has many hidden capabilities, such as fingertips
that can shoot water and a membrane on its back
that it can use to glide through the air.
entries.shield:
Its nictitating membranes let it pick out foes’
weak points so it can precisely blast them with
water that shoots from its fingertips at Mach 3.

entries.sword:
Found throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon
becomes uneasy if its cheeks are ever completely
empty of berries.
entries.shield:
It eats berries nonstop—a habit that has made
it more resilient than it looks. It’ll show up on
farms, searching for yet more berries.

entries.red:
Formed by several
MAGNEMITEs linked
together. They frequently appear
when sunspots
flare up.
entries.blue:
Formed by several
MAGNEMITEs linked
together. They frequently appear
when sunspots
flare up.
entries.yellow:
Generates strange
radio signals. It
raises the tem­ perature by 3.6F
degrees within
3,300 feet.
entries.gold:
Three MAGNEMITE
are linked by a
strong magnetic force. Earaches
will occur if you
get too close.
entries.silver:
The MAGNEMITE are
united by a mag­
netism so power­ ful, it dries all
moisture in its
vicinities.
entries.crystal:
When many
MAGNETON gather
together, the resulting magnetic
storm disrupts
radio waves.
entries.ruby:
MAGNETON emits a powerful magnetic
force that is fatal to mechanical
devices. As a result, large cities sound sirens to warn citizens of large-scale
outbreaks of this POKéMON.
entries.sapphire:
MAGNETON emits a powerful magnetic
force that is fatal to electronics and
precision instruments. Because of this, it is said that some towns warn
people to keep this POKéMON inside
a POKé BALL.
entries.emerald:
It is actually three MAGNEMITE linked
by magnetism. It generates powerful radio
waves that raise temperatures by 3.6
degrees F within a 3,300-foot radius.
entries.firered:
A linked cluster formed of several
MAGNEMITE. It discharges powerful
magnetic waves at high voltage.
entries.leafgreen:
Formed by several MAGNEMITE linked
together. They frequently appear when
sunspots flare up.
entries.diamond:
It is actually three MAGNEMITE
linked by magnetism. A group can
set off a magnetic storm.
entries.pearl:
It is actually three MAGNEMITE
linked by magnetism. A group can
set off a magnetic storm.
entries.platinum:
Many mysteriously appear when more
sunspots dot the sun. They stop
TV sets from displaying properly.
entries.heartgold:
Three MAGNEMITE are linked by a
strong magnetic force. Earaches
will occur if you get too close.
entries.soulsilver:
The MAGNEMITE are united by a
magnetism so powerful, it dries all
moisture in its vicinity.
entries.black:
Many mysteriously appear when more
sunspots dot the sun. They stop
TV sets from displaying properly.
entries.white:
Many mysteriously appear when more
sunspots dot the sun. They stop
TV sets from displaying properly.
entries.black-2:
The stronger electromagnetic waves
from the three linked Magnemite are
enough to dry out surrounding moisture.
entries.white-2:
The stronger electromagnetic waves
from the three linked Magnemite are
enough to dry out surrounding moisture.
entries.x:
A linked cluster formed of several Magnemite.
It discharges powerful magnetic waves at
high voltage.
entries.y:
Generates strange radio signals. It raises the
temperature by 3.6 degrees Fahrenheit within
3,300 feet.
entries.omega-ruby:
Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to
mechanical devices. As a result, large cities sound sirens
to warn citizens of large-scale outbreaks of this Pokémon.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to
electronics and precision instruments. Because of this, it is
said that some towns warn people to keep this Pokémon
inside a Poké Ball.
entries.sun:
When three Magnemite link together, their brains
also become one. They do not become three
times more intelligent.
entries.moon:
It has about three times the electrical power of
Magnemite. For some reason, outbreaks of this
Pokémon happen when lots of sunspots appear.
entries.ultra-sun:
Delicate equipment can malfunction in areas
inhabited by Magneton, which send out
mysterious electrical signals.
entries.ultra-moon:
When rain clouds form, many Magneton gather
in high places to wait for lightning to strike.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Generates strange radio signals. It raises
the temperature by 3.6 degrees Fahrenheit
within 3,300 feet.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Generates strange radio signals. It raises
the temperature by 3.6 degrees Fahrenheit
within 3,300 feet.
entries.sword:
This Pokémon is three Magnemite that have
linked together. Magneton sends out powerful
radio waves to study its surroundings.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon is constantly putting out a powerful
magnetic force. Most computers go haywire when
a Magneton approaches.
entries.legends-arceus:
Three Magnemite gathered to evolve into this Pokémon.
The source of much vexation on my part, as its powerful
magnetism destroys my research equipment.

entries.sword:
It stashes berries in its tail—so many berries that
they fall out constantly. But this Pokémon is a bit
slow-witted, so it doesn’t notice the loss.
entries.shield:
Common throughout the Galar region, this
Pokémon has strong teeth and can chew
through the toughest of berry shells.

entries.sword:
It will bravely challenge any opponent, no matter
how powerful. This Pokémon benefits from every
battle—even a defeat increases its strength a bit.
entries.shield:
Jumping nimbly about, this small-bodied
Pokémon takes advantage of even the slightest
opportunity to disorient larger opponents.

entries.sword:
Smart enough to use tools in battle, these
Pokémon have been seen picking up rocks and
flinging them or using ropes to wrap up enemies.
entries.shield:
The lessons of many harsh battles have taught it
how to accurately judge an opponent’s strength.

entries.sword:
This Pokémon reigns supreme in the skies of the
Galar region. The black luster of its steel body
could drive terror into the heart of any foe.
entries.shield:
With their great intellect and flying skills, these
Pokémon very successfully act as the Galar
region’s airborne taxi service.

entries.sword:
A constant collector of information, this Pokémon
is very smart. Very strong is what it isn’t.
entries.shield:
Often found in gardens, this Pokémon has hairs
on its body that it uses to assess its surroundings.

entries.sword:
It barely moves, but it’s still alive. Hiding in its
shell without food or water seems to have
awakened its psychic powers.
entries.shield:
As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic
abilities to monitor the outside world and
prepare for evolution.

entries.sword:
It’s famous for its high level of intelligence, and
the large size of its brain is proof that it also
possesses immense psychic power.
entries.shield:
It emits psychic energy to observe and study
what’s around it—and what’s around it can
include things over six miles away.

entries.sword:
Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids
the food stores of other Pokémon. It survives off
its ill-gotten gains.
entries.shield:
Cunning and cautious, this Pokémon survives by
stealing food from others. It erases its tracks with
swipes of its tail as it makes off with its plunder.

entries.sword:
It secretly marks potential targets with a scent.
By following the scent, it stalks its targets
and steals from them when they least expect it.
entries.shield:
With a lithe body and sharp claws, it goes
around stealing food and eggs. Boltund
is its natural enemy.

entries.sword:
It anchors itself in the ground with its single leg,
then basks in the sun. After absorbing enough
sunlight, its petals spread as it blooms brilliantly.
entries.shield:
It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous
song. This delightful display has charmed many
into raising this Pokémon.

entries.red:
The sprig of
green onions it
holds is its weapon. It is
used much like a
metal sword.
entries.blue:
The sprig of
green onions it
holds is its weapon. It is
used much like a
metal sword.
entries.yellow:
Lives where reedy
plants grow. They
are rarely seen, so it's thought
their numbers are
decreasing.
entries.gold:
If anyone tries to
disturb where the
essential plant sticks grow, it
uses its own stick
to thwart them.
entries.silver:
If it eats the
plant stick it
carries as emer­ gency rations, it
runs off in search
of a new stick.
entries.crystal:
In order to pre­
vent their
extinction, more people have made
an effort to breed
these POKéMON.
entries.ruby:
FARFETCH’D is always seen with a stick
from a plant of some sort. Apparently,
there are good sticks and bad sticks. This POKéMON has been known to fight
with others over sticks.
entries.sapphire:
FARFETCH’D is always seen with a stick
from a plant of some sort. Apparently,
there are good sticks and bad sticks. This POKéMON has been known to fight
with others over sticks.
entries.emerald:
It is always seen with a stick from a plant.
Apparently, there are good sticks and bad
sticks. This POKéMON occasionally fights
with others over choice sticks.
entries.firered:
It always walks about with a plant stalk
clamped in its beak. The stalk is used for
building its nest.
entries.leafgreen:
The plant stalk it holds is its weapon.
The stalk is used like a sword to cut all
sorts of things.
entries.diamond:
It can’t live without the stalk it
holds. That’s why it defends the
stalk from attackers with its life.
entries.pearl:
It can’t live without the stalk it
holds. That’s why it defends the
stalk from attackers with its life.
entries.platinum:
It can’t live without the stalk it
holds. That’s why it defends the
stalk from attackers with its life.
entries.heartgold:
If anyone tries to disturb where the
essential plant stalks grow, it uses its
own stalk to thwart them.
entries.soulsilver:
If it eats the plant stalk it carries
as emergency rations, it runs off
in search of a new stalk.
entries.black:
It can’t live without the stalk it
holds. That’s why it defends the
stalk from attackers with its life.
entries.white:
It can’t live without the stalk it
holds. That’s why it defends the
stalk from attackers with its life.
entries.black-2:
It can’t live without the stalk it
holds. That’s why it defends the
stalk from attackers with its life.
entries.white-2:
It can’t live without the stalk it
holds. That’s why it defends the
stalk from attackers with its life.
entries.x:
The plant stalk it holds is its weapon. The stalk is
used like a sword to cut all sorts of things.
entries.y:
It always walks about with a plant stalk clamped in
its beak. The stalk is used for building its nest.
entries.omega-ruby:
Farfetch’d is always seen with a stalk from a plant of some
sort. Apparently, there are good stalks and bad stalks. This
Pokémon has been known to fight with others over stalks.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Farfetch’d is always seen with a stalk from a plant of some
sort. Apparently, there are good stalks and bad stalks. This
Pokémon has been known to fight with others over stalks.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
They live where reedy plants grow.
Farfetch’d are rarely seen, so it’s thought
their numbers are decreasing.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
They live where reedy plants grow.
Farfetch’d are rarely seen, so it’s thought
their numbers are decreasing.
entries.sword:
The stalk this Pokémon carries in its wings serves
as a sword to cut down opponents. In a dire
situation, the stalk can also serve as food.
entries.shield:
They use a plant stalk as a weapon, but not all
of them use it in the same way. Several distinct
styles of stalk fighting have been observed.

entries.sword:
The seeds attached to its cotton fluff are full of
nutrients. It spreads them on the wind so that
plants and other Pokémon can benefit from them.
entries.shield:
The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be
spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar
regional specialty.

entries.sword:
Its curly fleece is such an effective cushion that
this Pokémon could fall off a cliff and stand right
back up at the bottom, unharmed.
entries.shield:
If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo won’t be
able to move. Cloth made with the wool of this
Pokémon is surprisingly strong.

entries.sword:
Weave a carpet from its springy wool, and you end
up with something closer to a trampoline. You’ll
start to bounce the moment you set foot on it.
entries.shield:
Its majestic horns are meant only to impress the
opposite gender. They never see use in battle.

entries.sword:
Apparently the itch of its teething impels it to
snap its jaws at anything in front of it.
entries.shield:
It starts off battles by attacking with its rock-hard
horn, but as soon as the opponent flinches, this
Pokémon bites down and never lets go.

entries.sword:
With jaws that can shear through steel rods,
this highly aggressive Pokémon chomps down
on its unfortunate prey.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon rapidly extends its retractable neck
to sink its sharp fangs into distant enemies and
take them down.

entries.sword:
This Pokémon is very popular as a herding dog
in the Galar region. As it runs, it generates
electricity from the base of its tail.
entries.shield:
This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with
their work because it wants treats. As it runs,
it crackles with electricity.

entries.sword:
This Pokémon generates electricity and channels
it into its legs to keep them going strong.
Boltund can run nonstop for three full days.
entries.shield:
It sends electricity through its legs to boost their
strength. Running at top speed, it easily breaks
50 mph.

entries.sword:
Most of its body has the same composition as
coal. Fittingly, this Pokémon was first discovered
in coal mines about 400 years ago.
entries.shield:
It can race around like a unicycle, even on rough,
rocky terrain. Burning coal sustains it.

entries.sword:
It forms coal inside its body. Coal dropped by
this Pokémon once helped fuel the lives of
people in the Galar region.
entries.shield:
By rapidly rolling its legs, it can travel at over
18 mph. The temperature of the flames it
breathes exceeds 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.

entries.sword:
It’s usually peaceful, but the vandalism of mines
enrages it. Offenders will be incinerated with
flames that reach 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit.
entries.shield:
While it’s engaged in battle, its mountain of coal
will burn bright red, sending off sparks that
scorch the surrounding area.

entries.red:
A bird that makes
up for its poor
flying with its fast foot speed.
Leaves giant
footprints.
entries.blue:
A bird that makes
up for its poor
flying with its fast foot speed.
Leaves giant
footprints.
entries.yellow:
Its short wings
make flying dif­
ficult. Instead, this POKéMON runs
at high speed on
developed legs.
entries.gold:
By alternately
raising and lower­
ing its two heads, it balances itself
to be more stable
while running.
entries.silver:
It races through
grassy plains with
powerful strides, leaving footprints
up to four inches
deep.
entries.crystal:
It lives on a
grassy plain where
it can see a long way. If it sees an
enemy, it runs
away at 60 mph.
entries.ruby:
DODUO’s two heads never sleep at the
same time.
Its two heads take turns sleeping, so one head can always keep watch for
enemies while the other one sleeps.
entries.sapphire:
DODUO’s two heads contain completely
identical brains.
A scientific study reported that on rare occasions, there will be examples
of this POKéMON possessing different
sets of brains.
entries.emerald:
Even while eating or sleeping, one of the
heads remains always vigilant for any sign
of danger. When threatened, it flees at
over 60 miles per hour.
entries.firered:
A two-headed POKéMON that was discovered
as a sudden mutation. It runs at a pace
of over 60 miles per hour.
entries.leafgreen:
A bird that makes up for its poor flying
with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant
footprints.
entries.diamond:
The brains in its two heads appear
to communicate emotions to each
other with a telepathic power.
entries.pearl:
The brains in its two heads appear
to communicate emotions to each
other with a telepathic power.
entries.platinum:
The brains in its two heads appear
to communicate emotions to each
other with a telepathic power.
entries.heartgold:
By alternately raising and lowering
its two heads, it balances itself
to be more stable while running.
entries.soulsilver:
It races through grassy plains with
powerful strides, leaving footprints
up to four inches deep.
entries.black:
The brains in its two heads appear
to communicate emotions to each
other with a telepathic power.
entries.white:
The brains in its two heads appear
to communicate emotions to each
other with a telepathic power.
entries.black-2:
The brains in its two heads appear
to communicate emotions to each
other with a telepathic power.
entries.white-2:
The brains in its two heads appear
to communicate emotions to each
other with a telepathic power.
entries.x:
A two-headed Pokémon that was discovered as a
sudden mutation. It runs at a pace of over 60 miles
per hour.
entries.y:
The brains in its two heads appear to communicate
emotions to each other with a telepathic power.
entries.omega-ruby:
Doduo’s two heads never sleep at the same time. Its two
heads take turns sleeping, so one head can always keep
watch for enemies while the other one sleeps.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Doduo’s two heads contain completely identical brains. A
scientific study reported that on rare occasions, there will be
examples of this Pokémon possessing different sets of brains.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this
Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this
Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.

entries.sword:
It spends its entire life inside an apple. It hides
from its natural enemies, bird Pokémon, by
pretending it’s just an apple and nothing more.
entries.shield:
As soon as it’s born, it burrows into an apple. Not
only does the apple serve as its food source, but
the flavor of the fruit determines its evolution.

entries.sword:
It ate a sour apple, and that induced its
evolution. In its cheeks, it stores an acid
capable of causing chemical burns.
entries.shield:
It flies on wings of apple skin and spits a
powerful acid. It can also change its shape
into that of an apple.

entries.sword:
Eating a sweet apple caused its evolution.
A nectarous scent wafts from its body, luring in
the bug Pokémon it preys on.
entries.shield:
Its body is covered in sweet nectar, and the
skin on its back is especially yummy. Children
used to have it as a snack.

entries.sword:
As it digs, it swallows sand and stores it in its
neck pouch. The pouch can hold more than
17 pounds of sand.
entries.shield:
It spews sand from its nostrils. While the enemy
is blinded, it burrows into the ground to hide.

entries.sword:
When it contracts its body, over 220 pounds of
sand sprays from its nose. If it ever runs out of
sand, it becomes disheartened.
entries.shield:
Its unique style of coiling allows it to blast sand
out of its sand sac more efficiently.

entries.sword:
It’s so strong that it can knock out some
opponents in a single hit, but it also may
forget what it’s battling midfight.
entries.shield:
This hungry Pokémon swallows Arrokuda whole.
Occasionally, it makes a mistake and tries to
swallow a Pokémon other than its preferred prey.

entries.sword:
If it sees any movement around it, this Pokémon
charges for it straightaway, leading with its
sharply pointed jaw. It’s very proud of that jaw.
entries.shield:
After it’s eaten its fill, its movements become
extremely sluggish. That’s when Cramorant
swallows it up.

entries.sword:
This Pokémon has a jaw that’s as sharp as a spear
and as strong as steel. Apparently Barraskewda’s
flesh is surprisingly tasty, too.
entries.shield:
It spins its tail fins to propel itself, surging
forward at speeds of over 100 knots before
ramming prey and spearing into them.

entries.sword:
It stores poison in an internal poison sac and
secretes that poison through its skin. If you touch
this Pokémon, a tingling sensation follows.
entries.shield:
It manipulates the chemical makeup of its poison
to produce electricity. The voltage is weak, but it
can cause a tingling paralysis.

entries.sword:
When this Pokémon sounds as if it’s strumming a
guitar, it’s actually clawing at the protrusions on
its chest to generate electricity.
entries.shield:
This short-tempered and aggressive Pokémon
chugs stagnant water to absorb any toxins it
might contain.

entries.red:
Uses its three
brains to execute
complex plans. While two heads
sleep, one head
stays awake.
entries.blue:
Uses its three
brains to execute
complex plans. While two heads
sleep, one head
stays awake.
entries.yellow:
One of DODUO's 2
heads splits to
form a unique species. It runs
close to 40 MPH
in prairies.
entries.gold:
It collects data 
and plans three
times as wisely, but it may think
too much and be­
come immobilized.
entries.silver:
If one of the
heads gets to eat,
the others will be satisfied, too,
and they will stop
squabbling.
entries.crystal:
An enemy that
takes its eyes off
any of the three heads--even for a
second--will get
pecked severely.
entries.ruby:
Watch out if DODRIO’s three heads are
looking in three separate directions.
It’s a sure sign that it is on its guard. Don’t go near this POKéMON if it’s being
wary - it may decide to peck you.
entries.sapphire:
Apparently, the heads aren’t the only
parts of the body that DODRIO has
three of. It has three sets of hearts and lungs
as well, so it is capable of running long
distances without rest.
entries.emerald:
A peculiar POKéMON species with three
heads. It vigorously races across grassy
plains even in arid seasons with little
rainfall.
entries.firered:
An odd species that is rarely found.
The three heads respectively represent
joy, sadness, and anger.
entries.leafgreen:
Uses its three brains to execute complex
plans. While two heads sleep, one head is
said to stay awake.
entries.diamond:
When DODUO evolves into this odd
breed, one of its heads splits into
two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.
entries.pearl:
When DODUO evolves into this odd
breed, one of its heads splits into
two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.
entries.platinum:
When DODUO evolves into this odd
breed, one of its heads splits into
two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.
entries.heartgold:
It collects data and plans three times
as wisely, but it may think too much
and fall into a state of immobility.
entries.soulsilver:
If one of the heads gets to eat,
the others will be satisfied, too,
and they will stop squabbling.
entries.black:
When Doduo evolves into this odd
breed, one of its heads splits into
two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.
entries.white:
When Doduo evolves into this odd
breed, one of its heads splits into
two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.
entries.black-2:
When Doduo evolves into this odd
breed, one of its heads splits into
two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.
entries.white-2:
When Doduo evolves into this odd
breed, one of its heads splits into
two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.
entries.x:
An enemy that takes its eyes off any of the
three heads--even for a second--will get
pecked severely.
entries.y:
An odd species that is rarely found. The three
heads respectively represent joy, sadness,
and anger.
entries.omega-ruby:
Watch out if Dodrio’s three heads are looking in three separate
directions. It’s a sure sign that it is on its guard. Don’t go near
this Pokémon if it’s being wary—it may decide to peck you.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Apparently, the heads aren’t the only parts of the body that
Dodrio has three of. It has three sets of hearts and lungs as
well, so it is capable of running long distances without rest.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
One of Doduo’s two heads splits to form
a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph
in prairies.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
One of Doduo’s two heads splits to form
a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph
in prairies.

entries.sword:
It stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to
generate heat. The yellow sections on its belly
get particularly hot.
entries.shield:
It wraps prey up with its heated body, cooking
them in its coils. Once they’re well-done, it will
voraciously nibble them down to the last morsel.

entries.sword:
When it heats up, its body temperature reaches
about 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. It lashes its
body like a whip and launches itself at enemies.
entries.shield:
While its burning body is already dangerous on
its own, this excessively hostile Pokémon also has
large and very sharp fangs.

entries.sword:
It’s very curious, but its means of investigating
things is to try to punch them with its tentacles.
The search for food is what brings it onto land.
entries.shield:
Its tentacles tear off easily, but it isn’t alarmed
when that happens—it knows they’ll grow back.
It’s about as smart as a three-year-old.

entries.sword:
A body made up of nothing but muscle makes
the grappling moves this Pokémon performs with
its tentacles tremendously powerful.
entries.shield:
Searching for an opponent to test its skills
against, it emerges onto land. Once the battle
is over, it returns to the sea.

entries.sword:
This Pokémon is said to have been born when
a lonely spirit possessed a cold, leftover cup
of tea.
entries.shield:
The teacup in which this Pokémon makes its
home is a famous piece of antique tableware.
Many forgeries are in circulation.

entries.sword:
This species lives in antique teapots.
Most pots are forgeries, but on rare occasions,
an authentic work is found.
entries.shield:
Leaving leftover black tea unattended is asking
for this Pokémon to come along and pour itself
into it, turning the tea into a new Polteageist.

entries.sword:
Via the protrusion on its head, it senses other
creatures’ emotions. If you don’t have a calm
disposition, it will never warm up to you.
entries.shield:
If this Pokémon senses a strong emotion, it
will run away as fast as it can. It prefers areas
without people.

entries.sword:
No matter who you are, if you bring strong
emotions near this Pokémon, it will silence
you violently.
entries.shield:
Using the braids on its head, it pummels foes to
get them to quiet down. One blow from those
braids would knock out a professional boxer.

entries.sword:
It emits psychic power strong enough to cause
headaches as a deterrent to the approach
of others.
entries.shield:
If you’re too loud around it, you risk being torn
apart by the claws on its tentacle. This Pokémon
is also known as the Forest Witch.

entries.sword:
Through its nose, it sucks in the emanations
produced by people and Pokémon when they
feel annoyed. It thrives off this negative energy.
entries.shield:
It sneaks into people’s homes, stealing things
and feasting on the negative energy of the
frustrated occupants.

entries.red:
The protruding
horn on its head
is very hard. It is used for
bashing through
thick ice.
entries.blue:
The protruding
horn on its head
is very hard. It is used for
bashing through
thick ice.
entries.yellow:
Loves freezing
cold conditions.
Relishes swimming in a frigid cli­
mate of around 14F
degrees.
entries.gold:
Although it can't
walk well on land,
it is a graceful swimmer. It espe­
cially loves being
in frigid seas.
entries.silver:
In daytime, it is
often found asleep
on the seabed in shallow waters.
Its nostrils close
while it swims.
entries.crystal:
The light blue fur
that covers it
keeps it protected against the cold.
It loves iceberg-
filled oceans.
entries.ruby:
SEEL hunts for prey in the frigid sea
underneath sheets of ice.
When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice with the
sharply protruding section of its head.
entries.sapphire:
SEEL hunts for prey in the frigid sea
underneath sheets of ice.
When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice with the
sharply protruding section of its head.
entries.emerald:
SEEL hunt for prey in frigid, ice-covered
seas. When it needs to breathe, it punches
a hole through the ice with the sharply
protruding section of its head.
entries.firered:
Covered with light blue fur, its hide is
thick and tough. It is active in bitter
cold of minus 40 degrees Fahrenheit.
entries.leafgreen:
The protruding horn on its head is very
hard. It is used for bashing through thick
icebergs.
entries.diamond:
A Pokémon that lives on icebergs.
It swims in the sea using the point
on its head to break up ice.
entries.pearl:
A Pokémon that lives on icebergs.
It swims in the sea using the point
on its head to break up ice.
entries.platinum:
A Pokémon that lives on icebergs.
It swims in the sea using the point
on its head to break up ice.
entries.heartgold:
Although it can’t walk well on land,
it is a graceful swimmer. It especially
loves being in frigid seas.
entries.soulsilver:
In daytime, it is often found asleep
on the seabed in shallow waters.
Its nostrils close while it swims.
entries.black:
A Pokémon that lives on icebergs.
It swims in the sea using the point
on its head to break up ice.
entries.white:
A Pokémon that lives on icebergs.
It swims in the sea using the point
on its head to break up ice.
entries.black-2:
The colder it gets, the better it feels.
It joyfully swims around oceans so cold
that they are filled with floating ice.
entries.white-2:
The colder it gets, the better it feels.
It joyfully swims around oceans so cold
that they are filled with floating ice.
entries.x:
A Pokémon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the
sea using the point on its head to break up ice.
entries.y:
Covered with light blue fur, its hide is thick and
tough. It is active in bitter cold of
-40 degrees Fahrenheit.
entries.omega-ruby:
Seel hunts for prey in the frigid sea underneath sheets of ice.
When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice
with the sharply protruding section of its head.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Seel hunts for prey in the frigid sea underneath sheets of ice.
When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice
with the sharply protruding section of its head.
entries.ultra-sun:
It has always been supposed that Seel live only
in cold seas. Their having shown up in Alola is
a mystery.
entries.ultra-moon:
Thanks to its thick fat, cold seas don’t bother it
at all, but it gets tired pretty easily in
warm waters.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Loves freezing-cold conditions.
Relishes swimming in a frigid climate
of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Loves freezing-cold conditions.
Relishes swimming in a frigid climate
of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.

entries.sword:
When it gets down on all fours as if to beg for
forgiveness, it’s trying to lure opponents in so
that it can stab them with its spear-like hair.
entries.shield:
With sly cunning, it tries to lure people into the
woods. Some believe it to have the power to
make crops grow.

entries.sword:
With the hair wrapped around its body helping to
enhance its muscles, this Pokémon can overwhelm
even Machamp.
entries.shield:
Its hairs work like muscle fibers. When its hairs
unfurl, they latch on to opponents, ensnaring
them as tentacles would.

entries.sword:
Its voice is staggering in volume. Obstagoon
has a tendency to take on a threatening posture
and shout—this move is known as Obstruct.
entries.shield:
It evolved after experiencing numerous fights.
While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that
would make any opponent flinch.

entries.sword:
What appears to be an iron helmet is actually
hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill
of battle.
entries.shield:
After many battles, it evolved dangerous
claws that come together to form daggers
when extended.

entries.sword:
Its shell is overflowing with its heightened
otherworldly energy. The ectoplasm serves as
protection for this Pokémon’s core spirit.
entries.shield:
Be cautious of the ectoplasmic body
surrounding its soul. You’ll become
stiff as stone if you touch it.

entries.sword:
Only Farfetch’d that have survived many battles
can attain this evolution. When this Pokémon’s
leek withers, it will retire from combat.
entries.shield:
After deflecting attacks with its hard leaf shield,
it strikes back with its sharp leek stalk. The leek
stalk is both weapon and food.

entries.sword:
It’s highly skilled at tap-dancing. It waves its cane
of ice in time with its graceful movements.
entries.shield:
Its amusing movements make it very popular.
It releases its psychic power from the pattern
on its belly.

entries.sword:
A powerful curse was woven into an ancient
painting. After absorbing the spirit of a Yamask,
the painting began to move.
entries.shield:
Never touch its shadowlike body, or you’ll be
shown the horrific memories behind the picture
carved into it.

entries.sword:
This Pokémon was born from sweet-smelling
particles in the air. Its body is made of cream.
entries.shield:
They say that any patisserie visited by Milcery
is guaranteed success and good fortune.

entries.sword:
When it trusts a Trainer, it will treat them to
berries it’s decorated with cream.
entries.shield:
When Alcremie is content, the cream it
secretes from its hands becomes sweeter
and richer.

entries.red:
Stores thermal
energy in its
body. Swims at a steady 8 knots
even in intensely
cold waters.
entries.blue:
Stores thermal
energy in its
body. Swims at a steady 8 knots
even in intensely
cold waters.
entries.yellow:
Its entire body is
a snowy-white.
Unharmed by even intense cold, it
swims powerfully
in icy waters.
entries.gold:
Its streamlined
body has little
drag in water. The colder the
temperature, the
friskier it gets.
entries.silver:
It loves frigid
seas with ice
floes. It uses its long tail to
change swimming
direction quickly.
entries.crystal:
It sleeps under
shallow ocean
waters during the day, then looks
for food at night
when it's cold.
entries.ruby:
DEWGONG loves to snooze on bitterly
cold ice.
The sight of this POKéMON sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be
a mermaid by a mariner long ago.
entries.sapphire:
DEWGONG loves to snooze on bitterly
cold ice.
The sight of this POKéMON sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be
a mermaid by a mariner long ago.
entries.emerald:
It loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice.
The sight of this POKéMON sleeping on
a glacier was mistakenly thought to be
a mermaid by a mariner long ago.
entries.firered:
Its body is covered with a pure white
fur. The colder the weather, the more
active it becomes.
entries.leafgreen:
It stores thermal energy in the body.
It swims at a steady eight knots even in
intensely cold waters.
entries.diamond:
In snow, the pure white coat
covering its body obscures it from
predators.
entries.pearl:
In snow, the pure white coat
covering its body obscures it from
predators.
entries.platinum:
In snow, the pure white coat
covering its body obscures it from
predators.
entries.heartgold:
Its streamlined body has little
drag in water. The colder the
temperature, the friskier it gets.
entries.soulsilver:
It loves frigid seas with ice
floes. It uses its long tail to
change swimming direction quickly.
entries.black:
In snow, the pure white coat
covering its body obscures it from
predators.
entries.white:
In snow, the pure white coat
covering its body obscures it from
predators.
entries.black-2:
Its streamlined body has low resistance,
and it swims around cold oceans at
a speed of eight knots.
entries.white-2:
Its streamlined body has low resistance,
and it swims around cold oceans at
a speed of eight knots.
entries.x:
Its body is covered with a pure white fur.
The colder the weather, the more active
it becomes.
entries.y:
Its streamlined body has little drag in water.
The colder the temperature, the friskier it gets.
entries.omega-ruby:
Dewgong loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice. The sight of this
Pokémon sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be a
mermaid by a mariner long ago.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Dewgong loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice. The sight of
this Pokémon sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought
to be a mermaid by a mariner long ago.
entries.ultra-sun:
It swims through the ocean at a speed of eight
knots, searching for Pokémon that will become
its prey. It’s especially fond of Wishiwashi.
entries.ultra-moon:
It sunbathes on the beach after meals. The rise
in its body temperature helps its digestion.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Its entire body is a snowy white. Unharmed by
even intense cold, it swims powerfully
in icy waters.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Its entire body is a snowy white. Unharmed by
even intense cold, it swims powerfully
in icy waters.

entries.sword:
Five of them are troopers, and one is the brass.
The brass’s orders are absolute.
entries.shield:
The six of them work together as one Pokémon.
Teamwork is also their battle strategy, and they
constantly change their formation as they fight.

entries.sword:
It feeds on seaweed, using its teeth to scrape it
off rocks. Electric current flows from the tips of
its spines.
entries.shield:
It stores electricity in each spine. Even if one gets
broken off, it still continues to emit electricity for
at least three hours.

entries.sword:
It spits out thread imbued with a frigid sort of
energy and uses it to tie its body to branches,
disguising itself as an icicle while it sleeps.
entries.shield:
It eats snow that piles up on the ground.
The more snow it eats, the bigger and more
impressive the spikes on its back grow.

entries.sword:
Icy scales fall from its wings like snow as it flies
over fields and mountains. The temperature of its
wings is less than −290 degrees Fahrenheit.
entries.shield:
It shows no mercy to any who desecrate fields
and mountains. It will fly around on its icy wings,
causing a blizzard to chase offenders away.

entries.sword:
It stands in grasslands, watching the sun’s descent
from zenith to horizon. This Pokémon has a talent
for delivering dynamic kicks.
entries.shield:
Once a year, on a specific date and at a specific
time, they gather out of nowhere and form up in
a circle.

entries.sword:
It drifted in on the flow of ocean waters from a
frigid place. It keeps its head iced constantly to
make sure it stays nice and cold.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon keeps its heat-sensitive head cool
with ice. It fishes for its food, dangling its single
hair into the sea to lure in prey.

entries.sword:
It uses the horns on its head to sense the
emotions of others. Males will act as valets for
those they serve, looking after their every need.
entries.shield:
Through its horns, it can pick up on the emotions
of creatures around it. Positive emotions are the
source of its strength.

entries.sword:
As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like
pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its
constant hunger. It’s also generating electricity.
entries.shield:
It carries electrically roasted seeds with it as if
they’re precious treasures. No matter how much
it eats, it always gets hungry again in short order.

entries.sword:
It digs up the ground with its trunk. It’s also very
strong, being able to carry loads of over
five tons without any problem at all.
entries.shield:
If a job requires serious strength, this Pokémon
will excel at it. Its copper body tarnishes in the
rain, turning a vibrant green color.

entries.sword:
They came over from another region long
ago and worked together with humans.
Their green skin is resistant to water.
entries.shield:
These Pokémon live in herds. Their trunks have
incredible grip strength, strong enough to crush
giant rocks into powder.

entries.red:
Appears in filthy
areas. Thrives by
sucking up polluted sludge
that is pumped
out of factories.
entries.blue:
Appears in filthy
areas. Thrives by
sucking up polluted sludge
that is pumped
out of factories.
entries.yellow:
Made of hardened
sludge. It smells
too putrid to touch.
Even weeds won't
grow in its path.
entries.gold:
As it moves, it
loses bits of its
body from which new GRIMER emerge.
This worsens the
stench around it.
entries.silver:
Wherever GRIMER
has passed, so
many germs are left behind that
no plants will
ever grow again.
entries.crystal:
When two of these
POKéMON's bodies
are combined together, new
poisons are
created.
entries.ruby:
GRIMER’s sludgy and rubbery body can
be forced through any opening, however
small it may be. This POKéMON enters sewer pipes to
drink filthy wastewater.
entries.sapphire:
GRIMER emerged from the sludge that
settled on a polluted seabed.
This POKéMON loves anything filthy. It constantly leaks a horribly germ-
infested fluid from all over its body.
entries.emerald:
Born from polluted sludge in the sea,
GRIMER’s favorite food is anything filthy.
They feed on wastewater pumped out from
factories.
entries.firered:
Sludge exposed to X rays from the moon
transformed into GRIMER. It loves feeding
on filthy things.
entries.leafgreen:
Appears in filthy areas. It thrives by
sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped
out of factories.
entries.diamond:
It was born when sludge in a dirty
stream was exposed to the moon’s
X-rays. It appears among filth.
entries.pearl:
It was born when sludge in a dirty
stream was exposed to the moon’s
X-rays. It appears among filth.

entries.black-2:
Born from sludge, these Pokémon now
gather in polluted places and increase
the bacteria in their bodies.
entries.white-2:

the bacteria in their bodies.

entries.omega-ruby:
Grimer’s sludgy and rubbery body can be forced through any
opening, however small it may be. This Pokémon enters sewer
pipes to drink filthy wastewater.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
Grimer emerged from the sludge that settled on a polluted
seabed. This Pokémon loves anything filthy. It constantly
leaks a horribly germ-infested fluid from all over its body.
entries.sun:
Its main source of food is the slimy industrial
waste of factories. This Pokémon’s numbers
have been decreasing in recent years.
entries.moon:
It was born from sludge transformed by
exposure to X-rays from the moon. When its
internal load of germs decreases, it dies.
entries.ultra-sun:
It was born from sludge on the ocean floor. In a
sterile environment, the germs within its body
can’t multiply, and it dies.
entries.ultra-moon:
The wastewater coming from factories is clean
these days, so Grimer have nothing to eat.
They’re said to be on the verge of extinction.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Made of congealed sludge. It smells too putrid
to touch. Even weeds won’t grow in its path.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Made of congealed sludge. It smells too putrid
to touch. Even weeds won’t grow in its path.

entries.sword:
In ancient times, it was unbeatable thanks to its
powerful lower body, but it went extinct anyway
after it depleted all its plant-based food sources.
entries.shield:
The powerful muscles in its tail generate its
electricity. Compared to its lower body,
its upper half is entirely too small.

entries.sword:
The shaking of its freezing upper half is what
generates its electricity. It has a hard time
walking around.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon lived on prehistoric seashores and
was able to preserve food with the ice on its
body. It went extinct because it moved so slowly.

entries.sword:
Powerful legs and jaws made it the apex predator
of its time. Its own overhunting of its prey was
what drove it to extinction.
entries.shield:
Its mighty legs are capable of running at
speeds exceeding 40 mph, but this Pokémon
can’t breathe unless it’s underwater.

entries.sword:
Though it’s able to capture prey by freezing its
surroundings, it has trouble eating the prey
afterward because its mouth is on top of its head.
entries.shield:
The skin on its face is impervious to attack, but
breathing difficulties made this Pokémon go
extinct anyway.

entries.sword:
Its body resembles polished metal, and it’s both
lightweight and strong. The only drawback is that
it rusts easily.
entries.shield:
The special metal that composes its body is very
light, so this Pokémon has considerable agility.
It lives in caves because it dislikes the rain.

entries.sword:
After being reborn as a ghost Pokémon,
Dreepy wanders the areas it used to inhabit
back when it was alive in prehistoric seas.
entries.shield:
If this weak Pokémon is by itself, a mere child
could defeat it. But if Dreepy has friends to help
it train, it can evolve and become much stronger.

entries.sword:
It’s capable of flying faster than 120 mph.
It battles alongside Dreepy and
dotes on them until they successfully evolve.
entries.shield:
Without a Dreepy to place on its head and
care for, it gets so uneasy it’ll try to substitute
any Pokémon it finds for the missing Dreepy.

entries.sword:
When it isn’t battling, it keeps Dreepy in the
holes on its horns. Once a fight starts, it launches
the Dreepy like supersonic missiles.
entries.shield:
Apparently the Dreepy inside Dragapult’s
horns eagerly look forward to being launched out
at Mach speeds.

entries.sword:
Known as a legendary hero, this Pokémon
absorbs metal particles, transforming them
into a weapon it uses to battle.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon has slumbered for many years.
Some say it’s Zamazenta’s elder sister—others
say the two Pokémon are rivals.

entries.sword:
In times past, it worked together with a king of
the people to save the Galar region. It absorbs
metal that it then uses in battle.
entries.shield:
This Pokémon slept for aeons while in the form of
a statue. It was asleep for so long, people forgot
that it ever existed.

entries.red:
Thickly covered
with a filthy,
vile sludge. It is so toxic, even
its footprints
contain poison.
entries.blue:
Thickly covered
with a filthy,
vile sludge. It is so toxic, even
its footprints
contain poison.
entries.yellow:
Smells so awful,
it can cause
fainting. Through degeneration, it
lost its sense of
smell.
entries.gold:
They love to gath­
er in smelly areas
where sludge ac­ cumulates, making
the stench around
them worse.
entries.silver:
Its body is made
of a powerful poi­
son. Touching it accidentally will
cause a fever that
requires bed rest.
entries.crystal:
As it moves, a
very strong poison
leaks from it, making the ground
there barren for
three years.
entries.ruby:
From MUK’s body seeps a foul fluid that
gives off a nose-bendingly horrible
stench. Just one drop of this POKéMON’s body
fluid can turn a pool stagnant and
rancid.
entries.sapphire:
This POKéMON’s favorite food is
anything that is repugnantly filthy.
In dirty towns where people think nothing of throwing away litter on the
streets, MUK are certain to gather.
entries.emerald:
It prefers warm and humid habitats.
In the summertime, the toxic substances
in its body intensify, making MUK reek like
putrid kitchen garbage.
entries.firered:
It is usually undetectable because it
blends in with the ground. Touching it can
cause terrible poisoning.
entries.leafgreen:
Thickly covered with a filthy, vile
sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints
contain poison.
entries.diamond:
A toxic fluid seeps from its body.
The fluid instantly kills plants and
trees on contact.
entries.pearl:
A toxic fluid seeps from its body.
The fluid instantly kills plants and
trees on contact.
entries.platinum:
A toxic fluid seeps from its body.
The fluid instantly kills plants and
trees on contact.
entries.heartgold:
They love to gather in smelly areas
where sludge accumulates, making
the stench around them worse.
entries.soulsilver:
Its body is made of a powerful poison.
Touching it accidentally will
cause a fever that requires bed rest.
entries.black:
A toxic fluid seeps from its body.
The fluid instantly kills plants and
trees on contact.
entries.white:
A toxic fluid seeps from its body.
The fluid instantly kills plants and
trees on contact.
entries.black-2:
It’s so stinky! Muk’s body contains
toxic elements, and any plant will
wilt when it passes by.
entries.white-2:
It’s so stinky! Muk’s body contains
toxic elements, and any plant will
wilt when it passes by.
entries.x:
They love to gather in smelly areas where sludge
accumulates, making the stench around
them worse.
entries.y:
A toxic fluid seeps from its body. The fluid instantly
kills plants and trees on contact.
entries.omega-ruby:
From Muk’s body seeps a foul fluid that gives off a
nose-bendingly horrible stench. Just one drop of this
Pokémon’s body fluid can turn a pool stagnant and rancid.
entries.alpha-sapphire:
This Pokémon’s favorite food is anything that is repugnantly
filthy. In dirty towns where people think nothing of throwing
away litter on the streets, Muk are certain to gather.
entries.sun:
The stench it gives off will make your nose
scrunch up. Still, there are Muk fans who think
that’s a good thing.
entries.moon:
After recent environmental improvements, this
Pokémon is now hardly seen at all. People
speculate that it may go extinct at some point.
entries.ultra-sun:
Their food sources have decreased, and their
numbers have declined sharply. Sludge ponds
are being built to prevent their extinction.
entries.ultra-moon:
Because they scatter germs everywhere,
they’ve long been targeted for extermination,
leading to a steep decline in their population.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
Smells so awful, it can cause fainting.
Through degeneration of its nose,
it lost its sense of smell.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
Smells so awful, it can cause fainting.
Through degeneration of its nose,
it lost its sense of smell.

entries.sword:
The core on its chest absorbs energy emanating
from the lands of the Galar region. This energy is
what allows Eternatus to stay active.
entries.shield:
It was inside a meteorite that fell 20,000 years
ago. There seems to be a connection between
this Pokémon and the Dynamax phenomenon.

entries.sword:
Kubfu trains hard to perfect its moves. The moves
it masters will determine which form it takes when
it evolves.
entries.shield:
If Kubfu pulls the long white hair on its head,
its fighting spirit heightens and power wells up
from the depths of its belly.

entries.sword:
This form of Urshifu is a strong believer in the
one-hit KO. Its strategy is to leap in close to foes
and land a devastating blow with a hardened fist.
entries.shield:
Inhabiting the mountains of a distant region, this
Pokémon races across sheer cliffs, training its legs
and refining its moves.

entries.sword:
Within dense forests, this Pokémon lives in a pack
with others of its kind. It’s incredibly aggressive,
and the other Pokémon of the forest fear it.
entries.shield:
Once the vines on Zarude’s body tear off, they
become nutrients in the soil. This helps the plants
of the forest grow.

entries.sword:
This Pokémon is a cluster of electrical energy.
It’s said that removing the rings on Regieleki’s
body will unleash the Pokémon’s latent power.
entries.shield:
Its entire body is made up of a single organ that
generates electrical energy. Regieleki is capable
of creating all Galar’s electricity.

entries.sword:
An academic theory proposes that Regidrago’s
arms were once the head of an ancient dragon
Pokémon. The theory remains unproven.
entries.shield:
Its body is composed of crystallized dragon
energy. Regidrago is said to have the powers of
every dragon Pokémon.

entries.sword:
Glastrier emits intense cold from its hooves.
It’s also a belligerent Pokémon—anything it
wants, it takes by force.
entries.shield:
Glastrier has tremendous physical strength, and
the mask of ice covering its face is 100 times
harder than diamond.

entries.sword:
It probes its surroundings with all its senses save
one—it doesn’t use its sense of sight. Spectrier’s
kicks are said to separate soul from body.
entries.shield:
As it dashes through the night, Spectrier absorbs
the life-force of sleeping creatures. It craves
silence and solitude.

entries.sword:
Calyrex is a merciful Pokémon, capable of
providing healing and blessings. It reigned over
the Galar region in times of yore.
entries.shield:
Calyrex is known in legend as a king that ruled
over Galar in ancient times. It has the power to
cause hearts to mend and plants to spring forth.

entries.legends-arceus:
The black orbs shine with an uncanny light when the Pokémon is
erecting invisible barriers. The fur shed from its beard retains
heat well and is a highly useful material for winter clothing.

entries.red:
A brutal POKéMON
with pressurized
water jets on its shell. They are
used for high
speed tackles.
entries.blue:
A brutal POKéMON
with pressurized
water jets on its shell. They are
used for high
speed tackles.
entries.yellow:
Once it takes aim
at its enemy, it
blasts out water with even more
force than a fire
hose.
entries.gold:
It deliberately
makes itself heavy
so it can with­ stand the recoil
of the water jets
it fires.
entries.silver:
The rocket cannons
on its shell fire
jets of water capable of punch­
ing holes through
thick steel.
entries.crystal:
It firmly plants
its feet on the
ground before shooting water
from the jets on
its back.
entries.ruby:
BLASTOISE has water spouts that
protrude from its shell. The water
spouts are very accurate. They can shoot bullets of water with
enough accuracy to strike empty cans
from a distance of over 160 feet.
entries.sapphire:
BLASTOISE has water spouts that
protrude from its shell. The water
spouts are very accurate. They can shoot bullets of water with
enough accuracy to strike empty cans
from a distance of over 160 feet.
entries.emerald:
The waterspouts that protrude from its
shell are highly accurate. Their bullets of
water can precisely nail tin cans from
a distance of over 160 feet.
entries.firered:
It crushes its foe under its heavy body
to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will
withdraw inside its shell.
entries.leafgreen:
The pressurized water jets on this brutal
POKéMON’s shell are used for high-
speed tackles.
entries.diamond:
The jets of water it spouts from
the rocket cannons on its shell
can punch through thick steel.

the rocket cannons on its shell
can punch through thick steel.

entries.lets-go-eevee:

entries.red:
Its hard shell
repels any kind
of attack. It is vulnerable
only when its
shell is open.
entries.blue:
Its hard shell
repels any kind
of attack. It is vulnerable
only when its
shell is open.
entries.yellow:
The shell can
withstand any
attack. However, when it is open,
the tender body
is exposed.
entries.gold:
It swims facing
backward by open­
ing and closing its two-piece
shell. It is
surprisingly fast.
entries.silver:
Grains of sand
trapped in its
shells mix with its body fluids to
form beautiful
pearls.
entries.crystal:
Clamping on to an
opponent reveals
its vulnerable parts, so it uses
this move only as
a last resort.
entries.ruby:
At night, this POKéMON uses its broad
tongue to burrow a hole in the seafloor
sand and then sleep in it. While it is sleeping, SHELLDER closes its
shell, but leaves its tongue hanging
out.
entries.sapphire:

tongue to burrow a hole in the seafloor
sand and then sleep in it. While it is sleeping, SHELLDER closes its
shell, but leaves its tongue hanging
out.
entries.emerald:
At night, it burrows a hole in the seafloor
with its broad tongue to make a place to
sleep. While asleep, it closes its shell,
but leaves its tongue hanging out.
entries.firered:
It is encased in a shell that is harder
than diamond. Inside, however, it is
surprisingly tender.
entries.leafgreen:
Its hard shell repels any kind of attack.
It is vulnerable only when its shell is
open.
entries.diamond:
It swims backward by opening and
closing its two shells. Its large
tongue is always kept hanging out.
entries.pearl:
It swims backward by opening and
closing its two shells. Its large
tongue is always kept hanging out.

and closing its two-piece shell.

entries.alpha-sapphire:
At night, this Pokémon uses its broad tongue to burrow a hole
in the seafloor sand and then sleep in it. While it is sleeping,
Shellder closes its shell, but leaves its tongue hanging out.
entries.sun:
The hardness of its shell surpasses the
hardness of a diamond. In days gone by,
people used the shells to make shields.
entries.moon:
This Pokémon’s tongue is always hanging out.
It uses its tongue with great dexterity to dig up
sand from the seabed in its search for food.
entries.ultra-sun:
The sand that accumulates inside its shell
eventually becomes a pearl. But the pearl gets
in the way, so it spits it out and discards it.
entries.ultra-moon:
Even when its shell is closed, its tongue still
hangs out. If you give its tongue a good yank,
the shock will cause Shellder to open its shell.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
The shell can withstand any attack. However,
when it is open, the tender body is exposed.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
The shell can withstand any attack. However,
when it is open, the tender body is exposed.
entries.sword:
It swims facing backward by opening and closing
its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.
entries.shield:
Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is
vulnerable only when its shell is open.

entries.legends-arceus:
A violent creature that fells towering trees with its crude axes
and shields itself with hard stone. If one should chance upon
this Pokémon in the wilds, one's only recourse is to flee.

I believe it was Hisui's swampy terrain that gave Ursaluna its
burly physique and newfound capacity to manipulate peat
at will.

Clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before
fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream. No other species
throughout all Hisui's rivers is Basculegion's equal.

Because of Sneasler's virulent poison and daunting physical
prowess, no other species could hope to best it on the frozen
highlands. Preferring solitude, this species does not form packs.

Its lancelike spikes and savage temperament have earned it the
nickname ”sea fiend.” It slurps up poison to nourish itself.

When it flies to this land from across the sea, the bitter winter
comes to an end. According to legend, this Pokémon's love
gives rise to the budding of fresh life across Hisui.

entries.red:
When attacked, it
launches its
horns in quick volleys. Its
innards have
never been seen.
entries.blue:
When attacked, it
launches its
horns in quick volleys. Its
innards have
never been seen.
entries.yellow:
For protection, it
uses its harder-
than-diamonds shell. It also
shoots spikes from
the shell.
entries.gold:
Once it slams its
shell shut, it is
impossible to open, even by
those with superi­
or strength.
entries.silver:
CLOYSTER that live
in seas with harsh
tidal currents grow large, sharp
spikes on their
shells.
entries.crystal:
Even a missile
can't break the
spikes it uses to stab opponents.
They're even hard­
er than its shell.
entries.ruby:
CLOYSTER is capable of swimming in the
sea. It does so by swallowing water,
then jetting it out toward the rear. This POKéMON shoots spikes from its
shell using the same system.
entries.sapphire:
CLOYSTER is capable of swimming in the
sea. It does so by swallowing water,
then jetting it out toward the rear. This POKéMON shoots spikes from its
shell using the same system.
entries.emerald:
It swims in the sea by swallowing water,
then jetting it out toward the rear.
The CLOYSTER shoots spikes from its
shell using the same system.
entries.firered:
Its shell is extremely hard. It cannot be
shattered, even with a bomb. The shell
opens only when it is attacking.
entries.leafgreen:
When attacked, it launches its horns in
quick volleys. Its innards have never been
seen.
entries.diamond:
It fights by keeping its shell
tightly shut for protection and
by shooting spikes to repel foes.
entries.pearl:
It fights by keeping its shell
tightly shut for protection and
by shooting spikes to repel foes.

entries.y:

entries.omega-ruby:

This Pokémon shoots spikes from its shell using the

entries.alpha-sapphire:
Cloyster is capable of swimming in the sea. It does so by

Pokémon shoots spikes from its shell using the same system.
entries.sun:
Its hard shell cannot be shattered—not even
by a bomb. The contents of the shell
remain unknown.
entries.moon:
Excavation of the tombs of ancient hunting
tribes has turned up many spears tipped with
spikes that had fallen off this Pokémon’s shell.
entries.ultra-sun:
If areas of Cloyster’s very hard shell get
damaged, those areas swell, gradually growing
into large sharp spikes.
entries.ultra-moon:
Slowpoke tails are its favorite food. It has even
been known to come up on land to look for
Slowpoke from time to time.
entries.lets-go-pikachu:
For protection, it uses its harder-than-diamond
shell. It also shoots spikes from the shell.
entries.lets-go-eevee:
For protection, it uses its harder-than-diamond
shell. It also shoots spikes from the shell.

even with a bomb. The shell opens only when it
is attacking.
entries.shield:
